A bomb was exploded on the Dhaka Metropolitan Magistrate (CMM) Court premises in the city on Thursday afternoon. The bomb was set off at the balcony in front of the courtroom around 5:15pm.However, no one was injured in the incident. It can be assumed that the BNP militia was behind the attack.
Three people, including a local Awami-League leader, received injuries in a bomb attack in Bejpara area of Jessore on Sunday night.
At least two persons were injured in a bomb explosion in a residence of capital's Mohammadpur area Wednesday afternoon. It is not known whether the assailants were involved in any political party.

On 23 June, unidentified assailants hurled an (assumed crude) bomb into Yaqub's tin-shed house in Lalbagh area of Dhaka city, killing his son and leaving his daughter critically wounded with splinter injuries.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Bangladesh (2009-) Border Guards Bangladesh
ACTOR2: ULA/AA: United League of Arakan/Arakan Army
NOTES: Bangladesh and Myanmar launched a coordinated security operation against the Arakan Army on Thursday [27 August]. In an encounter the Arakan Army attacked BGB's Baramadak camp firing some 20 rocket launchers while the border guards immediately retaliated with identical weapons though no casualty was reported during the skirmish. [Time precision 2 as the operation lasted several days and the exact day of the encounter was was not reported.]

Three workers were injured as an underground bomb blasted at Bhulubaria Debottar village in Santhia upazila on Tuesday [6 October]. It is not clear who planted the bomb. [Geo-precision 2 as coordinates are for Santhia]

Mohammed Javed (24), commander of Jamaat-ul Mujahideen (JMB) Chittagong unit, was killed, and two police men were injured in a grenade explosion in Ananya residential area in Chittagong on Wednesday [7October]. The police was conducting a raid, together with the earlier captured Javed, when JMB members threw a granade at them.

Two were killed and over 100 wounded early Saturday [24 October] when three improvised explosive devices were detonated in the midst of a gathering of Shia Muslims, outside Old Dhaka's Hussaini Dalan. [The Oslamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.]
On Oct 29, unidentified assailants detonated an IED at Rajshahi university campus in Rajshahi city. No injuries were reported in the incident.
On Dec 5, unidentified assailants detonated an IED at Rajshahi university campus in Rajshahi city. No injuries were reported in the incident.
At least six people were injured in two successive explosions at a mosque at Bangladesh Navy Isha Khan out-post in Chittagong on Friday afternoon [18 December].
On Dec 18, six people were injured in a bomb attack at a mosque inside the Issa Khan Base of Bangladesh Navy at Chittagong city.

SOURCE: Financial Express (Bangladesh); Daily Star (Bangladesh); New Nation (Bangladesh)
NOTES: A man was killed as he exploded a powerful bomb he was carrying inside an Ahmadiyya Masjid (mosque) in Mochmoil area of Bagmara upazila in Rajshahi district on Friday. 3 other people were injured. IS later claimed responsibility.

On Dec 25, one person was killed and three others were injured in a bomb attack at Chokpara Ahmadiyya Jamaat Mosque during Juma prayer in Bagmara sub-District of Rajshahi District. IS claimed the responsibility.

An unidentified youth was killed when he tried to hurl a bomb inside a Kadiani mosque in Monchmoil Syedpur area under Bagmara upazila of the district today, police and local people said. said at least 10 others, including children, were injured in the incident.
On Dec 26, unidentified assailants exploded two IEDs outside Charnoabad Government Primary School (Char Noabad, Bhola) as a mayoral candidate's procession passed by the school.

A man was killed and two others were injured as some miscreants hurled hand bombs towards them following previous enmity over land at Gangadashpur in Jibannagar upazila on Monday evening. Locals said some landless people had been leaving on a piece of land that is about116 bighas in size. Four years back, one Abdul High Tuku of Drashana and some local people claimed the ownership of the land. Other reports suggest two persons were killed.
A policeman received minor injury as a bomb was exploded in Baishari Bazar in Naikkhonchhari upazila of Bandarban district on Wednesday night.
On Feb 18, unidentified assailants threw an IED at a university bus in Chittagong city. There were no casualties in the incident.
On Mar 31, one person was killed when unidentified assailants blasted IEDs at a school which was being used as a polling station in Jessore city.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Bangladesh (2009-) Border Guards Bangladesh

It is suspected that a Myanmarese separatist group might have launched the attack on the camp to spoil the good relations between Bangladesh and Myanmar.

On Tuesday, a member of a union parishad was attacked by unidentified assailants. The attackers threw bombs, which injured the parishad member at Jhenaidah Sadar upazila.

On Jan 2, at least three kids were critically injured in a bomb explosion when they took three substances from the nearest garbage of a house in Fatullah (Narayanganj). The culprits who placed the bombs are unknown.

On May 26, unidentified assailants threw a powerful explosive at a police van which injured two people including a female police officer in Malibagh, Dhaka city. The reason and culprits behind the attack are unknown.

NOTES: On 26 Jan, unidentified assailants hurled a hand grenade into a house in Vanni district (Northern). No casualties reported.

NOTES: The CMEV reported a grenade attack by unidentified gunmen allegedly targeting a SLMC member at a polling station but no injuries were reported.

An unidentified group allegedly threw a grenade against the vehicle of a UPFA candidate. No one was reported injured.

At least two people were injured in a hand grenade explosion at Ariyalai in Jaffna city, police said. They said two masked men who came on a motorcycle had thrown the grenade and fled.

A grenade exploded near the Polling Station at Nelukkulam Kalaimagal Maha Vidyalaya. No injuries were reported and the police are investigating.

NOTES: On 19 November 2021, CPI-Maoist cadres used explosives to blow up a railway track on the Howrah-Mumbai main line, between Sonua and Tatanagar stations under Chakradharpur (West Singhbhum, Jharkhand), in support of a regional 'bandh' (strike) called by the CPI-Maoist party, in agitation against recent deaths of rebels during an encounter with security forces in Gadchiroli. NOTES: On 22 November 2021, around 60-65 CPI-Maoist cadres used explosives including a cylinder bomb to blow up a mobile tower, a community centre, and a water tank, in Jurahi village under Madanpur police limits (Aurangabad, Bihar), in support of a regional 'bandh' (strike) called by the CPI-Maoist party, in agitation against recent deaths of rebels during an encounter with security forces in Gadchiroli. On 9 December 2021, a low-intensity blast occurred inside a courtroom in the Rohini court complex in Delhi - Rohini, Narela, North Delhi, injuring a policeman, who was posted on duty.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Government of Maldives (2018-); Police Forces of Maldives (2018-); Civilians (United Kingdom)
NOTES: On 6 May 2021, a remote explosive was detonated outside the house of the speaker of parliament Mohamed Nasheed in Male (Male City) while he was leaving his house. Mohamed Nasheed and four others were injured in the incident including his police bodyguards and two bystander. One of the bystander was reported to be a British citizen. No group has claimed responsibility for the explosion.

On 15 Jan, a bomb exploded in Krishna Guesthouse located in the main chowk of the market in the now of Krishnanagar, damaging its walls and roofs. Police said a group of four unidentified persons exploded the bomb in the site. No casualties were reported.

On February 7, a bomb, possibly planted by Janatantrik Terai Mukti Morcha-Prateek group, exploded at Ghantaghar chowk of Birgunj city (Parsa district, Narayani). Two persons, including an Indian national, were injured in the incident.
On 9 March, 6-7 children were injured when a bomb went off in front of a medical health post at Ramgunj, Belgadiya in Sunsari District. JTMM has claimed responsibility.

ACTOR1: JTMM-J: Democratic Terai Liberation Front-Jwala Singh
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
NOTES: On 28 March, a pressure cooker bomb exploded at the office of the Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist) in Nepalgunj, Banke district in the morning. The office was empty at the time. Terai Mukti Morcha-Jwala Singh has claimed responsibility for the explosion.

A woman was critically injured when a socket bomb went off in Kalaiya Municipality on 18 May. The injured was identified as Pashupati Devi Shah and was rushed to Birgunj for treatment. An unidentified group detonated the bomb.

A bomb exploded at the western gate of the International Convention Center, which houses the Constituent Assembly, on 21 May. A second socket bomb was also found in the area, along with pamphlets for the Dynamic Youth Forum. No injuries were reported.

ACTOR1: NMRYTG: Nepal Marxist Republican Young Tigers' Group
NOTES: Nepal Marxist Republican Young Tigers' Group (NMRYTG) detonated an improvised explosive device in the house of Pushkar Shah in Tulsipur, Dang, on 29 May.The blast destroyed the terrace. NMRYTG member Deepak Pandey told the media over phone that the group had bombed Shah's house because the latter was spying against his organisation.

ACTOR1: JTMM-R: Democratic Terai Liberation Front-Rajan Mukti
NOTES: A private car laden with explosives exploded outside Ishan Children's Nursing and Maternity Home near Basundhara in the Capital on 8 June leaving seven people wounded and in hospital. The explosion completely destroyed the car and shattered windowpanes of homes nearby. A hitherto unknown group calling itself the Independent Nepal Party has owned up the responsibility for the explosion. In a statement sent to media persons, it claimed that the explosion was carried out against the extension of the Constituent Assembly's tenure. However, afterwords, the Janatantrik Terai Mukti Morcha (Rajan Mukti faction) claimed responsibility, stating that the vehicle was carrying explosives that went off accidentally. It is unsure which group is really to blame.

A powerful explosion rocked the Goithi VDC office in Saptari District on 5 July, injuring two people and causing minor damage to the office. The injured, Khagari Mahato, and Indrajit Mahato, of the same VDC sought treatment at a hospital in nearby Bhardaha. Although no one has claimed responsibility, the police are assuming it was one of the many Terai armed groups active in the district.

An Improvised Explosive Device (IED) went off in front of the Constitutional Assembly (CA) building at the International Conference Center (ICC) in Kathmandu on 6 July. There were no injuries or damage. The Dynamic Youth Forum took responsibility for the bombing and said it carried out the explosion to press the government to fulfill its demands.
At least ten people were wounded, when a bomb went off at a busy vegetable market in Bara district headquarters, in Kalaiya on 19 July. No other details were reported.

on 27 July, Samyukta Jatiya Mukti Morcha (SJMM), an active underground outfit, exploded a powerful bomb targeting the shop of Murkuchi Trade and Commerce Chairman Rajendra Prasad Sah in Udayapur district. The leaflets of SJMM putting forth five-point demands, including the formation of ethnical government have been recovered from the incident site.

On 11 Sept, an improvised explosive device went off in front of Shangri-La Carpet Industry in Attarkhel in Jorpati. No casualties and loss of property were reported. A little known group by the name of Samyukta Jatiya Mukti Morcha has claimed the responsibility for the explosion and has been carrying out terrorist activities in Western Nepal.

ACTOR1: JTMM-R: Democratic Terai Liberation Front-Rajan Mukti
NOTES: At least nine people were injured when a powerful bomb exploded in a bus in western Nepal on 27 Oct. The bus was heading towards Butawal from Bhairahawa when the explosion occurred. Terai Janatantrik Mukti Morcha, an armed outfit of Terai plains, took responsibility for the blast.

On 29 Nov, a bomb went off in the premises of Rupandehi District Court in Bhairahawa, causing no injuries. Police found the explosives and it detonated as a bomb disposal unit was on its way to diffuse it. Sanyukta Jatiya Terai Mukti Morcha, an underground outfit, sent a message to local media claiming that they were responsible.
5 people were injured in a bomb explosion by an unidentified group in Nepalgunj city, Mid-West, on 29 December.
1 person was killed in a landmine explosion at a Nepal Army manned telephone repeater tower in Dhanwang village, Mid-West, on 10 Jan.

A socket bomb went off in the Women Development and Children office in Rautahat, shortly after the bomb blast in the bus on 25 March. No causalities were reported, although infrastructure in the office was damaged.
On 25 March, at least three persons were injured when a socket bomb went off inside a running bus at Bhediyahi in Rautahat. No one has owned up to the incident so far.
A bomb, suspected to be planted by JTMM, exploded in Tulapur village, Mid-West, on 26 March, causing no casualties.

On 26 March 2011, at least six passengers were injured when a bomb went off inside a bus at Piprahwa of Nepalgunj along the Kohalpur - Banke section of the Mahendra Highway in Banke district. According to police, two were in a critical condition.

ACTOR1: JTMM-R: Democratic Terai Liberation Front-Rajan Mukti
NOTES: On 27 March, 28 passengers were injured when an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) exploded in a passenger bus heading for Butwal from Bhairahawa. Three passengers were critically injured at Milan Chowk in Butwal. Nobody has yet claimed responsibility for the incident, but authorities suspected the Bhagat Singh-led Janatantrik Tarai Mukti Morcha group. This is the third such incident of explosion in a passenger bus in the past three days.
On 2 April, 2 people were killed in a bomb explosion in Dolpa district at Dolpa headquarters Dunai. No other details were reported.
Two children were killed when a bomb went off at Thehe VDC in Humla headquarters in Simkot on 2 April. No other details were reported.
On 11 April, a pressure cooker bomb went off at the Revenue Office in Belbari in Morang and flyers of Khumbuwan Mukti Morcha were found at the incident area. No other details were reported.

On 11 April, a bomb went-off at the Koshi Region Transportation office in Itahari, Sunsari. A pressure cooker bomb went off outside a room that had important documents, but no injuries were reported. Flyers of Khumbuwan Mukti Morcha were found at the incident area.

ACTOR1: JTMM-R: Democratic Terai Liberation Front-Rajan Mukti
NOTES: Cadres of the Janatantrik Terai Mukti Morcha (Rajan Mukti) exploded a bomb in Sagarmatha Transport Zonal Office in Siraha on 17 April. No one was injured but window panes and doors of the office were partially damaged.

ACTOR1: JTMM-R: Democratic Terai Liberation Front-Rajan Mukti
NOTES: Three people were injured in a bomb attack on a bus as it was returning to Jaleshwar after transporting CPN-UML cadres from a program on 28 April. An Improvised Explosive Device (IED) was planted by the Janatantrik Tarai Mukti Morcha (Rajan Mukti).
An unidentified group triggered an IED at a police post in Mahammadpur, an area in Bardiya district, Mid-West, on 20 June. 1 police officer was injured in the explosion.
JTMM detonated an IED at the customs office in Gulariya municipality, Mid-West, on 7 July. No casualties reported.
On 12 July, KNF detonated an IED in Dharan municipality (Sunsari, Koshi). No casualties reported.
On 12 July, KNF detonated an IED in Itahari municipality (Sunsari, Koshi). No casualties reported.

On 5 August, a bomb went off at the Nepal Electricity Authority, District Centre at Itahari of Sunsari. No one was injured. It was the second bomb in the area in a week. Samyukta Limbuwan Morcha, an armed outfit operating in the eastern hilly districts, has owned up to the blast at the NEA.

ACTOR1: JTMM-R: Democratic Terai Liberation Front-Rajan Mukti
NOTES: A bomb exploded in front of Simyaks Meat Factory in Narsingha of Sunsari in 5 Sept. The compound walls of the factory were damaged by the blast, and it was known that the Chinese funded factory was the target of the attack. Police are further investigating. From last few months Khambhuwan Mukti Morcha (Samyukta) and Terai Janatantrik Mukti Morcha have been terrorizing Sunsari and Morang districts with such incidents.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
NOTES: An unidentified group detonated a bomb at the personal residence of a UCPN (Maoist) leader in Bhardaha-1 of Saptari district on 28 Sept. A bomb disposal team diffused two other socket bombs, also planted at the house. No one was injured. Police have started investigating the case, claiming that the motive behind the attack was a political revenge.

On 28 Sept, an unidentified group detonated a bomb at the District Land Revenue Office in Bhojpur (Koshi). No casualties were reported. Police reportedly found a bundle of leaflets of Khumbuwan Mukti Morcha (Samyukta), an underground armed outfit. No other details were reported.

In Chatakpur of Kailali district a pressure cooker packed with explosives went off early in the morning on 28 Sept, leaving a truck partly damaged. No injuries were reported. Another bomb was found and defused later, in the same area, planted under a bus.

An underground armed outfit detonated a powerful bomb near the District Land Reform Office in Nepalgunj in Banke district on 2 Nov. An explosive was set off near the room of the office in-charge, causing minor damage. Terai Madhes Mukti Party took responsibility.

A bomb, allegedly planted by Nepal Defense Army, a Hindu extremist organization, went off in front of the office of United Mission to Nepal in Kathmandu on 22 Nov. However, no injury or property loss was reported. The UMN has been working as a bridge between Nepali people and Christian organizations. Police had yet to establish whether the Christian missionary was targeted.

In Bara district, a bomb went off at the house of Mukseh Jaisawal at district headquarters in Kalaiya on 28 Nov. Police said there were no casualties and the Madhes Rastra Janatantrik Party has owned up to the explosion.

On 3 Dec, at least five people were injured when a bomb disposal squad of Nepal Army tasked with defusing explosives tried to defuse a 'time bomb' planted at an urban area of Itahari. Khumbuwan Mukti Morcha-Unified has taken the responsibility for plating the bomb in a densely populated area.

A bomb went off at the District Development Committee office in Kathmandu on 9 Dec, causing minor damage to the office. The bomb had exploded before a disposal squad of the Nepali Army reached the site. The Janatantrik Terai Madhes Mukti Party, an underground outfit, owned up to the blast.

A bomb blast took place at a shop in Chandanigahapur, the second biggest market of Rautahat district, on 25 Dec. A child sustained minor injuries while the The Rose Cold Store at Chandranigahapur VDC-7 suffered some damages. The Janatantrik Tarai Madhesh Party claimed responsibility for the bomb blast.

On 25 Dec, a bomb went off at the under-construction Sonapur Cement Udhyog at Dudhara of Dang district. No one was injured and another bomb was found at the site. The Terai Janatantrik Mukti Morcha, an underground outfit, claimed responsibility for the bomb.
An unidentified group detonated an IED in Kathmandu city, Central, on 6 Jan. No casualties reported.
A Nepal Army officer was injured while defusing a bomb planted by an unidentified group in Bara district, Central, on 9 Jan.
A Nepal Army officer was injured while defusing a bomb planted by an unidentified group in Sarmujawa Village, Central, on 21 Jan.

On 24 Jan, An IED planted inside a passenger bus by militant outfit went off in Tulsipur of Dang District in the morning. However, there were no casualties or any serious injuries in the incident. Police said that they have found leaflets of JTMM, an outfit active in Terai area, inside the bus.
1 person was killed in a grenade explosion at a shop in Pokhara city, West, on 25 Jan. The grenade was planted by an unidentified group.

On 1 Feb, Samyukta Madheshi Mukti Morcha (SMMM) detonated a bomb at KP Store belonging to Kul Prasad Kandel (35) at Radha Krishna Chowk of Gulariya Municipality-8 in Bardiya District. The explosion caused minor damage to the counter and property but no human casualty occurred as the bomb went off during night.
3 people were killed and 5 injured when a bomb exploded outside the Nepal Oil Corporation office in Kathmandu city, Central, on 27 Feb. SJMM claimed responsibility for the blast.

Three people were killed and seven others injured when a powerful bomb went off near the Singha Durbar, the country's administrative hub, in Kathmandu, on 28 Feb. The explosion was outside the Nepal Oil Corporation (NOC) central office at Babarmahal. The Samyukta Jatiya Mukti Morcha-Bishwokranti (SJMM) claimed responsibility.

JTMM detonated a pressure-cooker bomb at a house belonging to a transport entrepreneur at Tikari of Tulsipur Municipality-8, on 7 March. The blast, however, caused no human casualty or damage. The district coordinator of JTMM has claimed responsibility for the blast.

Radio Paschimanchal, an FM radio-station of the UCPN(M) in Palpa District, was blown up by an unidentified group on 15 March. The blast took place at the third floor of the building where the FM office was stationed, leaving the office completely damaged. However, no human casualty was reported. UCPN(M) cadres reside in the other two floor of the building. No one has claimed responsibility for the explosion.

An unknown group exploded a socket-bomb outside a school at Balaju in Kathmandu on 15 March. Police said the bomb smashed window panes of the ground floor of Pragati Higher Secondary School. However, no one was hurt in the incident.
On 22 March, JTMM detonated a bomb at the Naya Bus Park in Tulsipur Municipality-5 of Dang District. One person sustained minor injury in the incident.

The Traffic Police office in Jaleswhar Municipal-5 in Mahottari District was damaged in a powerful bomb explosion on 31 March. However, no casualties have been reported in the incident. No person or group has yet owned up responsibility for the blast.
2 civilians were killed in a bomb explosion by an unidentified group at their house in Kataujapani in Baitadi district, Far-West, on 31 March.

ACTOR1: JTMM-J: Democratic Terai Liberation Front-Jwala Singh
NOTES: JTMM- J detonated a bomb at the rented house of a businessman in Kothiya, Gulariya VDC-10 on 23 April. The blast caused minor damage to the house. Meanwhile, JTMM-J in-charge Ranbir has owned up the blast saying that the businessman had failed to provide NPR 100,000 as donation to his group and that he had spied against his group.
An explosion by an unidentified group was reported in Janakpur city, Central, on 2 May. No casualties reported.

An improvised explosive device of moderate intensity went off in Jalbire, Sindhupalchowk, nearby a Maoist meeting which was attended by the country's Finance Minister onb 2 June. The bomb exploded while a Maoist politician was addressing the gathering. No was hurt in the explosion, which has caused slight damage to the school building where the meeting was held. Eyewitnesses claimed to have seen two people fleeing the explosion site and the police have arrested three people. No other details were reported.

A bomb went off at Dursanchar Chowk in Banepa without any damage or injuries on 3 Dec. A pamphlet of Biswabhumi Sena Bishal Nepal was recovered from the explosion site. It has warned against looting and dividing the country in the name of democracy and republic system.
2 civilians were killed in a bomb explosion by an unidentified group in Birendranagar city, Mid-West in March.
A bomb exploded at the front gate of the District Development Office (DAO) Dhanusa on 1 April. No group has claimed responsibility.

An explosive went off at the quarters of Suresh Raut, a planning officer of the Siraha District Development Committee (DDC) office on 3 April. The explosion caused minor damage to the building after the fire ignited chairs, curtains and others materials. The Terai-based underground outfit, the Terai Communist Party claimed responsibility for the explosion. They said that they carried out the act to protest the embezzlement and corruption of the funds allocated for Madhes at the DDC.
A bomb, planted by an unidentified group, exploded at a police office in Kaski district, West, on 9 April. No casualties reported.

NOTES: The ancestral house of the Royal Nepalese Army spokesperson, Colonel Deepak Gurung, was blown up by a group of Maoists in Kawasoti in Nawalparasi on 18 Jan. There were no casualties, however. No other details were reported.

Six people were seriously injured when a pipe bomb went off at a workshop in Dashera VDC on 20 Feb. A local had brought the pipe to the workshop after he found in the jungle, and police suspected that the improvised explosive device (IED) had been left behind the jungle during the Maoist insurgency. The next day, one of the injured succumbed to his injuries in the hospital.

Two children were critically injured when an abandoned bomb went off in Dandare Patal Community Forest of Swanra VDC-6 on 12 March. Police said was a detonator bomb and believe it was concealed during the decade long Maoist insurgency.

A minor was seriously injured in a village of Jajarkot district when an unattended improvised explosive device (IED) went off on 18 March. This is the fourth incident of stray IED explosion in the district, which were placed during the Maoist insurgency.

A minor was injured when a socket bomb went off at Ghamir-9 of Gulmi on 13 July. According to police, the injured was playing with the explosive device found at the doors of his cowshed. No other details were reported.

A child was killed and eight others injured when a bomb went off at Gobindapur-7 in Siraha on 27 July. A huge crowd had gathered to take a glimpse of suspicious object brought by a local that she found while cutting grass. Locals said someone unknowingly detonated the bomb while handling the suspicious object. No other details were reported.
In Morang, two unidentified persons exploded an improvised explosive device at MM Plastic Industry in Biratnagar on Sunday [23 August].
An unidentified armed group detonated a cylinder bomb at the Police Station of Lamahi located in the Lamahi Municipality, Dang district, on Saturday [19 August]. No one was injured in the attack.

A bomb explosion took place at Lamki Chuha Municipality-2, Thakalipur, of Kailali district on Monday [21 September]. No one was injured in the attack. No armed group has claimed responsibility so far.
An IED planted by an unidentified group exploded near the Gautam Buddha Airport in Bhairahawa (Siddharthanagar) on Thursday [8 October]. The reason behind the explosion is still unknown.

Bombs have gone off at two Boudha-based schools in the Capital on Tuesday [20 September] morning. The attack was claimed by Maoist Communist Centre (MCC), after the talks with PABSON and NPABSON, organisation of private school operators, failed.

With the Free Students Union election just around the corner, tension has flared at both of the colleges in the district. Unidentified assailants have detonated an improvised explosive device (IED) at Drabya Shah Multiple Campus (Laxmibazar).
On 10 April, a homemade bomb exploded near the Nepal-India border on the Nepali side in Laxmipur Belbichhawa of Rautahat district. A woman and her buffalo were injured.

NOTES: On March 8, an explosion occurred in an underground parking lot in Basundhara locality of Kathmandu city (Kathmandu district, Bagmati), which targeted the chairman of the Nepal Association of Foreign Employment Agencies. Netra Bikram Chand led Communist Party of Nepal took responsibility for the incident.
On 12 March 2019, an unidentified group detonated a cylinder bomb at municipal ward office in Bharatpur city (Chitwan). No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: CPN(M)-NBC: Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)-Netra Bikram Chand
NOTES: On 14 March 2019, Netra Bikram Chand led Communist Party of Nepal detonated an IED near the District Police Headquarter and Division Forest Office in Kawasoti city (Nawalpur). The party had called a nation wide general strike demanding the release of their party cadres. No casualties occurred.

ACTOR1: CPN(M)-NBC: Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)-Netra Bikram Chand
NOTES: On March 25, Chand-led Nepal Communist Party exploded a bomb targeting a police van, which was assigned for the security of a local school in Ratadab locality near Jubitha area (Kalikot district, Karnali).

ACTOR1: CPN(M)-NBC: Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)-Netra Bikram Chand
NOTES: On April 29, Netra Bikram Chand-led Communist Party of Nepal detonated an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) at Liwang city (Rolpa district, Rapti), targeting the Province 5 Chief Minister, Shanker Pokhrel.

ACTOR1: CPN(M)-NBC: Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)-Netra Bikram Chand
NOTES: On April 30, Netra Bikram Chand-led Communist Party of Nepal detonated an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) at Triveni Rural Municipality near Jungar area (Rolpa district, Rapti), targeting the Province 5 Chief Minister, Shanker Pokhrel.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Government of Nepal (2015-); FSFN: Federal Socialist Forum, Nepal
NOTES: On May 17, an improvised explosive device went off at the residence of a rural municipality chair associated with the Federal Socialist Forum Party in Balan-Bihul Rural Municipality near Malhaniya area (Saptari district, Sagarmatha). Akhil Terai Mukti Morcha took the responsibility of the explosion citing that the chair was involved in financial irregularities and was unsupportive towards their cause.

ACTOR1: CPN(M)-NBC: Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)-Netra Bikram Chand
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: CPN(M)-NBC: Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)-Netra Bikram Chand
SOURCE: Kathmandu Post; Himalayan Times; Rising Nepal
NOTES: On 26 May 2019, a pressure cooker bomb, planted by the cadres of Netra Bikram Chand led Communist Party of Nepal, exploded prematurely in a barber's shop at Sukedhara locality of Kathmandu city (Kathmandu district, Bagmati), injuring one civilian, and several party members. Three cadres of the party died during the accidental set off of the bomb and another 1 cadre died during treatment. One of the injured cadre was identified as the member of Newa Mukti Morcha, one of the sister wings of the Chand-led party.

ACTOR1: CPN(M)-NBC: Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)-Netra Bikram Chand
NOTES: On May 29, a bomb was exploded by Netra Bikram Chand led Communist Party (Maoist) targeting the Chief Minister of Karnali Province in Palata Rural Municipality's Thirpu locality (Kalikot district, Karnali). The Chief Minister, accompanied by the Social Development Minister and his team, was in the area to inaugurate 11th District-level President Running Shield Competition and Palata Sports and Tourism Festival.

ACTOR1: CPN(M)-NBC: Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)-Netra Bikram Chand
NOTES: On July 18, several persons were injured in the explosion of an IED, possibly planted by Netra Bikram Chand led Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist), in a local hotel at Chatakpur locality of Dhangadhi Sub Metropolis (Kailali district, Seti). One person died following the incident.

ACTOR1: CPN(M)-NBC: Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)-Netra Bikram Chand
NOTES: On July 31, a bomb was detonated, possibly by the cadres of Netra Bikram Chand led Communist Party (Maoist), in the ward offices of Chandrapur Municipality (Rautahat district, Narayani). Properties, including official documents, were destroyed in the explosion.

ACTOR1: CPN(M)-NBC: Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)-Netra Bikram Chand
NOTES: On July 31, a bomb was detonated, possibly by the cadres of Netra Bikram Chand led Communist Party (Maoist), in the ward offices of Kakani Rural Municipality (Nuwakot district, Bagmati). Properties, including official documents, were destroyed in the explosion.
On August 3, an unidentified group exploded a cylinder at the ward office of Khadadevi rural municipality-3 (Ramechhap district, Janakpur). The explosion caused property damages in the ward office.

ACTOR1: CPN(M)-NBC: Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)-Netra Bikram Chand
NOTES: On August 14, a group of cadres of the outlawed Netra Bikram Chand-led Nepal Communist Party (Maoist) detonated an improvised explosive device (IED) targeting the Chief Minister of Karnali Province at Khigma area in Pachaljharana rural municipality near Kalikot area (Kalikot district, Karnali). Further investigation of the incident is underway.

ACTOR1: CPN(M)-NBC: Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)-Netra Bikram Chand
NOTES: On September 8, Netra BIkram Chand led Communist Party (Maoist) detonated a pressure cooker bomb at Gauradaha Municipality Office at Gauradaha locality (Jhapa district, Mechi). Properties were damaged as a result of the incident.

ACTOR1: CPN(M)-NBC: Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)-Netra Bikram Chand
NOTES: On September 8, Netra BIkram Chand led Communist Party (Maoist) detonated a pressure cooker bomb at Sahara Nepal Cooperatives in Charpane locality of Birtamod Municipality (Jhapa district, Mechi). Properties were damaged as a result of the incident.
On November 25, a bomb was detonated at the house of a ward chairman of Pokhara Metropolis (Kaski district). The explosion damaged a vehicle parked at his residence.

On November 27, a bomb was detonated in the election campaign rally of the ruling Nepal Communist Party at Pradarshani Kendra locality in Pokhara Metropolitan City (Kaski district). A vehicle was reported damaged as a result of the explosion.

On November 28, an improvised explosive device was detonated at the contact office of Nepal Communist Party candidate Bikram Chaudhary near Pipara area (Mahottari district). Further investigation of the incident is underway.

On November 30, a bomb was detonated near an election center in Sundarbazar Municipality (Lamjung district). The bomb was possibly exploded to obstruct the election by inflicting fear amongst the voters.
On November 30, two bombs were detonated in two different election centers of Pokhara Metropolitan city (Kaski district). The election was affected for a brief time following the incident.

On November 30, an unknown person threw a bomb inside a school compound, which was used as an election center, in Pokhara Metropolitan city (Kaski district). The walls of the school compound were damaged as a result of the explosion.

ACTOR1: CPN(M)-NBC: Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)-Netra Bikram Chand
NOTES: On December 11, possibly members of Chand-led party exploded a bomb in Deukhuri locality of Gadhawa Rural Municipality (Dang district). The explosion caused property damages to a civilian's house. No casualties were reported. Further investigation is underway. [size=no report]

On December 13, two civilians and a policeman were killed in a bomb explosion in Kshireshwarnath Municipality-5 near Mahendranagar area (Dhanusha district). The explosion occurred when the policeman was trying to verify if the suspicious bag placed at a civilian's residence contained IED. Several people were also injured in the incident. Further investigation is underway.

ACTOR1: CPN(M)-NBC: Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)-Netra Bikram Chand
NOTES: On January 25, a group, suspected of belonging to Chand-led outfit, detonated an IED (Improvised Explosive Device) at the construction site of Arun Hydropower project in Chichila Rural Municipality (Sankhuwasabha district). Properties were damaged in the incident. Further investigation is underway.

Assumed on 22 February 2020, a bomb planted by an unidentified group exploded in Martadi city (Bajura district), when a team of Nepal Army tried to dispose it. Civilian properties sustained damages during the incident.

ACTOR1: CPN(M)-NBC: Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)-Netra Bikram Chand
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Former Government of Nepal (2015-); NCP: Nepal Communist Party
NOTES: On 11 March 2020, a powerful bomb was detonated, allegedly by the cadres of Chand-led outfit, at the newly-constructed house of the former Minister for Communications and Information Technology Gokul Baskota in Lokanthali Manohara locality of Madhyapur Thimi municipality (Bhaktapur district). Properties were damaged in the incident. Further investigation of the incident is underway.

On 22 March 2020, an explosive device went off in Fulbasti locality of Godawari Municipality-4 (Kailali district). One person was reported dead following the explosion. Further investigation of the incident is ongoing.

On 30 April 2020, an unidentified group detonated a bomb in Duwagaun village of Triveni Rural Municipality-7 near Holeri area (Rolpa district). Four persons were killed in the incident. Further investigation is ongoing.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: NCP: Nepal Communist Party; Former Government of Nepal (2015-)
NOTES: On 18 July 2020, unidentified group exploded a bomb at the residence of a Nepal Communist Party leader and former VDC chairman in Aurahi rural municipality (Siraha district). The victim sustained injuries and is undergoing treatment at a district hospital.

ACTOR1: CPN(M)-NBC: Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)-Netra Bikram Chand
NOTES: On 22 November 2020, an improvised explosive device was detonated, suspectedly by the cadres of Chand-led party, at the municipal office of Tapli rural municipality (Udayapur district). Office properties were reported damaged during the incident. Two cadres of Chand-led outfit have been arrested in connection with the incident.

On 3 December 2020, an unidentified armed group exploded an improvised explosive device in the mine area of Solar Cement Industry at Bhantawari locality in Katari municipality-8 (Udayapur district). Five mine workers were injured as a result of the blast. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: CPN(M)-NBC: Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)-Netra Bikram Chand
NOTES: On 22 January 2021, Chand-led party detonated a bomb at Bethanchowk locality near Banepa area (Kavrepalanchok district), against the arrest of its central secretariat member. No casualties were reported following the incident. The outfit had called for nationwide strike on 23 January 2020, against the arrest of its central secretariat member.

SOURCE: Kathmandu Post; My Republica (Nepal); Himalayan Times; COCAP-Nepal Monitor
NOTES: On 14 March 2021, Janatantrik Terai Mukti Morcha-Revolutionary, led-by Jaya Krishna Goit, detonated a pressure cooker bomb at the premises of Land Revenue Office in Lahan municipality (Siraha district), as part of their campaign against corruption in the Terai region. Government properties were damaged and several people, including an office staff, were injured during the incident.

A police spokesman confirmed at least 93 were killed and as many as 100 others were injured in a vehicular suicide bombing by 3 suspected Taliban militants on a volleyball match in Shah Hassankhel town in Lakki Marwat.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: At least 3 Taliban militants were killed and 2 injured by a US drone strike in Ghundikala village, near Miramshah. It was confirmed that a key Taliban commander, Haji Omar, was killed in the attack.

At least 5 people, including a pro-government tribal elder, were killed by a remote detonation of a bomb near their vehicle just outside the village of Salarzai, near Khar. Local officials believe Taliban rebels planted the explosive.
Militants blew up 2 schools and a basic health centre in the Malangi area of Tehsil Mamund near Bara. No casualties were reported.

The attack allegedly targeted the schoolgirls and not the American personnel. The Koto Girls High School was devastated in the explosion. The U.S. embassy released a statement saying the US soldiers were working to train FC forces in the area. [women targeted: girls]
5 rockets were fired at a school in the Badrashi area of Nowshera during the night. The school was partially damaged but no casualties were reported.
Property destruction: An explosive was thrown at a house on Almo Chowk causing significant property damage but no casualties.

On February 5, at least 34 people were killed and more than 100 injured in two bomb attacks by suspected TTP militants in Karachi. The first was a bomb blast on Shahra-e-Faisal which hit a bus carrying Shia Chehlum procession mourners, killing 12 and wounding over 50. The second was caused by a motorcycle with a bomb on it outside Jinnah Hospital where the wounded from the first blast were taken, killing 13 and wounding more than 50. There was dispute over whether the attacks were suicide blasts or remote detonations. Police claimed they also defused a bomb planted in a television set at the hospital. By Feb.8 the death toll had risen to a total of 34.

At least 3 members of the FC and 1 bystander were injured when a bomb planted on a motorcycle exploded in the Killi Ibrahimzai area of Quetta as a police van passed by. One of the injured FC personnel later died. The Baloch Liberation Front claimed responsibility.
At least 3 members of the FC and 9 others were injured when a remote bomb planted by on a motorcycle went off as an FC vehicle passed by a busy hotel on Jinnah Road. The BLF is suspected.
A gas pipeline which was under construction near a western bypass in Quetta was destroyed by suspected Baloch separatists.
Suspected Taliban militants blew up the grave of a member of the FC killed in recent clashes with militants in Bajaur Agency.

2 people were injured when militants blew up a CD shop in the main bazaar of Hangu district.

1 person was killed and 2 others injured in a landmine explosion of the outskirt sof Dera Bugti.

A bomb exploded in the Koto Moto area of Shahdadkot, injuring 2 people and damaging vehicles and shops in the area.

7 Taliban militants were killed and 2 hideouts destroyed in an airstrike by the Pakistani military.

At least 30 militants were killed, including 3 important commanders, in shelling and assaults by helicopter gunships and security forces including FC personnel in the Pandyali area of Mohmand Agency following an earlier attack by militants in the Agency.
At least 1 FC member was killed and 2 injured when suspected Baloch separatists either threw a grenade at their vehicle or detonated a bomb on Spanni Road.

15 people were killed and dozens injured, including at least 15 youths, when a 17-year old suicide bomber rammed a cart laden with explosives into a convoy of vehicles being escorted by security forces in the Thall area of Hangu on its way to Parachinar.
1-2 people was injured in a grenade attack on Sibbi Jinnah Road.
The BLF has claimed responsibility for a bomb blast that injured 2 people in Sibi, which targeted an alleged informer.

2 members of the security forces were injured by 2 rockets fired by militants on Bargha checkpost in Ladha tehsil.

2 boys were seriously injured when a mortar shell hit their house in the Feroze Khel area of lower Orakzai Agency. Local tribesmen blamed security forces but army sources say they were not present in the area and would have been unable to hit the house regardless.

14 people were killed, including 2 police officers and at least 8 SIA personnel who were mostly retired soldiers, and as many as 89 injured when a suicide car bomb struck the Special Investigations Agency (SIA) interrogation centre the Model Town area of Lahore, totally destroying the building with a blast heard as far as 12 kilometers away. The TTP claimed responsibility for the blast.

2 people were killed when their vehicle hit a roadside remote-controlled bomb planted by suspected Taliban militants.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: At least 14 died when a US drone struck near Ziaret and Madakhel villages near Miranshah in North Waziristan on March 10. Airstrikes were carried out by Pakistani jets on suspected militant positions in Ladha, killing 2 and wounding 7.

3 people were killed and at least 8 others injured in a blast allegedly targeting members of the FC.

At least 68 people were killed (including later deaths from injuries) and over 120 injured in at least 7 explosions in 24 hours in Lahore. The official casualty toll for the security forces (included in these numbers), which was confirmed by the military, was 5 dead and 10 injured. The large majority of the casualties were caused by 2 suicide bomb attacks (either by assailants on foot or motorcycles) which targeted military vehicles of the Garrison Security Force in the RA Bazaar area of South Cantt in Lahore which took place shortly before the beginning of Friday prayers. A series of low-intensity explosions also occurring in the Allama Iqbal Town and another later in the night in Samanabad.
A young shepherd died after stepping on a landmine in the Garha Akhunzada area near Dera Ismail Khan.
One passerby was injured when a NATO oil tanker was blown up with an 'explosive device' planted by suspected Taliban militants near the Chaman Customs House.
2 children were injured by a stray mortar shell fired across the border with Afghanistan by the Afghan National Army (ANA) after Taliban forces attacked an ANA checkpost in Afghanistan.
1 person was killed and 4 injured by a blast caused by a home-made bomb in the Soldier Bazaar area under the Liyari expressway in Karachi.

Suspected Taliban militants bleww up a boys school with planted explosive material.

NOTES: 63 civilians were allegedly killed and dozens injured by the security forces during airstrikes in the Sra vella area of the Tirah Valley in Jamrud division of Khyber Agency. At least 50 of these were killed in one strike on a Jirga at the house of Hameed Khan Janikhel, who is a serving soldier. Many of those killed and injured were former or current soldiers, or members of the paramilitary forces. Many were from the Kukikhel communal group. The Pakistani military has claimed that all those killed were militants. The Chief of Army Staff apologized for the attack.

6 personnel of law-enforcement agencies were wounded in a bomb blast in Quetta. Suspected Baloch separatists planted explosive device, which exploded and damaged a power pylon.

15 militants were killed, while 8 injured when military forces used fighter jets to target militant hideouts in Orakzai Agency.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: Near Miranshah, US drones fired missiles into a target in North Waziristan, killing 10 people including suspected militants and 2 women and 2 children.
Security forces used heavy shelling on militant hideouts in lower Orakzai agency, killing 18 militants.

The Difa-e-Nazria-e-Pakistan was responsible for five minor blasts in Lahore but no casualties were caused. The low-intensity blasts shattered the windowpanes of some of the houses and shops in the area.
2 personnel of Frontier Corps (FC) were killed and 4 were injured in a rocket attack at a check post in Gwadar by theBaloch Liberation Front (BLF).
5 low intensity blasts in Lahore's populated areas injured 5 people.

4 people were killed and 5 others sustained injuries when helicopter gunships shelled suspected hideouts of militants in the Arkhanga area of Tirah Valley in Khyber Agency in response to attacks on security check posts.
In Awaran, suspected Baloch separatists placed explosive material near premises of DC Office which exploded.
On May 23, at least 71 TTP militants were killed, including four commanders, when Pakistan Air force jets destroyed seven of their hideouts in Upper Orakzai.
Security forces killed 38 militants and injured 21 militants in air attacks on their hideouts in Orakzai.
25 militants were killed several sustained injuries when the security forces pounded the militant's hideouts in Upper Orakzai Agency
In a joint airstrike, the Pakistan Air Force (PAF) jet aircrafts and helicopter gunships bombed militant hideouts in Mamoozai, Ghalju and Debori, killing 17 militants and injuring 11 others.
Militants blew up 2 government-run schools and the office of directorate of agriculture in the Safi tehsil of the Mohmand Agency.
Security forces fired artillery shells at a militant camp in the Kasha area of Orakzai, killing 25 militants and destroying the camp.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On 28 May, 11 suspected militants were killed and three others got injured in a US drone attack in the Nazai Narai area (South Waziristan Agency, FATA).
On May 28, at least 80 TTP militants were killed and 60 injured in air strikes of security forces in Orakzai Agency during an on-going operation against militants.

Places of worship of Ahmedis were attacked in the areas of Garhi Shahu and Model Town-C in which 72 persons were killed and 125 others were injured in firing, hand grenades attacks and car explosions.
Suspected Baloch separatists hurled a grenade at the a police station in Quetta that landed and exploded outside its compound. Police personnel remained unhurt in the blast.
Unidentified men hurled hand grenade at the house of a PPP leader in which a 10-year-old girl suffered injuries.
Suspected militants planted 2 explosive devices that exploded near a grid station in Dera Ismail Kha.
12 militants were killed in air strikes of jet fighters while eight others sustained severe injuries in Orakzai Agency
Fighter jets of the security forces attacked the hideouts of militants in Orakzai, killing 15 militants on the spot and injuring 14 others.
On 1 June, seven people, including a minor, received injuries in a grenade attack by unidentified armed men in Hub (Lasbela, Balochistan).
A blast caused by a planted explosive device resulted in damage to a bridge on Quetta-Karachi National Highway near Kalat on 1 June 2010.
Unidentified armed men hurled a grenade at a government primary school at Mano Jan Road, Quetta on 1 June 2010. No loss of life occurred.
At least three women and two minors were killed by mortar shells hitting their houses in Mir Kalam Khel in Orakzai.
At least 9 suspected. TTP militants were killed and another six injured in an aerial attack on Orakzai by security forces on 3 June 2010.
On 5 June, at least seven people were wounded when unidentified armed men threw a hand grenade at a group of people outside Taj hotel in Khuzdar town (Balochistan).

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: An US drone strike killed 3 suspected TTP militants in Mir Ali, NWA on 09 June 2010.
A roadside bomb killed one Naval Police Official and wounded three in Baldia Town, Karachi on 10 June 2010. Lashkar-e-Balochistan has taken responsibility.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: At least 4 suspected TTP militants were killed on 10 June 2010 during a US drone attack in the village of Norak, 20km east of Miranshah town in North Waziristan. 4 civilians were also killed, bringing the total fatalities to 8.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: At least 10 militants, from both Al Qaeda and the TTP, were killed in a US drone attack on the village of Mizar Madakhel outside Miranshah town. Foreign militants were also killed in the strike
Susp TTP militants blew up four schools in different areas of Orakzai Agency on 12 June 2010. Six abandoned houses were also blown up.
At least four suspected TTP militants were killed and 25 others sustained injuries when jet fighters hit suspected militant hideouts in Bara, Khyber Agency on 12 June 2010.
Four people including two cops were injured when unknown gunmen hurled a hand grenade on a police patrolling van on Dr Bano Road of Quetta on 13 June 2010.
Two people were wounded in a hand grenade attack in Hub when unidentified armed men threw it at a house in Asad Chowk on 13 June 2010.
Ten suspected TTP militants were killed and six sustained injuries in shelling by military gunship helicopters and jet fighters in Upper Tehsil Orakzai Agency on 14 June 2010.
A NATO oil tanker was partially damaged in a bomb blast near Chaman on 15 June 2010. No casualties were reported.
An FC vehicle went through a remote control bomb attack, but did not suffer damages in Mashkay on 16 June 2010.

Pakistani attack helicopters and heavy artillery, along with military, engaged in battle with suspected TTP militants near Khar, Bajaur Agency on 16 June 2010. 63 militants were killed along with 10 soldiers.
Suspected TTP militants planted a remote control bomb and blew up the house of a policeman in Nowshera. His brother and sister were injured. The attack took place on 17 June 2010.
A woman was injured in a grenade attack at Brewery Road, Quetta, when unidentified armed men threw a hand grenade into her house on 17 June 2010.
Unidentified armed men hurled a hand grenade at the house of a PPP leader in Maripur, Karachi on 18 June 2010. No casualties were reported.

A roadside bomb targeted a police patrol, wounding six policemen and three passers-by in Dera Ismail Khan on 19 June 2010. One of the officers reportedly played an important role in arresting militants. One of the passers-by later died (supp. Research).
2 policemen were injured when militants attacked a checkpost with rockets and hand grenades in Batgram police limits, Charsadda on 19 June 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A suspected US drone strike killed 16 people on 19 June 2010, when it hit a house in Haider Khel, Mir Ali, NWA.
A woman was killed and a minor injured when a mortar shell fired by unidentified armed men hit a house in Shamsha on 19 June 2010.

Three soldiers sustained injuries in a roadside bomb blast in Baizai, Mohmand Agency on 19 June 2010. The landmine was planted by suspected TTP militants, and six other such devices were later found by security forces in the area.
Military pounded suspected TTP militant positions in Upper Tehsil, Mohmand Agency on 20 June 2010, killing 20 militants and injuring 17 others. Four hideouts were destroyed.
Four civilians were killed and two injured when a bomb fired by unidentified armed men hit the house of a civilian in Mamozai on 20 June 2010.
Helicopter gunships shelled militants in Baizai, Mohmand Agency, killing four suspected TTP militants and injuring 10 on 20 June 2010.
A car bomb killed one soldier and wounded 10 others in Quetta on 20 June 2010. The car bomb exploded as four military vehicles were passing by. Seven soldiers and four civilians were injured.
A man was injured when unidentified armed men hurled a hand grenade at his house in Goth Hussain Bukhsh Lashari, near DMJ on 23 June 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AQIS: Al Qaeda in the Indian Subcontinent
NOTES: At least 2 militants (assumed TTP and AQIS), along with 3 injured were killed when a drone strike hit a house in Khushkali village in Mir Ali, North Waziristan on June 26.
At least eight suspected TTP militants were killed and six injured by fighter pilot jets on 26 June 2010 in Orakzai. Two militant hideouts were also destroyed.
Two low-intensity bombs exploded in a CD market in Lahore on 26 June 2010, injuring four people. Shopkeepers in the area had received threatening letters earlier.

24 militants were killed and 10 injured when security personnel bombed a private hospital which had been occupied by suspected TTP militants. Four abandoned houses and 13 shops were also damaged. This took place in Bahram Khak, Mamozai on 27 June 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: At least six suspected. TTP militants were killed and three others injured when a US drone fired two missiles on a suspected militant compound in Miranshah, North Waziristan Agency on 27 June 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
ACTOR2: AQIS: Al Qaeda in the Indian Subcontinent
NOTES: At least 8 militants were killed and two injured when a US drone fired two missiles at an al-Qaeda safe house in Wana, SWA on 29 June 2010.
One civilian was injured in an explosion orchestrated by unidentified assailants in Quetta on 30 June 2010.
A convoy of the security forces was attacked with a remote-controlled bomb in Sarmalu Kandao area of Orakzai Agency, however no casualty was reported. This took place on 30 June 2010.
On June 30, at least 20 TTP militants were killed and 15 injured during the air strikes of security forces in Upper Orakzai areas.

At least 43 (supp. Research) people were killed and 175 others injured in three suicide bomb blasts which took place at the shrine, Data Darbar, in Lahore on 1 July 2010. TTP later claimed responsibility for the attack.
A man was killed and another injured when a bomb exploded at Turbat Grid Station on 1 July 2010. It is not clear who planted the bomb.
Two sisters were killed and their brother injured when their house was attacked by a hand grenade thrown by unidentified assailants in Sariab, Quetta on 1 July 2010.
Four people, two of them students and two WAPDA employees, were injured when unidentified armed men threw a hand grenade at a WAPDA vehicle in Bara Qadeem on 1 July 2010.
At least five people were injured in three rocket attacks by unidentified gunmen in three different places in Quetta on 1 July 2010.
Four security personnel were killed and five injured in a remote-control (suspected. TTP) bomb blast in Gurgori, Bara, Khyber Agency on 3 July 2010.
Two people died and five were injured when a roadside bomb exploded in Ibrahimkhel, Kohat on 4 July 2010. The attackers are unidentified.
At least 15 suspected. TTP militants were killed and 45 injured in shelling by security forces in Jabba, Upper Orakzai on 5 July 2010.
Two people, including a NATO tanker driver, were injured on 7 July 2010 when unidentified militants attacked the tanker with a hand grenade in Chaman.
On 7 July 2010, at least 15 suspected. TTP militants were killed and 10 sustained injuries when the security forces bombarded militant hideouts in different areas of Kurram Agency.
Seven persons were injured when suspected. TTP men hurled hand-grenades at the houses of two local journalists in Bhai Cheena near Khar, the headquarters of Bajaur Agency, on 7 July 2010.
Fourteen militants were killed and 23 others injured when jet fighters hit their hideouts in various areas in upper tehsil of Orakzai Agency on 8 July 2010.

A TTP militant detonated a bomb in Yakaghand Tehsil, Mohmand, while trying to force his way into a political agent's office on 9 July 2010. 102 (supp. Research) people were killed and several injured.
Five people of the same family were injured when unidentified assailants blew up their house with explosives in Kohat on 9 July 2010. It was the house of a PAF officer.
3 people were injured in an IED blast outside the house of a peace committee member in Ring Road, Peshawar on 10 July 2010.
25 militants were killed and 10 injured as PAF jets carried out airstrikes in Torkaran, Torsak, Balyana and Toor in Upper Orakzai on 11 July 2010. Nine hideouts were also destroyed.

A suicide bomber detonated outside the residence of a tribal elder, whose vehicle had been ambushed earlier in the month as well. It was suspected to be a TTP attack. This took place in Khawasi Banda, Kohat on 12 July 2010.
A girls' school in Sheikh Baba area of Bajaur Agency in northwest Pakistan was blown up by suspected. TTP militants on 12 July 2010.
A rocket was fired in front of the local press club in Bara, Khyber Agency on 12 July 2010. Curfew prevented any casualties, although two people were injured.
A powerful blast took place on a rail track near the Rohri railway station on 14 July 2010, suspending train service on down track but no loss of life was reported due to the explosion.
An apparent suicide bombing near a bus terminal in Mingora killed five people and wounded at least 58 on 15 July 2010. TTP is suspected.
A powerful explosion blew up a mosque and some shrines in Landi Kotal of Khyber Agency on 15 July 2010. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 14 people were killed in a US drone strike on July 15th, including foreign fighters. Although 7 were alleged militants linked to TTP, the BBC reported that 7 civilians were also killed. Took place in a village 30km west of Miranshah in Miram Shah tehsil in North Waziristan
A bomb (suspected. LeI) ripped through a busy market in Kuki Khel, Khyber Agency on 16 July 2010, killing 10 civilians.
At least ten persons were killed and 20 others were injured in a suicide bomb blast. TTP militants in 'Meharban-Kilay Bazaar' of Tirah valley, Khyber Agency on 16 July 2010.
Two blasts in Lahore (in Garhi Shahu and Begum Kot) injured at least eight people on 17 July 2010. Tehrik-e-Tuhafaz Pakistan has taken responsibility for these attacks.
25 militants were killed and 12 others injured when jet fighters hit their hideouts in Arganju, Torsand, Dari toti and Mandati of Orakzai Agency on 17 July 2010.
A bomb at a minority Shiite mosque in Sargodha wounded several worshippers on 18 July 2010. It appeared to be the latest in a string of attacks by Sunni militants.
Twenty suspected. TTP militants were killed and 15 others sustained injuries in air strikes on hideouts of militants in Tehsil Upper of Orakzai Agency on 19 July 2010.
Thirty-nine militants were killed, while many others were injured during the security forces operation in different areas of the Orakzai Agency on 23 July 2010 during a gunship helicopters attack.
The head of a local Aman committee and his two companions were killed in a suspected TTP remote-controlled bomb blast in Spray, Mamond on 23 July 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone fired four drone missiles into a compound used by Islamist fighters in Angoor Adda on the Afghan border in Birmal tehsil of South Waziristan, killing at least 16 suspected TTP militants on 24 July 2010.
One person was wounded as unknown men lobbed a hand grenade at a house in Kili Baro area of Quetta on 24 July 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 32 militants of TTP were killed when a US drone hit a housing complex and a vehicle in Shaktoi village in Ladha tehsil in South Waziristan on 25th of July. 17 militants were killed in the housing complex, with another 15 in the vehicle. 7 injured, including 5 civilians.
On 25 July 2010 security forces claim to have killed 15 militants when fighter jets bombarded Upper Orakzai's Mamozai and Dabori areas.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone attack in NW killed four Haqqani militants on 25 July 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 4 TTP militants were killed and 5 more injured in a US drone strike in Landikhel village in Sararogha tehsil of South Waziristan on July 25th.
On 25 July 2010 security forces claim to have killed 15 militants when fighter jets bombarded Upper Orakzai's Mamozai and Dabori areas.
Unidentified assailants hurled a hand grenade at a house in Gamal, Tank, killing two people on 25 July 2010.
Six people were hurt when UAM hurled hand grenades on the house of a local journalist in Khar on 26 July 2010.

The house of KPK's information minister was attacked. TTP Suicide bomber in Pabbi on 26 July 2010. Seven people were killed, 20 wounded. The minister escaped; his son was recently killed by suspected. Militants as well.
Susp. TTP militants blew up two government Primary schools at Tehsil Bara Khyber Agency late 27 July 2010.
Unknown men tossed a hand grenade at a house of government official Wasif Siraj, which went off, wounding him and smashing the windowpanes of his house.
The security forces pounded militants' hideouts with jet planes, killing at least 15 suspected. TTP militants and injuring 10 others in the Upper Orakzai Agency on 1 August 2010.
Two soldiers were killed when a suspected. TTP bomb was detonated by remote control on the road connecting the villages of Sararogha and Janata in South Waziristan. This took place on 1 August 2010.
A Khwaizai Peace Committee hit a landmine on the road in Ghalanai on 2 August 2010. The vehicle was damaged but no injuries were sustained.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2008-2013) Frontier Corps
NOTES: A TTP suicide bomber killed the head of the Frontier Constabulary Safwat Ghayur when he was driving home off-duty in Peshawar on 4 August 2010. A passerby was also killed. This is one of the highest-ranking security officers ever assassinated in the country.
Leader of Balochistan National Party (Mengal) and a Sub-Inspector of police were killed while six others were wounded when an explosion took place in Hub on 4 August 2010.
Susp. TTP militants planted bombs in Jalozai, which went off to injure three people including a Khasadar security personnel on 7 August 2010. This took place in the Hujra of a former Senator.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 14 people died when a US drone strike struck a compound in Issori town in Mir Ali tehsil of North Waziristan on 14th of August. 7 of the people were local TTP militants, while 7 others were local civilians (including 1 child) who were praying at the time.
UaG fired two rockets at the premises of high-power transmitter of Radio Pakistan Khuzdar on 14 August 2010. No casualties or injuries occurred.
Three (supp.research says 5) school children were wounded when a roadside bomb hit a Coastguard vehicle in Pasni on 17 August 2010.
On 19 August 2010, at least 14 people were injured in a hand grenade blast which took place at a shop in the downtown area of Bannu.
At least two people were injured in a suicide blast on 19 August 2010 near a shrine in Lahore.
Six people were killed and four injured when a remote-control device planted by suspected. TTP militants exploded in Baizai, Mohmand Agency on 21 August 2010. It was a checkpost for peace committees.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 6 civilians were killed when a drone hit two vehicles in Qutab Khel in Miran Shah tehsil in North Waziristan on August 21. The intended TTP target had left just before the drone hit the civilian vehicle.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Muslim Group (Pakistan); Students (Pakistan); Former Government of Pakistan (2008-2013); JUI-F: Jamiat Ulema-e-Islam-Fazl
NOTES: On August 23, a TTP suicide attack at a mosque inside a religious school in Wana, South Waziristan killed 26 people including a former MNA of Jamiat Ulema-i-Islam (Fazl) and injured 40 more. The mosque was badly damaged.
A bomb exploded inside a school during a meeting of elders in Kurram, killing seven people on 23rd August 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone attacked a TTP compound killing 5 TTP militants in the village of Darga Mandi, located 6km north of Miranshah town in North Waziristan on August 23.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: Missiles fired from a US pilotless drone aircraft killed at least 9 Haqqani militants and seven civilians in Kutabkhel, NWA on 23 August 2010.
A blast on the outskirts of Peshawar killed the leader of an anti-Taliban militia and two aides as he passed through a market in the village of Matni on 23 August 2010.
Four people incl. a child were killed in Matni, Peshawar when a roadside bomb targeting a peace committee exploded on 23 August 2010. One member of the peace committee died.
A young boy was injured in a hand grenade attack at his house by UaG in Chaman on 24 August 2010.

On 26 August 2010 two people, including a woman, had been injured in an explosion on Hospital Road of Khuzdar district, some 300 kilometres from Quetta. Police sources said unidentified persons placed an explosive device along the roadside that exploded injuring two passers-by.
A child was killed and five others injured in a grenade attack at the residence of a settler in Panjgur on 26 August 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On 27 August 2010, at least five suspected militants were killed and several others injured as US drone attacked suspected hideouts and vehicles of the suspected. TTP militants at Shahidano village of Kurram Agency.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A third drone attack on August 27 struck a mosque and housing compound in the village of Taaloo Ganj, located close to Shahidano village in Lower Kurram tehsil of Kurram Agency. Alongside at least 2 militants from HQN, 1 civilian was also killed
At least two security forces officials were killed and four others sustained injuries when a roadside bomb hit their vehicle here at remote Mamara area of Khyber Agency on 29 August 2010.
A soldier sustained serious injuries when an explosive device planted by suspected. TTP exploded on the roadside in Baizai on 29 August 2010.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: TTP: Tehreek-i-Taliban Pakistan
NOTES: The third in a three-blast series took place at Anarkali, Lahore on 1 September 2010, when a suicide bomber blew himself up and killed 10, injuring a number of people. Both LeJ and TTP claimed responsibility. Over 160 people were injured in total.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: TTP: Tehreek-i-Taliban Pakistan
NOTES: The second in a three-blast series took place at Bhatti Chowk, Lahore on 1 September 2010, when a suicide bomber blew himself up and killed 10, injuring a number of people. Both LeJ and TTP claimed responsibility. Over 160 people were injured in total.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: TTP: Tehreek-i-Taliban Pakistan
NOTES: The first in a three-blast series took place during a Shia religious procession at Karbala Gamay Shah, Lahore on 1 September 2010, injuring a number of people. Both LeJ and TTP claimed responsibility.

Fourteen suspected. TTP militants were killed and nine others sustained injuries when gunship helicopters targeted a training centre and three hideouts of militants in central part of Kurram Agency on 1 September 2010.

Pakistan military helicopters shelled suspected militants and killed 45 in Tirah Valley, Khyber on 1 September 2010. Women and children were used as human shields; 15 people were injured. Suspected LeI.

Three tribesmen were injured and their livestock killed in indiscriminate shelling from across the border in Afghanistan on a Pakistani border village, Loli Faqeeran, in Saidgai area of North Waziristan Agency (NWA) on 1 September 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: Two US drone strikes killed seven suspected TTP militants, two foreigners in Datta Khel on 2 Sep 2010.
TTP militants blew up a girls government school in Kalam, Swat on 3 Sept 2010. No loss of life.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone fired four missiles and killed 5 suspected. TTP militants in Dattakhel on 3 September 2010. Ten sustained injuries.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone fired two missiles and killed 10 suspected. TTP militants in Machis Camp near Miranshah on 3 September 2010. Eight sustained injuries.
One policeman killed while three others sustained injuries when a remote control bomb blast occurred near police van on Ring Road, Peshawar by UaG on 3 September 2010.
At least three people were killed and six others were injured on 3 September 2010 as a suspected. TTP suicide bomber attacked a minority worship place in Mardan.

On September 3, LeJ took responsibility for a suicide attack targeting a Shia rally at Meezan Chowk in Quetta city (Quetta, Balochistan) observing al-Quds day, an international event held every year by the Shia community in opposition to Israel's control of Jerusalem and to show solidarity with Palestinian Muslims. 66 (updated figure) people were killed and over a hundred were injured.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On 4 Sep 2010, 2 US drone missiles killed 4 suspected. TTP militants near Miranshah. Four were foreigners.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone strike hit a housing complex and a vehicle in Mizer village in Datta Khel tehsil in North Waziristan on 4th of September. A TTP commander died along with 7 other militants.
On 4 Sep 2010, heavy artillery fired by security forces left six suspected TTP militants dead and 10 injured in the Chinark area of Kurram Agency.

12 suspected TTP militants were killed and six others received injuries when a remote-controlled bomb planted by UaG targeted the vehicle carrying them on Mirandah Road in Central Kurram Agency on 4 September 2010.
Four short-range missiles fired from the Afghan territory landed in the Pakistani border villages of Kharghalay and Charbagh in Landikotal Tehsil on 5 Sep 2010. No loss of life reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone fired two missiles and killed 5 suspected. TTP militants in Dattakhel on 6 September 2010. This is the fourth such attack in four days.

Explosive devices planted at the Government Primary School (Boys) in Mir Akbar Killay and at the Government Girls Primary School in Fazal Muhammad Killay in Mandikas area, Bara by suspected. TTP blew up the schools on 6 Sep 2010.
At least 18 (updated figure) people were killed and several others injured when a suspected. TTP suicide car bomb exploded at a police station in Lakki Marwat on 6 Sep 2010.
Three policemen, including Deputy Superintendent of Police (DSP) were injured in a bomb blast at Hangu by-pass road on 7 Sep 2010 by suspected. TTP.
At least 2 people were injured in a landmine attack on the house of a former senator in Khuizai, Mohmand on 7 Sep 2010.
Two security forces' personnel were injured on 7 Sep 2010 when an explosive blast occurred near Dog Forte in the Coda Khel post of Bunry, sub-division of Muhammad Agency.
At least 23 people were killed and over 80 others injured as a massive suicide bomb blast ripped through a police residential area on 7 Sept 2010 in the city of Kohat.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A suspected US missile strike killed at least six suspected. TTP militants in Dande Darpa Khel, NW on 8 Sep 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 4 suspected. TTP militants were killed, 2 injured in a US drone attack on a car in Amborshaga, Dattakhel on 8 Sep 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 6 HQN militants and four children, were killed on 8 Sep 2010 when a second suspected US drone launched an airstrike at North Waziristan in Pakistan's northwest tribal belt in Dande Darpa Khel in Miran Shah tehsil.
Three persons were killed and six other sustained injuries in two back to back bomb blasts in the house of provincial Finance Minister in Quetta on 8 Sep 2010.
2 people were killed and several injured as a result of a bomb explosion in Hub, industrial area of Balochistan on 8 Sep 2010.
A blast by suspected. TTP militants partially damaged the UNICEF office in Hangu on 9 Sep 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone strike hit a compound in Machis camp close to Miranshah town on September 9. 3 Uzbek militants died and 3 more were injured.
Ten civilians were killed, six injured when a remote controlled bomb planted by suspected. TTP exploded in central Kurram on 9 Sep 2010.
1 prisoner was killed and another injured in a remote control bomb last by UaG in Mach on 11 Sep 2010 during Eid prayer.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A suspected U.S. missile strike on 12 Sep 2010 killed at least three suspected associates of a suspected. TTP warlord who is fighting Western troops in Afghanistan. This took place near Miranshah. 3 others wounded.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone strike on September 12 hit a compound, killing 5 militants and injuring 2-3 more. Took place in Newey Adda in Data Khel tehsil of North Waziristan.
A remote-controlled bomb exploded outside a Lutheran church in Mardan on 13 Sep 2010, second day of Eid. No loss of life reported. 2 policemen were injured.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 3 suspected TTP militants were killed on 14 Sep 2010 when a US drone was launched at them in Qutub Khel, NWA.
4 people were killed and four injured when a remote-control roadside bomb exploded near Parachinar, Kurram on 13 Sep 2010. No group has claimed responsibility.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 4 Haqqani militants were killed on 14 of September when a US drone hit their vehicle in Qutab Khel, a town south of Miranshah town in North Waziristan.
Four civilians were injured in a suspected TTP roadside explosion in Chamkni, Upper Kurram on 14 Sep 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 10 suspected TTP militants were killed on 14 Sep 2010 when a US drone was launched at them in Shawal near Miranshah, NWA.

Susp TTP militants detonated government girls' primary school Bar Lashti Dawood Shah and government boys primary school Mir Alam Dawood Shah on 14 Sep 2010 in Bannu with remote controlled explosive devices.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone killed militants in Pai Khel, a village in Data Khel tehsil, on 15th of September, killing at least 4 and injuring three more. Missile hit a housing compound there.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On 15 September, drones were reported and the first 4 missiles hit a housing compound, killing 7 Haqqani militants. After an interval of 15 minutes, 8 more missiles struck the housing compound when people were attempting to rescue the bodies. 5 of those that died were civilian rescuers. Took place in Darga Mandi village 6km north of Miranshah town in North Waziristan. At least 12 were killed
5 security personnel were injured in a remote controlled roadside bomb planted by an unidentified group in Bara, Khyber on 15 Sep 2010.

Susp. TTP Militants blew up a private school on the outskirts of Peshawar on 18 Sep 2010. Police said that the attack targeted the Rozatul Atfaal Academy in Charkhakhel village at around 1:40 am and a classroom was destroyed from the force of the blast.
An unidentified group blew up a girls high school in Charkha Khail, Peshawar on 18 Sep 2010; no loss of life reported.
Three persons were injured as a hand grenade blast in the house of scrap dealer in Gulab Shah Colony Daharki on 18 Sep 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 4 suspected TTP militants were killed by a US drone strike on a vehicle in the Miranshah area of North Waziristan.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone strike on September 19 hit a vehicle in the Data Khel tehsil in North Waziristan. 4 militants belonging to Hafiz Gul Bahadur Group were killed, as well as many as 5 local welfare workers.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US unmanned aircraft fired two missiles on a village in Khand Morsak, a locality of Jandola, and as a result eight suspected TTP militants were killed while several others got injured on 21 Sep 2010 (SWA).

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
