NOTES: A suspected US drone fired 4 missiles at 4 people on 2 motorcycles in Darazinda town in Data Khel tehsil of North Waziristan. At least 3 militants were killed, although it is not known which group they had ties to. Took place on September 20.
The house of a pro-gov tribal elder was blown up in Othmankhel, near Kalaya on 20 Sep 2010 by suspected TTP militants. No loss of life reported.
A woman was injured in a remote-control bomb explosion by an unidentified group in Sui on 20 Sep 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US unmanned aircraft fired missiles on Azam Warsak village near Wana, killing 8 suspected TTP militants on 21 Sep 2010.
5 people were killed and 10 injured when security forces shelled Shalozan with helicopters in order to stop communal militia. This took place on 21 Sep 2010.
Susp TTP militants dynamited a girls primary school at Sulman Khel area, some 10 kilometers from Peshawar, the capital of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province on 22 Sep 2010.
At least three troops were killed when an unidentified group's roadside blast struck a military vehicle in Mamari (additional research), Bara, Khyber on 22 Sep 2010.

An explosion on the Pak-Afghan highway in Khyber Zakha Khel area damaged some NATO oil tankers, containers and vehicles on 23 Sep 2010. Two men were killed and traffic was stopped. TTP took responsibility.
A blast on the Pak-Afghan highway in Torkham-Landi Kotal area and damaged some NATO oil tankers, containers and vehicles on 23 Sep 2010. TTP took responsibility.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone strike on 25 Sep 2010 killed four suspected TTP militants in Dattakhel.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: Three Arabs and 2 local militants were killed in a drone attack in Lawra Mandi village in Data Khel tehsil on September 26. The strike hit a truck and a house in the village, and there 2 injured. All the fatalities were thought to be tied to the TTP.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone targeted a vehicle with four missiles in Sherani, Miranshah, killing seven suspected TTP militants and injuring 2 on 26 Sept 2010.
Four people incl a child were injured when members of Khwazai Peace Committee stepped on a landmine in Khwazai, Mohmand on 27 Sep 2010.
NATO forces based in Afghanistan (ISAF) killed over 50 suspected. TTP militants in a series of air strikes in Kurram on 27 Sep 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: An unmanned US aircraft fired two missiles at a house in Khushkali village in Mir Ali tehsil of North Waziristan on 27 Sep 2010, killing at least four TTP militants.
A security man was killed and two injured in a remote-control blast in Shakai, SWA on 28 Sep 2010. Susp TTP involvement.

Three people were injured in a hand grenade in Industrial Town Hub of Lasbela district, on 28 Sep 2010. According to sources, unidentified assailants hurled a hand grenade on Government High School in Hub town.
Building of Basima levies station was partially damaged in a rocket attack by an unidentified group on 28 Sep 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A suspected American drone missile strike killed four suspected TTP militants in NWA on 28 Sept 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: Senior Al Qaeda figures were reportedly killed in a US drone missile strike on September 28th, killing 4 people. Missiles hit a house in Zeba Pahar village, west of Wana, in South Waziristan

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: At least 3 alleged suspected TTP militants were killed and five injured in a US drone attack in Miranshah on 29 Sep 2010.
At least three FC men died in a NATO attack in Kurrum on 30 Sept 2010. This took place in Mand-to-Kandao area.

NATO helicopters shelled a paramilitary checkpost, killing three soldiers and injuring three others in a cross-border attack in Kurram Agency on 30 September 2010. It was an unprovoked attack, and NATO's third in a week.
An unidentified armed group (assumed TTP) fired rockets at NATO oil tankers in Shikarpur near Mastung on 1 October 2010, killing 2 people.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 8 suspected. TTP militants have been killed in an American drone attack in a house in Dattakhel on 1 Oct 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 2 US drones fired four missiles at a suspected. TTP militants compound at Inzar Kas in Dattakhel on 2 Oct 2010, killing 10 and injuring four. The compound was destroyed. Another strike hit a nearby house in the same village moments later, killing 7 and injuring 2 more. In total, 17 died with 4 injured. All of those hit by the strikes were militants according to an Associated Press investigation.
A man was killed in a hand-grenade attack on the office of a local cable TV operator in Mastung on 2 Oct 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone fired two missiles on a suspected. TTP militant compound near Mir Ali market in the town centre in North Waziristan on 4 Oct 2010. At least 8 TTP militants were killed, 5 of whom were Germans, while 3 women were also killed.
2 security personnel died and eight were injured when a military convoy was targeted with a suspected. TTP remote-controlled bomb near Miranshah on 5 Oct 2010.
A low intensity explosive device went off in NATO supply tanker damaging it partially in Torkham on 5 Oct 2010.
26 NATO oil tankers were set on fire by militants with explosive devices in Khairabad, Nowshera on 6 Oct 2010. No casualties reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
ACTOR2: AQIS: Al Qaeda in the Indian Subcontinent
NOTES: 4 suspected. Al Qaeda militants were killed and two injured in an attack by two missiles fired by a US drone in Khaisur village in Mir Ali tehsil in North Waziristan on 6 Oct 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 2 missiles from US drones struck a house in the middle of Hurmuz village in Mir Ali tehsil of North Waziristan on October 6. The militants were described as belonging to TTP and Hafiz Gul Bahadur Group. At least 3 died, with another 3 more injured

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone fired two missiles at a house in Miranshah, no casualties reported. This took place on 6 Oct 2010.
Seven people were killed and over 65 injured when two suicide bombers blew themselves up outside a shrine in Clifton on 7 Oct 2010. The TTP later claimed responsibility (supp. Research).
An MQM activist was injured by UaG in Karachi on 7 Oct 2010 in the wake of the shrine suicide blasts.
2 FC men died in a landmine explosion by UaG in Safi Tehsil, Mohmand Agency on 7 Oct 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 4 TTP militants were killed in a second strike in Data Khel tehsil in North Waziristan - this time in Mohammad Khel area on 8th of October.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 5 suspected TTP militants were killed in a US drone strike in Chhar Khel village of Data Khel tehsil in North Waziristan on 8th of October.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: Seven suspected TTP militants were killed by a US predator drone in two separate strikes in Spinwam tehsil of North Waziristan on 10 Oct 2010. The first strike killed 4 when it hit a house of a tribesman said to be a TTP militant, while the second strike killed 3 more moments later when it hit a car near a bridge in the same vicinity.
A remote controlled bomb in Hazar Ganji exploded, aimed at a police convoy nearby on 12 Oct 2010. No damage was done.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 14 people died in Inkar Kas in Data Khel tehsil in North Waziristan on October 13 after a triple strike was fired from a US drone. 3 civilians were among the fatalities when a strike hit them as they were attempting to rescue survivors from the previous strike. Other fatalities were alleged to be affiliated to the TTP.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 4 militants were reportedly killed in a US drone strike on a house. The TTP's Qari Hussain was reported killed - took place on October 15 in Aziz Khel village in Mir Ali tehsil in North Waziristan.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 3 TTP militants were killed when a drone missile hit a TTP-linked house in Machi Khel, a village north of Mir Ali in Mir Ali tehsil in North Waziristan on 15th of October. Possible civilian casualties.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A double strike on a house and car killed six people, with six people injured. 'Foreigners' were said to be among six dead alleged militants. Shrapnel also killed a 10-year-old boy in the next-door house. Took place on 18th of October in Data Khel tehsil of North Waziristan
At least 3 security personnel were killed and 2 injured when militants targeted their convoy with an IED in Qalandar Killi near Wana on 19 Oct 2010.
An RC bomb planted by UaG exploded near suspected. TTP militants in central Kurram, killing six incl. a top commander 21 Oct 2010.
10 TTP killed and 8 injured in gunship helicopter attack by Pakistani armed forces in Orakzai Agency on 22 Oct 2010.
An RC bomb blast killed a lieutenant colonel and five soldiers in Upper Orakzai Agency on 22 Oct 2010.
At least four people were killed and 24 others wounded in a planted bomb blast at Pashta Khara Mosque on 22 Oct 2010.
13 militants were killed and seven others were injured when gunship helicopters shelled suspected positions of the militants in the north-western Orakzai region on 24 Oct 2010.
At least 3 people were killed and 2 injured when their vehicle hit a roadside bomb in Ferozkhel, Orakzai on 25 Oct 2010.
3 people were killed and 2 wounded in a RC bomb attack on a vehicle by UaG in Tanda, Orakzai on 25 Oct 2010.
Susp. TTP militants blew up a government boys school in Amray Koroona, Mohmand Agency on 25 Oct 2010.
Gunship helicopters pounded suspected. TTP militants hideouts in Upper Orakzai Agency, destryoing six of the dens on 25 Oct 2010.
A woman was killed when a stray mortar shell hit her house in Mohmand Agency on 25 Oct 2010.
At least 7 people were killed and several injured in RC bomb blast by UaG at the mausoleum of Baba Farid-ud-Din Ganj Baksh on 25 Oct 2010 in Pakpattan.
2 government schools and a CD shop were blown up by UaG using explosive devices in Bannu on 25 Oct 2010.
Khyber Agency's Peace Committee Chief escaped a life attempt when a remote-controlled bomb went off at Qambarabad area of Tehsil Bara, injuring 4 on 27 Oct 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: Four suspected. TTP militants were killed and several injured when two US drone missiles slammed into a vehicle in Dattakhel on 27 Oct 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: US drone strikes killed four suspected. TTP militants in Mir Ali near Miranshah on 27 Oct 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A car was reportedly destroyed by a US missile and four militants linked to the Haqqani Network were killed, apparently including two 'Arabs' and two 'Westerners'. Many more were reported injured. Took place in Data Khel tehsil in North Waziristan on October 27th.

As many as ten civilians were wounded when Malikdin Khel tribe chief's vehicle hit a roadside planted bomb in Kambarabad, Tehsil Bara on 27 Oct 2010. The tribal chief on his way when his vehicle hit an explosive remote control device, planted by suspected. TTP along the road in Kambarabad.
At least three persons, including police personnel, were killed while eight others injured when a roadsidebomb struck a police mobile in Quetta on 27 Oct 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 7 suspected. TTP militants were killed and 3 people injured when a US drone fired missiles at a house in Dattakhel, NWA on 28 Oct 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: In Ismail Khel village in Data Khel tehsil of North Waziristan on October 28, drone strikes hit a compound killing 7 people. 6 were alleged militants belonging to Haqani Network, and at least one civilian was also killed.
Three suspected TTP militants and one civilian woman were killed when security forces shelled their hideouts in Mandal, Salarzai Tehsil of Bajaur Agency on 31 October 2010.
Helicopter gunships shelled suspected TTP militant positions on 31 October 2010 in Painiali, Mohmand Agency. No loss of life was reported.
A vehicle and four militant hideouts were destroyed in air strikes by helicopter gunships at Saifal Darra, Orakzai on 31 Oct 2010. At least 12 militants were killed and eight injured.
2 policemen were killed and thirteen others injured (including seven policemen), by a TTP militant suicide bomber in Swabi on 1 November 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US missile strike killed five suspected TTP militants and one unidentified person in Mir Ali, North Waziristan, on 1 November 2010.
Four homemade time bombs exploded at the Guddu railway tracks through Sehrish Nagar on 1 November 2010. The Sindh Liberation Army claimed responsibility.
On Nov 2, at least 17 TTP militants were killed and 10 injured when gunship helicopters attacked their hideouts in Dwezai area of Mohmand Agency (FATA).
Sindh Liberation Army claimed responsibility for a bomb blast on a railway track near Detha Railway Station which took place on 2 November 2010.
A government-run middle school for girls was damaged when explosives planted by unidentified militants went off at the school in Katlang tehsil, Mardan, KPK on 3 November 2010.
An unidentified suspected militant lobbed a hand grenade at a CD shop in Garhi Atta Khan in Kohat, KPK on 3 November 2010.
A boy was killed and three tribesmen injured when militants (supposedly TTP) fired rockets at Ara Khel in Darra Adam Khel on 3 November 2010.
Sindh Liberation Army claimed responsibility for a bomb blast on a railway track near Nawabshah which took place on 3 November 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A car was hit by a US missile that killed 4 militants (assumed TTP). A nearby house was also hit, though it's unknown whether there were casualties from this. Took place in Khaso Khel village in Mir Ali tehsil in North Waziristan on November 3.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone attack killed four suspected Haqqani militants on 3 November 2010, in Qutab Khel, Miranshah.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On November 3, a third strike of the day took place in Pai Khel in Data Khel tehsil in North Waziristan, killing 4 TTP militants.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: Five Uzbek fighters were killed in the first of three linked strikes in North Waziristan. A car 'loaded with arms and ammunition' was destroyed, damaging a nearby house. Took place in Qutab Khel, a village close to Miranshah, the main centre of North Waziristan on November 3rd.
Sindh Liberation Army claimed responsibility for a bomb blast on a railway track near Therhi railway crossing, Khairpur on 4 November 2010.
A government-run primary school was blown up by unidentified militants in Tehsil Safi of Mohmand Agency on 5 November 2010.
A NATO oil tanker and container were blown up by suspected militants on 5 November 2010 at Torkham border (found by supplemental research) in Khyber Agency, FATA.
Armed militants purported to be TTP men hurled hand grenades into a mosque in Suleman Khel, Badhber, KPK, injuring 30 and killing six people on 5 November 2010.
A TTP suicide bomber blew himself up at a mosque in Darra Adam Khel, near Peshawar, during prayers on 5 November 2010. At least 75 people were killed and over a 100 wounded.
Unidentified militants detonated explosive devices at two government-run primary schools in Kamngara Miangan Kallay, Tehsil Nawagai, Bajaur Agency, once a stronghold of Taliban, on 6 November 2010.
A NATO supply vehicle carrying oil for forces in Afghanistan was blown up by in Jamrud Tehsil, Khyber Agency on 6 November 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: At least 8 people were killed and at least two other people injured in a joint strike by up to eight drones on a house and car in Ghulam Khan town in Ghulam Khan tehsil in North Waziristan. Militants thought to belong to Taliban, although local sources claim there were some civilian deaths as well. Took place on November 7.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On November 7, a US drone strike killed 4 TTP militants, and many more were injured when a car was destroyed in a fireball. Civilians were also allegedly among the casualties. Took place in Mizer village in Data Khel tehsil in North Waziristan
An oil tanker loaded with fuel for NATO forces was blown up with a time bomb in Landikotal, Khyber Agency on 8 November 2010.

21 people were killed and over a hundred injured when a truck loaded with explosives smashed into the DIG CID's building in Karachi on 11 November 2010 in a suspected suicide attack. TTP has claimed responsibility.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: US drone strikes hit TTP militants in tribal area of Orakzai, killing 15 militants and destroying three hideouts on 11 November 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: At least 5 alleged TTP fighters returning from Afghanistan and staying with the TTP were the reported targets of a strike that killed 5 people in Ghulam Khel tehsil in North Waziristan , with 5 more injured.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 5 suspected TTP militants were killed in the Mir Ali area by a US drone strike.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: In Hamzoni in Miran Shah tehsil of North Waziristan on November 13, 4 civilians were killed when a US drone hit a vehicle.
A remote-controlled bomb went off in Adzai Animals Market in Peshawar on 15 November 2010, injuring several civilians including an Imam in the area.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 20 people were killed when US drones fired missiles at a vehicle and nearby compound on 16th of November. While most of those killed were linked to the TTP, several women and children were also killed. Took place in Ghulam Khan village in Ghulam Khan tehsil in North Waziristan
A woman and child were killed and four others injured in rocket attacks on 18 November 2010 in Kohlu, Balochistan; the BLA (Baloch Liberation Army) has claimed responsibility.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: Three suspected TTP militants were killed in a US drone strike in Mir Ali, North Waziristan on 19 November 2010.
Unidentified militants blew up a girls school in Landi Kotal, Khyber Agency on 20 November 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone strike hit a vehicle and a house belonging to Uzbek militants in Khaddi village in Miran Shah tehsil in North Waziristan on 21st of November. 5 militants killed.
Three security personnel were injured when militants attacked a convoy with a remote-controlled bomb in Ghiljo, Orakzai Agency on 21 November 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: At least 5 suspected TTP militants were killed and others injured in a US drone attack at Tehsil Mirali, North Waziristan on 22 November 2010.
Militants blew up a government-run primary school in Safi Tehsil of Mohmand Agency on 25 November 2010.
Unidentified militants planted and detonated explosives inside a government-run girls primary school in the Khugakhel Area of Landi Kotal in Khyber Agency on 25 November 2010.
At least one soldier was killed and six others wounded when a roadside bomb blast planted by unidentified militants hit a security convoy in Hangu, KPK on 25 November 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A student was killed in a car with 3 college friends. The strike hit at around 4pm on the road outside MiranShah town on November 26 as he was making his way home from college. This case was later submitted to the UN Human Rights Council.
Two NATO helicopters fired at Lawra Mandi, Dattakhel in North Waziristan on 26 November 2010, injuring three suspected TTP militants.
A government-run girls primary school was blown up by unknown actors via a time device in Landikotal, Khyber Agency on 26 November 2010.
A government-run boys primary school was blown up by TTP on 26 November 2010 in Safi, Mohmand Agency.
A woman was killed in the Qandaro Area of Safi Tehsil, Mohmand Agency, after a mortar shell hit her house on 26 November 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: At least five suspected TTP militants were killed by a US drone attack on 28 November 2010, in Hassankhel village, Miranshah, North Waziristan.
Three policemen sustained injuries when a bomb planted on a roadside exploded near their vehicle in Armar Baghban, Peshawar, on 28 November 2010.
Unidentified militants attacked a police station in Hangu district, KPK with two rockets on 28 November 2010. Neither of them reached their targets.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: Missiles fired from a US drone on a vehicle and a house killed five militants in Khysore, Miranshah on 29 November 2010.

SOURCE: Daily Regional Times (Pakistan); South Asia Terrorism Portal
NOTES: On 30 November 2010, seven people (incl. bomber) including 2 policemen were killed and 22 others were injured in a suicide attack on a police mobile van in Milad Park, Bannu town (Bannu, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa).
A roadside explosive device narrowly missed Balochistan Governer Nawab Zulfiqar Magsi's convoy in Kalat, southeast of Quetta on 30 November 2010. The BLA claimed responsibility.
At least three tribesmen were injured in remote control bomb blast in Bilitang area near Kohat Bandi road on 1 December 2010.

A remote controlled bomb planted under a NATO container at the Mangochar National Highway exploded just after the convoy of the Governor Balochistan passed on 1 December 2010. It was targeting the Governor.
An FC man was killed and seven others (incl. a civilian) were injured when a bomb targeting the FC van exploded in Kalat on 1 Dec 2010.
An FC personnel lost two legs and an arm when a mine planted by unidentified armed men exploded in Kholu, Quetta on 3 Dec 2010.

A NATO container caught fire in Peshtahra, Peshawar on 6 Dec 2010 due to a time bomb exploding inside it. No injuries reported. Another NATO container was attacked with a RC device in Karhano, Peshawar, injuring 2 people on 6 Dec 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A missile fired from a CIA drone hit a vehicle as it passed through Khushkali village in Mir Ali tehsil in North Waziristan on December 6th. 2 TTP militants died, though at least one escaped into a nearby shop. As CNN and others reported at the time, the drone then fired another missile into the shop, killing the suspect and two civilians. Three people were injured by the blasts. Some later reports claimed that all those inside the shop were militants. In total, 3 militants and 2 civilians were killed.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: Another strike took place in nearby Ali Khel in Mir Ali tehsil on 6th of December. A number of drones fired missiles at a house, killing 2 people, although it was not clear if they were militants or not
Taliban militants destroyed two government run schools in Bajaur Agency with explosives on 6 Dec 2010.

At least 32 (incl. bombers) people were killed and 70 more sustained injuries in two back-to-back suicide blasts in Ghalanai, Mohmand Agency on 6 Dec 2010. Most of the dead were elders and participants of a local jirga. TTP later claimed responsibility.
Susp. TTP blew up a girls primary school in Jogian on 6 Dec 2010. No injuries reported.
2 people were killed and 4 injured in a landmine explosion in Kohlu on 7 Dec 2010. BLA took responsibility.

Chief Minister of Balochistan survived a suicide attack on 7 Dec 2010 when his motorcade was targeted by a bomber at Sariab Road crossing in Quetta. The attacker was killed and 10 people including 5 policemen were injured in the incident. Lashkar E Jabbar/Jhangvi later claimed responsibility.
Two people were killed and five injured in a landmine explosion in Bala area of Kohlu, Balochistan on 7 Dec 2010.
Four levies men were injured in Saro Khel, Hangu, on 8 Dec 2010 when a RC bomb exploded and destroyed their vehicle on the way to Kurram Agency.

SOURCE: Frontier Post; Express Tribune (Pakistan); Frontier Star
NOTES: On December 8, a suspected. TTP teenage suicide bomber killed 19 people and injured another 31 at Tirah market in Kohat. More than 30 shops were destroyed and several other vehicles as a result of the attack.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: US unmanned aircraft fired at least four missiles two each at a vehicle allegedly carrying militants and a militant compound at Khadar Khel village in Datta Khel. Five suspected. TTP militants were killed and two others received injuries. The vehicle and compound were completely destroyed in the attack on 9 Dec 2010.

On December 10, as many as 21 (incl. bomber) persons, including three policemen, were killed and 16 others got seriously injured when a suspected. TTP suicide bomber rammed his explosive-laden vehicle into a hospital in Pass Kalay area of district Hangu on 9 Dec 2010. It was most likely sectarian violence as the hospital was run by a Shia trust.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 4 Al-Qaeda linked militants were killed when US drones fired missiles at a target in Data Khel tehsil in North Waziristan on 10th of December. 2 of the militants were British Muslim converts who had joined Al-Qaeda back in 2009. 2 more people were also injured. Strike coincided with demonstration in Islamabad by civilian victims of drone strikes.
A woman was killed and five others were injured in a landmine blast in Dera Bugti area on 13 Dec 2010.
At least one Frontier Corp (FC) solder was killed and another sustained serious injuries in a remote controlled explosive device blast in Adil Khad, Tehsil Landi Kotal on 13 Dec 2010.
An explosion hit a school bus in Lundi Arbab area of Peshawar on 13 December 2010, killing at least 1 person and wounding others.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A drone fired missiles at a vehicle in Tappi village in Miran Shah tehsil on December 14th, killing four people. Local security officials described the victims as civilians, 4 died.
Susp. TTP militants blew up government primary schools for boys and girls and a peace committee member's house in Chenari, Safi on 14 Dec 2010.
Susp. LeI militants blew up a school in Bazaar-Zakhakhel area of Landi Kotal in Khyber Agency on 14 Dec 2010.
3 people were injured in a remote control bomb blast at Charsadda road in Peshawar on 14 Dec 2010. According to police sources, police van was targeted in remote control bomb blast.

Nine persons were injured in a bomb blast at a CD shop in Lachi Bazaar of Kohat district on 14 Dec 2010. Susp. TTP militants had planted a time device outside the CD shop near Tehsil Municipal Office in Lachi Bazaar.
A grenade attack killed one child and wounded 28 people, including children, at a Muharram procession on the eve of Ashura in Peshawar on 16 Dec 2010. TTP is suspected to be behind the attack.
One man got killed and three injured during a mine explosion in Kohlu district around 15 Dec 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone missile strike killed up to seven militants in Spin Darang, Tirah Valley on 16 Dec 2010. The area is an LeI stronghold.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On the third drone attack on the same day (December 16), 32 people died in the Speen Drang area of Bara tehsil in Khyber Agency. 30 were militants of the group Lashkar-e-Islam, while 2 civilians also died in the attack.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A TTP commander and his six bodyguards were killed when a US drone fired missiles at their compound on December 16. Took place in Speen Drang area in Bara tehsil of Kyber Agency .

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A missile fired from a US drone reportedly hit a compound, killing 7 TTP militants and injuring two others. Took place in Sandana area in Bara tehsil of Kyber Agency on December 17th.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On December 17, 2 cars were destroyed by missiles fired by US drones. 11 TTP militants were killed, and some of the casualties were civilians. Took place in Speen Drang area in Bara tehsil of Kyber Agency.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: Three US drone strikes targeting Tirah Valley, including a compound in Speen Drang, where pro TTP militants from LeI were in a meeting, killed 50 suspected militants in total.
A mortar attack killed nine people, including and children, in Peshawar on 17 Dec 2010 as Shia Muslims marked Ashura.
A police officer was killed and five others were injured when a security vehicle was targeted with a roadside bomb in Quetta city on 24 Dec 2010.
Three people incl. 2 students were injured when a blast occurred at a school in Palosi Peshawar on 24 Dec 2010. The explosive material was attached to the wall of the school.
43 (incl. bomber) were killed when a female suicide bomber detonated through a gathering of conflict-hit people waiting to receive food in Khar, Bajaur on 25 Dec 2010. TTP took responsibility.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 4 TTP fighters were killed when US drones fired a missile at a vehicle in Machi Khel village in Mir Ali tehsil of North Waziristan on 27th of December.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone fired six missiles at two vehicles carrying suspected. TTP in Mir Ali, NW on 27 Dec 2010, killing 18.
A security man was killed in a landmine blast in Bara tehsil of Khyber Agency on 27 Dec 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: More than six suspected. TTP militants were killed when a US drone fired four missiles at two houses in Ghulam Khan, NW on 27 Dec 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 18 suspected TTP militants were killed when US drones struck 2 vehicles in the North Waziristan. The attack targeted Shera Tala village in Mir Ali tehsil.
At least nine students were injured in cracker blast at Karachi University through a package with a bomb inside it on 28 Dec 2010.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AQIS: Al Qaeda in the Indian Subcontinent; Civilians (Pakistan)
NOTES: US drone strikes hit Ghulam Khan village, targeting a compound and vehicles in two missile strikes, killing 5 TTP and Al Qaeda affiliated militants on 28th of December. Afterwards, two more strikes took place when rescuers were attempting to retrieve bodies from the rubble, killing 6 more people. The third and final strike hit a truck reportedly carrying the wounded. In total 19 died, with at least two civilians killed. All took place in Ghulam Khan tehsil in North Waziristan on 28th of December.
At least 20 militants have been killed and 25 wounded in recent helicopter gunship attack launched by the security forces against the militants in Chinarak, Kurram Agency on 30 Dec 2010.

A young man was killed and another was wounded while a former union council nazim and his cousin narrowly escaped in separate bomb explosions in the same area of Lakki Marwat on 31 Dec 2010. It was a land mine blast meant to target police.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On December 31st in Ghulam Khan tehsil in North Waziristan, 4 TTP militants were killed in a drone strike after they were retreating from an attack on an Afghanistan checkpoint.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: Four suspected TTP militants were killed in a US drone strike in Datta Khel on 1 January 2011.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: Around 7 suspected TTP militants were killed in a US drone strike in Ghoresti on 1 January 2011.
A landmine planted by unidentified persons exploded in Pewar, Kurram Agency on 1 January 2011, killing a young girl.

Security forces shelled different areas of Baizai, Ghalanai in Mohmand Agency, targeting hideouts of suspected TTP militants. This took place on 1 January 2011. No information about casualties was gathered.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 14 TTP militants were killed in two US drone strike in Mandi Khel on 1 January 2011. The first strike hit a house and a moving car (killing 8), and then after two hours, another drone killed 6 more TTP militants as they attempted to rescue those injured from first strike.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A car was attacked and up to four militants were killed in a strike by US drones on January 1. Militants were Uzbek fighters
On 1 January 2011, driver was killed when his truck hit a landmine in Ambar tehsil [coded at Ajdarra] , Mohmand Agency.
Four policemen were injured when unidentified assailants threw a hand grenade at them on 1 January 2011 in Peshawar.
Suspected militants threw a hand grenade at a police checkpost in Bara Qadeem, main Peshawar on 3 January 2011. One policeman sustained injuries.

A NATO oil tanker was destroyed near Ali Masjid in Khyber Agency when a pre-planted time device on it exploded. The attack took place on 3 January 2011. As a result, traffic was blocked and local officials suspended NATO supplies.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Students (Pakistan); Police Forces of Pakistan (2008-2013) Frontier Corps
NOTES: On 4 January 2011, a remote-controlled bomb blast tore through a school bus carrying 30 children of Frontier Corps (FC) personnel in Turbat town (Kech, Balochistan). More than a dozen children were injured.
Six people, including three policemen, were injured in a remote-control bomb blast in Charsadda on 7 January 2011.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 4 people were killed when a US drone fired a missile at a house and a moving vehicle on 7th of January in Ghar laley, a village close to Datta Khel in North Waziristan. Various reports claim civilians were also killed, although others claim TTP militants were hit.
A watchman was injured when suspected TTP militants blew up a health centre in Charsadda on 8 January 2011. Five rooms of the health centre were also destroyed.
Three Frontier Corps personnel were injured when their vehicle hit a landmine planted by suspected TTP militants. The attack took place on 8 January 2011.
Two girls primary schools were blown up by suspected TTP militants in Landi Kotal on 9 January 2011.
The BRA blew up five gas wells in Dera Bugti with the use of explosive devices on 9 January 2011. Gas supply to the main plant was suspended, but supply to any province was not interrupted.
Three minors were injured in a remote-control bomb blast in Peshawar on 10 January 2011. The perpetrators could not be identified.

At least 20 people, including six policemen, were killed and 20 others wounded when a suicide bomber rammed an explosive-laden vehicle into a mosque in Bannu on 12 January 2011. The TTP have claimed responsibility for the attack.
Two security men were killed when their vehicle hit a landmine planted by unknown militants. The incident took place near Sarwakai, South Waziristan on 12 January 2011.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: At least 6 suspected TTP militants were killed in a US drone strike in the Haider Khel area.
One security person was killed and three injured in Dera Bugti on 13 January 2011. Their vehicle had driven over landmines planted by unidentified militants.
Two girls schools were blown up and a mosque was damaged in pre-dawn blasts on 15 January 2011 in Chilas.
A police checkpoint was attacked by a suspected militant hurling an explosive device at it in Peshawar, on 17 January 2011. No casualties occurred.
18 people were killed and seven injured when a bomb planted in a passenger bus exploded near Kohat on 17 January 2011. The culprits are suspected TTP militants.
Two people were killed and one wounded as a result of a landmine explosion in Kohlu on 18 January 2011.
Two civilians were killed when a roadside explosive device detonated in Mand, Kech on 18 January 2011.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: At least 3 militants were killed when a strike hit a compound in Daska village in Data Khel tehsil in North Waziristan on January 18th. Militants were thought to be international fighters attached to Al Qaeda.

ACTOR2: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone strike killed at least 5 suspected militants in Dashgah, North Waziristan.
2 people died and 15 children were injured when a remote control bomb exploded near a private school in Peshawar on 19 January 2011.
Two security personnel were injured in a landmine explosion in Shawa Farsh, Tehsil Safi, Mohmand Agency on 21 January 2011. The landmine was planted by suspected TTP militants.
At least three people were killed in a roadside blast in Lower Orakzai Agency area of Ibrahimzai on 22 January 2011.

ACTOR2: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 6 suspected militants were killed when a US drone hit a militant compound near Razmak.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: In the third strike fired by US drones on 23rd of January, 6 militants were killed when a missile struck a vehicle in the southern tehsil of Razmak. Took place in the village Razmak. Along with the 6 militants who died, 3 were also injured, including a child.

ACTOR2: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 6 people were killed in two drone strikes in Doga Mada Khel and Mando Khel villages in North Waziristan. The missiles hit two vehicles and a house.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: In the second strike, 2 more militants died when a missile hit a moving motorcycle. Foreign militants were thought to have died, took place in Datta Khel tehsil on January 23.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: In the first of three linked strikes on January 23, a car was destroyed as it parked and a nearby house was badly damaged in a US drone strike that killed two militants. Took place in Datta Khel tehsil. Pakistan intelligence identified the militants as 'local militants' without giving any indication of which group.
Suspected TTP militants destroyed a girls' school in Landi Kotal with the use of explosives at midnight on 23 January 2011.
Suspected TTP militants fired at least 20 rockets at Fort Salop in Bara Tehsil, injuring a FC soldier on 23 January 2011.
Two people died when their vehicle hit a landmine planted by unknown militants. The incident took place in Loti, Dera Bugti, on 23 January 2011.
A young boy was killed and his two sisters injured when a mortar shell from unknown sources landed in their house in Chora, Landi Kotal on 24 January 2011.

On 25 Jan 2011, at least 10 people, including a woman and three policemen were killed when a suicide bomber struck at the Ghora Chowk in the Urdu Bazaar area of Lahore city (Punjab). At least 85 people were injured in the incident.
Six people were killed when a bomb from an unknown source targeted the house of a civilian in Darra Adam Khel on 25 January 2011.

On 26 January 2011, at least 18 TTP militants were killed and 22 others injured when gunship helicopters and fighter jets of military forces bombed militant hideouts in different areas of Mohmand Agency (FATA).
On 28 January 2011, security forces killed 28 TTP militants in an aerial attack in Tehsil Safi, Mohmand Agency.
Eight people were killed and 14 wounded when a suicide bomber detonated in Kohat tunnel on 29 January 2011. The TTP have claimed responsibility.

Unidentified armed men remotely detonated a bomb which exploded to injure 8 people, including 3 policemen. The bomb, which went off when a police vehicle neared it, went off in Quetta on 29 January 2011.
On 29 January 2011, security forces killed 9 TTP militants in an aerial attack in Tehsil Safi, Mohmand Agency.
Two children were killed by a landmine in Safi, Mohmand Agency on 30 January 2011. The landmine was planted by unidentified militants.
A remote explosion partially damaged a levies checkpost in Kohlu on 31 January 2011. No loss of life was reported and no group claimed responsibility for the accident.

Two schools were blown up by suspected TTP militants in Peshawar on 1 February 2011. One of the schools was a girls school in Adezai and another was a boys school which held some classes for girls in Badhaber.

Three suspected TTP vehicles were destroyed by Pakistan Military forces through shelling by helicopters in many areas of Mohmand Agency. The event took place on 1 February 2011. No casualties were reported.

Two schools were blown up by suspected TTP militants in Peshawar on 1 February 2011. One of the schools was a girls school in Adezai and another was a boys school which held some classes for girls in Badhaber.
Ten people were killed and 32 injured when an explosive-laden car was blown up in front of the Badhaber police station on 2 February 2011. The intended target was the police station itself.
Two civilians were killed after a mortar shell struck their house in Dawezai, Pandyali on 2 February 2011. The attackers were suspected TTP militants.
A man was injured in a landmine blast (planted by suspected TTP militants) in Marjana-I, Bazai on 2 February 2011.
A woman was killed and another person was wounded when an explosive device planted by suspected TTP militants went off near their house. The event took place on 2 February 2011.
Unidentified armed men planted explosives beside a power tower in Kale Kashmir Abad, Quetta. The attack took place on 2 February 2011.

A gas pipeline and a power pylon were blown up in Quetta with remote-controlled devices planted by unidentified armed men on 2 February 2011. No casualties were reported. Supplemental research showed that BRA: Baloch Republican Army took responsibility.Supplemental research showed that BRA: Baloch Republican Army took responsibility.
One person was killed and another injured in a landmine blast in Mehar Garh, Bolan (Kachhi) on 3 February 2011.
13 TTP militants were killed and eight sustained injuries when jetfighters bombed three hideouts in Ali Sherzai, Upper Orakzai Agency on 3 February 2011.
Suspected TTP militants blew up a girls government school with a remote-controlled bomb in Khwa Darra, Orakzai on 3 February 2011.

Two people were killed and 27 (including a policeman) injured in a bomb blast at the entrance of Baba Haider Sain shrine in Lahore on 3 February 2011. A remote-control bomb had been planted outside the shrine.
One Pakistani soldier was killed and three injured when Afghan forces reportedly fired mortar shells on a Pakistani checkpost in the Peshawar area. The event took place on 4 February 2011.
Three people were killed and two injured in Kambarkhel, Bara on 5 February 2011 when a car bomb exploded. It was a timed bomb which had been planted on a moving car.
Ten TTP militants were killed in airstrikes in Ali Sher Zai, Orakzai on 5 February 2011. Eight militants were injured and three hideouts destroyed in the operation.
Unidentified armed men blew up 2 electricity towers in Bolan (Kachhi), with the use of remote-controlled devices on 5 February 2011. Power supply to Sibi and Mach was cut off.

Over 10 shops and a seminary were damaged during a bomb disposal squad's attempt to defuse an explosive device. It was set up to blow up an Imam Bargah in the vicinity. No casualties were reported. The attack took place around 6 February 2011.
Suspected TTP militants blew up the house of a tribal elder in Hafizabad, Orakzai on 6 February 2011. No casualties were reported.

Fourteen (suppl. Research) people were injured in a bomb explosion outside Jama Mosque in Hub, Lasbela, Balochistan on 6 February 2011. The person who threw the bomb also suffered injuries and later succumbed to them.
One security person was killed by a remote-controlled bomb in Dera Bugti on 6 February 2011 during a routine patrol.
A remote control bomb was detonated by unidentified armed men in Sohbatpur, DMJ on 6 February 2011. It was meant to target an oil and gas company convoy, but the vehicle had already passed the area.

Two low-intensity bomb blasts took place simultaneously in different police stations on 7 February 2011 in Karachi. One woman received minor injuries. The police are of the opinion that these blasts are meant more to intimidate than to hurt police personnel.

Unidentified armed men planted an explosive device in a market, leading to the destruction of 10 shops in the area near Cahto Chowk, Mardan on 7 February 2011. No casualties occurred, as the market was closed at the time.

Two policemen, including an ASI, were killed and six were injured in a suspected Taliban rocket attack on a police mobile van. Six others received injuries. The attack took place on 7 February 2011 in Hillmania, Hangu.

SOURCE: Balochistan Times; South Asia Terrorism Portal
NOTES: On 8 February 2011, at least two security personnel were killed and four wounded in a remote control bomb attack on a security forces mobile in Jani Kheel, Bannu.
An electricity tower was blown up with remote explosive devices in Dera Allah Yar on 8 February 2011. Electricity supply to the city was suspended.
An electricity tower was blown up with remote explosive devices in Mamal, Jaffarabad on 8 February 2011. Electricity supply to the city was suspended.
A powerful explosion occurred after unidentified militants planted an explosive device on Umarzai police station, Charsadda on 8 February 2011. Buildings were damaged but no loss of life reported.
Suspected TTP militants detonated a roadside bomb in Janikhel, Bannu, which exploded to kill two military personnel and injured six others. The incident took place on 8 February 2011.
Four people were critically injured when an explosive device planted on a bicycle by unidentified armed men went off in Dera Ismail Khan on 8 February 2011.

An 18-inch natural gas supply line in Naseerabad was blown up by unidentified armed men, who used explosive devices on 8 February 2011. Supplemental research showed that BRA: Baloch Republican Army took responsibility.
Military forces killed ten Taliban militants via shelling near the Afghan border in Upper Orakzai on 8 February 2011.
Militants blew up four NATO oil tankers in Hayatabad, Peshawar on 9 February 2011. No casualties were reported.
A man was killed in a cattle market in Charsadda when an explosive device planted by unknown armed men exploded. This occurred on 9 February 2011.
Unidentified men blew up a gas pipeline in Dera Murad Jamali on 10 February 2011, cutting off supply to several regions of Balochistan. Supplemental research showed BRA took responsibility.
Four people sustained injuries in a landmine blast in Pir Koh, Dera Bugti on 10 February 2011.
The only girls' school in Orakzai was blown up by suspected TTP militants on 10 February 2011. The explosion took place in the Merazai area.

At least 20 people were killed and 40 injured when a teenage suicide bomber targeted a parade of military recruits at Punjab Regiment Centre in Mardan on 10 February 2011. Supplemental research shows that TTP claimed responsibility for the attack.

On 11 February 2011, pro-government peace committee chief and four other activists sustained injuries when their vehicle was targeted by a roadside IED in Ambar Tehsil [coded at Ajdarra] , Mohmand Agency.
At least two Pakistanis were killed in a bomb explosion in Killa Saifullah, in Shamalzai area in Balochistan on 11 February 2011. The bomb was planted by suspected TTP militants

Three people were hurt when two low-intensity bombs went off at railway tracks in Baloch Colony in Karachi on 11 February 2011. Police found pamphlets of a Sindh-based nationalist party at the site of the blasts.
Two gas pipelines in Peer Koh, Dera Bugti, were blown up by unidentified armed men on 12 February 2011. Gas supply to the puriication plant was suspended as a result.

A Pakistan Army soldier was injured when a suspected Taliban suicide bomber blew himself up in Batkhela, Malakand Agency on 12 February 2011. Further research shows five people were injured; an accomplice of the bomber was also killed.
1 herdsman and 24 cattle were injured in a landmine blast in Mehrgarh, Bolan (Kachhi) on 12 February 2011.
Train service in Sitharja, Khairpur was interrupted due to a low intensity blast which resulted in the suspension of traffic on 13 February 2011.
A water supply pipeline of Och Gas Company was blown up by unidentified armed men in Jaffarabad on 14 February 2011.
One security personnel was killed and one injured in a landmine blast in Toba Nokhani, Dera Bugti on 14 February 2011.
A 220KV electricity tower was blown up and 15 kg explosive materials attached to another tower were defused in Ghaffar Goht, Nasirabad on 15 February 2011.
At least 2 police personnel were injured in a remote control bomb blast on Mastung Road, on 15 February 2011. It was targeting the DSP, who remained unharmed.
Two power pylons were blown up by unidentified armed men in Lakki Marwat on 15 February 2011. Power supply to Ghandi Khankehil and Left Irrigation Lift Canal areas was suspended.
Railway traffic across the country was suspended after 2 separate blasts damaged the railway track near Tando Adam area of Matiari district on 15 February 2011.
TTP militants destroyed the only remaining telephone exchange in Darra Adam Khel on 16 February 2011.
TTP militants destroyed a girls' primary school in Bazid Khel, Qasim Khel on 16 February 2011.
Militants blew up three power pylons in Razghar Mela on 17 February 2011, disrupting electric supply to seven villages in Sheikhan.
Two low-intensity bombs went off near Landhi Railway Station in Karachi on 17 February 2011. The explosion damaged tracks and injured a man as well.

A teenage suicide bomber died when an explosive-laden vehicle went off near a police station in Bannu on 18 February 2011. The target seemed to be the police but the blast killed the attacker and injured four others.
A TTP militant blew himself up during an official raid in Marghozar, Mingora on 18 February 2011. His brother and father were then arrested.
Unidentified armed men blew up a 220 KV transmission line near Bakhtiarabad in Sibi on 18 February 2011, interrupting power supply to parts of Balochistan.

Suspected TTP militants blew up a private school in Peshawar on 18 February 2011. They used an explosive to blow the school up on Charkhana Road - no loss of life was reported. It is the third incident of its kind in this locality.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
ACTOR2: AQIS: Al Qaeda in the Indian Subcontinent
NOTES: At least 7 suspected TTP militants were killed in three US drone strikes in Kaza Panga, in Azam Warsak district of SWA. Those killed included both Arabs and Turkmen, as well as allegedly an Iraqi al-Qaeda finance coordinator named Abu Zaid al-Iraqi.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A night time drone attack killed both TTP militants and civilians in Tappi, a village located in Miran Shah tehsil in North Waziristan on February 21st. 8 militants and 6 local civilians were killed.
14 people were wounded in a remote control blast in Peshawar on 22 February 2011. An electiricty transformer was blown up with a remote control bomb in Liquat market.

On 22 February 2011, at least four people of a family were killed and seven injured in a suspected TTP missile attack in Doaba area (Hangu, KP). The missiles were apparently targeting police checkposts and hit the house of a civilian instead.
At least two security personnel were killed and five injured when a remote control bomb went off in Jannat bazaar, Gwadar on 22 February 2011. According to the police, it was a targeted attack.
Unidentified men fired a rocket at a NATO oil tanker at Jamrud Bypass road in Khyber Agency on 23 February 2011. No damage reported.
Suspected BRA planted a bomb near a 220 kv pylon of the Sibi-Quetta transmission line in Mach, causing it to blow up on 23 February 2011.
The Uch power plant was closed after a pipeline supplying gas to it was blown up near Sohbatpur on 23 February 2011. BRA is suspected due to previous incidents.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: Suspected US drone missiles hit a house and car in Mohammad Khel village in Data Khel tehsil in North Waziristan on 24 February 2011, killing at least four TTP militants and injuring 2 more.
A bomb blast damaged a railway track in Dalbandin, Balochistan on 24 February 2011. It was exploded via a remote device.
Unidentified armed men blew up the girls gov. primary school in Mian Essa on 24 February 2011.
One personnel of LEA was killed and another injured in a landmine explosion in Pir Koh, Dera Bugti on 25 Feb 2011.
Taliban militants blew up five government schools in Darra Adam Khel on 26 February 2011.
Another blast in Garhi Qamardin on Saturday set ablaze the already damaged oil tankers, carrying fuel to Nato forces in Afghanistan, while police recovered three more explosive devices from the area.
Two soldiers sustained injuries in a suspected TTP explosion in Dosali, NWA on 26 Feb 2011.
Suspected TTP militants blew up 2 government schools, a boys school, a dispensary and a telephone exchange in Darra Adam Khel, Tor Chapper on 27 Feb 2011.
Unidentified armed men planted explosives and blew up a railway track near DMJ on 27 Feb 2011, suspending travel between Sibi and Dera Allahyar

One student was killed and at least 36 students of Government Girls Degree College Lundkhwar were injured when two motorbike riders opened fire and hurled hand grenades into the building on 1 March 2011. The incident took place in Lundkhwar, Takht Bai.
Four people were injured when a coach was attacked with an improvised explosive device in Mamo Khwar, Thall on 2 March 2011.
At least four people were injured in a bomb blast on 2 March 2011. A remote-controlled bomb explosion in Hangu, KPK triggered the attack.
Two people were killed and another injured when a roadside bomb exploded in Alingar, Safi tehsil, Mohmand Agency on 2 March 2011.
A powerful explosion near a police station in Hangu killed at least nine people, including two policemen. 30 others were wounded. The attack took place on 3 March 2011.
Three people sustained minor injuries when suspected militants blew up a NATO oil tanker in Hayatabad on 3 March 2011.
As many as four security men were injured when unknown armed men fired eight rockets at a security checkpost in Tora Warai (aka Tatai Palosa) on 3 March 2011.
At least ten people were killed and many others injured when a bomb exploded in a mosque in Akbarpura, Nowshera on 4 March 2011.
Three NATO oil tankers were blown up by suspected TTP militants in Torkham on 4 March 2011. A magnetic time bomb was used. No loss of life reported.
Suspected TTP militants blew up a NATO oil tanker near Taj market in Peshawar on 4 March 2011. No people were hurt.
Suspected TTP militants blew up a high school in Shewa, Swabi on 5 March 2011, with the use of explosives.
Suspected TTP militants blew up a high school in Bara on 5 March 2011, with the use of explosives.
Suspected TTP militants blew up a high school in FR Kohat on 5 March 2011, with the use of explosives.
Ten suspected TTP militants were killed in shelling by Pakistani helicopter gunships in Kurram Agency on 7 March 2011.
Unidentified men blew up a gas pipeline of 24 inch diameter near Sirki Police Station in Quetta on 7 March 2011. The pipeline was routing towards Karachi from Sui near Kashmor.

24 people were killed and about 132 injured in a bomb blast in the Civil Lines Area in Faisalabad on 8 March 2011. A car loaded with explosive material blew up near a CNG station in front of the PIA cargo office, with the intended target seeming to be the nearby ISI office. TTP claimed responsibility (supp. research).

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On 8 March 2011, five people were killed and seven sustained injuries in a US missile attack at Landi Noor area in Birmal Tehsil of SWA.
Three people sustained injuries when an explosive device planted by unknown armed men exploded. It caused the collapse of the building, which was in Dera Murad Jamali, on 8 March 2011.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone strike killed five local tribesman in Azam Warsak in Wana tehsil of South Waziristan on 8 March 2011. Intelligence officials insisted TTP militants were killed, but local officials and Bureau researchers claimed they were civilians who died.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: At least five suspected TTP militants were killed and three injured in a US drone strike in Dattakhel on 8 March 2011.
A pick-up carrying some people was heading to Dera Bugti when it hit a landmine on 9 March 2011. As a result, four people died and 18 were injured.

At least 14 people were killed and dozens injured when a TTP suicide bomber detonated himself during the funeral prayers of the wife of an Aman Lashkar member in Adezai, Matni near Peshawar on 9 March 2011.

Suspected TTP militants blew up a government run school for boys in the eighth strike in a week in Darra Adam Khel on 9 March 2011. The school was blown up with explosives in Kohiwal for the second time.
Suspected TTP militants blew up the Akakhel bridge connecting Bara and Darra Adam Khel on 9 March 2011.
Suspected TTP militants blew up a government-run primary school at Darwazgai village, Peshawar on 9 March 2011. Explosives were detonated.
Unidentified men planted an explosive device on a motorcycle, detonating it when a convoy of OGDC passed by on 10 March 2011 in DMJ. Three people died and 18 were injured.
Suspected TTP militants blew up a government-run girls school in Sadukhel, Landikotal on 10 March 2011.

Three people were injured in a bomb blast in Dera Bugti on 10 March 2011. An explosive device planted by unidentified armed men was parked in tehsil bazaar and detonated via remote control, injuring three passersby.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On March 11 in Ghoroski, a village in Spinwam tehsil of North Waziristan, a US drone hit a white car, killing 4 TTP militants.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A double US drone strike on a vehicle and a house killed at least 10 people in Khaisur village in Mir Ali tehsil of North Waziristan on March 11. 5 of those killed were TTP-linked militants, while 5 civilians also died.
Suspected TTP militants planted bomb which exploded in a mosque in Peshawar on 11 March 2011. No loss of life was reported however.
A child and a man were injured (several shops also damaged) when a bomb planted near a bridge in Peshawar exploded on 11 March 2011.
Four people were injured in a landmine explosion in Chethar, DMJ on 12 March 2011. They were injured when the landmine exploded during the inspection of a damaged electricity pylon.
Six members of a family including four children were killed by a stray rocket that hit their house in Jaffarabad on 12 March 2011.
The boundary walls of a police station caved in and one suspect in lock-up was injured on 12 March 2011, when a bomb planted by unknown men exploded in Sabzi Mandi, Gojranwala.
Suspected TTP militants blew up a girls' school in Khyber Agency on 13 March 2011.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: US drones fired four missiles at a double cab pickup boarded by 5-6 non-local TTP militants. However, the first strike missed the vehicle and therefore the militants managed to escape. Took place in Azam Warsak in Wana tehsil of South Waziristan on March 13.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: At least 4 TTP militants were killed, with 5 more injured, when a US drone fired a missile at a house and a car. Took place in Spalga village in Miranshah tehsil in North Waziristan on March 13.
2 FC Officials were injured in a remote-controlled device attack on an FC vehicle near Chagai, Khyber Agency on 14 March 2011.
A Landi Kotal government school for boys was blown up with explosives on 14 March 2011 by suspected TTP militants.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: At least four people were killed in the latest US drone strike on 14 March 2011 in NWA.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 5 suspected TTP militants were killed in a US drone strike in Datta Khel on 16 March 2011.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 42 people were killed and several injured in a fresh missile attack by American drones in Data Khel town in Datta Khe tehsil in North Waziristan on 17 March 2011. 10 people were injured. The majority of those killed were civilians holding a jirga (a formal gathering to resolve a local dispute) to deal with a dispute related to a chromite mine. While the Taliban confirmed that 12 members of the Taliban had joined the jirga, this strike represented a new low in US-Pakistani relations with it being condemned by Pakistan's president, prime ministry and army chief condemning the strike.

At least 2 FC personnel were killed and seven sustained injuries when their vehicle was targeted with a remote-controlled bomb on Chattar Road, Naseerabad on 17 March 2011. BRA claimed responsibility (supp. Research).
2 ANF personnel were injured in a bomb attack in Turbat, Kech. Explosives were fitted to a bicycle and went off at main Turbat crossing; BRA claimed responsibility.
Unidentified armed men targeted an FC convoy with a remote control bomb on 17 March 2011 on Saryab Road. One FC personnel was killed and five injured. BRA claimed responsibility (supp. Research).
At least seven people were injured in a remote control bomb attack at Bolan mail by unidentified men at Dhangra in Sibi on 17 March 2011. BRA claimed responsibility (supp. Research).
Four soldiers and a civilian were injured in a remote-controlled bomb attack carried out by suspected TTP militants in Shalobar, Bara, Khyber Agency on 18 March 2011.
As many as four security personnel were injured on 18 March 2011 in a landmine blast in Peshawar as the convoy passed through Qamarbad Chowk.
Pakistani helicopters targeted and killed eight suspected TTP militants in Kurram Agency on 18 March 2011.
Suspected TTP militants blew up a second bridge in Akakhel, Bara on 19 March 2011.
Five people were injured in a hand grenade attack on a real estate agency in Nippier police station limits, Karachi on 19 March 2011. The grenade was targeting a PPP activist.
A landmine explosion injured a security man when he stepped on it in Chinari, Safi on 21 March 2011. Suspected TTP involvement.
Three people, incl. a cop, were injured when a bomb planted at a police checkpost by unidentified armed men exploded. This took place in Gujranwala on 21 March 2011.
Six security personnel were injured when a remote control bomb detonated in Bara near security forces on 22 March 2011. TTP involvement suspected.
4 people killed and 16 injured in a rocket attack on 23 March 2011 in Sariab road, Quetta. BRA claimed responsibility (supp. research.)
A CD shop in Hangu Bazaar was blown up with explosives in Hangu on 23 March 2011. No casualties reported.
A powerful explosive device planted by unidentified individuals killed a civilian on 23 March 2011. It was originally placed for lashkars.
A power pylon was blown up and a telephone exchange in Jamrud damaged on 23 March 2011 by unidentified armed men.
A rocket attack was reported in Karachi, during which three people inside a mosque were injured on 23 March 2011. Perpetrators unclear.
Unidentified armed men fired a rocket at Quetta on 24 March 2011, in Satellite Town area. The room of a house collapsed but no loss of life occurred.
2 Dir Levies Force personnel were killed and two injured when a roadside bomb ripped through their vehicle near Toor Afghan refugee camp, near Timergara on 24 March 2011.
A TTP suspected suicide bomber rammed an explosive-laden ambulance into the Doaba police station gate, killing at least five and injuring 30 others in Hangu on 24 March 2011.
Suspected TTP militants blew up two girls schools in Khyber, Landi Kotal on 25 March 2011.
A blast in the Hashtnagri area injured 15 people in Peshawar on 25 March 2011, as explosives placed inside a rickshaw exploded.
At least 2 security personnel were killed and two injured when a planted bomb exploded near their vehicle on 25 March 2011 in Dir, Manda.
Four civilians were killed by a rocket fired by suspected TTP militants in Shahi Dhand, Lower Kurram on 27 March 2011.
Four people, including a women, were injured when mortar shells fired by suspected TTP militants hit their house in Jawakai, FR Kohat on 28 March 2011.

On 30 March 2011, a suicide bomber on a motorbike killed 10 people and wounded 20 others near a police checkpoint in Swabi town (Swabi, KP). It was an assassination attempt on JUI-F chief, who was holding a meeting nearby. Total 11 fatalities including bomber.
Three persons killed and two others injured in a remote controlled blast in Turbat, area of Quetta on 30 March 2011. It was a targeted attack by unidentified armed men.
At least 5 people were killed and 15 injured in a blast in Charsadda on 30 March 2011. 2 cops were also killed. It was targeting a local political party chief.
At least 6 people were injured in a blast on 31 March 2011. It was a remote-control bomb which detonated when a car hit it, in Turbat.

At least eight suspected. TTP militants were killed and three hideouts destroyed in artillery fire by the Pakistan military in Ali Sher Zai, Chinarak and Sparkut in Central Kurram Agency on 31 March 2011.

ACTOR2: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: American spy planes fired three missiles in Angoor Adda (South Waziristan), injuring five people on 31 March 2011. The drone was targeting unidentified armed persons.
3 people were killed in a landmine explosion on 31 March 2011 in Chamalang, Loralai, when their car hit a bomb planted by unidentified armed men.

A tribal elder including his son and three security guards were killed in a remote controlled bomb blast here at the Kohaar area of Tump on 31 March 2011. Baloch Liberation Front claimed responsibility, accusing the victim of spying (supp. Research).

At least eight suspected. TTP militants were killed and three hideouts destroyed in artillery fire by the Pakistan military in Ali Sher Zai, Chinarak and Sparkut in Central Kurram Agency on 31 March 2011.
Unidentified armed men blew up an under-construction Girls High School in Samander Kot, Danday Darya Khel, NWA on 1 April 2011.
Unidentified armed men blew up a primary school in Mandio, Bannu on 1 April 2011.
Two people (incl. bomber) were killed and eight injured in a suicide blast on 1 April 2011 in Darra Adam Khel.
2 people were injured in a roadside bomb explosion in Salman Khail, Budh Pir near Peshawar on 2 Apr 2011.
At least two persons were killed while three others suffered injuries on 2 Apr 2011 in a blast targeting the convoy of a renowned tribal leader in Koshak mountainous area of Kohlu district.

At least 51 people (incl. bombers) died and more than 120 wounded out of which 80 critically injured in three bomb blasts at Darbar Hazrat Sakhi Sarwar on 3 Apr 2011. The injured were rushed to the different hospitals of Dera Ghazi Khan and Multan. They were suicide attacks for which TTP later claimed credit.

At least 9 (incl. bomber) were killed and 26 injured in Munda, Lower Dir on 4 April 2011 when a suicide bomber blew himself up in front of a motor showroom. His target was the head of an Aman Lashkar, who died in the attack.
Susp TTP men blew up the Government Primary School of Momanabad in Mohmand Agency on 5 Apr 2011.
Susp TTP blew up the Government Primary School and a health centre in Shah Baig in Mohmand Agency on 5 Apr 2011.
Unidentified armed men attacked a house with a hand grenade in Chhattar, Nasirabad on 5 Apr 2011. No casualties reported.
BLA took responsibility for blowing up 16-inch diameter gas pipeline supplying gas to Karachi at Taal around 6 Apr 2011.
Four children were killed and three injured in a roadside bombing incident in Jarma, Kohat on 6 April 2011.
Four security personnel got injured when their convoy was targeted by remote control bomb blast in Mashkay on 6 Apr 2011.
A security vehicle was targeted with a planted explosive device when it was on routine patrolling in Shalober Nogazi Baba, Tirah on 7 Apr 2011. Five FC men were injured.
2 people (incl. bomber) were killed and 12 injured in a suicide blast at the house of DIG Investigation in Quetta on 7 Apr 2011.
A settler was killed in a hand grenade attack on a barber's shop at Chaman Pattak area of Quetta on 7 Apr 2011. He was the elder brother of PML-N leader.

A security vehicle was targeted with a remote control explosive device when it was on routine patrolling in Speen Qabar, Sipah on 7 Apr 2011. Seven Frontier Corp (FC) personnel were injured and their vehicle was also damaged.
2 policemen were injured in an RC bomb explosion in Peshawar near Rehman Baba Colony on 8 Apr 2011.
A road side planted bomb by unknown miscreants exploded at Sui on 9 Apr 2011. No loss of life reported.
Unknown militants planted explosives which went off along Sui-Kashmore Road in Dera Bugti on 9 Apr 2011. No loss of life reported.
At least three villagers including a minor were killed and six others injured when a rocket exploded under a house in Jhando Marri, Tando Allahyar on 10 Apr 2011.
2 people were killed when they stepped on a landmine in Dera Bugti on 10 Apr 2011. BRA claimed responsibility.
BRA claimed responsibility for using explosives to damage an 8-inch diameter gas pipeline in Loti, Dera Bugti on 10 Apr 2011. No loss of life reported.
A security personnel was injured due to land mine explosion in Dera Bugti area on 11 Apr 2011.
At least three people were injured in two separate bomb blasts in Noshki on 11 Apr 2011.

Eight suspected TTP militants were killed and 12 others sustained injuries when jet fighter planes and gunship helicopters pounded militant positions in tehsil Baizai and Safi in Mohmand Agency on 12 Apr 2011.
Two security personnel were injured when a roadside bomb exploded at Soran Darra, Baizai on 12 Apr 2011.

Eight suspected TTP militants were killed and 12 others sustained injuries when jet fighter planes and gunship helicopters pounded militant positions in tehsil Baizai and Safi in Mohmand Agency on 12 Apr 2011.
Militants blew up two towers of Mamagut Grid station with explosives in Mohmand Agency on 12 Apr 2011.
At least one person was injured when a bomb planted on the railway track exploded and badly damaged the engine of Khushhal Khan Khattak express here in Thal area of Jacobabad on 13 Apr 2011.

ACTOR2: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On 13 Apr 2011, consecutive American twin drone strikes in Angoor ada killed at least 6 suspected militants and injured four others. The drone fired around seven missiles which hit a vehicle, motorcycle and a house in Tehsil Barmal, South Waziristan agency.
A man received injuries when explosives planted along the road went off in Dera Bugti on 14 Apr 2011.
Several children (at least 2) and an adult were killed when a mortar shell hit a house in Baidmanai on 14 Apr 2011.
Militants blew up a gas pipeline in Dera Bugti on 15 Apr 2011, suspending supply to a purification plant.
Four security men were injured in an RC bomb blast targeting a vehicle of security forces in Tank on 18 Apr 2011.
Two security guards were killed in a landmine explosion near Chamalang coalfield on 18 Apr 2011. They were from the Marri Security forces.
At least two persons have been injured in a landmine blast took place in Jani Berri area of Tehsil Sui on 19 Apr 2011.
At least two persons have been injured in a landmine blast took place in Jaffarabad on 19 Apr 2011.
Unknown individuals blew up the building of Charsadda FM Radio Station in the jurisdiction of Prang Police Station on 19 Apr 2011.
At least two Prisoners and three Policemen were wounded in a bomb explosion inside a civil line Police station on 19 Apr 2011 in Faisalabad.

SOURCE: Balochistan Times; Aid Worker Security Database
NOTES: On 19 April, at least two national staffs of an NGO were injured in a RC car-bomb blast that took place outside a NGO office in Quetta city (Balochistan). It is not known if and why the NGOs may have been targeted.
Gunship helicopters pounded militant hideouts, sources said six suspected TTP militants were killed and two hideouts destroyed in Lower Kurram on 20 Apr 2011.

Susp. TTP Militants launched a rocket attack on Asif check-post at the Kurram Agency border, injuring a security man. Another rocket missed its target and hit the house of a local, killing his son on 20 Apr 2011.
Suspected TTP militants blew up a market owned by Naib Subedar, an official of Orakzai Levies in Ferozkhel, Lower Orakzai on 20 Apr 2011. 10 shops were destroyed.
A Bomb explosion took place outside a private FM radio station at Parang area of Charsadda on 20 Apr 2011. No casualties reported.
A 12-year-old boy was killed in a landmine blast in Nasirabad on 21 Apr 2011.
A grenade attack shook the provincial metropolis on 21 Apr 2011, killing sixteen persons on the spot, while wounding thirty-five others in Ghaas Mandi area of Karachi.
A gas pipeline was bombed on the outskirts of Quetta on 21 Apr 2011.
One person was killed and another injured in a landmine blast on 23 Apr 2011 near Rabi Canal in DMJ, Nasirabad.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On 22 April, at least 25 people were killed and several other sustained serious injuries in US drone strikes in the Mir Ali area (North Waziristan, FATA). Those killed were members of the TTP Hafiz Gul Bahadur group. At least 4 women and 5 children were also killed in the strike.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: Two US drones fired missiles at a house and guesthouse, killing 25 people (20 militants and 5 civilians). The militants had been staying at the guesthouse at the time of the attack, while 3 women and 2 children also died who lived next to the guesthouse. Locals reported the funerals of the civilians. Took place in Spinwam town in Spinwam tehsil in North Waziristan on April 22. Militants were loyal to Hafiz Gul Bahadur Group
Unidentified miscreants on 22 Apr 2011 threw a hand grenade at the house of a prominent businessman in the limits of Defence police station, Karachi. No casualties reported.
A Frontier Corps personnel was killed in a landmine explosion in Pir Koh, Dera Bugti on 23 Apr 2011.
Six people (bomber incl.) including a chief of Qaumi Lashkar were killed on 23 Apr 2011, while two others injured in a suicide blast in Bajaur Agency.
Security forces killed six suspected. TTP militants in Kharzai, Orakzai on 23 Apr 2011 with gunship helicopters.
Susp. TTP militants blew up an electricity pylon in Shabqader, Mohmand Agency on 23 Apr 2011, resulting in a total blackout.
Two police constables were wounded in a hand grenade attack by unidentified men in Mastung town, some 60 KM south of the provincial capital on 23 Apr 2011.
Two women were killed and two others injured when a mortar shell hit a house in Hangu on 24 Apr 2011.
Twin blasts by unidentified armed men on 25 Apr 2011 in a Police Station in the Gulbahar area of Peshawar left 8 people critically injured while building of station caught fire.

At least 2 people were killed and over 31 others were injured in one of two blasts on Pakistan Navy buses on 26 Apr 2011 in Karachi, while the Taliban claimed responsibility.The first blast occurred at around 7:25am in Phase II Defense Society in which two people were killed and 31 others were wounded when a remote-controlled bomb planted in a parked bike exploded alongside Navy bus.

At least 2 people were killed and over 14 others were injured in one of two blasts on Pakistan Navy buses on 26 Apr 2011 in Karachi, while the Taliban claimed responsibility. The second blast occurred around 7:35am when a bus carrying Navy personnel reached near the Northern Bypass, killing two, while14 others were injured. The police cordoned off the area and found a bomb of 10-kg explosives from the spot. bike exploded alongside Navy bus.
Unidentified armed men planted a bomb in a power supply tower of 500 KV on 27 Apr 2011. Two other bombs were defused. No loss of life reported.
Constable of Balochistan Constabulary was killed and three injured when an underground mine planted by unidentified armed men blew up in Chattar, Naseerabad on 26 Apr 2011.
At least 8 suspected TTP militants were killed and two hideouts destroyed by security forces using artillery in Khadaizai and Mamozai, Upper Orakzai on 28 Apr 2011.
Security forces' vehicles hit an underground mine during routine patrolling in Alinigar area of Tehsil Safi, resultantly a security personnel killed and five got injured on 28 Apr 2011.
A Pakistan Navy bus was bombed on Sharae Faisal here on Thursday, killing four Navy sailors and one civilian.
Unidentified armed men blew up a rural Health Centre in Banaizai on 28 Apr 2011. No loss of life reported.
Official sources said the military's gunship helicopters targeted the hideouts of militants in Mirandi, Sangroba and Chinarak areas, killing, at least, 22 insurgents and injuring several others.
Official sources said the military's gunship helicopters targeted the hideouts of militants in Mirandi, Sangroba and Chinarak areas, killing, at least, 22 insurgents and injuring several others.
Official sources said the military's gunship helicopters targeted the hideouts of militants in Mirandi, Sangroba and Chinarak areas, killing, at least, 22 insurgents and injuring several others.
A woman incurred injuries in a blast on GT Road near Danga railway crossing in Gujranwala
A man received injuries in a landmine blast inSangseela area of Dera Bugti here on Friday.
At least two people were killed and six others wounded when a landmine blast struck their vehicle in central Kurram region on Saturday.
Unidentified militants detonated a remote controlled bomb targeting a patrolling team in Miranshah. One trooper was killed.
Unidentified militants installed an explosive device on a parked NATO oil tanker in Torkham. The tanker exploded and the resulting fire spread to 3 more oil tankers parked in close proximity.
A NATO oil tanker bound for Afghanistan from Peshawar was bombed via explosive device in Jamrud by unidentified militants. No causalities or fatalities were reported.
7 LeI men killed by army helicopter shelling in Khyber Agency.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
