NOTES: In the first strike following Osama bin Laden's death, a US drone strike took place on a vehicle carrying explosives and ten armed TTP militants. The attack also hit a nearby unrelated roadside eatery and a house. As part of a Bureau investigation in 2011 into CIA claims that its drones were no longer killing civilians, the investigation found out that the total number of people killed was 18. Six were civilians while the rest were stated to be militants. Took place in Dua Toi area of Data Khel tehsil in North Waziristan on May 6.

4 injured in remote controlled bomb explosion outside the house of KPK agriculture minister and ANP party member in Peshawar. Authorities said the explosion could be Taliban retaliation to the recent killing of Osama Bin Laden.
Two people were wounded in Dera Bugti when one of them stepped on a landmine causing it to explode.
A remote bomb planted in the car of a senior tribal journalist was detonated in Peshawar. The journalist was killed in the blast.
A remote explosive device was detonated at the gate of Nowshera district court when police personnel were patrolling. 2 deaths, including one police woman, and at least 12 injuries were reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
SOURCE: Daily Regional Times (Pakistan); Long War Journal
NOTES: A US drone strike targeting a vehicle in Angur Ada, South Waziristan, killed four alleged militants and wounded five others. Officials said the unmanned Predator drone fired two missiles on a vehicle at Angoor Adda, a town near Pak-Afghan border, killing four alleged insurgents and wounding at least five others. The area is said to be under the control of Mullah Nazir.
On May 11, the Saudi Consulate in Karachi city was attacked by 2 unidentified men on motorcycles. The attackers threw hand grenades at the consulate. No damage or casualties were reported.
A suicide bomber in Duki detonated his explosive laden belt at a residence, injuring 2.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: At least 5 suspected militants were killed in a US drone strike targeting a vehicle Dattakhel. The identies of the deceased were not confirmed.

2 suicide bomb blasts occurred 10 minutes apart at the Frontier Constabulary training center in Charsadda. The TTP had claimed responsibility for the attack and the death toll reached 98 with 140 casualties.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 5 suspected militants were killed by 4 missiles fired by a US drone at a vehicle in Doga Madakhel village in NWA.

On May 14, militants threw hand grenades at a fleet of NATO oil tankers parked near the Torkham border crossing. The attack destroyed 19 oil tankers, no casualties were reported. The Abdullah Azzam group claimed responsibility for the attack.
A security forces patrol vehicle contacted a land mine planted by militants in the Safi area of Mohmand Agency. The landmine exploded killing a civilian and injuring 6 others.
1 man was killed and 2 others injured in a handgrenade attack by unidentified armed individuals in Hub.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: At least 3 suspected TTP militants were killed in a US drone strike targeting a pick-up truck in Sandasa village in Mir Ali tehsil in North Waziristan on May 16.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: Six suspected Al Qaeda militants were killed by a US drone strike on a compound in Aimarki in Mir Ali tehsil in North Waziristan on May 16.
An IED targeting a police van exploded in Nowshera, injuring 2 policemen and killing a civilian.
2 people were killed and 10 were injured in a remote control bomb explosion targeting a US consulate convoy in Peshawar. TTP claimed responsibility for the attack.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: At least six militants were killed when a US drone targeted a vehicle near North Waziristan's Tappi area. Reports suggest that Sirajud Din Haqqani, son of Haqqani network chief Jalalud Din Haqqani, was the target of the attack.
16 were killed by the explosion of a NATO oil tanker in Landi Kotal. AAB claimed responsibility for the attack.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: At least 4 alleged Haqqani militants were killed when their moving car was destroyed in a drone attack on the road between Miranshah and Spalga in Miran Shah tehsil in North Waziristan on 20th of May.
2 people were killed and 10 were injured in an explosion on Jamrud road.
Unidentified militants threw handgrenades at a security forces vehicle in Mand, killing 2 and injuring 2 others.
2 individuals were killed in a landmine explosion at the Sindh-Balochistan border area.
A motorist was injured when a remote control bomb was detonated in Nowshera.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A van was destroyed by a US drone strike and seven militants were killed, reportedly all 'Uzbeks'. Took place in Machi Khel village in Mir Ali tehsil of North Waziristan on May 23.

11 policemen killed over 4 injured in a suicide car bomb on a Peshawar police station. TTP claimed responsibility for the attack which was carried out in retaliation to the killing of Osama Bin Laden.

32 people were killed and over 50 wounded in a suicide attack near offices and residences of senior police officials in Hangu. TTP claimed responsibility for the attack and threatened even greater attacks in the wake of the operation against Osama Bin Laden.
TTP militants fired a mortar bomb at a military check post in Miranshah. The bomb missed the checkpost and there were no casualties.
A military operation targeting TTP hideouts killed 8 militants in Kurram Agency using jet fighters.
3 people were killed and eight others injured when a remote control bomb was detonated in a commercial market in Salarzai.

8 people were killed and 12 others injured when a suicide bomber attacked a restaurant in Salarzai. The target of the attack was Malik Tehsil, a leader of the Aman Lashkar which fights militants in the area.
An unidentified armed group planted a road side bomb targeting a security forces convoy in Sui. No injury or loss of life was reported as a reported as a result of the explosion.
An unidentified armed group targed a security forces came with rockets in Sibi. No injuries or casualties were reported as a result of the attack.
2 law enforcement agency officials were killed and 4 others injured when an unidentified armed group detonated a remote control bomb in Quetta.
Over 17 militants were killed in Mamozai during a security forces operation targeting militant hideouts using helicopter gunships.
6 people were injured when a remote control bomb planted along the side of a road in Dera Bugti was detonated as a bus was driving by.
2 people were injured when a bomb exploded in a mosque next to a law enforcement agency office in Chaman.
2 security personnel were injured in a land mine explosion in Chamalang.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
ACTOR2: AQIS: Al Qaeda in the Indian Subcontinent
NOTES: 9 suspected AL Qaeda militants were killed in a US drone strike in the Kari Kot area, south of Wana in Wana tehsil in S. Waziristan on June 3. An al-Qaeda commander, Illyas Kashmiri, was allegedly killed.
3 soldiers and 1 civilian were injured in an IED attack by militants on a Khasadar forces check post in Jamrud.
26 people were injured in a grenade attack by an unidentified armed group in Karachi.
18 people were killed and several others injured in a suicide bomb attack on a bakery in Nowshera. Most of the victims were security forces personnel.
6 people were killed and 11 wounded in a remote controlled bomb attack on a bus terminal in Mattani.
One person was injured in a landmine explosion in Sui.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: Two strikes hit TTP militants in Birmal tehsil of South Waziristan on June 6th. First, a US drone fired missiles at a house belonging to a local tribesman in the Shalam Raghzai area, killing 7 people. Then a second strike targeted another compound in the Wacha Dana area, killing eight militants. The area is some two kilometers away from the site of the first attack. In total, 15 died, although some reported that civilians were among the fatalities in the second strike on the compound.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: In the third drone strike of June 6th in S. Waziristan, a vehicle was destroyed killing 5 alleged militants in the borderlands between North and South Waziristan. Up to five drones were reported to be flying in the area, with the attack taking place at around 10am, some eight hours after the previous two strikes. Took place in Makin tehsil of S. Waziristan.
7 NATO oil tankers were destroyed by a remote explosive device in Torkham.
19 PPP activists were injured in a hand grenade attack by unidentified armed men in Karachi.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: US drones followed and fired missiles at a pick up truck carrying injured Hafiz Gul Bahadur militants away. 4 died as a result of this attack a few hours after previous one in Shawal tehsil of N. Waziristan on June 8.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: An attack on a housing compound in a forested area of the Shawal valley by four or five drones killed at least 18 militants, with a further six people injured. Sources linked the dead to Hafiz Gul Bahadur's group, with the housing compound described as 'a major training centre.' Took place in Shawal tehsil in N. Waziristan on 8th of June
4 civilians were killed and several injured when a passenger van hit a roadside planted bomb in Peshawar.
2 civilians were injured when their motorcycle ran over a landmine which detonated in Dera Bugti.
2 law enforcement agency officials were killed and another injured in a remote controlled explosive attack on a petrol pump by an unidentified armed group in Mastung

2 civilians were killed when a road side bomb targeting a security forces vehicle was detonated in Barawal. The vehicle was destroyed but no security forces personnel were present in the vehicle at the time of the explosion.
A NATO oil tanker rigged with a magnetic bomb was destroyed by assumed TTP militants in Landi Kotal.
A NATO oil tanker was blown up by militants (assumed TTP) in Torkham.
A civilian was injured when he stepped on an underground mine which exploded in Dera Bugti.
34 people were killed in a suicide explosion at a market in Peshawar.
5 people were injured in Karachi when unidentified armed men threw hand grenades at a PAC member.
3 people were injured when an old explosive device exploded by the roadside in Islamabad.
Two people were killed and 3 others injured in a suicide bomb attack by an unidentified attacker at a bank in Islamabad.
2 civilians were injured in a remote control bomb explosion in Quetta. The bomb was planted in a bicycle by an unidentified armed group.
1 security forces official was killed and 4 others injured as a result of a landmine explosion in Ibrahimzai.
3 soldiers were killed and 4 others were injured while patrolling in Ladha when a planted road side bomb exploded next to them.
7 NATO oil tankers were destroyed by a remote explosive device assumed to be planted by TTP in Torkham.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: In Karez village, 10km west of Wana in S. Waziristan, a drone missile missed the intended target and four militants successfully escaped into the orchard from their car on June 15

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A drone strike targeted a vehicle driving from Miranshah town to Spulga (a village 15km away) on June 15, killing 5. All were thought to be civilians, with further research having been conducted on those who died.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 10 militants of the Mullah Nazir group were killed in a US drone strike targeting 2 militant compounds near Wana.
Militants (assumed TTP) destroyed a NATO oil tanker in Landi Kotal using a timed bomb.
2 soldiers were injured in an IED explosion in Upper Orakzai.
3 people were killed and 31 injured during a remote control bomb attack on a security forces vehicle in Panjgur. Balochistan Laskhar claimed responsibility for the attack.
A law enforcement official was injured in a planted remote control bomb explosion in Dera Bugti while he was cleansing the area of land mines.
2 police officials were injure in a remote control bomb attack on their vehicle in Dera Murad Jamali.
1 person was killed and 8 more were injured in a bomb blast in Quetta. Unidentified armed men had planted explosives in a car and parked it next to a college.
3 people were killed and 5 injured in a suicide bomb blast at a market in Peshawar.
TTP militants threw hand made explosives at the residence of an Aman Lashkar volunteer in Momand Agency, killing a child and injuring 2 others.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: At least 15 people were killed, mostly militants but including at least 2 civilians, in a US drone strike in Kurram Agency.
3 security forces personnel were killed in a bomb blast at a checkpost in Jamrud.
3 people were killed and 4 injured when unidentified armed men threw grenades at a drug den in Mastung.
Military forces of Pakistan attack militant hideouts in Kurram Agency with fighter jets killing 10 militants.
3 policemen were killed and 10 injured when a suicide bomber on a bike blew himself up at a police check post in Multan.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: At least 13 militants were killed in a US drone strike in Mantoi

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: Up to a dozen people (at least 6) were reported killed in an attack on one or two trucks in the Kung Ghalai area of Birmal tehsil in S. Waziristan on June 27. Sources say both TTP and Hafiz Gul fighters were reported among the dead.
Unidentified armed men on a motorcycle threw hand grenades at a hotel in Karachi killing 1 person and injuring 19.
2 people were injured in Pubbi when a NATO oil tanker was blown up using remote explosives by assumed TTP militants.
5 people were injured when their vehicle struck a landmine planted by an unidentified armed group in Sui.
Unidentified militants planted a bomb which exploded at a rest house in Quetta. No loss of life was reported.
4 children were injured in North Waziristan when a mortar shell fired from Afghanistan landed on their house.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone attack on a guesthouse killed 6 people and injured 5 more in Hurmuz village in Mir Ali tehsil in N. Waziristan. One of those killed was an Australian convert who was aligned with Hafiz Gul Bahadur's Group, as well as two children and a women. Other militants also died in the attack
5 security forces personnel were killed and 6 more injured in a remote controlled explosives attack by an unidentified armed group on their convoy in Turbat.
6 people were killed including 2 security forces personnel when a suicide bomber detonated himself at a security check post in Battagram.

On July 11, three explosions at a Pakistan Army arms depot killed a soldier and destroyed a building, at Sihala, in Islamabad city. A military official, however, claimed the accident was likely caused by faulty electrical wiring and not a militant attack.
2 policemen were killed and 7 others injured in a remote control bomb explosion targeting a police van in Peshawar.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On July 11, US drones targeted a van in Gurwak village in Data Khel tehsil in N. Waziristan. 5 militants died in the attack, thought to have belonged to the TTP.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On July 12, for the second time in the same day US drones targeted Shawal tehsil in N. Waziristan. This time the attack took place in Barma/Barmal village just west of Shawal town, and 5 students (which some reports claimed had TTP links) were killed in. Most reports stated they were students visiting a compound with TTP links. Between 5 and 13 died

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A drone strike was directed at the New Adda (new public stand) in Dattakhel town. 8 suspected TTP militants were killed in the attack. A civilian was also killed. Took place on July 12, and nine died in total.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: For the second time in two days, US drones fired missiles at Gurwak village on the Afghan border in Data Khel tehsil in N. Waziristan on July 12th. At least 13 militants died in the strike.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: In Shawal tehsil in N. Waziristan on July 12th, drones attacked a TTP hideout as militants were entering the compound from their car. Drones followed up the attack by hitting people rescuing injured bodies in the aftermath of the first missile strike, At least 13 died, 4 of which were civilian rescuers.
2 women were killed and nine others were injured in Mamund due to mortar fire originating from Afghanistan.
5 people were killed and 3 injured in Shakai when their vehicle hit a road side bomb which exploded. The victims were on their way to attend a peace jirga.
A man was killed when he stepped on a mine in Kurram Agency.
9 childeren were killed as they played cricket near a helipad when militants fired 6 mortar shells at the Helipad in Landi Kotal.
Three Pakistani soldiers were killed and four injured when a mortar fired from Afghanistan hit them in Angoor Adda.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone missile attack on a house killed four suspected TTP militants and injured two more in Khushkali village in Mir Ali tehsil in N. Waziristan on July 20.
A remote controlled bomb targeting an Oil and Gas Development Corporation vehicle killed 4 people in Dera Allahyar.
Heavy artillery fire over militant hideouts by security forces killed 8 militants in Kurram Agency.
7 people were injured when a remote controlled bomb targeting a security forces convy was detonated in Dera Murad Jamali.
5 mortar shells fired from Afghanistan, allegedly by the Afghan military, killed 2 people and injured 5 others in Mamund.
A bomb planted by unidentified persons destroyed the house of a former MPA in Dera Allah Yar.
An unidentified armed group planted a bomb at a market in Kohlu which detonated killing a woman and injuring a child.
11 militants were killed in Central Kurram when security forces attacked their hideouts with heavy artillery fire.
One security personnel was killed and seven others were injured when a militant blew himself up at a security checkpost in South Waziristan.
Militants fired a mortar shell killing a security forces personnel in Sararogha.
Militants attacked a security forces convoy with a remote control explosive device in Bara. No loss casualties or loss of life was reported.
One security personnel was killed in an IED explosion near Wana.
1 security forces personnel was killed and 7 injured when Afghan forces fired 25 mortar shells into Angoor Adda.
One security forces personnel and 2 Aman Lashkar members were killed in landmine explosions in Momand Agency.
5 people were injured in a grenade attack by unidentified armed motorcyclists in Karachi.
A man was killed and 9 others injured in a hand grenade attack on a hotel by an unidentified armed group in Hub.
1 person was killed and 8 others injured in a bomb blast at a hotel in Hub.
A woman was killed and her son injured when militants fired rockets at her house in Dara Adam Khel.
Two minors were killed in a bomb blast in Quetta.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone strike killed at least 4 militants in Azam Warsak.
A roadside bomb killed 2 Pakistani soldiers in Ladha.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 4 people were killed when a US drone targeted a moving car. Took place on August 2 in Qutab Khel in Miran Shah tehsil - all those that died were thought to have links to the TTP.
Militants (assumed TTP) detonated a NATO oil tanker in Jamrud using a planted bomb.
One man was killed in a grenade attack on Punjabi labourers by an unidentified armed group in Quetta.
Unidentified armed men threw grenades at a group of people, injuring a former PPP leader.
5 militants were killed in Mamozai when their vehicle struck a landmine.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 21 militants, at least 14 of whom were members of the Haqqani Network, were killed in a US drone strike near Miranshah. Uzbeks were also among those killed.
An unidentified armed group attacked a security forces vehicle in Turbat using a remote control bomb. The vehicle was damaged but no casualties were reported.
7 people and a suicide bomber were killed and 35 more sustained injuries in a suicide and handcart bombing targeting the Police in Peshawar.
Unidentified armed men threw hand grenades at a bank in Kharan killing one person.
Unidentified armed men fired rockets in Quetta, killing 1 and injuring 3 security forces personnel.
Mortars fired from Afghanistan struck a house in Angoor Adda killing 2 people and injuring 2 others.
14 people were killed and 33 injured in a bomb blast at a restaurant in Dera Allah Yar. BLT claimed responsibility for the attack.
2 children were injured in a bomb blast at a bus terminal in Mastung.
3 soldiers were killed and 25 others injured in a rocket attack by militants on a Pakistani military camp in Miranshah.
7 people were injured when a bomb planted on a pole near a preaching center was detonated in Charsadda.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: At least 4 people died when US drones fired missiles at a compound in Miranshah town, the largest in N. Waziristan on August 16. Of the four that died, at least two were civilians, including one child. Militants were linked to the Haqani network.

On 16 Aug 2011, at least 12 TTP militants were killed when two of their vehicle hit bombs planted by unidentified assailants in Tharkho Kas and Tora Dara areas of Tirah Valley in Khyber Agency (FATA). Total fatalities divided equally across 2 events with 6 fatalities coded for each event.

On 16 Aug 2011, at least 12 TTP militants were killed when two of their vehicle hit bombs planted by unidentified assailants in Tharkho Kas and Tora Dara areas of Tirah Valley in Khyber Agency (FATA). Total fatalities divided equally across 2 events with 6 fatalities coded for each event.
5 security forces personnel were injured when a landmine exploded near their vehicle in Kurram Agency.
1 NATO oil tanker was destroyed following an explosion (assumed to be caused by TTP) at a NATO oil tanker terminal in Torkham.
48 people were killed and 100 were injured in a bomb blast at a mosque in Jamrud.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: Four militants were killed in a US drone strike in Sheen Warsak.
1 person was injured in a rocket attack by an unidentified armed group targeting a company searching for oil in Harnai.
4 people were killed in a landmine explosion in Kohlu.
A remote control bomb targeting an FIA office in Quetta was detonated causing damange to the building. No casualties of loss of life was reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
ACTOR2: AQIS: Al Qaeda in the Indian Subcontinent
NOTES: A US drone strike killed at least 4 militants in North Waziristan. One of those killed was allegedly al-Qaeda's 2nd in command, Atiyah Abd al-Rahman.
On 23 Aug 2011, 10 Lashkar-e-Islam militants were killed when landmines planted in a bunker by militants of Tariq Afridi group of TTP exploded in the Tirah valley of Khyber Agency (FATA).
12 people were killed and 20 others injured when a bomb planted on a bicycle was detonated at a bazaar in Nowshera.
17 rockets were fired which landed in Angoor Adda area of South Waziristan Agency. No loss of life or injury was reported.

One person was injured and a vehicle was completely destroyed in a hand grenade attack at PML-N office here on Sunday.According to police, two persons riding on a motorcycle threw a hand grenade at the PML-N office in Sherpao colony.
Several shops and medical stores were partially damaged in a blast near the Agency Headquarters Hospital in Landikotal in Khyber Agency, hospital and official sources said on Sunday.
A low intensity bomb, planted in a hotel in Torkham, went off with a bang early morning on Sunday causing partial damage to the hotel building.
12 people were killed (including the bomber) and 13 others injured when a suicide bomber drove a car full of explosives into a Shiite prayer congregation in Quetta.
Two men were killed in a blast that occurred on Abul Hasan Ispahani Road. The bomb was fixed in a motorcycle and according to SHO Mobina Town Yaqoob Sammon, the rider were alleged suicide bombers.
A powerful blast killed at least 11 and injured 13 others when a bomb was detonated on Gulistan Road in the Murriabad area of Quetta on Wednesday.
13 people were killed (including the bomber) in a suicide bomb blast targeting the Hazara Eidgah in Quetta just before eid prayers.
2 people were killed when a car packed with explosives was driven into a police station in Lakki Marwat. 18 people were also injured in the attack.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 7 suspected militants were killed in a US drone strike in NWA.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2008-2013) Frontier Corps
NOTES: On 7 September 2011, at least 28 people were killed and over 60 injured in two suicide attacks by unidentified assailants targeting the residence of the DIG of FC in Quetta city (Quetta city, Balochistan). 30 fatalities coded, including 2 bombers.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: At least 2 militants were killed in a drone strike on their vehicle in the Esokhel (or Hisokhel) area of NWA. One of the militants was allegedly Hafeezulla, a commander of the Haqqani Network, while the other is believed to be a senior al-Qaeda operations chief.
An ANP leader was killed in a remote control bomb explosion targeting his vehicle traveling in Lower Dir. 4 other people were injured in the explosion.
41 people were killed (including the bomber) and 68 wounded in a suicide bombing on the funeral of a pro-government tribal elder in Lower Dir.
One FC man was killed in a remote control bomb blast at a bazaar in Landi Kotal.
6 policemen and 2 civilians were killed in a remote control bombing targeting the residence of a police official in Karachi. TTP claimed responsibility for the attack
2 people were killed and 20 injured in a bomb blast at a CD market in Peshawar.
A powerful bomb planted along the road side was detonated killing 4 people affiliated with the local Aman Lashkar in Chamarkand.
2 people were injured in Quetta when a bomb targeting a security forces convoy was detonated.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 6 Haqqani linked militants were killed in a US drone strike Khushkali village in Mir Ali tehsil of North Waziristan on September 23.
Pakistan security forces attacked militant hideouts with Jet planes throughout Orakzai Agency killing 10 militants.
Pakistan security forces attacked militant hideouts with Jet planes in Tirah Valley killing 4 militants.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone targeted a compound in Azam Warsak, a village west of Wana in S.Waziristan on September 27th. Initially, the 4 militants (associated with Mullah Nazir's group that controls the area) were thought to have died, but subsequent reports suggested that all those in the compound escaped.
5 people were injured in a gas cylinder blast at a hotel in Islamabad. The explosion was confirmed to be an act of terrorism.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone strike killed 3 suspected foreign militants in the Bagher Cheena area near Wana.
7 police officers were killed when a road side explosive device targeting their convoy exploded in Battagram.
Following an attack on a police check post, militants detonated a bomb planted at a Bazaar in Kumbar destroying some shops. No loss of life was reported.
A Pakistani soldier was killed when he was struck by a missile fired by suspected militants in South Waziristan.
A bomb planted at the house of a school teacher was detonated in Quetta. No casualties were reported.
A bomb was detonated at a CD store in Quetta. No loss of life was reported.
2 people were injured when a bomb exploded outside an NGO in Kohat.
2 people were killed when their motorcycle struck a landmine in Dera Bugti.
A police officer was killed in a rocket attack aimed at the house of the district police officer in Bannu.
A NATO oil tanker was destroyed with an explosive device in Jamrud. 1 person was reported injured.
1 person was killed and 3 injured in a landmine explosion in Kohlu.
A security forces personnel was injured in a landmine explosion in Dera Bugti.
3 soldiers were injured in a remote controlled bomb attack on their convoy in Wana.
6 people were injured in a TTP missile attack on a Jirga in Kalaya

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 3 suspected al-Qaeda militants were killed in a US drone strike in Angoor Adda, SWA.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On 13 Oct, four people including an HQN leader were killed in a US drone strike in Dande Darpa Khel (North Waziristan Agency, FATA).

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On October 14, at least three militants linked to both the Haqqani Network and the TTP died in a US drone strike on a vehicle in Dande Darpa Khel area of North Waziristan.
A man was injured in a Landmine explosion in Dera Bugti.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: Another strike hit Mullah Nazir militants in Angoor Adda later on the same day, although some reports claimed they were not drone strikes but rather NATO helicopters. 3 died with at least 3 more injured, and some claim they were low-level TTP commanders.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On October 15, 4 Arab nationals were killed, and at least three injured, in Angoor Adda in Birmal tehsil of S. Waziristan by a US drone strike striking a compound. All the Arabs were militants attached to Mullah Nazir's group, a group aligned to the TTP. This was the US' 300th drone strike since 2004.
A law enforcement official was killed when he stepped on a landmine in Dera Bugti.
Several people were injured in a bomb blast in Quetta.
5 security forces personnel were injured in a remote control bomb blast near a grid station in Jandola.
2 police officers were wounded in a hand grenade attack by an unidentified armed group in Kachhi.
1 person was killed and 2 others injured when their vehicle struck a landmine in Dera Bugti.
An unidentified armed group attacked a security forces checkpost with rockets in Quetta. No casualties were reported.
4 people were killed in a remote control bomb attack on a vehicle in Samar Bagh.
1 security forces personnel was killed in a rocket attack by an unidentified armed group in Quetta.
12 people were injured in an IED explosion at a market in Peshawar.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: At least 13 militants were killed in a US drone strike in Azam Warsak, SWA.
4 people were injured in a landmine explosion in Dera Bugti.
2 people were injured in a landmine explosion in Dera Bugti.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone strike killed 4 militants of the Maulvi Nazir faction of the TTP in the Azam Warsak area of SWA.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone strike killed 6 suspected militants in the Mir Ali area of NWA.
2 police officers were killed in a suicide blast targeting their vehicle in Risalpur.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On October 30th, a US drone hit a vehicle in Datta Khel tehsil, killing 4 people and injuring two more. All the fatalities were civilians who worked at the local chromite mine.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
SOURCE: Express Tribune (Pakistan); Bureau of Investigative Journalism
NOTES: On October 31, two young boys were killed when a US drone hit a vehicle in the village of Norak, 20km outside of Miranshah town in Mirah Shah tehsil. There were also 3 people injured. One of the boys had recently attended an anti-drone rally in Islamabad.

Two personnel of paramilitary troops Frontier Corps (FC) were killed and six others were injured in a remote controlled explosion near Naseerabad area of Turbat. The unidentified armed group specically targetted the military forces but no group has taken responsibility.
A civilian was killed and ten others injured in a bomb blast in Karkhano Market near police check post in Peshawar. Ten vehicles were also damaged in the blast.
Unidentified men near Frontier Corps checkpost installed a remote bomb, which blew up with a loud noise but no loss of life was reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone strike killed at least three militants in North Waziristan, destroying a compound in a mountain stronghold of the Afghan Taliban's Haqqani network.
Six people were injured in Lyari on Thursday after unidentified men on a motorcycle hurled a hand grenade in the area.

A convoy of paramilitary troops Frontier Corps (FC) escaped a remote controlled blast in Mian Ghundi on Sibbi Road, outskirts of Quetta. However, no on was hurt in the blast as it took place a few minutes later as convoy passed by. Around 4 kg explosive were used in the blast aimed at security forces convoy.

The leader of ruling Awami National Party (ANP) in Khyber Pakthunkhwa and ex-union nazim, Hanif Jadoon and his bodyguard was killed while his son and seven others sustained critical wounds in a suicide attack in Malikabad area.

Katlingdheri girls' school in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa was blown up with explosives by an unidentified armed group causing substantial damage to the building. Since it was after hours, no loss of life occurred.
Two civilians sustained critical injuries when they unknowingly came in contact with a landmine explosion that occurred in the Loti area of Dera Bugti.

Three civilians were injured when a bomb planted on a motorbike by unidentified armed group exploded in Bakra Mandi area of Dera Murad Jamali in Balochistan. The target of the attack was the SHO of the area but he was not harmed since he was not present in the vehicle when the blast took place.

Six civilians died when a driverless donkey cart, laden with explosives, ran into a market area of Tirah valley in Khyber Agency. Eight civilians sustained injuries. No group has yet accepted responsibility for the attack.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone fired a missile at the bazaar in Miran Shah town on November 15, killing Al Qaeda and TTP militants. Although initial reports stated 7 died in the attack, but internal Pakistani reports stated that only 3 died in the attack.

A vehicle was blown up when unidentified armed men wearing suicide jackets were stopped by the police in Defence area of Karachi. One of the men blew himself up, killing the other two as well as injuring the two police officers at the scene.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: At least 16 suspected TTP militants, were killed in a US drone strike on a compound in the Babar Ghar area of Sararogha tehsil in S.Waziristan on November 16. One of those killed was an American who had joined militants in Pakistan in 2009.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: At least 7 TTP militants were killed in US drone strikes in Shawal tehsil of N. Waziristan on 17th of November.
A policeman was killed while another was injured when a remote-controlled explosion took place near a police checkpost in the Shabqadar tehsil of Charsadda.
Two security personnel died while three sustained injuries when a landmine exploded in the Jani Bheri area near Sui.

A police constable was killed while eight others were injured when an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) blew off outside a Girls High School in Mardan District, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa. Three police officials were also injured in the incident. No school children were hurt.
Army helicopters targeted militant hideouts in the Marghan area of Kurram Agency, six militants were killed and several injured. Six hideouts were also destroyed.

Three security personnel and two civilians were killed and eleven others wounded in a remote controlled bomb attack on Chinese engineers in restive district Dera Bugti. The Chinese engineers remained unharmed. No group has claimed responsibility, however, police suspect Baloch militants might be behind the attack.
Personnel of private oil and gas company BGP escaped unhurt and vehicle was partially damage in land mine explosion in Pat Feeder area of Dera Bugti.

Several shops were partially damaged in an explosion near Tariq Hospital area of Saryab road in Quetta. No casualty was reported in blast.According to Bomb Disposal Squad, about two kilograms explosive were used in the blast.

Heavily armed militants attacked a police station near South Waziristan tribal region and killed two police men. The militants fired rockets on the roadside police station in Daraban area in Dera Ismail Khan.
At least 25 security personnel have been killed and several others injured in unprovoked firing by NATO helicopters on 3 Pakistani check posts in Mohmand Agency.

At least six blasts ripped through railway tracks near Hussainabad, Hyderabad and Nowshero Feroze districts, destroying portions of railway tracks. However no loss of life or injuries have been reported. Security officials investigating the blasts said that they had found the pamphlets of separatist outfit 'Sindhu Desh Liberation Army' near the explosion site.

At least eight militants were killed and several others injured in bombardment of hideouts by the security forces in Dabori area of Upper Orakzai district. Security forces attacked militant hideouts at night destroying two sancturies.

A woman and a girl were killed and three others received injuries when a mortar shell fell on a house in Akkakhel area of Bara. The shell fell as a result of battle between security forces and militants.
The chief of Darband Peace Committee, Haji Hashim Khan was killed while two others sustained critical injuries when a time-bomb exploded in their vehicle.
Nine militants were killed when security forces targeted their hideouts with artillery in Upper Tehsil of the Mamozai area. The security forces also destroyed three hideouts of militants.

A low intensity blast partially damaged the boundary wall of the Peshawar district coordination officer's (DCO) office at the Bacha Khan Chowk. No casualties were reported. Unidentified armed men had planted 700 grams of explosive materials near the boundary wall to create fear and panic in the surrounding areas.
A child was injured in landmine blast in Dera Bugti district. Levies Force registered a case against unidentified armed group responsible.

One person has been killed in landmine blast in Dera Bugti district. Levies Force sources said the victim was on his way in Haft Wali area when he hit landmine which exploded. Resultantly, he died on the spot.
The security forces shelled five militant's hideouts in different areas of North Waziristan killing twelve militants.

A pipeline supplying gas to the Sui purification plant exploded in Pir Koh area of Dera Bugti. Reportedly, unidentified people had fitted explosives beneathe the gas pipeline. The explosives damaged the pipeline and suspended gas supply to the plan. No loss of life was reported in the blast.
Two people were killed and four were injured including policemen in a rocket attack that took place in the main market of Kohat city. According to police, two rockets were fired from unknown place.
At least seven militants were killed when security forces bombed their mountain hideouts with fighter jets in the Kurram Agency near the Afghanistan border.
An explosion occurred on Karachi's Kala Pul bridge on Tuesday the 10th day of Muharram (Ashura). the bomb seemed to be a planted device.However, no injuries or casualties were reported.
In another incident, three soldiers of Elite Force sustained injuries when eight mortar shells fired from unknown direction by militants hit Hangu.

Suspected militants blew up a power pylon of heavy transmission line at Mera Balarzai area in Peshawar. The militants planted explosives at the base of tower which went off causing suspension of power supply from Peshawar to Kohat district. Police said that the area was stronghold of the Khyber Agency based Lashkar-i-Islam group and they might have been behind the blast, but so far no one has taken responsibility.

At least three Rangers personnel were killed and five people including three other Rangers were injured in a remoted controlled explosion. The blast took place near Safoorah Chowrangi in Gulistan-e-Jauhar.

Seven people were injured in a blast that occurred near Karachi University when a Rangers vehicle was targetted. Such incidents have taken place previously where Rangers have been specifically targetted.

The Rangers were attacked in a bomb blast at Safora Chowk in Gulistan Johar area. Seven Rangers were injured in the early morning blast. Three Rangers died later of wounds. No group has claimed responsibility.

On December 10, unidentified armed men damaged a shrine by blasting a bomb inside its premises while torched another in Kam Shalman area in Landi Kotal (Khyber Agency, FATA). Both the shrines were partially damaged in the incident while no loss of life was reported.

Unidentified militants blew up a government school for girls in Sardheri area of Charsadda district using an improvised explosive device (IED). Damage was caused to the building but no loss of life was reported.

The militants blew up a girls primary school in Jamal Garhi village in Mardan. No casualty was reported in the incident. The blast took place in the limits of Jabbar police station and destroyed rooms and the boundary wall of the school.

Militants planted two time bombs of 20 kilograms each at the building of a middle school for boys in Kot area of Kohat. The explosive devices went off one after another at midnight. The rooms of the building were destroyed but nobody was injured in the incident.

One person has been killed in landmine blast in Dera Bugti district. Levies Force sources said the victim was on his way in Haft Wali area when he hit landmine which exploded. Resultantly, he died on the spot.

A low-intensity bomb explosion outside the University of Karachi killed a man and spread panic in the neighbourhood. Only a day earlier had witnessed the killing of three soldiers of Pakistan Rangers, Sindh, in an almost similar manner.

One security officer was killed, and six others were injured when militants fired a rocket in the Shawal Valley of North Waziristan Agency. The attack came just a day after the government denied peace talks with militants.
Mortal shell fired from unspecified direction hit a house in Tehsil Bara as a result seven children sustained serious injuries.
Explosives planted by unidentified armed men near gambling den in Malagori, Tehsil Jamrud went-off unexpectedly. No loss of life is reported.

One policeman was killed and four others were injured when militants attacked them on Frontier Road in Peshawar. The militants were armed with rocket launchers, mortars and Kalashnikovs. The militants attacked an armoured personnel carrier and then fled away. A number of militants also opened indiscriminate fire on them.

Militants blew up a government primary school for girls in Imamkhel area of the district. Militants planted improvised explosive devices at the school building and destroyed two rooms but no loss of life was reported.
Two personnel of law enforcement agency were killed and five others sustained injuries in a remote control bomb explosion in Tump area by unidentified armed men.
Two Frontier Corps (FC) personnel were killed and five others injured when their vehicle hit a landmine in the Mand Balo area of Balochistan. No group claimed the responsibility for the attack.
Five persons were killed and four others injured in remote controlled explosions in two passenger buses in Chamarkand area of Bajaur Agency.
In Khadezai area of Upper Orakzai, one security man was killed when a landmine exploded during patrolling.
A lieutenant and two personnel of Pakistan Army were killed in a landmine explosion in the Gadda Sarayee area of Kurram Agency.
Security forces (assumed military) targeted suspected militants' hideouts and killed six militants in shelling while one hideout was also destroyed.
Unidentified militants blew up a primary school, a house and a tubewell in Mandeo area of the district here on the night between Friday and Saturday, official sources said.
PAF jets killed at least 17 militants and destroyed a number of hideouts.

Militants planted an explosive device in Girls High School Aqal Jan Kale in Ghandi area. The explosion destroyed the school building completely and three children were injured. [women targeted: girls]

Two security personnel sustained injuries in a landmine explosion in the Katisar area of the Central Kurram Agency. The incident took place when vehicle of security forces was on routine patrolling duty and it suddenly hit a landmine in the Katisar area.
Militants attacked a check post with rockets in Bajaur Agency. No casualties were reported.

Militants blew up two government schools in Shabqadar area of Charsadda district, bordering Mohmand tribal region. The blasts were so powerful that several houses in the area also developed cracks. Taliban in Mohmand Agency claimed responsibility for the attacks.
Military helicopter gunships bombed militant hideouts in the Kago Qamar area of upper Orakzai.
Five children of a family received injuries when a mortar shell hit a house in Bara tehsil of Khyber Agency.
Eight people were injured when a powerful blast ripped through Shaikhabad market. Several shops caught fire after the blast that took place near Nasir Mohmand hospital. No casualty was reported.
Security forces bombarded militant hide-outs in the Orakzai tribal area, killing 16 militants and wounding 10 others.

Two gas pipelines were blown up in Sui and Pir Koh gas fields. According to Levies Force sources, unknown people set off explosives placed under the pipelines. The banned Baloch Republican Army (BRA) claimed responsibility for the attacks.
A woman was killed and five others injured when a mortar shell landed on a house. A mortar shell fired from an unknown location landed at a residential house in Shalobar area of Khyber Agency.

On December 23, a house was partially damaged in a hand grenade attack in Rashid Ghari, a suburban locality of Peshawar city. Unknown armed men hurled a grenade on the house of a person identified, which resulted a huge explosion that partially damaged the outer of the house. However, no casualty has reported in the incident.

A man, who was injured in a bomb blast outside a clinic in Hangu a few days ago, succumbed to his injuries at a hospital. Four people were injured in two remote controlled bomb blasts occurred at the main gate of clinic of lady doctor Asma Waheed in Bahadar Garhi area, last week.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2008-2013) Frontier Corps
NOTES: A deadly suicide explosion in the FC office in Bannu Saturday early morning resulted in the death of at least 9 FC men and serious injuries to 17 others.

A man and two children were killed while another child was injured when an explosive device, construed as a 'toy' by a child, exploded in their house in the outskirts of Peshawar. The child had found the device in a nearby mountain and brought it home in Urmur village to play with it.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2008-2013) Frontier Corps
NOTES: At least five FC personnel were killed and up to 12 injured when a suicide bomber ripped through the Tochi Scouts Lines located on Kohat Road. Police said they have kicked off search operation in the areas adjacent to the site of attack, adding that the Tochi Scout Line and suspected this attack to be a reatalliation by the militants.
Three children and a woman were injured when mortar shells fell on two houses in Spin Qabar area of Bara. Both the houses were partially damaged.

In Upper Orakzai, jet fighters pounded militant hideouts in Toor Semat, Jandri and Jabba Killi localities in Muhammadzai, a Taliban stronghold. At least 12 militants were killed and seven others injured. Five hideouts were destroyed.

Unidentified men blew up a gas pipeline in Shah Mansoor area of Swabi district. Gas supply was suspended to most parts in the area. There waas no loss of life reported and no group has claimed reponsibility.
Twelve suspected militants were killed as security forces pounded militant hideouts in central Kurram Agency.
Unknown militants blew up a government-run girls' with an improvised explosive device (IED) at Tahir Shah Kalli.
According to Levies Force, unknown men had planted landmine beside the road when a pedestrian hit the landmine it exploded.As a result, he sustained serious wounds.

Militants blew up a bridge, connecting Bara and Jamrud with explosive device in Khyber Agency. According to Political Administration, the bridge at InqlaabKhwar in Shalobar area was totally destroyed. No loss of life was reported. No group has claimed responsibility but it is suspected that TTP was behind the attack.

Another state-run school was destroyed in a bomb attack in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa. Unknown militants planted explosives in the premises of Government Boys Primary School Shahabkhel in Nowshehra. No loss of life was reported.
bomb blast ripped through the house of Shafiq Mengal, a son of former federal minister Naseer Mengal, followed by gunfire, claiming twelve lives and injuring at least 25.
bomb blast ripped through the house of Shafiq Mengal, a son of former federal minister Naseer Mengal, followed by aerial firing, claiming twelve lives and injuring at least 25.

At least 11 militants have been reported killed and eight hurt in Security forces' air assault in Upper Orakzai. The security forces and jet fighters launched shelling and targeted hideouts of militants in Sammy Bazaar, Adu Khel and Hoda areas of Upper Orakzai this day.
Two children were killed in the Salarzai tehsil of Bajaur Agency after a remote controlled bomb detonated at a general store. Six people were injured after a fire engulfed the store.

Taliban militants blew up a state-run primary school in Pakistan's restive northwest today though there were no casualties. The destruction of the school at Ziarat Kaka Sahib in Nowshera district of Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa province caused panic among local residents.
Two schoolchildren were killed and seven others injured when a bomb went off outside the residence of a tribal elder in the Khugakhel area of Landi Kotal.
Six militants were killed and four others were injured when jets bombarded militant hideouts in Garium, North Waziristan Agency.
A militant blew himself up in fear of being caught during an encounter with security forces at Karmana of Landi Kotal Tehsil, killing four of his close aides.

A remote-controlled bomb hit a shop in Salarzai town, about 20 kilometres (12 miles) northeast of Khar, the main city in Bajaur tribal district along the Afghan border. The blast killed an anti-Taliban militiaman and wounded three others, an official said.
As many as 15 militants were killed and three others sustained injuries when Pak army jets hit militants' positions in Orakzai Agency.
Unidentified armed men riding a motorcycle hurled a hand grenade, which landed near a hotel along Joint road. Nine persons were injured in the attack.
A landmine buried at a roadside hit a vehicle in Sui on Sunday, killing three soldiers.
At least four personnel of Frontier Corps were killed and two others wounded in a landmine blast in Dera Bugti district on Sunday .
Two security personnel were wounded in a landmine blast in Dera Bugti.
Explosives planted by unknown people with pipeline supplying water to OGDCL plant exploded, damaging the pipeline and suspending supply to the plant.
Five children were injured in a landmine blast in Sui area of Dera Bugti.
Two people were injured when some unidentified persons hurled an explosive material in Karachi's Hyderi market.
Two people were killed and 20 others injured as bomb explosion hit the basement of Azam Tower building on Arbab road in the jurisdiction of University Town Police Station.
Unknown miscreants planted an explosive device inside government primary school in Gagezai area and blew the government school up in Tehsil Safi of Mohmand Agency.
Four people were killed including a Khasadar force official in a remote-controlled attack at Bacha Khan Chowk in Landi Kotal town in Khyber Agency bordering Afghanistan.
In central Orakzai s Ali Sherzai area, five militants were killed and two insurgent hideouts were destroyed by security forces shelling.
Unknown men blew up a gas pipeline in Dera Bugti area of Balochistan disrupting gas supply.
Some unknown extremists blown up Tarbela Peshawar transmission line in Risalpur.
Unidentified militants blew up an 18-inch diameter gas pipeline in the Sui area.
Sui Southern Gas Company (SSGC) has said that its 18 inch diameter high pressure gas pipeline was blown up by some unknown miscreants at Jaffarabad, Balochistan.
Unidentified armed men blew up a gas supply-line in Balochistan on Jan 4 via remote control.
A hand grenade attack by a militant on a police checkpost in Kandhkot of the district Kashmore of Sindh on July 4, killed a man and injured 2.

Unidentified people blew up a 16-inch diameter gas pipeline in Pir Koh area of Dera Bugti on Thursday, suspending supply to the gas purification plant in Sui while two security personnel were also wounded in another blast.
One security personnel was killed in Maro area of Dera Bugti when explosives planted along the road went off.
Unidentified miscreants planted bomb near house of social activist. 6 children were wounded.
A planted explosive was detonated at the house of the head of peace committee on Jan 6 in the Sangar Khwar area of Mohmand Agency in FATA. No casualties have been reported.
Five militants were killed and two hideouts destroyed when security forces bombarded militants hideouts in Upper Orakzai.
A landmine explosion killed a civilian and injured three security guards on Jan 6 in the Jano Beri area of Dera Bugti of Balochistan.
Militants set off explosives at a girls' school on Jan 6 in the Ibrahimzai area of the Charsadda district of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa. The building was damaged but no casualties have been reported.
Militants set of explosives at a boys' school in Miranshah in North Waziristan Agency of FATA on Jan 7. A part of the building has been damaged.
Militants fired three rocket-propelled grenades at an army camp of the Military Forces of Pakistan on Jan 7 in Miranshah in North Waziristan Agency of FATA. No causalities have been reported.
Unidentified militants fired three rocket-propelled grenades at a Pakistan army camp in the town of Miran Shah in the North Waziristan tribal region.
Unidentified militants set off explosives at a boys school in Miran Shah.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: Four suspected TTP militants were killed when US drone struck a house near Miranshah, center of North Waziristan.
On January 10, at least 30 people were killed and dozens wounded when a remote-controlled bomb went off in a busy Jamrud market, believed to have been targeting members of a tribal militia.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2008-2013) Frontier Corps
NOTES: A bomb attack by the Baloch Liberation Front targeting Frontier Corps vehicles of the Police Forces on Jan 11 in Turbat in the district Kech of Balochistan killed 14 police officers.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: Air strikes by the US Military Forces on Jan 11 in Miranshah in North Waziristan Agency of FATA killed three militants.

Military jets targeted different areas of Mamuzai in upper Orakzai agency, killing at least 11 suspected militants. Six militants were reported to be injured, while four suspected hideouts were also destroyed
Some portions of Hujra (guestroom) of an ANP leader and former Nazim advocate Johar Muhammad were damaged in a blast in Dallokhel village in the outskirts of Lakki city.
At least 15 militants have been reported killed, several injured and their 3 hideouts destroyed in security forces' jet fighters air assault on secret hideouts in Orakzai Agency

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: ON January 12, 2 vehicles were hit by US drone missiles in the village of Dogga, 18km west of Miranshah in Data Khel tehsil in N. Waziristan. The militants killed (at least 6) were thought to be TTP linked of Turkmeni origin.
A mortar attack by an unknown armed group killed 3 civilians in the Akakhel area of Bara Tehsil of Khyber Agency in FATA on Jan 12.

Five people sustained injuries and four CD shops were damaged when a bomb exploded on Charsadda-Nowshera Road. Unidentified armed group planted a bomb near a CD shop at Farood-i-Azam Chowk on Charsadda-Nowshera Road that detonated, damaging four shops.

Unidentified armed group planted explosives along the road to target the police. They detonated it when the police party led passed the area. Van was damaged, but the police personnel remained unhurt.
A bomb explosion occurred during a Chehlum procession in the Khanpur area of Rahim Yar Khan in which eighteen people were killed and thirty other were injured.
A remote-controlled bomb exploded near a Shia procession marking the chehlum of Hazrat Imam Hussain (RA) in Khanpur, killing 18 people and wounding 30.
A homemade bomb exploded near a paramilitary camp in the Landi Kotal area near the Afghanistan border wounding a soldier.
The main gas pipeline supplying gas to Sindh was blown up in Sui area of Dera Bugti district by unidentified armed men.
A car with two militants was stopped by the police. One terrorist blew himself up, injuring the police officers. The other terrorist was arrested.
Six police personnel, including an SHO, sustained injuries when the suicide bomber detonated his explosives on Akora Khora check post, Nowshera while police arrested two militants.
On 20 January 2012, unknown men blew up gas pipeline in the Pir Koh area of Dera Bugti (Balochistan).
Gas supply to a purification plant was suspended after unknown militants blew up a 16-inch diameter pipeline at Pirkoh.
Unidentified persons exploded a main gas pipeline in Jaffarabad district on Sunday, suspending gas supply to several parts of Sindh and Balochistan.
Two policemen were injured when a roadside bomb, targeting a police mobile, went off in Azakhel, Nowshera district.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone fired missiles into a vehicle, killing four militants in North Waziristan.
Three rockets were fired by some unidentified persons from unknown side injuring a couple.
Unidentified armed men blew up a gas pipeline with explosives suspending gas supply to various areas by planting explosives to the gas pipeline.
A rocket fired by the unknown men landed near the Doctor's colony in Turbat. No loss of life and property occurred as a result of rocket attack.
Unidentified armed men had planted an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) in Government Primary School which exploded and razed the school building to the ground.
Pakistani gunship helicopters on Friday attacked two militant camps in the north-western Kurram tribal region near the Afghanistan border killing seven militants, security officials said.
Rockets have been fired at the Pakistan Military Academy from Galyat Mountains, damaging the academy s wall partially.
Two soldiers were killed on Jan 28 by a roadside bomb in the Jogi area of the northwestern Kurram district of FATA.
A bomb went off outside the Hujra of a former brigadier in Kohat Saturday. However, no loss of life was reported in the blast.
In Dera Bugti a paramilitary soldier was killed when a landmine exploded during mine-clearing operations, security officials said.

A vehicle of FC was passing from Soro area of Buleda in Kech district when it rolled on a landmine which exploded with a huge blast. Consequently, three security personnel received injuries due to the blast while the vehicle was also badly damaged.
A roadside bomb killed two Pakistani soldiers when it exploded in the Jogi area of the north-western Kurram tribal region, near the Afghanistan border.

Two motorcyclists chucked an explosive device on a group of people sitting at a tea shop named Quetta Chaman Hotel located on the Tannery Road in Bihar Colony. Three people were injured in the attack and they were immediately shifted to the Civil Hospital Karachi.
In tehsil Jandola of South Waziristan (SWA) a bomb planted by roadside exploded at the time when security forces were passing nearby. A security official was killed in the blast.
Two security personnel were injured in mortar shell attack in Jogi area of Central Kurram Agency.
At least eight militants were killed in bombardment by security forces in Kurram Agency s Markhan Kandao area on Monday.
A FC cop was killed in a landmine blast in FR Jawakai area of Kohat.
A suicide bomber struck a police van at Kohat Road around 9am, killing DSP , his driver ,a constable and a passer-by. It is suspected that the suicid bomber was a Tehreek-i-Taliban militant.

A bomb blast took place at Taajabad in the limits of Pishtakhara police station where one policeman was killed and three others were wounded. It is suspected that Tehreek-i-Taliban Pakistan conducted the attack.

A suicide bomber of the suspected militant group Lashkar-e-Islam killed a militant commander of the Ansar-ul-Islam and three other people on Jan 30 in Pakha Ghulam in Peshawar of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa. 7 others have been injured.
Four persons including Ameer of banned Tanzim Ansarul Islam and his son in law were killed and six others were injured in a suicide attack at Pakka Ghulam area here on Monday.
A man was killed and seven others, including three women, wounded when unidentified men lobbed a hand grenade at a brothel in Sibi on Wednesday.
Approximately 5 TTP militants were killed by the military forces of Pakistan by jet fighter planes.
Approximately 15 militants were killed while 7 other sustained injuries after their positions were attacked by jet fighter planes in Orakzai agency on Wednesday.

A powerful bomb blast left a primary girls school in ruins on Dera-Sherani road in the Dera Ismail Khan area, on late Thursday night around 2 am.Officials claim it to be a sectarian act. It is suspected that Tehreek-i-Taliban militants carried out the attacks.

A remote controlled Improvised Explosive Device (IED) went off with deafening sound in Acheni area of Peshawar without inflicting any damages on Friday. It is suspected that Tehreek-i-Taliban militants planted the IED.

Four people were killed and several injured as a large explosion hit Peshawar on Friday. It was reportedly targeting a tribal elder hailing from the Khyber Agency, but he was not present at the time of attack. It is suspected that the Tehreek-i-Taliban Pakistan conducted the attack.

The residence of a Federal Investigation Agency deputy director was attacked with an improvised explosive device on Mano Jan Road in Quetta on Friday morning. There were no casualties or injuries in the attack. It is suspected that the Baloch Separatists led the attack.

Baloch Separatists fired three rockets on the night between Friday and Saturday on the direction of cantonment in Quetta. However, all projectiles landed in the open and exploded without causing any damage.

A remote-controlled bomb killed two and injured one policeman in Naseerabad district in Balochistan on Saturday. According to police, the bomb was planted alongside the wall of Manjhoti Police Check-post in Naseerabad. Baloch Separatists are suspected.
Two police constables were killed and a passer-by was injured in a landmine explosion in Naseerabad district on Saturday .
A portion of railway track was blown up by Baloch Separatists near the Pat Feeder Bridge of Dera Murad Jamali on late Sunday night causing suspension of train traffic for some hours.
There was a landmine explosion in the Dera Bugti area of Balochistan, injuring one security person. Baloch Separatists are suspected.
Baloch Separatists on Monday blew up three pipelines supplying gas to purification plant in the Loti area of Dera Bugti.
Two girls sustained minor wounds when a bomb went-off at Asbanar (Lower Dir) on Monday morning. It is suspected that the TTP militants planted the bomb.
At least two activists of a political party were killed and another five sustained injuries in a bomb attack that ripped through an office of a PPP political party in Lyari locality.
A powerful bomb blast rocked the provincial capital late Tuesday night slightly injuring a person and damaging several shops. It is suspected that the Baloch separatists carried out the attack.
Four persons including personnel of law enforcement agency have been injured in a bomb blast took place in Notal area of Naseerabad district on Tuesday night. Baloch Separatists are suspected.
bomb exploded near Double Road in Quetta on Wednesday, injuring at least four people. It is suspected that the Baloch Separatists led the attack.

NOTES: Four Al-Qaeda militants, including Badar Mansoor, the head of Pakistani Al-Qaeda, were reported killed in the pre-dawn drone strike, which targeted a compound in Miranshah, the main town of North Waziristan.

NOTES: A drone strike on a compound in Tappi, 10 kilometres (six miles) southeast of Miranshah, killed 10 Haqqani men on Wednesday.

Many reports reported that civilians also died in this attack, with Pakistani intelligence stating that the death toll may have included civilians since the building next to the one targeted by the drone was also badly damaged in the attack. At least 5 fatalities

NOTES: Airstrikes by the Military Forces of the US killed 5 militants in Miranshah in North Waziristan Agency of FATA on Feb 09. Among them was a commander, who is affiliated with the groups Al-Qaeda and Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan. 2 people were injured.
At least one person was killed and eleven others including four policemen were injured Friday evening in a grenade attack suspected to be led by TTP militants on a police can in Swabi district.

A man was killed and another sustained wounds in bomb blast in Katan Bridge area of Khuzdar, about 360-kilometre southeast of Quetta, on Friday. It is suspected that the bomb blast was led by Baloch Separatists.
At least four people are reported hurt in a hand grenade attack at Double Road of Quetta. It is suspected that the Baloch Separatists led the attack.

Three people were killed on February 10 when the police and public were targeted with grenades on returning homes from the Public meeting of Pakistan Tehrik-i-Insaf Chairman, Imran Khan, in Shewa playground.
At least seven members of a family were killed in a hand-grenade attack by unidentified armed men late Saturday night at a house located on Kohat Road in Mattani village of Peshawar city.
Unidentified armed men hurled hand grenade at the camp of Muttahida Qaumi Movement (MQM) on Saturday.

Seven persons were killed and three other injured in explosion in a house in Frontier Region (FR) Peshawar during the wee hours of Sunday. The explosive material is said to be planted in a television set.
A bomb exploded in the outskirts of Quetta of Balochistan on Feb 12. No injuries have been reported.

NOTES: At least two people including a child lost their lives in a powerful explosion in Dera Murad Jamali on Monday, officials said. Police said that the explosion was targeted at a police van. Baloch Republican Army claimed responsibility.
A motorcycle bomb blast in the Hyatabad area of Peshawar city partly damaged a police check post. The IED was planted in a bike and detonated with a remote control.
A man was killed and eight others were wounded when bomb exploded in Wazir Dand area of Khyber Agency on Wednesday. Lashkar-e-Islam is suspected.
Unknown armed men attacked an armored vehicle of police with a hand grenade in Baghdadi area of Lyari on Wednesday.
As reported on Feb 15, a bomb hit a market in Jamrud in Khyber Agency of FATA and injured 6 people.
At least nine people including five policemen sustained injures in a powerful blast at Batta Tal Bazaar area of Peshawar, where a police van was targeted, officials said on Thursday.
bomb blast occurred at Sariab Road of Quetta on Thursday. No loss of life was reported.

A suicide bomber killed three persons including the son of a tribal militia chief and injuring four others in Upper Dir on Thursday. The bomber and another suspected militant were spotted by the son of Qaumi Lashkar chief and asked to surrender. The bomber raised his hand and detonated his explosives.
At least seven persons were killed and 30 others injured when a remote-controlled bomb exploded outside the venue of a public meeting of Awami National Party (ANP) in Nowshera.
At least seven persons including four police personnel were injured when some unknown miscreants hurled a hand grenade at a police vehicle in Sirband area of Peshawar on Thursday.

As many as nine TTP militants were killed while five others were injured when security forces pounded suspected militant hideouts with gunship helicopters and fighter jets in Mamozai area of Orakzai Agency on Thursday.

15 militants were killed and 10 others were injured when the military jetfighters targeted their positions in Alikhel.

A powerful blast ripped through busy Kurrmi Bazaar after Friday prayers, killing 43 and wounding scores of people. Fazal Saeed of Tehreek-i-Taliban Islami claimed responsibility.

At least 28 persons have been killed and 40 others injured as a bomber was pushing a handcart with explosive materials which exploded before hitting the targeted mosque in the congested Kurmi bazaar in Kurram Agency.

Pakistani fighter jets bombed TTP: Tehreek-i-Taliban Pakistan's positions in the country's northwestern tribal region close to the border with Afghanistan, killing at least nine militants and injuring several others.

Unidentified culprits hurled a hand grenade at Right Vision News reporter Saeedullah Marwat's house, which failed to explode.

At least two security personnel were martyred and four others injured in a remote controlled bomb blast by the militants on Saturday.

A woman and her daughter have been killed by a landmine planted by an unknown group on Feb 20 in the Mondrani Pat area of Sui in Dera Bugti district of Balochistan.
Muhammad Shafi, a shepherd, was killed in a landmine explosion in Chamalang.

The wife of Riaz Bugti with her daughter was coming out of her home in Gott Bashir Mandorani area of Jaffarabad when she suddenly stepped on a landmine laid by unidentified people. The mine exploded with a big bang, killing the daughter of Riaz Bugti on the spot.

Baloch Separatists exploded a gas pipeline in Pir Koh area of Dera Bugti district of Balochistan on Monday. The explosives were fitted with an 8-inch diameter gas pipeline in Pir Koh area of Dera Bugti which went off with a huge explosion and damaged a portion of the pipeline.

A blast took place in a market area at Peshawar's locality, with no causalities reported. The explosives were planted on a motorcycle by TTP militants.
Two civilians were killed when bomb planted by TTP militants along a roadside near their house in Bara area exploded early in the morning.
Three people were killed when a landmine exploded in the Sipah area of Bara in Khyber Agency. Lashkar-e-Islam is suspected.

An explosion took place near a security forces convoy in the Sro Kali locality of the Shabqadar area in Charsadda, close to Mohmand Agency, when a roadside bomb went off. No casualties were reported in the blast. TTP is suspected.
A remote - controlled blast took place in a market area at Peshawar's locality, with no causalities reported. TTP is suspected.
A power pylon was damaged when an explosive device, planted by TTP militants near Mandi Bazaar area of Haleemzai, went off on Monday night.
bomb planted by TTP militants exploded near a paramilitary vehicle in Shabqadar area of district Charsadda on Wednesday.
Baloch Separatists detonated a gas pipeline near Gott Kare in Jaffarabad.
bomb exploded near the gate of Lakson Tobacco Company at Yar Hussain village in Swabi late on Thursday night. There were no casualties.
At least 4 TTP militants were killed and several injured when airforce jets bombed suspected hideouts of miscreants in Mamozai in upper Orakzai agency on Thursday.
At least 4 TTP militants were killed and several injured when airforce jets bombed suspected hideouts of miscreants in Khadizai in upper Orakzai agency on Thursday.
At least 4 TTP militants were killed and several injured when airforce jets bombed suspected hideouts of miscreants in Bermela in upper Orakzai agency on Thursday.
At least 3 TTP militants were killed and several injured when airforce jets bombed suspected hideouts of miscreants in Samabazar in upper Orakzai agency on Thursday.
A car bomb ripped through a bus station on Thursday, killing 13 people, including two children, on the outskirts of the north-western city of Peshawar.
A mortar shell landed on a house in the Bara area of the Khyber tribal region, near the Afghanistan border, late on Friday night killing three children and wounding four others.
A blast damaged a passenger van in Mehraban Kalay in Tehsil Jamrud.

NOTES: A car bomb attack left 13 dead and 37 injured at a bus stand on Kohat Road in Peshawar. It is suspected that the attack was carried out by Abdullah Azam Brigade.
In Dera Bugti, a pipeline supplying gas to Sui purification plant was detonated on Friday, 450kms southeast of Quetta.
Baloch Separatists on Friday blew up gas pipeline in the Pir Koh area of Dera Bugti.
A major part of the government primary school for boys, Khat Killay, was destroyed by TTP in a pre-dawn blast in Swabi on Friday while bomb disposal squad defused another homemade device at the site.
