ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On February 25, a US drone crashed in Machi Khel village in Mir Ali tehsil of N.Waziristan. Hafiz Gul Bahadur militants claimed they shot it down, and got hold of half the wreckage before fleeing when the Pakistani military arrived. While the Pakistani military were looking for the debris of the drone, US drones flew overhead and fired a missile at two US missiles that were lying on the ground. No injuries but the drones nearly hit many personnel from Pakistani military
The railway track was damaged by a bomb blast in Sukkur. SDLA: Sindhu Desh Liberation Army claimed responsibility.
Unidentified men planted explosives on the rail track in Sariab, which damaged about two feet long piece of the track, cutting off rail link temporarily between Quetta and rest of the country.
Five persons were injured when a house at Bara was hit by mortar shells. Tribesmen reported these as civilian casualties in the military action in Bara.

SOURCE: South Asia Terrorism Portal; Daily Regional Times (Pakistan)
NOTES: At least five militants were killed and their several dins were demolished in gunship helicopters shelling at far flung mountainous Tirah Valley of Khyber Agency on Sunday.
A police check post in Bara in Khyber Agency of FATA has been attacked by a rocket on Feb 27. No casualties have been reported.
At least seven people were killed and many more injured, as explosives weighing around three to four kilograms attached to a motorbike detonated near the site of an ANP rally.

A government school was blown up in Swabi district. Explosive material was placed in the building of Government Primary School Mir Aftab Kothy. No loss of life was reported but parts of the school building were damaged.
A bomb planted by unidentified men to a primary school in Tehsil Razzar went off at mid-night. The school building was destroyed.

At least three people including two women were killed and three others wounded in powerful blast at Qamberabad, suburb area of Bara, in troubled Khyber Agency. No group claimed responsibility for the blast but it is suspected that TTP was behind the blast.

Unidentified militants blew up the sub-campus of Abdul Wali Khan University (AWKU) at Palosa area in Charsadda. Parts of the campus was damaged badly when explosives, planted at the building went off. Nobody was hurt in the incident.
Militants blew up a government primary school in Dalazak area of Shabqadar. The residents of the area said that the school building was destroyed in the explosion. No loss of life was reported.

At least five person sustained injuries when a rocket fired from unknown location landed at posh Hayatabad locality.According to police, the rocket possibly fired from Khyber Agency landed at Ibrahim Market injuring five persons. A shop also caught fire in the incident.

Two bombs blasts at a public sector school in Tehsil Razaar at night rocked its building as razing of the educational institutions by unidentified militants continued unabated in the district.The officials said that the latest target of the suspected militants was the government high school (boys) Yar Hussain No.1.The two blasts took place one after another at night. No casualties were reported.
Six tribesmen were critically injured when six mortar shells fired by NATO forces in Afghanistan landed in Zairai village of tehsil Dattakhel in North Waziristan on Thursday.

Pakistan military jets bombed militant hideouts in different areas of Orakzai Agency, killing at least 18 militants. The jets targeted and destroyed five militants' compounds including two training camps in Upper Orakzai.
A policeman was killed and seven people including three policemen were injured in a suicide blast that occurred after a political rally convened by Pakistan People's Party-Sherpao (PPP-Sherpao).

Jetfighters targeted militant positions in Akhun Kot, Bilrass and Chappar areas of Manozai at around 12:00 noon.At least 15 militants, including two key commanders, were killed and 13 wounded, while five of their hideouts were destroyed in the bombings.

On 2 March, 22 people were killed in a suicide attack targeting a mosque after Friday prayers in the Tirah valley. The mosque is located in an area controlled by warlord Mangal Bagh, most of the dead were from his Lashkar-i-Islam militant group.

At least six local tribal persons have been reported hurt in mortars' attack from Afghanistan on Miranshah. Six mortars were fired from Afghan side in Gharlami area of Miranshah, leaving six local residents injured.
Two militants attacked civilians with hand grenades injuring themselves and two others on March 03 in Lyari area of Karachi of Sindh.

Three gas pipelines were exploded in Dera Bugti District that suspended gas supply to purification plant. Unidentified people had fitted explosives beneath three gas pipelines in Pirkoh. No loss of life was reported.
A suicide attack by TTP on March 03 in Charsadda of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa killed one policemen and injured 8 people.

Twenty-two people were killed in a suicide attack targeting a mosque after Friday prayers in the Tirah valley.The mosque is located in an area controlled by warlord Mangal Bagh,and most of the dead were from his Lashkar-i-Islam -a group widely linked to militants and criminal gangs.
A suicide attack against a Police vehicle on March 04 in Dera Ismail Khan of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa injured 5 policemen.

NOTES: A Girls school building was partially damaged in landmine explosion in Khyber agency on MondayAccording to Khasadar force, the mine was planted near the government girl's primary school Jaffer Khan area.The explosion partially damaged the building but no one was hurt
Unknown men blew up three 220-KV electricity tower in Mach area. Electricity to some areas were suspended after pylons blown up.No loss of life was reported.

Unidentified militants blew up five houses in Dahri Likpani area in the Katlang Police Station jurisdiction on Tuesday. Police and locals said the terrorists had planted explosive material outside the house of a retired employee of the Pakistan Air Force, Ameer Rehman. Four other houses in the surrounding area, including that of Rehman's brother Rwadad Khan, were partially damaged.

A nine-year-old boy was killed and three others including two children and a man were wounded on Wednesday when a bomb planted in a push cart exploded in Peshawar. The blast took place in the Scheme Chowk neighbourhood of Peshawar.

Four schoolchildren were injured when a remote-controlled bomb placed in a handcart exploded on Kohat Road, in the suburbs of Peshawar. A military convoy had passed five minutes before the explosion took place, however, the exact target of the attack was not clear. No loss of life was reported.

NOTES: On March 9, a US drone strike hit a vehicle in the Makin tehsil in S. Waziristan close to the border of N.Waziristan. At least 12 died, all TTP militants and including members from Mehsud faction of the TTP, and one of the fatalities was a well-known jihadist from Germany (who had travelled to Waziristan in 2009).

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: At least 12 militants were killed when three US drone missiles were fired on a vehicle in South Waziristan Agency. The attack took place in the Mandao area on the border between North and South Waziristan agencies.

5 security personnel, including a high-ranking office, were killed and 7 others injured in a land mine explosion. Another member of the security forces was killed in the Toor Khel Wali area of Baizai in Mohmand Agency as well.

22 militants were reported dead in clashes with security forces and bombing by fighter jets in parts of Orakzai Agency. At least 10 militants, including a senior commander identified as Zulfiqar, were killed, while eight others, including another key militant Hasbullah, were injured. The official said that fighter jets also pounded suspected militants hideouts in the Sama, Adukhel, Jab, Kagu Kamar and Akhund Kot areas of the Upper Orakzai agency, killing about 12 militants.
Unknown militants fired a mortar shell at the house of Zel Akbar, killing four persons on the spot.
In Akakhel, a mortar shell fell on a house, killing two children while injuring two others.
At least 8 people were killed and 29 others injured in Peshawar's Budh Bher area in a suicide bomb blast during funeral prayers, Geo News reported.

A pipeline supplying gas to Sui purification plant was blown up in Dera Bugti district of Balochistan on Sunday. According to reports reaching here, unidentified people had fitted explosive device beneath a 16-inch diameter gas pipeline in Pir Koh area of Dera Bugti. As a result of teh explosion, the gas flow was suspended.

A TTP suicide bomber attacked a funeral in Badaber in Peshawar district of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa on March 11 killing 17 people and injuring 33. The target, who has survived, was a politician. He was attacked because he set up a militia to battle against the TTP.

At least 2 people were killed and 17 other wounded in a remote control roadside bomb blast in Lower Kurram on Monday. A passenger van heading to Parachinar from Peshawar hit an explosive device planted on the road side at Dir Qayyum area in the tribal region.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On March 13, at least 6 militants were killed in Darnashtra area in Makin tehsil of S. Waziristan. The militants were said to be commanders from Mullah Nazir's group, an ally/faction of the TTP.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: US drone fired four missiles which hit a vehicle carrying eight people in Barmal area of Datta Khel resulted killing of all men onboard.

Two people were killed and 20 others injured when bomb ripped through a bus near Sadda town in Kurram Agency on Monday. The bus was going from Peshawar to Parachinar, the Kurram Agency's administrative headquarters, when it was hit by the remote-controlled bomb planted on the road near Pir Qayyum village.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: Seven more people were killed in a second US drone strike in Shawal area of South Waziristan.

Two people were killed when a suicide attacker blew himself up in a remote area of North Waziristan Agency, bordering Afghanistan. Security sources said the bomber attached local office of the political agents, killing two persons and injuring an assistant political agent.
A senior government official and two other people were killed in a hand grenade attack and firing in Pakistan's volatile North Waziristan tribal region on Tuesday.
Five members of a family including three women and two children were injured when a mortar shell fell on the house of Lal Zar on Gandao Road in Sipah area of the tribal region.

Another girl primary school was blown up on GT Road in Nowshera on Wednesday. The school situated at Wapda Colony on GT Road Nowshera-Peshawar, was blown up when explosives planted by unidentified militants exploded with a big bang. Resultantly, the school building was destroyed. However, no human casualty was reported as nobody was present in the school school at the time of the blast.

A minor girl was killed and five people including four personnel of Frontier Constabulary were wounded in a rocket attack on a police post in Mattani area of Peshawar early on Wednesday. A police official said that a rocket fired from an unidentified location hit the police post located at Janay Khwar which had also damaged a house.
At least four people were killed and three other wounded in a remote control bomb blast at Gudgay area of Mohmand teshil of Bajaur Agency, on Wednesday.
A bomb explosion in the Gatcheena village in Khar of Bajaur Agency in FATA killed 5 anti-TTP tribal Militia members on March 14.

At least four people were killed and 3 other wounded in a remote control bombblast at Gudgay area of Muhmad teshil of Bajor agency, on Wednesday. Security officials said that a vehicle was targeted by terrorist who exploded remote control device when it was passing through the main road of the area.
At least six tribesmen were killed and three others injured in an improvised explosive devise (IED) blast in a village of Mamond Tehsil, Bajaur Agency on Wednesday [14 March].

Militants blew up a government school in village of Landikotal sub-division of Khyber Agency. The early morning attack came after terrorists placed powerful explosives inside the boy's primary school's compound. No loss of life was reported.

Superintendent of Police, Kalam Khan, was killed and five others injured in a suicide attack in Pishtakhara Square, close to Bara, Khyber Agency.The suicide bomber targeted the vehicle in which Khan was travelling while he was on a routine check.

Military jetfighters targeted militants' hideouts in remote areas of Tirah valley on Thursday morning, killing 6 militants and injured several others while three hideouts of the terrorists were also destroyed.
At least 16 people were injured when a passenger van was hit by a remote controlled bomb in Pakistan'snorthwest tribal area of Kurram Agency on Friday morning.

Unidentified militants blew up two government school buildings Kohat and Swabi in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province. No one was hurt as the schools were closed at the time of blasts. No group claimed responsibility but the authorities blamed suspected Taliban militants for the attack.

Unidentified militants blew up two government school buildings Kohat and Swabi in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province. No one was hurt as the schools were closed at the time of blasts. No group claimed responsibility but the authorities blamed suspected Taliban militants for the attack.
In Kohat, militants blew up a primary school for boys in remote area of Kotangi Marchoongi.No loss of life was reported.
In Lakki Marwat, two schools for boys were destroyed by explosive devices in Dhoda and Zer Janu villages. No loss of life was reported.
In Swabi, a government high school was destroyed in Kaddi village after two bombs went off.No loss of life was reported.
Unknown militants detonated a Government High School Babozai in Katlang area, by planting explosive materials insides the building. No loss of life was reported.
According to police, a roadside bomb exploded in the outskirts of Peshawar at Qadirabad, no casualties have been reported in the explosion.

A bomb blast killed at least three women in Khyber Agency. According to officials, the roadside bomb exploded near a market near Mandi Khas area when the women were passing. Two persons received injuries in the explosion, who were taken to the hospital for the treatment. No group claimed responsibility for the blast.

Unidentified armed millitnts planted a bomb inside Government High School Babozai in Katlang area.The blast destroyed five rooms of the school completely. The explosion also injured two school watchmen who were trapped in the rubble of the building.
At least 8 militants were killed and several injured in aerial bombing in Pakistan's north Waziristan tribal region on Saturday.
In the Mandi Kas area of Bara in Khyber Agency, a bomb planted at the roadside killed three women and injured two others on Saturday.

At least 23 militants were killed and seven others sustained injuries when fighter jets pounded militants' hideouts in Orakzai Agency. The forces targeted militants in the areas of Dabori, Kago Qamar, Hasanzai, Mamozai, Torsam, Adukhel, and Sama Bazaar. 11 militants' hideouts were also destroyed in the action.

A woman was killed and six others including three Pakistan Army soldiers and three women sustained injuries in an improvised explosive device (IED) attack on a military convoy as a result of subsequent action of the security forces in North Waziristan Agency.
A roadside bomb in the Mir Ali district of North Waziristan Agency in FATA on March 18 injured several soldiers.

After an attack by militants on a military convoy, Military Forces of Pakistan began shelling villages in the Mir Ali Tehsil in North Waziristan Agency of FATA on March 18, killing 3 civilians and injuring several others.
A land mind planted by the Military Forces of Pakistan injured 2 civilians in Ghulam Khan, Miran Shah of North Waziristan Agency in FATA on March 18.

A soldier was killed in an ambush by the militants at Ameen security check post located in Miranshah. In retaliatory action by the forces, five buildings located in Miranshah Bazaar were blown up. Miranshah market bombardment killed militants and injured 15 others (unknown fatalities).
After attacks by militants the Military Forces of Pakistan fired shells in Datta Khel of North Waziristan Agency in FATA killing 3 civilians and injuring 15 others.
A roadside bomb hit the vehicle of the militants in Dwa Thoi area of Tirah valley, Bara Tehsil, killing five of them. The vehicle was also destroyed in the explosion.

Four police personnel including a sub-inspector were killed and two others seriously injured when an explosive device hit a police van on Kohat Road here on Tuesday evening. The blast occurred when the police vehicle was on a routine patrolling.

Five improvised devices went off damaging Hub-Jamshoro Circuit of the National Transmission and Dispatch Company (NTDC) near Liaquat University of Medical and Health Science (LUMHS) in Jamshoro district on Thursday.

Millitants blew up two high transmission towers near Ghombat village in the limits of Ghari Kapura police station. Both the towers were destroyed by the explosion affecting the power transmission line, which supplied power from Tarbela to Peshawar.
One of the two lines of Daddu-Guddu Circuit tripped after the early morning blasts in Naseerabad near Larkana district, after improvised devices were planted near the circuit.

A radio bomb killed a security official and his son in the South Waziristan tribal district on Friday. Two of his children were also seriously injured. The explosive device was concealed in a radio set delivered to the official.

On 23 March, a deadly suicide blast at the office of banned outfit Lashkar-i-Islam [LI] at the time of Friday prayers congregation killed 10 militants in Tirah Valley of Khyber Agency bordering Afghanistan.
Unidentified militants targetted a police mobile van by detonating an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) in the outskirts of the city. The police van was damaged and one policeman was injured.
An FC man, Gul Zaman, died in a landmine explosion when he stepped on it in Bakar area of Dera Bugti. The security personnel rushed to site and moved the deceased to hospital.

Unknown militants blew up a telephone exchange and community centre by detonating bombs at flour market in Mohmand Agency. The structure of the buildings were badly damaged, however, no loss of life has been reported.
Three persons received injuries in a bomb blast outside the residence of a leader of Pakistan People's Party-Sherpao at Dalazak Road in Peshawar on Tuesday evening.
A gas pipeline was blown up by unidentified men by detonating a low-intensity bomb near Ring-Road in the outskirts of Peshawar.
Two policemen were wounded in a bomb blast in Pishin, some 70 KM away from Quetta.

At least three people were injured in a blast, when an IED was planted on the front gate of a Khyber Agency tribal elder, Haji Firdous near Pharipura, Dalazak road near Peshawar. However the blast did not injure any one inside the house.
Suspected Baloch Separatists had placed explosives beneath a 15-inch diameter gas pipeline in Pir Koh area of Dera Bugti which went off with a huge blast badly demanding the pipeline.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone launched a missile attack in the built-up market area of Miranshah, the main town of N.Waziristan. 4 militants died, with most sources claiming they were local TTP fighters.

Unknown militants blew up a government school in Ebrahim Zai area of district Charsadda. They planted explosive device in government Primary school No-2, the school's building, including two room were completely damaged in the explosion.No loss of life was reported.
Unknown armed men on Friday blew up a government school in Ibrahim Zai area of district Charsadda.

Army helicopters targeted militant hideouts in the Upper Orakzai Agency on Saturday killing 10 militants. Official sources said that security forces had headed towards the Akhwanda Kot area as military offensive had been launched against militants in the tribal belt.Four hideouts of militants were also destroyed in bombardment.

Unknown men attached an explosive device to the gas pipeline near Pirkoh Gas field that went off resulting in a huge explosion. The gas supply from three wells to Pirkoh gas field was suspended due to the blast. The banned Baloch Republican Army (BRA), in past, has often claimed responsibility for targeting gas pipelines in Dera Bugti. However, there have been no such claims for this latest attack so far.
An official of Civil Defence identified was wounded when explosives planted with a power pylon in Sibi exploded. Baloch separatist groups are suspected.
A youth got seriously injured in a landmine explosion in Barkhan district Sunday. He was rushed to nearby hospital for medical aid.

A man was killed and 15 others were injured in a car bomb explosion in bus stand in Lower Kurram on Monday. The bomb explosion occurred in an unidentified car stood in Sada Bus Stand in the area of Lower Kurram.
An explosion in the Sadda Market in Khyber Agency of FATA killed one person and injured 13 on April 2.

An FC helicopter was attacked on Tuesday causing an emergency landing in Ghalanai, Mohmand Agency. No casualties were reported in the attack.Tehreek-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed the responsibility of the attack.

One soldier was killed and two injured when a roadside planted explosive device went off on Tuesday, close to Amin check-post. Official sources said that as curfew was imposed on the route from Miranshah to tehsil Dattakhel area of North Waziristan Agency, for the movement of military convoys in the rugged region, roadside planted explosive device detonated, targeting army vehicle when military convoy was on move.
In Speen Dhand locality of Bara, three minor girls were injured when a mortar shell fell on the house of Bahadar Khan on the night between Tuesday and Wednesday.

At least two people were killed after an unidentified armed man threw a hand grenade on a protest rally near Gari Bagh in Gilgit on Tuesday. The rally was called by Ahle Sunnat Wall Jamaat (ASWJ) for release of one of its leader who was detained earlier. The rival sects continued to fire at each other despite the enforcement of the curfew. At least 50 people including police personnel were injured in various firing incidents in different areas of the city.

In Nowshera, militants blew up a primary school for girls in Arbab Dheri area on Wednesday. Two classrooms were destroyed completely in the blast. Other potions of the building were also partially damaged. No loss of life was reported.
At least six people were killed and three injured when a remote control bomb exploded near a passenger van, in sub-division of Jamrud, Khyber Agency.
In Kohat, at least six shops were damaged when unidentified persons fired a rocket at a market and resorted to indiscriminate firing in Miangan Colony on Thursday

Four people including two policemen were killed while 19 others were injured when a suicide bomber targeted a police official at Malir Halt area of Karachi on Thursday. The banned outfit Tehrik-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) has claimed responsibility of the attack.

A primary school for girls was blown up by unidentified militants in Safi tehsil of Mohmand Agency on Friday night. The militants planted explosives to the building of Malik Zargar primary school for girls in the Gurbaz area, which caused the building to collapse. No loss of life was reported. Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan Mohmand Agency chapter accepted responsibility for destroying the school building.
Pakistani helicopter gunships attacked hideouts in a tribal area near the border with Afghanistan on Sunday, killing 14 suspected militants, in two areas of the Orakzai tribal agency.

Four personnel's of Tochi Scouts were injured in a roadside bomb blast near Miranshah, on Sunday. A vehicle of the Tochi Scouts was hit by a roadside bomb planted at Miranshah-Datakhel road. Four personnel were injured in the incident. Officials said the FC men were taking ration for the security forces in the mountains when came under attack. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

At least eight laborers were injured on Saturday when unknown persons hurled hand grenade on them in the outskirts of Gwadar in Balochistan. Police suspected that anti-government nationalists may be behind the incident.

Excise Inspector Khaista Mir was killed in bomb blast near Peshawar on Saturday. Unknown militants had planted a bomb outside Mir's house. The motive behind the attack was unknown and no group claimed responsibility for the attack.
On 14 April, as a result of on going riots in Lyari, a man was killed and several others were injured in a hand grenade attack near Eidgah Police Station in Lyari area (Karachi city, Sindh).

Five security personnel were injured when a suicide bomber in an explosives-laden vehicle was intercepted at the gate of Wana Scouts Camp, in South Waziristan Agency. The guards received minor injuries.

Unidentified militants blew up a private school, owned by a lawmaker of Awami National Party, on Monday.The main gate, boundary wall and rooms of the school were damaged when a five-kilogram bomb was planted at its entrance. No one was present in the school at the time of explosion.

A six-year-old student was killed, while another one injured when unidentified millitans threw a hand grenade into a school in the Chargano Kalay area of Peshawar on Monday. The armed men on a motorbike threw hand grenades at Iqra Public School in Chargano Kalay on Charsadda Road, killing a student and injuring two others.
In the on-going operation, PAF fighter jets pounded the militants' hideouts in which at least six militants were killed and three bunkers were destroyed in Kurram Agency.

A check-post of the Frontier Corps near Kolpur railway station, some 50km off Quetta, came under rocket attack on Wednesday night. The Levies Force sources said that unidentified men perched in the nearby mountain fired two rockets that landed near the railway station and exploded. No casualty was reported.
Three policemen received serious injuries here on Thursday when suspected persons hurled a hand grenade at them.

Four persons were injured in a remote controlled blast in Shahookhel area of Hangu district on Thursday. Police said that a roadside bomb exploded when a passenger van, going to Shahookhel from the bazaar, reached the area. As a result the driver, Mohammad Shoaib, cleaner Rafiullah and pedestrians Mosam Ali and Ali Ahmed sustained injuries.

In Bajaur Agency, unidentified militants blew up a government school in Sharifkhana locality of tehsil Nawagai on the night between Wednesday and Thursday. Unidentified armed militants planted explosive device at the primary school for boys that destroyed the building completely. No loss of life was reported.

Unidentified militants blew up a government girls' school in Jamrud tehsil of Khyber Agency on the night between Thursday and Friday. The explosives were planted in the school that damaged the building. No loss of life was reported. A local militant group Abdullah Ezzam Brigade took responsibility for the incident.

A security man sustained injuries when an improvised explosive device, planted by suspected militants, went off near Khirgi village on Tank-Jandola Road.No one was hurt. No group claimed responsibility.
A landmine explosion killed 2 people and injured another 2 in the Za Mardan village area of Loti Gas Field in the Dera Bugti district of Balochistan on April 21.
Explosives planted in a government-run school building in Dera town, blew up in the early hours of Sunday morning. The school building was damaged but no loss of life was reported.

A private medical clinic was blown up in the Sulaiman Khel area within the jurisdiction of the Badaber Police Station on the outskirts of Peshawar late Saturday night. The blast completely destroyed the small building and also inflicted damage to adjacent houses. No loss of life was reported.

At least two persons have been killed and another two injured in a landmine blast took place in Loti gas field area of Dera Bugti district on Sunday. A pick up vehicle carrying passengers hit a landmine when it reached in Za Mardan village area of Loti Gas Field.

A clinic was damaged when two bombs went off in Salmankhel village in the limits of Badhber police station. Police said militants had planted two bombs outside the doors of the clinic of Dr Misal Khan. No loss of life was reported.

An eight-year-old Afghan boy was killed and two shopkeepers injured after a hand grenade hurled by suspected militants at a Frontier Constabulary checkpost in Bara Qadeen area of Peshawar missed the target on Tuesday.

Unidentified armed men blew up two 16-inch gas pipelines on Tuesday in Balochistan province's Dera Bugti region. After the incident that took place in Dera Bugti's Pir Koh area, gas supply was disrupted to a purification plant.

Another bomb exploded in a middle school for boys in Dera Ismail Khan. Two rooms of the building were completely destroyed. However, no casualties were reported in the incident. No group claimed responsibility but TTP was suspected as the group behind the attack.

Militants planted explosives in a primary school building in Peshawar. There were no casualties, as the bomb exploded on a Sunday. No group claimed responsibility but TTP was suspected as the group behind the attack.

At least two people were killed and over 35 including women and children injured in a blas tat the railway station in Lahore, on Tuesday. Police confirmed that a blast took place at platform No-2 during rush hours. According to reports a bomb was kept in a bag near the booking counter of Business Train.
A suspected suicide attacker died when his explosive-laden vest went off during an attempt to escape police arrest near Hazara town on Thursday.
At least five policemen were wounded when a police van was targeted by a remote-controlled bomb in the Rustam area of Mardan on Friday.
A station house officer and five other police officials were injured when their van hit a remote-controlled bomb at Sharaopul in Pishkando area.

A police personnel has been injured in hand grenade attack in Wapda Colony on Friday. Unknown armed men hurled hand grenade at the house of a Deputy Superintendent Police. As a result, one policeman was injured in the explosion.

In Charsadda, unknown militants blew up a government girls' school in Shabqadar on Friday. The explosion occurred at the government primary school, Daman Matta, which was completely destroyed.No loss of life was reported.

A woman was critically injured when an Improvise Explosive Device planted by unknown armed men in a field of Boshera Hamime, Parachinar, went off on Saturday. The woman lost both her legs as a result. No group claimed responsibility.
Two members of a peace committee were killed in a roadside blast in Mohmand tribal region on Saturday. Both the deceased were members of Dawezai Peace Committee.
On April 29, unknown armed men threw a hand grenade on a house but no harm was caused to life or property as it failed to explode in Darwazi Ploasi area of Hangu district (Khyber Pakhtunkhwa).

An explosive-laden car parked inside a workshop was blown up with a remote-controlled device in Jamrud tehsil. One man was killed and 15 others were wounded. Several vehicles were also partially damaged. The motive behind the attack was not known but the political administration suspected it could a reaction to the Khyber Agency operation.
Three people were killed and fourteen others were injured when an explosive-laden vehicle exploded in a bus stand of the Zakhakhel Tribe, in Jamrud sub-division of Khyber Agency.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone strike killed four people in North Waziristan Agency. The remotely piloted aircraft targeted an abandoned girls' high school building used by militants in Miranshah. Three people were wounded. Amongst the dead were TTP militants and the leader of the Islamic Movement of Uzbekistan.

Pakistan People's Party (PPP) leader Nabeel Gabol narrowly escaped an attack at Miran Naka road, Lyari area of the city. Unidentified individuals threw a hand grenade on Gabol's vehicle when he was on his way to a PPP workers funeral.

A policeman was killed and another received injuries in a bomb blast in Ghari Suhbat Khan on the suburbs of Peshawar on Monday. An official of Khazana police station said that four policemen, led by head constable Gul Zar Khan, were targeted by suspected militants with a remote controlled explosive device when they were passing near a girls college in the area.

A powerful bomb blast left a girls school in ruins in Swabi district of Khyber Pakhtoonkhwa province, on Monday. The incident took place overnight in the Mian Dheri area, where three bombs were planted in a girl's primary school. No casalities were reported.

Unknown armed men parked an explosive - laden car on Sariab Road near Irrigation Colony and detonated it through a remote control when a convoy of the Frontier Corps (FC) was passing there. At least 2 persons were killed and 15 others, including six personnel of law enforcement agencies, were injured. The blast also damaged two vehicles of FC, four rickshaws and four shops.

At least six other people were injured in the series of 15 blasts outside the National Bank branches that hit Sindh early Wednesday morning. A security guard has been killed in Kotri while 3 security personnel were injured in Larkana, Nawab Shah and Hyderabad. Police found pamphlets belonging to the separatist organisation Sindhu Desh Liberation Army (SDLA) near the targeted ATMs.

At least six other people were injured in the series of 15 blasts outside the National Bank branches that hit Sindh early Wednesday morning. A security guard has been killed in Kotri while 3 security personnel were injured in Larkana, Nawab Shah and Hyderabad. Police found pamphlets belonging to the separatist organisation Sindhu Desh Liberation Army (SDLA) near the targeted ATMs.

Unidentified armed men also blew up ATM machines up in Dadu, Badin, Rani Pur, Qazi Ahmed, Dokri. Police found pamphlets belonging to the separatist organisation Sindhu Desh Liberation Army (SDLA) near the targeted ATMs.

Unidentified armed men also blew up ATM machines up in Dadu, Badin, Rani Pur, Qazi Ahmed, Dokri. Police found pamphlets belonging to the separatist organisation Sindhu Desh Liberation Army (SDLA) near the targeted ATMs.

Unidentified armed men also blew up ATM machines up in Dadu, Badin, Rani Pur, Qazi Ahmed, Dokri. Police found pamphlets belonging to the separatist organisation Sindhu Desh Liberation Army (SDLA) near the targeted ATMs.

At least six other people were injured in the series of 15 blasts outside the National Bank branches that hit Sindh early Wednesday morning. A security guard has been killed in Kotri while 3 security personnel were injured in Larkana, Nawab Shah and Hyderabad. Police found pamphlets belonging to the separatist organisation Sindhu Desh Liberation Army (SDLA) near the targeted ATMs.

Unidentified armed men also blew up ATM machines up in Dadu, Badin, Rani Pur, Qazi Ahmed, Dokri. Police found pamphlets belonging to the separatist organisation Sindhu Desh Liberation Army (SDLA) near the targeted ATMs.
There was a powerful bomb blast on the railway track near Mirpur Mathelo in Ghotki district on early Wednesday morning. No loss of life was reported.
ATMs belonging to government-run banks were targeted on May 2 in Hyderabad, Sindh in blasts injuring many people. Police found pamphlets belonging to the SDLA near the targeted ATMs.
ATMs belonging to government-run banks were targeted on May 2 in Nawabshah, Sindh in blasts injuring many people. Police found pamphlets belonging to the SDLA near the targeted ATMs.
ATMs belonging to government-run banks were targeted on May 2 in Dadu, Sindh in blasts injuring many people. Police found pamphlets belonging to the SDLA near the targeted ATMs.
ATMs belonging to government-run banks were targeted on May 2 in Ghotki, Sindh in blasts injuring many people. Police found pamphlets belonging to the SDLA near the targeted ATMs.
ATMs belonging to government-run banks were targeted on May 2 in Moro, Sindh in blasts injuring many people. Police found pamphlets belonging to the SDLA near the targeted ATMs.

Unidentified armed men had planted an explosive devise on national highway passing near Kalat and detonated it when an official vehicle carrying personnel of a law enforcement agency passed there. No loss of life was reported.
Unrest in Liyari caused six people including a woman to be injured in a rocket and hand grenade attack in the area during the night of Tuesday and Wednesday.
ATMs belonging to government-run banks were targeted on May 2 in Larkana, Sindh in blasts injuring many people. Police found pamphlets belonging to the SDLA near the targeted ATMs.
After an explosion the Police Forces started a search operation in Chamarkand, Safi of Mohmand Agency, FATA on May 2, when another bomb exploded killing 3 policemen.
A bomb attack by an unidentified group killed 2 pro government tribal elders in Chamarkand village of Safi in Mohmand Agency, FATA on May 2.

Unidentified armed men also blew up ATM machines up in Dadu, Badin, Rani Pur, Qazi Ahmed, Dokri. Police found pamphlets belonging to the separatist organisation Sindhu Desh Liberation Army (SDLA) near the targeted ATMs.

At least six other people were injured in the series of 15 blasts outside the National Bank branches that hit Sindh early Wednesday morning. A security guard has been killed in Kotri while 3 security personnel were injured in Larkana, Nawab Shah and Hyderabad. Police found pamphlets belonging to the separatist organisation Sindhu Desh Liberation Army (SDLA) near the targeted ATMs.

SOURCE: Frontier Star; South Asia Terrorism Portal
NOTES: On 4 May 2012, at least 29 people were killed including 4 policemen in a suicide attack by unidentified assailants targeting police forces in Khar town (Bajaur Agency, FATA).
At least one person died in a hand-grenade attack in Agra Taj Colony. According to the police, unknown men hurled a grenade at some people, which killed one man on the spot.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AQIS: Al Qaeda in the Indian Subcontinent
NOTES: In Shawal tehsil of North Waziristan, eight suspected TTP militants have been killed and several injured in a US drone attack at Darra-e-Nishtar area. The casualties occurred when the drones fired missiles at a house in the area early on 5th May - it later emerged that a senior al Qaeda commander was killed in this drone attack.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: Air strikes by the Military Forces of the US in the Derry Nashter area of Shawal in North Waziristan Agency, FATA on May 5 killed 10 people. The identity of them is not clear. However, it is claimed that militants were using that area.

Banned outfit, Baloch Republican Army (BRA) claimed the responsibility of rocket attacks on security personals in Lyari. The Baloch activists fired 12 rockets, destroying 2 armed vehicles and killing 10 security personals while several policemen were injured. The attack was to take revenge against the ongoing operation in Lyari against the Balochis.

Two persons were injured in a landmine explosion in Mandrani Mat near Sui area of Dera Bugti district on Sunday. According to police, the victims were on way to home riding a motorcycle when their motorbike hit the landmine which was planted beside the road by unknown men.

The house of a former District Councilor, Arab Gul, was targeted and partially destroyed a nearby mosque in the suburb of Peshawar. No casualty was reported but a person was injured. A car full with explosives was left outside his house resulting in damage to four rooms of the house.
The militants destroyed a primary school Halimzai district of Mohmand Agency by detonating explosives. No loss of life was reported.
The militants destroyed the girls' middle school in Kari Kot area fiver kilometer away from Wana district of the South Waziristan. No loss of life was reported.
After the Military Force of Pakistan raided the Dattakhel village and Zafar area in North Waziristan Agency of FATA by air, explosions and shells killed 3 civilians and injured 24 people on May 7.

Air raids by the Military Forces of Pakistan in the Dattakhel village and Zafar Town areas of North Waziristan Agency in FATA on May 7 killed 12 militants belonging to the Asmat Al-Maavia group. Another source claims that 17 militants have been killed.
A blast occurred in the parking lot close to DC office in District Panjgur of Balochistan, on Tuesday, that damaged the parked vehicles. However, no casualty was reported.

At least 10 militants were killed and eight other injured when jet planes targeted their hideouts in Tirah valley of Khyber Agency on Wednesday. The security forces targeted the hideouts of Taliban of Tariq Afridi group in Meer Khwla, Dwa Thoe and Thora Vella areas near the Afghan border.

On 9 May 2012, the house of a senior government official came under a grenade attack in defence colony in Kohat (Khyber Pakhtunkhwa). Some unidentified men threw a grenade in his house but no one was hurt.

A roadside blast hit a vehicle of security forces in outskirts of Peshawar on Thursday morning, however no casualty was reported. Officials said the explosion occurred in Bazid Khail area near Badaber, 24 km from Peshawar, when a vehicle of security troops was passing through the area.
Two bombs exploded in a graveyard of Akorakhatak, destroying the under construction mausoleum of Awami National Party (ANP) leader and poet Ajmal Khatak. Eight people were injured in the blasts.

Unidentified men had planted a bomb along roadside on Kamrani road and detonated it with a remote control when an official vehicle carrying policemen passed there. As a result, four persons including three policemen and a civilian sustained injuries. A policeman succumbed to his injuries.
A DSP was attacked by a remotely controlled explosion on May 11 in Chughalpura area of Peshawar, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa. He remained unhurt but 1 person was injured and 2 vehicles destroyed.
A remote-controlled blast targeted a police mobile at Sariab Road, killing a policeman and wounding three others. Officials said the blast took place in Lango Abad of Sariab Road area, Quetta.

A remote-controlled bomb targeted the vehicle of DSP Faqirabad Banaras Khan near Chughalpura in Ring Road area of the city on Friday. The police official escaped the attack; however, a man was injured in the incident and two vehicles were destroyed.
At least four children were killed and a woman injured when a mortar shell, fired from unknown location, hit a car in Shalobar area of Khyber Agency on Friday.
A remote-controlled bomb exploded as a police van carrying four prisoners was passing by in Peshawar city on Saturday, killing one policeman and wounding 17 others.
A taxi driver was killed when a mortar bomb hit his cab in the upmarket Hayatabad area of Peshawar on Friday night.

A roadside bomb injured two security men in North Waziristan tribal region on Sunday. The bomb was detonated through a remote-control device near Thal Pikkat when a convoy of security officials was passing on the Razmak-Miran Shah road.
At least eight persons were injured in a blast near a police checkpost at a cattle market on Ring Road on the outskirts of Peshawar on Sunday.

A railway track was blown away with explosives at Saryab Road in Quetta. According to police, the blast caused damage to a portion of a railway track at Saryab Road and as a result of which railway traffic was temporarily suspended.

Three people, including two paramilitary frontier constabulary (FC) personnel, were killed and 35 more were wounded in a powerful roadside blast in Quetta on Monday. The blast took place at Aalmo Chowk when a convoy of FC vehicles was passing.
As reported on May 14, air raids by the Military Forces of Pakistan in Ali Sherzai area of eastern Kurram Agency killed 9 militants, injured 5 and destroyed 3 hideouts.

Shelling by the security forces in central Kurram Agency killed 13 militants of banned outfits and destroyed three hideouts. The gunship choppers targeted militants' positions in Kot area near Pak-Afghan border.

A man sustained injuries when an improvised explosive device (IED) exploded on Monday. According to police, the blast occurred near Refugee camp on Shin Dand Road. The motive behind the attack was unknown.
Nine militants were killed when a mortar shell hit their hideout in Upper Orakzai Agency on Tuesday. The shell hit the militant position at Jang Baz Killi in Mamozai.
Three people were wounded, on Tuesday, when six rockets fell at Hayatabad in Peshawar. According to police, unknown militants fired six rockets in Hayatabad Phase VI.
A hand grenade attack by unidentified men in Karachi of Sindh killed one civilian and injured 10 others on May 16.
In Kurram Agency, 12 militants were killed and several injured when security forces pounded their hideouts with artillery and helicopter gunships in Kanzaki Kandao area.
At least four persons including two police personnel were injured in an explosion in Goth Ghulam Muhammad area of Nasirabad district on Wendesday.
One man was killed while two sustained critical injuries in bomb explosion on Thursday in the area of Scheme chowk Badhber. According to the police, the bomb exploded in a mechanic's shop.

Unidentified militants blew up the building of government degree college for women in Jamrud tehsil of Khyber Agency by detonating powerful bomb with a remote control device. No casualty was reported.
A person was injured in a hand grenade attack in coastal town of Pasni on Saturday. Police said that unknown armed men hurled a hand grenade on some people in Pasni bazaar.

According to police, unknown armed men planted a bomb with the boundary wall of government boys primary school located in Kalu Khan area of Swabi which exploded on Sunday. No loss of life was reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On May 23rd, a missile fired from a US drone at Dande Darpa Khel area in Miranshah tehsil in N.Waziristan killed at least 2 TTP-linked militants - as many as 5 drones were reported above at the time of the strike.

As reported on May 23, during air raids by the Military Forces of Pakistan in the Mamozai, Sama Bazaar and Manzar Taap areas of Orakzai of FATA, 12 militants were killed, 4 hideouts destroyed and several other militants injured.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: At least 10 suspected TTP militants were killed and several others injured when a US drone fired missiles on a mosque in North Waziristan, tribal area bordering Afghanistan, on Thursday.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: At least 10 people died when a missile struck a building and a mosque on May 24th in Khushkali in Mir Ali tehsil of N.Waziristan. Among the dead, at least 4 were civilians.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: Drone strikes suspected by the US killed 10 mostly Uzbek militants on May 24 in Khassokhel near Mir Ali in North Waziristan Agency of FATA.
At least nine people were injured in an incident of hand grenade attack when unidentified armed men targeted a roadside restaurant located on Jamsheed Road number 3 on late Friday night.
A child was critically injured and the house of a prominent tribal leader was destroyed in a bomb blast in the Bara area on Friday.The bomb was planted in a car and detonated in front of the house.
At least five people have been injured in a bomb blast took place on Qandhari bazaar road, on Saturday night. Unknown men had planted explosive material near Manan Chowk.

Unidentified armed men fired two rockets from Sariab locality of Quetta. One of the rockets landed at a shoe shop on crowded Kandahari Bazaar while the second rocket landed in Basti Panchayat (Christian Colony) at Kasi Road of Quetta. At least 2 people were killed and over 20 others wounded.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On May 26th, a US drone targeted a bakery in Miranshah bazaar in N.Waziristan, where 3 Arab fighters had entered to buy bread. Following the attack, TTP were reported to be clearing the rubble and it soon became clear that a senior Al Qaeda commander was killed in the attack. At least 3 died and two injured

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: Drone strikes by the US killed 4 militants on May 26 near Miranshah in North Waziristan Agency of FATA.

A security personnel died and five others sustained injuries in a remote control bomb blast at Rashakai area of district Nowshera on Sunday. A convey of security forces was on its way to Nowshera from Swat, when it reached Sherin Koto area on main Mardan-Nowshera road, a remote control bomb planted by unidentified armed men exploded.
A bomb attack targeting a police van on May 27 in Quetta, Balochistan killed 3 People and injured 6 others.

Unidentified militants blew up a high power transmission line in Yousufabad area of Bajaur Agency on the night between Saturday and Sunday as a result electricity remained completely suspended to the whole region.
A car-bomb in the suburbs of Chaman in Killa Abdullah of Balochistan on May 28 injured several people and destroyed houses nearby. The number of fatalities is unknown.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On May 28, two suspected militants and their driver were killed when a US drone hit a vehicle in Pai hel area of Data Khel in N.Waziristan.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
ACTOR2: AQIS: Al Qaeda in the Indian Subcontinent
NOTES: On May 28, two missiles hit AL Qaeda targets in Khushkali village in Mir Ali tehsil in N.Waziristan - the second attack in the village that week. At least 4 Al Qaeda militants died when the missile hit a pickup truck on the road, and a house was also damaged, injuring three children and a woman.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: Drone strikes by the US killed 4 militants on May 28 in the Datta Khel district of North Waziristan Agency in FATA.
In Mohmand Agency, militants blew up a government boy's primary school in Qayumabad Lakaro area of Safi tehsil. However, no loss of life was reported.

As reported on May 29, airstrikes by the Military Forces of Pakistan in the Mamozai, Jandarkhel and Sama Bazar areas of Orakzai Agency in FATA have killed 10 militants and destroyed 3 militant hideouts.
Six people, two of them women, were killed and two others injured when military planes attacked militant positions in Tirah valley of Khyber Agency on Tuesday.
As reported on May 29, airstrikes by the Military Forces of Pakistan in the Tirah valley area of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa 5 militants were killed.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 2 drone strikes in Mir Ali and Dattakhel killed 12 suspected TTP militants.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 2 drone strikes in Mir Ali and Dattakhel killed 12 suspected TTP militants.

A Frontier Corps check-post in Kohlu area came under rocket attack, injuring a security man. The post and a vehicle were partially damaged in the attack. United Baloch Army claimed responsibility of the attack.
Unidentified militants blew up a school for girls in Galandary village of Mardan district on the night between Wednesday and Thursday. No loss of life was reported.
A superintendent of police sustained injuries in roadside blast near Sairu Badakhel on Bannu-Dera Ismail Khan Road on Friday.
Three people were injured in Hangu Bazaar on Friday after an improvised explosive device and mortar shells placed in a handcart exploded. The blast partially damaged two shops and a bank.

A low intensity Improvised Explosive Device (IED) exploded on main Mardan road on Friday. However, no casualty was reported. The device was planted on road side and police mobile van was the target.TTP was suspected as being behind the attack.

A girls' school was partially damaged in a blast in Shabqadar tehsil of Charsadda district on Friday. The explosive device planted by suspected militants at the Government Girls Primary School went off at night destroyign the boundary wall of the school.

At least eight militants were killed and three were injured in a military operation on Friday during helicopter shelling by the security forces inMela of upper Orakzai. Three militant hideouts were also destroyed.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A second strike took place in S. Waziristan on June 2nd, when a US drone fired a missile at the Ghowa Khowa area close to Wana in South Waziristan. 4 militants were reportedly killed

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On June 2, two militants were killed when two US drone missiles hit their motorbike in Kari Kot village, 5 km east of Wana city in S Waziristan. Both militants were members of Mullah Nazir's group, a group close to the Taliban.

Four persons were killed and two others sustained injuries when an artillery shell accidentally hit a house of a tribesman in Mamozai area in upper Orakzai Agency. Forces had been targetting the hideouts of the militants in Mir Qalamkhel village.

Unidentified armed men blew up a high power transmission line in Khar area on Saturday in Bajaur Agency. Explosives were planted near the transmission tower that caused a blackout when the explosibes went off.

On 2 June, in Kurram Agency, a tribesman was killed when he stepped on a landmine on Saturday. Locals said that the landmine was planted at a dirt track. The tribesman was killed on the spot when he stepped on the landmine.

Military planes targeted militant positions in Dwa Thoe area of Tirah valley in Khyber Agency, killing 23 militants. Two hideouts were also destroyed in the air attacks carried out early in the morning.

At least two persons have been injured in a hand grenade attack in Dalbandin, the district headquarters of Chagai district on Saturday evening, when unknown men hurled a hand grenade at a house in Killi Baz Muhammad area.

A blast occurred in the Suhbatpur area of Jaffarabad. No loss of life or property was reported. Police said that minutes after a OGDC vehicle passed by the Sim Nala area, explosive device planted along the road side by unknown men exploded.

The houses of a former parliamentarian and a policeman were targeted with bombs in Ghaznikhel and Jabukhel villages of Lakki Marwat district on Saturday. The boundary walls of the two houses were partly damagedbut there was no loss of life.

The houses of a former parliamentarian and a policeman were targeted with bombs in Ghaznikhel and Jabukhel villages of Lakki Marwat district on Saturday. The boundary walls of the two houses were partly damagedbut there was no loss of life.

A convoy of security forces, on way from Tank to South Waziristan tribal region, hit a landmine planted by suspected TTP militants near Kharkai post. One security man received injuries and a vehicle was partially damaged in the attack.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On June 3, in Birmal tehsil of N.Waziristan, Taliban militants were hit by a US drone strike while they attended the funeral prayers of a senior TTP commander. 1 fatality reported.
An Afghan refugee, Ajmeer Khan, was killed when he stepped on a land mine in Shaheedano Dhand in Lower Kurram Agency.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 10 suspected TTP militants were killed in a US drone strike on the Mana Raghza area in SWA.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: One civilian was killed and three others including two important militant commanders of Maulvi Nazir Group sustained critical injuries in Landaiwarai area of South Waziristan Agency (SWA) when US drones targeted a vehicle and locals during rescue activity on Sunday morning.

A minor girl was killed and two others sustained injuries in a hand-grenade attack in Kach Banda early Monday. Unidentified gunmen hurled a hand-grenade into the house of Farid Khan. The motive behind the attack was not known.

A man was killed and seven others, including three lawmen, sustained injuries in a remote-controlled bomb blast in Panjgour town near Iran border, about 500km south of Quetta. Unidentified armed men had fitted an explosive device to a motorbike parked in front of a private bank in Chatkan Bazaar and security personnel were the main target as they were in the bank when the blast occurred.
On last Sunday suspected militants targeted Government Boys Primary School in Ghala Dahar village in the limits of Sheikh Malton Town (SMT) police station.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
ACTOR2: AQIS: Al Qaeda in the Indian Subcontinent
NOTES: On June 4, a US drone strike killed Al Qaedas second in command. A first strike killed at least 4 people, and a follow up strike during the rescuing of those injured in the original strike, killed a further 10 (it was during second strike that Al-Qaeda's 2nd in command was killed. Amnesty's research found that of the 14 killed, at least 4 were civilians.

At least 14 members of the Akakhel Amn Lashkar sustained injuries when the fighters of the militant group Lashkar-e-Islam hurled hand-grenades and explosives at their office in Abdul Khwar area of Bara tehsil in Khyber Agency late Monday night.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: At least four drone missiles were fired in the attack on a house located in Ghwa Khwa area of Wana where four people lost their lives in the assault and two others sustained injuries.

Militants fired seven rockets at the house of Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) leader Khyal Zaman Orakzai in Zargari village causing partial damage to the house, on Tuesday. No casualty was reported in the incident.

Militants blew up the government-run school for boys in Mera Kheshgi on Tuesday. The sources said the militants had planted explosives in a water cooler and placed it inside the Government Middle School Sher Afzal Korona in Mera Kheshgi that went off and destroyed two rooms. No casualty was reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone strike targeted a house firing four missiles in Mir Ali area of North Waziristan Agency in the early hours of Monday. In the latest drone attack, the first missile struck the compound in Hesokhel before dawn, killing three militants. A second missile then killed 12 more militants who had arrived at the scene.
A hand grenade was lobbed at the Risala police station late on Wednesday night in which four people, including three police constables, were injured.
In Kalanga locality of Akkakhel, 2 people were injured when shells hit their houses.
Four children received injuries when an explosive device, planted by unidentified persons, went off in Thang Khatta village of Bajaur tribal region on Thursday.

On June 7, the house of Balochistan Constabulary (BC) man was attacked with a hand grenade in Quetta city (Balochistan). According to police, unidentified people lobbed hand grenade at the house of BC personnel Abdul Faheem located on Samungli Road of Quetta. The grenade went off but no loss of life occurred.
Unknown armed men hurled a hand grenade at the house of a police constable in Smuggli Housing Scheme on Smuggli road on Thursday night. However, no loss of life was reported.

A police check post was partially damaged in an explosion in the jurisdiction of Garhi Kapura police station on Thursday late night. The sources said that explosive device planted by the militants in the building of police check post of Mohib Banda village went of at night, causing partial damage to the boundary wall. However, no casualty was reported.
An IED bomb attack outside a seminary in Satellite Town area on Sariab Link road in Quetta, Balochistan killed at least 14 people and injured more than 40 on June 7.
A remote controlled bomb targeting a government employees' bus at Charsadda Road in Peshawar killed 21 people and hurt 42 others including some passersby on Friday.
Six persons, including two policemen, were injured when unknown militants targetted a police van with an improvised explosive device (IED) on the Grand Trunk (GT) Road, on Friday.
Electricity supply to parts of Balochistan was suspended after militants blew up three power pylons in Dashat area of Mastung district late on Sunday night.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: JUI: Jamaat Ulema-e-Islam
NOTES: A blast partially damaged a tubewell owned by a lawmaker of Jamiat Ulema-i-Islam on late Friday night. Officials said that a power transformer and a room of the tubewell got damaged when an explosive device went off in Kherukhel Pakka area of the district.

Unidentified militants blew up a government primary school for boys in Khat Kallay near Sheik Maltoon Town in broad daylight on Sunday. Police said that two classrooms of the school were destroyed completely in the explosion. No casualty was reported.

Three persons including a senior member of the Zakhakhel Amn lashkar were killed while six others were injured in two subsequent bomb blasts targeting two vehicles in Mastak area of Tirah Valley in Khyber Agency on Monday. The Zakhakhel tribesmen believed the peace lashkar was the target of the two explosions carried out by their rival militant group Lashkar-e-Islam (LI). The LI, however, did not claim the responsibility for the blast.

Two militants were killed in a bomb blast in a village of Tirah valley in Khyber Agency on Monday. An explosive device planted along the road went off when Alif Khan, local leader of a militant group Tawheedul Islam, reached there to inspect the site of the blast. Alif Khan was killed on the spot while four of his bodyguards received injuries in the second blast. One of the injured identified as Umar Khan succumbed to his injuries in a private clinic.

At least two men, including a commander for a religious militant group,Umer Afridi, were killed while two children were wounded as remote-controlled car bombs ripped through the Tirah valley in Khyber tribal region on Monday. The bomb targeted a pickup truck on the borders of Khyber's Landi Kotal and Bara districts.
Two men were injured when a bomb exploded at a gambling den in Malagori on Monday.

Suspected militants blew up Government High School (GHS) Babuzi Katlang, Three classrooms, offices and veranda got totally destroyed in the incident while the school building got partially damaged in this incident. Sources said two watchmen got seriously injured.
Suspected militants also targeted power transmission tower in Gahri Kapura police station limits, as a result the tower got damaged.

Suspected militants targeted a house of a person named Ameer Rehman located at Dahri Likpani village in the limits of Katlang Police Station. Four other houses also got partially damaged in this incident.

Unknown militants destroyed three shops and a tubewell in Darra Adamkhel on Tuesday. Owner of one shop, Gul Hassan Afridi, had been warned by militants to stop informing security forces about their activities. However no loss of life was reported.
Suspected militants targeted a house of a person in the limits of Lund Khwar police station, as a result one person got injured.

A low intensity blast occurred in the outskirts of the district in Badhber on Tuesday however, no casualty was reported. The blast occurred near the car of former peace committee member, Fahim, but he was not in the car.
An explosion near a passenger bus en route from Mastung to Noshki killed at least 6 and wounded 50 passengers.
Suspected militants target police post of Mohib Banda located in a private building in the limits of Ghari Kapura police station. The wall of the police post got partially damaged in the blast.
Suspected militants targeted a Government Community Girl Primary School in the limits of Saddar police station in Noweshera, as a result office, two rooms and veranda of the school got damaged.
Suspected militants targeted police mobile in the limits of Rustam police station, ASI, driver and three constables got seriously injured in this incident while the mobile van got damaged.
Millitants fired 11 rocket shells at Jawakai area in the Frontier Region (FR) Kohat, on Wednesday. However, no loss of life was reported in the incident.
At least five people suffered injuries when a hand grenade was lobbed at a gambling den late on Wednesday night, situated in Landhi's Muslim Colony.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On June 13, 4 militants were killed when a US drone missile hit their vehicle in the evening in the village of Isha in Miranshah tehsil in N.Waziristan.

Unknown armed men blew up a primary boys school in Kohat. Explosives planted in the Boys school in Shah Pur area of Kohat went off, damaging the exterior of the school and completely destroying two rooms. No loss of life was reported.

Unknown armed men planted improvised explosive device (IED) at the main gate of the hujra (guesthouse) of former MPA Syed Hameed Shah at the Miranshah road, some 5km from Bannu city, destroying the gate of the hujra. However, no casualties were reported.
Nine militants were killed and eight others sustained injuries when the jetfighters shelled the hideouts in Mamozai area in Orakzai Agency on Thursday.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On June 14, a US drone fired a missile and killed one local TTP commander while he was sleeping near Miranshah bazaar in North Waziristan. Only one died, despite initial reports of multiple deaths.

Unidentified militants, on Friday, blew up two electricity pylons with an IED in Maund area of district Kohlu. As a result, the pylons were destroyed and power supply to all surrounding areas was suspended.

Two rockets were fired from an unidentified location in Quetta. One rocket fell near General Musa College in Gulistan town while the other in an open ground near grid station. No loss of life was reported. Spokesperson of banned organization, United Baloch Army claimed responsibility of the attack.
A remote-controlled bomb attack on a police mobile killed seven people including four policemen, as they were patrolling Dhoda Road. At least 10 policemen were injured in the attack.
A car-bomb explosion in the bazaar in Landi Kotal, Khyber Agency of FATA killed 26 people and injured more than 50 on June 16.
At least 27 people were killed when unidentified persons had parked an explosives-laden pickup truck at Ranghar Bazaar, Charbagh Road. The vehicle of Zekha Khel tribe was the main target.
Seven militants were killed and several of their hideouts destroyed in bombing by aircraft in NWA.
An explosion took place when a buss of Balochistan IT University was travelling through Samangali. The blast killed 3 students and injured over 50 others on Monday.
A rocket was fired from an unknown location. No casualty has been reported after rocket landed near Mingora police station on Monday.
An explosion in Sariab road in Quetta of Balochistan on June 18 injured 4 people.

The niece of provincial minister and two security guards were critically injured in remote control bomb blast, which was fixed in the car by militants. The blast resulted complete destruction of one house.

A bomb exploded near a police van in Lower Dir district, however no one was injured in the targeted attack. SHO Hazrat Hussain along with two constables was on routine patrolling when a remote control bomb exploded in Zamdar area.
Three persons were killed and two others sustained injuries when unknown persons fired mortar shells on tribesmen moving from the Mamozai area in Orakzai Agency to safer places.
Two people were killed and 15 injured in a blast occurred outside a Jamia Masjid in the Gausabad area of Quetta.
Suspected militants blew up two high power transmission towers at Surizai Mera area in the limits of Badhber police station.
A bomb explosion attached to a donkey cart killed 3 Sufi Muslims and injured 21 in Peshawar of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa on June 21.

Three people including a child were killed in a landmine blast in the city suburban area of Sohbatpur on Thursday. According to details, some unidentified militants planted a landmine in the border area of Dera Bugti and exploded when a bike hit it.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2008-2013)
NOTES: On 21 June 2012, 10 militants were killed and 3 injured when jetfighters pounded Sharqi and Janata areas of the tribal region.
As reported on June 21, air raids by the Military Forces of Pakistan in South Waziristan Agency of FATA killed 11 suspected TTP militants.
A Pakistan Army officer was killed and six other soldiers sustained injuries in a roadside blast near Bazay Mountain in Ladha tehsil of South Waziristan.
Three people of Bugti family died as a result of a landmine blast, near Tangwani village of Kandhkot-Kashmore district.
Two levies personnel were killed and two injured after a mortar shell fired from an unidentified direction hit Kharasha checkpost in Khawezai tehsil of Mohmand Agency on Friday.
Militants blew up a bridge on a canal in Malikdinkhel area of Bara tehsil. The destruction of the bridge suspended water supply to Nala and Miangano Kali.
A bomb was planted outside a general store and after the explosion, some shops and a workshop of power transformers were burnt down on Ring Road Chowk. No loss of human life was reported.

Militants destroyed a power pylon by firing rockets on it in limits of the Badhber police station. Earlier on Thursday, suspected militants blew up two high power transmission towers in Surizai Mera area of Badhber.
Millitants blew up a Government Girls High School in Kohat. Explosives were planted in two rooms that destroyed the whole building. However, No loss of lives has been reported.
At least 3 people were killed and 21 others injured in the blast that occurred in Hazar Khwani area. The explosive material was planted in a donkey-cart outside the shrine.

The house of a former political official in Ekkaghund tehsil of Mohmand Agency was partially damaged when a device was planted by unidentified militants near the house of Zabita Khan. No casualty was reported in the blast.
Security forces' camp in Miranshah was targeted with two missiles by militants. No causalities were reported in the attack.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: At least 5 militants were killed and three were wounded, belonging to Haqqani network, in an American drone attack in North Waziristan on Tuesday.

A woman was killed while about a dozen people including two policemen wounded when unidentified armed men threw hand grenade on a police party in Dalmia locality of Aziz Bhatti Police Station on Wednesday.

A passenger bus, escorted by a police van, carrying 40 pilgrims was on its way from Pak-Iran border Taftan to Quetta. When it reached in Hazar Gunji area of Quetta, it was targeted by powerful bomb that killed 13 and injured 30 people.

Two volunteers of the Zakhakhel Amn Lashkar were killed in a roadside explosion in Sheenkamar area of Bara bordering with Tirah valley on Thursday. They were travelling on a motorbike and hit a landmine.
As many as 8 security personnel were killed and 3 received injuries as their vehicle was targeted with a remote control explosive device in Al-Haj market in Bara Tehsil of Khyber Agency on Thursday.

On 28 June, at least eight people were killed while thirty others sustained injuries in a bomb exploded near passenger bus in Hazar Ganji area of the provincial capital. No group claimed responsibility of the attack but it was suspected that TTP was behind the attack.
At least seven people were killed and twenty injured after an explosion at the railway station in Sibi town of Balochistan province.
The FC personnel were searching vehicles near Mach bridge on National Highway, when a landmine exploded. As a result, five FC officials sustained injuries.
Six FC personnel were wounded in Behlol Basti area of Musakhel when their vehicle hit a landmine that had been planted by unidentified armed men.

Militants had planted explosive devices in a girls' school situated in Mata Shah area of Salarzai Tehsil which exploded on early Friday morning and badly damaged the school building. No casualties was reported in the incident.
4 civilians were killed & others were injured in two blasts in the border area of Upper Dir by militants.
Unidntified militantsblew up another school in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Dara village of Swabi. The bomb was planted and detonated.

Tension prevailed in Bin Qasim area after a locally made bomb exploded at the railway track near Bin Qasim Town police station in Karachi. Unidentified persons planted the locally made bomb. Hand written slips confirmed that the Sindhu Desh Liberation Front had claimed the responsibility of the blast.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: Air strikes by the Military Forces of the US on July 1 in the Dre Nishter village of North Waziristan Agency, FATA killed 8 militants of the Hafiz Gul Bahadur Group and ETIM.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On July 1, a US drone fired a missile in the Shawal tehsil of N.Waziristan, killing 6 militants. The militants were linked to both Hafiz Gul Bahadur group and the Islamic Movement of Turkmenistan.
BRA militants blew up an eight-inch-diameter gas pipeline in the Pirkoh area of Dera Bugti.
A man was injured in a landmine explosion in the Chamalang area of Balochistan planted by unidentified men.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2008-2013); PML-N: Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz
NOTES: Punjab Chief Minister Shahbaz Sharif's chief security officer was injured by a blast attack at his house on July 5 in Lahore, Punjab.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On July 6, after a 6 month diplomatic standoff with the US, the US fired a missile from a drone that killed at least 19 people, many of them civilians. The militants were thought to be from Hafiz Gul group. Took place in Maizer area of Data Khel tehsil in N. Waziristan.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On 6 July 2012, at least 24 villagers were killed and 10 injured in a drone strike by US forces at Gorwaik village of Datta Khel area (North Waziristan Agency, FATA).
One police man was killed and three others were injured when a remote control improvised explosive device (IED) exploded near a police mobile van in Achani Chowk, Peshawar.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On August 24, this was the first in a series of strikes were hit in the Shawal tehsil in N.Waziristan killing at least 13 people, although the number may be as high as 22 with 14 more injured. In total, 6 missiles were launched by 5 drones coordinated with each other, with each missile hitting targets a few kilometers away minutes apart from each other. This strike took place in Makai village in Shawal tehsil, where the leader of the East Turkistan Islamic Movement was killed along with 3 other high profile Turkistanis. The casualties also included 2 TTP militants, bringing the fatalities count to 6.

NOTES: On January 6, 5 missiles hit a target killed between 8 and 18 militants in Babar Ghar village in Sararogha tehsil of S.Waziristan. The militants were all affiliated with TTP.
