During a door-to-door investigation of a hand grenade attack, another unidentified armed group threw a hand grenade at a police van. The type of attack is suggestive of TTP involvement.
Two men riding a motorbike threw a hand grenade outside the home of police constable. No one was injured or killed, and police responded with a door-to-door search operation.
Jet fighters carried out airstrikes against militant hideouts in Bara tehsil. No casualties reported.
Two security personnel were killed in an IED explosion near the Pak-Afghanistan border.TTP claimed responsibility for the attack, which injured one other.
An engineer was killed and three other injured in a bomb explosion on Sariab Road.
A tribal elder attending a jirga escaped a remote-controlled bomb explosion unhurt in Kasai area of Mohmand district.
3 missiles from an unknown source hit Bannu Cantt. No casualties reported.
An unidentified armed group planted a remote-control bomb at Sariab road, detonating it when law enforcement vehicles were passing through. There were no fatalities.
On 8 January, four people were killed and 30 injured when a TTP bike bomb went off in Karachi near a MQM rally.
A militant linked to Tauheedul Islam (Aman Lashkar) was killed in an IED explosion
An IED explosion killed a member of a peacekeeping committee in Landi Kotal, injuring another volunteer.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
SOURCE: Right Vision News; Express Tribune (Pakistan); Daily Times (Pakistan)
NOTES: Two US drone strikes occurred within hours of each other in Haider Khel area, killing at least 4 suspected TTP militants.
On 8 Jan, a volunteer for Tauheedul Islam (Aman Lashkar) was killed and another injured in a bomb blast in Landi Kotal (Kyber, FATA).

Unidentified militants fitted an explosive device to an electricity pylon at Raisani Road, near a government official's personal residence. A passerby was injured when the device went off, but no one was killed.
Unidentified militants threw hand grenades at police forces during a mass arrest of Afghan nationals at Baraki Camp in Swabi. No casualties were reported.
Several people were injured in an explosion in Swabi Bazaar in Peshawar.
A hand grenade was hurled at Panjgur Election Commission Office by unknown attackers. The explosion damaged the building, but no casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On January 10 in Khushkali area of Mir Ali tehsil in N/Waziristan, 6 militants died after 2 missiles fired from a US drone killed 4 in a house and then a further two missiles struck a nearby motorbike. Several more were reported injured, and militants from an unknown group were reported to have collected the bodies.

A remote explosive was detonated in a crowded market in Quetta, killing at least 12, including both security forces personnel and civilians, and injuring 27. The bomb was planted under a Frontier Corps vehicle. UBA claimed responsibility.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Civilians (Pakistan); Journalists (Pakistan); Aid Workers (Pakistan); UN: United Nations
SOURCE: Aid Worker Security Database; Daily Times (Pakistan); Right Vision News; BBC News
NOTES: At least 92 people were killed and more than 120 injured in twin blasts in Quetta city. The first was a suicide bombing at a snooker club on the basement of a building followed by the explosion of a remote controlled IED bomb attached on a car (coded separately PAK15603) outside the building as police, media persons and rescuers were rushing to the site. In the two incident 9 policemen, 25 rescue workers and 3 journalists were killed. One UN employee was killed in the suicide attack. LeJ is suspected of having carried out the attacks in retaliation for the recent killing of a Sunni cleric. (Fatality count divided into two events.)

SOURCE: Aid Worker Security Database; Right Vision News; BBC News; Daily Times (Pakistan)
NOTES: At least 92 people were killed and more than 120 injured in twin blasts in Quetta city. The first was a suicide bombing at a snooker club (coded separately PAK15602) on the basement of a building followed by a remote controlled IED bomb attached on a car outside the building as police, media persons and rescuers were rushing to the site. In the two incident 9 policemen, 25 rescue workers, 3 journalists were killed. LeJ is suspected of having carried out the attacks in retaliation for the recent killing of a Sunni cleric. (Fatality count divided into two events.)

On 10 January 2013, 30 members of the Tablighi Jamaat were killed and more than 70 injured in a suicide blast by an unidentified group inside the Tablighi Markaz on Takhta Band Road in Mingora town (Swat, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa). 31 fatalities coded, including the bomber.
On 13 January 2013, 14 personnel of military forces were killed and at least 21 injured in an IED explosion by unidentified assailants in Dosali village (North Waziristan, FATA).
Ansar-ul-Mujahideen claimed responsibility for an IED attack in North Waziristan that killed 17 Pakistani soldiers.
Three police personnel were injured when a bomb blast occurred in Chaman police line.
Unidentified militants attacked a police vehicle with a remote controlled bomb and killed 4 police in Pangjur.
More than 10 people were injured when a powerful bomb exploded near a police mobile van on Sibbi Road in Quetta.
At least four suspected militants were killed and four others injured in shelling by Pakistan Army's gunship helicopters in Mir Ali area of the North Waziristan.
A school girl was injured when unidentified militants detonated a school and basic health unit in Landkhwar area of Mardan. [women targeted: girls]
Unknown actors blew up a CD shop at Chowki Mamraiz in Nowshera. No casualties were reported.
A girl's school in Landkhwar area of Mardan was destroyed by a bomb detonation. No injuries or fatalities were reported.
A person has sustained serious injuries when a tractor-trolley hit a land mine near Shahpur of Tehsil Chhatr.
Two brothers were killed in a land mine explosion near Khameesa Khan Bugti Village in Balochistan.
Three houses, including that of an employee of Peshawar High Court, were partly damaged in a bomb blast in Peshawar. No casualties were reported.
Unidentified persons detonated a remote controlled bomb, destroying a cellular tower in Landkhwar.
Unidentified militants detonated a remote-control bomb in a girls' primary school in Badabair suburb of Peshawar. The school was partiall destroyed but no casualties were reported.
Five volunteers of a peace militia were injured in an IED explosion in Shalobar area of Bara Tehsil.
An unidentified militant group detonated a bomb planted close to an electricity transmission pole near Swabi Grid Station. No casualties were reported.
At least two personnel of Pakistan army were killed and nine others were injured their vehicle hit landmine in Dozai area of Mohmand Agency.
In Merikhel village in Bara, a government high school was partially destroyed by an explosive planted by a group of militants. No casualties were reported.
An IED laid by suspected TTP militants on the road from spinwam to Mir Ali detonated, injuring four soldiers and damaging a military vehicle.
Four members of the Tall Scouts frontier troops were injured when an IED exploded on the Spinwam road outside Miranshah.
After receiving threats from suspected TTP militants, explosive devices planted under two school buses near Chota Lahore were detonated. However, no casualty was reported.
Unidentified militants blew up a cell phone tower in Safi tehsil of Mohmad Agency, disrupting cell service for several hours. No casualties were reported.
Two bombs in the Landi area of Karachi killed three police officials and injured three others.
Unidentified militants blew up a school in Batgram.

Five mortars were fired at Frontier Corps headquarters in a residential district of Peshawar, although no casualties were reported. The mortars seemed to come from Shalobar area of Bara, fired by sustected LeI militants.
On January 23, no casualties were reported in a grenade attack on a house in Hangu (Khyber Pakhtunkhwa).

A timed bomb went off near the venue of Awami National Party's rally in Charsadda. Unidentified militants planted two remote-controlled bombs there on the anniversary of the death of an ANP leader in the city. Though the bombs were detonated, no casualties were reported.
According to Pakistani officials at least seven mortar shells were fired from the Afghan soil and landed in the border area of Ghulam Khan in North Waziristan Agency. No casualties were reported.

Three children were injured when four mortar rounds were fired from Khyber Agency hit the residential neighbourhood of Hayatabad, the second such incident in two days. Police allege that Lashkar-e-Islam is responsible.
One person was killed while two sustained injuries in a hand grenade attack in the Manghopir area of Karachi. Two other grenade attacks also occurred in Karachi, although there was no loss of life.
At least four people, including a deputy superintendent of police and a sub-inspector, were killed and 13 others injured in twin blasts at Rehri Road in Sherpao Colony of Karachi.

At least four people, including a deputy superintendent of police and two policemen, were killed in an improvised explosive device blast in Karachi. A second explosion injured 19 people, but no fatalities were reported.
A watchman was killed and two guards were injured when an explosive device went off outside the residence of a local industrialist at Par Hoti area of Mardan
Levies officials said that a motorcycle struck with a landmine in Talimat area of Dera Bugti District. As a result, one member of a peace militia was killed and several others injured.
Five people died when a mortar shell hit a house in Bagh area of Tirah.
A missile fired by unknown assailants on a house in Bagh area of Jamrud Tehsil killed eight people.
At least five civilians were reported killed when a mortar fell on a compound in the Tirah region of Jamrud. At least 10 people were injured.
A bomb planted near a hujra detonated in Khuga Khel area of Landi Kotal, injuring one.
In Khyber Agency, militants blew up a government school in Bara, planting a quantity of explosives in a government high school.

Unknown militants blasted a 132-KV electricity supply line in Sarokali area, suspending electricity supply to some 25 villages of Mohmand Agency. A landmine fitted on the other side of the road was detected and defused.
A roadside bomb, apparently planted to target a convoy of the security forces on Kohat-Hangu road, went off without causing any casualty or damage in the Utmankhel area of Orakzai Agency.
A bomb exploded in Chaman; however, no causality was reported. According to local police, the bomb was planted on a bicycle near old NADRA office in the city.
In Swabi, the hostel of a private educational institution was damaged in a blast. The institution is owned by former provincial president of Pakistan Tehrik-i-Insaf Asad Qaisar.
A bomb planted in bag on roadside of Peshawar-Islamabad motorway near Marhati Banda area in Nowshera went off. No casualties were reported.

Thirteen militants were allegedly killed and 16 injured when military planes attacked their hideouts in Mamozai area of Orakzai tribal agency. Reports from the TTP suggest that no militants were killed.
A police post was damaged in a blast on the outskirts of Peshawar. No casualties were reported after the bomb, which was planted beside the wall of the post, went off.
Explosives buried outside a house detonated in Kohat, with no casualties reported. The planted material was affixed outside the house of former mayor of Tapi area.
Unknown militants attacked a Bam Khel police check-post with a hand grenade. However, no causality was reported.
As many as four persons were injured in a bomb explosion at Acheeni village outside of Peshawar near Ring Road. The IED was planted by unknown militants.

About 23 militants were killed and many other injured during a targeted operation in Khyber Agency. A number of holdouts were attacked by security forces, resulting in the deaths of 23 and injuries of other LI and TTP adherents in Nakai.
At least one person was killed, while three others injured in a blast in Peshawar. According to initial reports, the blast occurred near Sarband police check post, where an IED had been planted.

About 23 militants were killed and many other injured during a targeted operation in Khyber Agency. A number of holdouts were attacked by security forces, resulting in the deaths of 23 and injuries of other LI and TTP adherents in Dawato, Bara Gate, and Wocha Wona.

Three persons were killed while several others injured in a bomb blast near Indus Plaza in the vicinity of Sohrab Goth in Karachi. A police official said bomb was planted in a motorbike, parked outside a vacant building. He said rescue workers have collected parts of human bodies from the scene.

At least 14 militants were killed and nine others sustained injuries when fighter planes pounded their hideouts in Orakzai Agency. Backed by security forces, jet fighter planes targeted the suspected TTP militant positions at Hasanzai and Arblan area in the lower tehsil of Orakzai Agency
The Pakistani air force carried out air strikes against suspected TTP hideouts in Khyber Agency in Dwa Toi area. Three hideouts of the militants were destroyed and 12 were killed
Army jets shot at militants in Hangu. Eight militants were killed and two sustained severe injuries while two hideouts were also destroyed.
Six members of a family were killed when a mortar fell on a house in Tirah valley of Khyber Agency. A stray mortar fired from an undisclosed location hit a in Sponrhai area of Kukikhel.
A Kalat District Police Officer and his staff escaped unhurt in rocket attack while on routine patrol in Sang Das area.
A remote bomb blast targeting a police van on Jinnah Park road near Peshawar's Jinnah Park injured at least nine persons.Nine vehicles, including the targeted police van, were damaged in the blast.

SOURCE: Aid Worker Security Database; Pakistan Today
NOTES: On 31 January, two aid workers on polio vaccination team were killed in a roadside blast in Khurram Agency. According to details, a roadside bomb went off in Mani Khel area in Upper Kurram tehsil (Kurram Agency, FATA).

10 more militants were killed and several others sustained injuries when fighter planes pounded their hideouts in Orakzai Agency. Backed by security forces, jet fighter planes targeted the suspected TTP militant positions at Arghanjo and Sarkani of Momozai in upper parts of ORakzai Agency.

At least 26 people were killed and several others sustained injuries when a suspected TTP suicide bomber blew himself up immediately after the Friday prayers outside a Shia mosque called Faizullah mosque located in Pat Bazaar of Hangu.

On February 1, unidentified armed men planted an explosive at the Institute of Arabic and Islamic Studies at the University of Peshawar in Peshawar city (Peshawar, KP), injuring two people and damaged the building.
An explosive device fitted to a timer and planted by a road went off in Shinwari Town in Paharipura area of Peshawar shortly after a police patrol van passed by.
Security forces pounded the suspected hideouts of the militants in the suburbs of Dabori with artillery shelling. Official sources claimed that eight militants were killed in the shelling.
A suicide bomber belonging to TTP blew himself up while hiding inside a house in Serai Naurang, Lakki Marwat killing 10 people.
A cross border attack from Afghanistan into South Waziristan Agency killed at least six people when mortal shells were fired into Pakistani territory.
A house was destroyed in a low intensity bomb blast in Hangu district, no group claimed responsibility.
Unknown armed men placed explosives near a shop situated on Tall-Hangu road, which exploded destroyed the shop completely.
An officer of the Awami National Party was attacked with a hand grenade by unidentified assailants in Landhi, Karachi.

A roadside bomb exploded in the Hawkes Bay area of Karachi. No casualties were reported in the incident. According to police, the attackers were trying to target the SHO Mauripur. The planted bomb detonated before time.

A man was injured in multiple grenade attacks outside Pakistan Air Force Base located on Shara-e-Faisal in Karachi. According to the eyewitnesses unknown attackers hurled at least five grenades at the Faisal flyover gate of the PAF base and fled.

At least 5 mortar shells were fired from the Afghanistan on Wednesday which landed in the border area of Ghulam Khan in North Waziristan Agency. There were no casualties and security sources confirmed the shelling by unidentified people believed to be Afghan security personnel.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: Three militants were killed when an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) fired missiles on a militant compound in Bandigar, Ghulam Khan tehsil in North Waziristan on Wednesday.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: At least five suspected TTP militants were killed after six drone missiles hit a house in Spinwam tehsil of North Waziristan. While many reports stated 5 TTP militants were killed, some reports stated that amongst the 5 dead were 2 civilian casualties
Pakistani fighter jets attacked militant hideouts in Mamozai, Orakzai Agency on Wednesday, killing eight militants.

At least 15 suspected militants were killed and several others wounded when jet fighters shelled their hideouts in upper Orakzai Agency on Thursday. Sources said that fighter planes pounded the hideouts of militants in Mir Kalam Khel, Jandari areas of Mamozai.

At least two policemen were killed and seven injured in a planted bomb blast in Karachi on Thursday. Explosives were planted near the Mominabad Police station and went off as a police vehicle passed through.
A bomb blast caused by an IED injured a man in Quetta on Thursday.
Unidentified armed men attacked a local leader of the Jamiat Ulema-e-Islam-Fazl in a bomb attack on his car on Friday in Mirdad Khel, Landi Kotal.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
ACTOR2: AQIS: Al Qaeda in the Indian Subcontinent
NOTES: On February 8, a US drone fired a missile in the Babar Ghar area of Sararogha tehsil in S. Waziristan (close to N. Waziristan border). At least 6 militants died, including 2 senior commanders, and some reports suggested the other militants were affiliated with TTP.
Unknown militants suspected to be TTP remote detonated a bomb killing at least 8 people and injuring dozens on Friday in Kalaya. It appears they were attacking at anti-Taliban gathering.
At least 13 suspected militants were killed and several others injured as jet fighters targeted militant hideouts in upper Orakzai agency's Mamozai area on Saturday.
Fighter jets pounded militant trenches in the remote Bazaar Zakha Khel areas of Landi Kotal subdivision of Khyber Agency, killing eight militants on Saturday.
Fighter jets continued to bombard militant hideouts in Upper Orakzai Agency on Saturday, killing at least 15 members of Tehreek-e-Taliban.
An IED explosion the Quetta left one dead and at least three injured on Saturday.
A grenade attack by unidentified armed men on Peshawar police on Sunday left four officers wounded in Peshawar.

An explosion caused by planted explosives damaged a shrine in Badaber, Peshawar on Sunday.
A sub-station in Karachi of the Sui Southern Gas Company (SSGC) was damaged when an IED explosion took place on Monday. Police most likely suspect TTP.
An explosive device exploded at Government Post Graduate College, Mardan on Tuesday causing no injuries.
A man was killed in Kohat when an IED went off on Tuesday.
A second bomb blast occurred when a roadside bomb went out in Hassan Zai Bazaar is Orakzai Agency killing at least 4 people.
A roadside bomb struck the bus in the village of Hassanzo in Orakzai Agency as it was on its way to Kohat killing at least seven members of a peace lashkar and wounding 13 others on Thursday.

At least seven people including three Frontier Constabulary (FC) personnel were killed Thursday when a suicide bomber rammed an explosive-laden vehicle into a security check-post in Hangu district of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa.
A suicide attacker attempted to target the convoy of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Chief Minister Ameer Haider Hoti near College Chowk in Mardan on Friday. Two people were injured.
84 people were killed and 200 wounded when a powerful bomb exploded in a market in a Shia populated neighborhood Quetta. LeJ claimed responsibility for the attack.
4 soldiers were wounded in a remote control bomb attack in Razmak.
10 militants were killed and 4 others injured when their hideouts in Mamozai were bombarded with fighter jets.
A NATO container was damaged by a planted road side explosive device in Jamrud, Khyber Agency.
1 person was killed and 5 others injured in a bomb blast targeting a religious rally in Jacobabad.
6 militants were killed when Pakistani jet planes targeted 3 militant hideouts in Tirah Valley.
29 militants were killed when Pakistani jet planes targeted a militant hideout in Upper Orakzai.
2 people were injured in a grenade attack by an unidentified armed group targeting an MQM office in Karachi.
3 Levies forces personnel were injured in a remote control bomb attack on the convoy of a tehsildar in Dhadar.

1 person was killed and 10 others were injured in a bomb blast at an electronics market in Peshawar.
An ANP leader survived a hand grenade attack by an unidentified armed group on his house in Karachi.
5 militants were killed in Tirah Valley when their hideouts were bombed by Pakistani aircraft.
4 people were killed and 12 others injured in a bomb blast at a shrine in a village in Shikarpur.
On February 26, unidentified men threw hand grenades at an MQM office in Karachi city (Sindh). No injuries were reported.
On February 27, an unidentified armed group threw hand grenades at a police station in Karachi city (Sindh). No loss of life or damage was reported.
5 militants were killed in Khyber Agency when their hideouts were bombed by Pakistani aircraft.
2 people were injured when their motorcycle struck a landmine in Dera Bugti.
7 LeI militants were killed when Pakistan Air Force jets targeted them in Tirah Valley.
A child was killed and another injured when jet planes bombarded their house during an operation targeting militants in Tirah.
2 security forces personnel and a Zakakhel Communal Militia man were injured in an IED explosion near an area of Bara under siege by LeI militants.
45 people were killed in an IED explosion by an unidentified armed group targeting the Shia community in Karachi.
A polio vaccination team volunteer was injured in a bomb blast targeting a vaccination center in Jamrud.
A security guard was injured in a remote controlled explosion at the gate of a Hujra in Jamrud.
5 soldiers were injured in an IED explosion targeting their vehicle in Bannu.
An explosive device planted at the house of a former police officer was detonated in Nowshera, causing no loss of life.
8 militants were killed by Pakistan fighter jets in Orakzai Agency.
3 children were injured when a concealed explosive device detonated in a market in Pabbi.
3 militants were killed by Pakistani fighter jets in Tirah Valley.

NOTES: A US drone strike killed a suspected Al-Qaeda militant in a village near Miranshah.
An unidentified armed group planted explosives at a CD shop in Bannu. The shop was destroyed but there were no reports of casualties or loss of life.
5 people were killed and 29 injured in Peshawar when a bomb planted in a Barelvi mosque was detonated.

2 people were injured in Lower Kurram when a planted bomb exploded by the road side.

5 Frontier Work Organization employees were injured in a planted bomb expolsion on a road in Ghulam Khan.
Militants blew up 4 CD shops in Peshawar and left a pamphlet warning of more attacks. The shops were destroyed but no casualties or loss of life occurred.
46 TTP militants were killed by 2 AI suicide attackers at a TTP controlled AI headquarter in Tirah Valley.
A remote controlled explosives device targeting a Levis office was detonated in Chaman causing no casualties or loss of life.

An MQM affiliated KESC official was killed in an explosion in Karachi. The remote controlled explosive device was planted under his car.
2 girls were injured when a missile fired by an unidentified armed group struck their house in Wana.

6 people were killed when a bomb planted on a motorcycle was detonated at a busy market in Dera Allahyar.
1 civilian was injured in an IED attack targeting a police vehicle in Kuchlak.

NOTES: On March 21, a US drone hit a vehicle as they were travelling through Data Khel bazaar just before midnight. 3 militants were killed, although it wasn't clear who they were affiliated with.

NOTES: On 21 March, 12 people including 2 local NGO workers were killed and more than 20 injured in an VBIED explosion at a World Food Programme distribution point in Jalozai IDP camp (largest camp for Afghans refugees in Pakistan) in Jallozai town (Nowshera, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa).
9 soldiers were killed when a suicide bomber drove his vehicle into a military checkpost in Miranshah. 9 other wounded soldiers died in the hospital as a result of their wounds.
A former MPA's house was damaged by an explosive device planted outside the house in Shabqadar. This was the second attack on the house during the month. No casualties were reported.
2 soldiers were injured in a remote controlled explosion in Mamond.
A local revenue official was injured in a road side bomb explosion in Peshawar.
2 people were injured in an explosion outside a firearms shop in Peshawar.
A explosion occurred at the house of a PPP leader in Peshawar. No casualties were reported.

2 people were injured in an explosion in Karachi.
4 soldiers were injured in a remote controlled explosives attack targeting their convoy in Lower Kurram.
12 militants were killed in Mamozai when security forces targeted them with jet planes.

NOTES: 12 people were killed and 14 injured when a suicide bomber targeted a frontier constabulary convoy in Peshawar.
5 police officials were injured when a remote controlled bomb targeting their vehicle was detonated in Besham.
A general store was blown up by militants in Hangu. No casualties occurred.
A women's rights NGO in Peshawar was targeted with a powerful explosive device. No casualties occurred.

2 people were killed and 6 injured in a remote controlled explosion targeting an ANP leader in Bannu. The ANP leader survived the attack with injuries. TTP claimed responsibility for the attack.

1 person was killed and 3 others injured when militants fired mortar shells at an FC building in Peshawar.

Rockets fired by an unidentified armed group targeting the Peshawar airport landed in various other locations injuring a girl.

9 people were killed in Peshawar when a bus planted on the roof of a passenger bus was detonated.

3 security forces personnel were killed in a suicide attack on their checkpost in North Waziristan.

2 children and a woman were killed in Buner when they unknowingly handled an explosive device they had found in a field.

2 police officers were wounded when unidentified men on a motorcycle threw hand grenades outside a police station in Quetta.
13 people were injured in a remote controlled bomb blast near a hospital in Quetta.
3 people were injured in a remote controlled bomb blast targeting the house of a PPP candidate in Peshawar.
5 people were killed and 13 injured when a car bomb planted outside an MQM office was detonated in Karachi. TTP claimed responsibility for the attack.
4 people were injured when a tractor collided with a roadside bomb in Parachinar.
11 people were killed in a planted bomb attack on an ANP election meeting in Karachi. TTP claimed responsibility for the attack.
A customs post was destroyed in an explosion by an unidentified armed group in Chaman. Nobody was present at the check post during the time of the explosion.
4 people were injured when suspected militants threw hand grenades at a JI election office in Sibi.
A remote control bomb targeting an election office in Miranshah was detonated at night causing no casualties or loss of life.
2 people were killed and 15 injured when a planted explosive device was detonated near a PPP meeting in Karachi.
3 people were killed in a bomb blast targeting a PPP election meeting in Karachi.
1 child was killed and several people were injured in a road side explosion in Quetta.
5 people were killed and 22 wounded in a bomb attack targeting an ANP election office in Kohat.
3 people were killed and 19 injured in a bomb blast targeting an ANP election office in Peshawar.
A child was killed and 5 people were wounded in a remote controlled bomb blast targeting an ANP rally in Swabi.
1 person was wounded when an explosive device attached to a bike was detonated in Hyderabad.
8 people were killed and 45 injured when a suicide bomber drove his motorcycle into a bus in Peshawar. A local city administration official was the target of the attack.
10 people were killed and 30 injured in a suicide bombing targeting the convoy of the commissioner of Peshawar.
1 person was killed and 12 injured in a bomb blast targeting an ANP election office in Charsadda.
A bomb targeting the house of an ANP leader in Katlang was detonated causing damage to buildings. No casualties were reported.
3 people were injured when a suicide bomber targeting an ANP office in Charsadda was shot at by party workers. The bomber prematurely detonated himself before reaching his target.
10 people were killed and 55 injured in a bomb blast targeting an ANP meeting in Karachi.
2 people were injured in a suicide attack on the convoy of an NPP candidate in Shikarpur.
5 PML-N workers were injured in a hand grenade attack on their party office in Quetta.
On 1 May 2013, the convoy of an independent candidate was targeted with a car bomb in Nasirabad. No casualties or loss of life were reported.
4 JUI-F workers were injured when militants fired rockets at an election rally in Harnai.
On 1 May 2013, 3 people were injured in a bomb attack targeting the convoy of an independent candidate in Dera Murad Jamali.
4 militants were killed in an air strike by Pakistani forces in Upper Orakzai.
An unidentified armed group blew up 2 schools designated as polling stations in Chattar.
Militants fired rockets and bullets at the house of a BNP candidate in Khuzdar. The candidate was not home at the time and no casualties or were reported.
9 people were injured in a bomb blast targeting an MQM office in Karachi.
5 FC personnel were injured in a roadside bomb blast targeting their convoy in Turbat.
3 people were killed and 27 injured in a bomb attack on an MQM election office in Karachi. TTP claimed responsibility for the attack.
A child was injured when an unidentified armed group attacked a PPP candidates office in Hub with hand grenades.
A JI candidates vehicle was targeted with an IED explosion in Lower Orakzai. He was unhurt.
A PTI office in Peshawar was attacked with a timed explosive device. No one was present in the office during the attack.
8 militants were killed in airstrikes by Pakistani military aircraft in Upper Orakzai.
2 people were injured when militants attacked a JI election office in Quetta with hand grenades.
2 soldiers were killed and 3 injured when their vehicle was targeted with a remote controlled bomb planted by TTP militants in Razmak.
16 people were killed and 50 injured in a bomb blast at a JUI-F rally in an area of Kurram Agency.
3 people were injured when a PTI meeting in Mardan was attacked with hand grenades.
5 people were injured when militants attacked a PML-N office in Kharan with hand grenades.
5 people were injured when militants attacked an NP office in Mach with hand grenades.
3 designated polling stations in Barkhan were destroyed by an unidentified armed group using remote explosives.
A PPP candidate was attacked with hand grenades at his election office in Shabqadar. He remained unhurt in the attack with one other person at the office being hurt.
On 6 May 2013, 23 people were killed and more than 70 injured in an explosion carried out by unidentified assailants at JUI-F rally in Sewak village of Kurram Agency, (FATA).
5 people were killed in a bomb blast targeting a PPP meeting in Babagam.
10 people were killed in a bomb blast targeting a JUI-F rally in Doaba.
2 police personnel were killed in a hand grenade attack by militants in Peshawar.
2 people were killed and 11 injured in an IED explosion at a market in Hangu.
18 people were injured in a bomb blast in Karachi.
2 people were killed and 1 injured in a bomb blast targeting an ANP office in Bajaur Agency.
On 8 May 2013, an independent candidate was targeted in Jamrud with a roadside explosive device. He survived the attack unharmed.
9 militants were killed in heavy artillery fire by Pakistani security forces in Mamozai.
14 people were injured in a grenade attack by an unidentified armed group in Quetta.
2 people were killed and 23 injured when a suicide bomber drove his vehicle into a police station in Bannu.
4 policemen and 2 civilians were injured in a hand grenade attack on a police vehicle in Dera Ismail Khan.
Non-violent activity: On May 8, an unidentified armed group threw grenades at a designated polling station in Nushki (Balochistan).
On 9 May 2013, 1 person was killed and 3 injured in an explosion in North Waziristan targeting an independent candidate and displaced South Waziristan voters.
The election office of an independent candidate in Peshawar was destroyed with explosives planted by militants.
A bomb targeting the house of a JUI-F leader was detonated in Bannu. No casualties were reported.
1 person was injured in an explosion targeting an ANP office in Peshawar.
5 people were killed in an IED explosion targeting a police van in Torghar.
4 people were killed and 21 injured in an explosion near election offices in Miranshah.
On 10 May 2013, 5 people were injured in a bomb attack targeting the house of an independent candidate in Dera Allahyar.
On 10 May 2013, 5 people were injured in a bomb blast targeting the house of an independent candidate in Naseerabad.
Militants blew up 3 polling stations in Dera Bugti.
Militants fired rockets at 2 polling stations in Panjgur.
5 people were injured in a bomb blast targeting a PPP election office in Quetta.
The election office of an independent candidate was bombed in Jani Khel. No casualties were reported.
8 people were injured in an explosion targeting a women's polling station in Peshawar.
2 ANP leaders were killed in a hand grenade attack in Swabi.
2 people were injured in a bomb explosion targeting a polling station in Mastung.
Several people were injured in a bomb blast near a polling station in Kuchlak.
9 people were injured in an explosion targeting a police convoy in Peshawar.
A boy was killed in an explosion targeting a polling station in Peshawar.
5 people were injured in a bomb blast near a polling station in Karachi.
11 people were killed and 30 injured in a bomb blast targeting an ANP candidate in Karachi. TTP claimed responsibility for the attack.
2 rangers personnel were killed when a suicide bomber drove his motorcycle into their checkpost in Karachi.
5 people were killed when a bus returning from a polling station in Dera Murad Jamali struck a landmine.
14 people were killed in a bomb blast targeting an election rally in Naseerabad.
An unidentified armed group fired rockets into Quetta causing damage to property and an explosion at a private TV channel office resulting in casualties.
19 people were killed in a suspected suicide bombing on a passenger van in Mirali.
1 person was killed and a child was injured when a rocket fired by an unidentified armed group struck their house in Wazir Dand.
On May 14, unidentified armed men a threw hand grenade at Naunehal Public School at Orangi Town in Karachi (Karachi City, Sindh), creating panic in the area.
1 person was killed in a planted bomb explosion at an ammunition shop in Mirali.
10 people were killed and 20 injured in bomb blasts at 2 mosques in an area of Malakand.
2 people were injured in a remote controlled bomb explosion targeting the house of a tribal elder in Dera Allahyar.
On 20 May, several people were injured when the house of an ANP leader was attacked by an unidentified armed group with hand grenades in Karachi city (Sindh).
6 people were injured in a bomb blast at a mobile store in Peshawar.
A soldier was killed and 5 others injured in a remote controlled bomb explosion in Dargai.
12 people were killed and 20 injured in a remote controlled explosion targeting a Balochistan Constabulary truck in Quetta.
3 people were killed and 2 injured in a bomb blast near a mosque in Peshawar.
2 security forces personnel were injured in a hand grenade attack on their vehicle by an unidentified armed group in Tump.
A man was injured when militants fired mortar shells at a police station in Darra Adamkhel.
3 policemen were injured in a remote controlled bomb attack on their vehicle in Sahibabad.
On 25 May 2013, 3 militants were killed in a Pakistani airstrike in Tirah Valley.
4 security forces personnel were killed and 6 injured in a remote controlled bomb attack on their convoy in Bannu.
5 police officers were killed in a bomb blast targeting their vehicle in Puran.
2 people were killed and 16 injured in a bomb blast targeting an imambargah (Shia mosque) in Peshawar.
1 person was killed and 5 injured in a remote controlled bomb explosion targeting a peace committee elder in Swat.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AQIS: Al Qaeda in the Indian Subcontinent
NOTES: On May 29th, a US drone strike killed 3 militants including second-in-command of the TTP. The strike hit a village called Chashma, a few kilometers east of Miranshah, the main town of N.Waziristan.
3 policemen were injured in a hand grenade attack by an unidentified armed group on a police station in Karachi.
On 30 May 2013, at least 18 suspected TTP militants were killed and several injured when military jets bombed their hideouts in Tabay area of Central Kurram subdivision in Kurram Agency (FATA).
A child was killed and 5 people injured when their vehicle struck a landmine in Loti.
Four Bomb Disposal Squad (BDS) officials were injured when a bomb exploded at a police station in Kashmore on Friday.
A man, Najeem Khan, was killed when a powerful bomb exploded at Badaber area in the outskirts of Peshawar on Friday. Police said the bomb was a time device meant to create fear in the area.
An explosive device planted to the building of government girls primary school in Miryan village, damaging two rooms, however, no loss of life was reported.
On May 31, a low-intensity blast caused by hand grenades occurred outside of the house of Jamiat Ulema-e-Islam-Fazl (JUI-F) leader Jafar Shah, in Bannu (Khyber Pakhtunkhwa). No casualty was reported.
A member of the Maso Khel Aman Lashkar was killed in a remote controlled bomb attack in Peshawar.

On 2 June 2013, two security personnel, were injured in a remote controlled Improvised Explosive Device (IED) attack in North Waziristan. Security forces' vehicle was targeted near the Esha check post.

On 3 June 2013, two security personnel were killed and two others injured in a bomb attack on a vehicle of Frontier Corps in Ispelengi area of Mastung district on Monday. The banned United Baloch Army group claimed responsibility for of attack.

On 3 June 2013, a suicide bomber rammed his explosives-laden car into a security checkpost in Razmak area of North Waziristan, leaving two security personnel injured. The bomber hit a wall of the Dam Del checkpost. Most soldiers escaped unhurt as they were sitting inside a nearby bunker because of rain.

Militants planted bomb outside the house of Nawaz Khan Bugti located in the area of Dera Murad Jamali near Mir khan Bugti. When it went off the boundary wall of the house was fully destroyed. However, no causality was reported.
Suspected militants blew up the Government High School for boys in Sra Dargai, Kandao area of Frontier Region (FR) Peshawar, where a military operation was underway.
Two policemen were killed and as many injured in a remote controlled bomb attack on a patrolling police party in Peshawar's Daudzai Police Station jurisdiction on Thursday.
Drones fired by a US drone killed seven suspected militants and injured three others in North Waziristan on Friday.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On June 7, US drones fired missiles at a house in Shawal tehsil of S.Waziristan. At least 7 militants were killed, all from TTP.

The building of a private bank was partially damaged on Saturday morning when unidentified people blew up a power generator on the premises. Police said the blast was caused by the setting off of an improvised explosive device.
Two soldiers were wounded in a second bomb attack on a military convoy 20 kilometers east of Miranshah.
On 9 June, 2 persons were killed and 16 injured in a hand grenade attack in Lyari area in Karachi (Sindh).

Three soldiers were killed and four wounded in bomb attacks on military convoys in North Waziristan on Sunday. A military convoy comprising of 35 vehicles was on its way to the northwestern town of Bannu from Razmak when an improvised explosive device planted along the roadside went off.
Unidentified men blew up a government primary school for girls in Sar Dheri area on Sunday morning. No loss of life was reported.
Seven security personnel sustained injuries in a remote controlled bomb attack, in Kalat. Sources said that a convoy of security forces was passing through Juhan area of Kalat when the bomb went off.

Three people were killed and two cars were burned in a rocket attack on Nato containers in Jamrud tehsil, Khyber Agency, on Monday. The drivers of the containers were killed as militants set the containers on fire and engaged in battlet with the security forces.
An army officer, Lieutenant Colonel Sajid, was killed in village Gulbai in Khyber Agency by an Improvised Explosive Device on Wednesday.
On June 14, two hand grenades exploded near Ittehad Chowk area of Baldia town in Karachi (Sindh). No loss of life was reported.
On 15 June, 3 rockets were fired from an unknown location in Ziarat, Balochistan, killing a policeman and causing fire at Quaid-e-Azam Residency.

On June 15, two suicide attackers and gunmen of unknown affiliation attacked the Bolan Medical Clinic in Quetta city (Quetta, Balochistan); those injured during the first attack on the campus of Sardar Bahaddur Khan Women's University were receiving treatment, killing 11 more people and wounding 17.

On June 15, members of Lashkare-Jhangvi placed a bomb on a bus carrying university students, which exploded on the campus of Sardar Bahaddur Khan Women's University in Quetta (Quetta, Balochistan), killing at least 14 people and wounding at least another 19. Several girls suffered burn injuries when the bus caught fire.
A female student died and 22 were injured in a bomb blast. The bomb was planted in a bus at the parking lot of Sardar Bahadur Khan Women's University just as students were heading home after school.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Pakistan Rangers
NOTES: On 16 June, unknown armed men riding a motorbike lobbed a hand grenade on Manghopir Road in Karachi city at a Rangers check post.

On 16 June, a policeman was killed and at least 8 people were injured in a blast that occurred when a rescue operation was being carried out in response to an earlier hand grenade attack on the Rangers check post in Karachi city.
In Peshawar, the house of the former MPA of Awami National Party, Alamgir Khalil, was partially damaged when bomb went off in front of its main gate on Tuesday. No one was hurt.
A man was injured in a landmine blast occurred in Sohbat Pur area of Jaffarabad. Police said that Owais Ahmed suffered serious injuries in the explosion.

At least 28 people were killed and 20 others wounded in bomb blast which targeted a funeral prayer in Mardan. Member of KPK provincial assembly Imran Mehmand, belonging to PTI, was killed in the blast and was the target.
At least four people including two law-enforcers were injured when unidentified persons attacked Gulbahar police station with a hand grenade on Wednesday evening.

In Nowshera, unidentified militants fired four rockets at Pakistan Tobacco Company's factory in Akora Khattak. Police said that the rockets landed on the premises of the factory and destroyed the boundary wall. It could not be ascertained whether the target was the factory or the nearby Akora Khattak police station.
A woman sustained injured when a grenade was hurled at a house in Pasni Tehsil of Gwadar district. The motive behind the attack was not known.

A suicide bomber blew himself up in Gulshan Colony, Peshawar, killing 14 and leaving 32 injured, on Friday. The Hussaini Madrassa in the area was the target of the blast. The interior of the madrassa was destroyed.

On 22 June, a man was killed and at least eight people, including policemen, were injured in a grenade blast at a park located in Bilal Colony of Orangi (Karachi, Sindh). Unidentified armed men hurled the grenade in the park causing panic.
Unidentified armed men threw two hand grenades inside the central jail building, injuring at least 4 prisoners. The building was partially damaged. The motive was not known.
A member of a local peace committee was killed and another injured in a blast near Pakistan-Afghanistan border area of Chamarkand tehsil of Bajaur Agency on Saturday.

Five militants were killed in shelling by fighter planes in Akkakhel area of Darra Adamkhel on Saturday. Security forces had received information that some militants were trying to cross into Darra Adamkhel.
Four policemen, including an ASI, were injured in a hand grenade blast in Peshawar on Sheikh Muhammadi Road in the jurisdiction of Budhbir Police Station on Saturday.

A blast occurred at Qambrani Road in Quetta targeting a police mobile. According to Superintendent of Police (SP) Saryiab, an improvised explosive device (IED) fixed along the road targeted the police patrolling van. However, there were no casualties.

One security officer was killed, while two others sustained injuries in an attack in Bannu, on Sunday. A convoy of security forces was patrolling the area when the bomb went off near one of the vehicles and destroyed it.
A passenger vehicle struck a landmine and exploded, injuring nine persons.

Nine people were killed and several injured, on Wednesday, when an explosion occurred near Karachi's Burns Road area, targeting the convoy of Sindh High Court judge Justice Maqbool Baqar. TTP claimed responsibility for the attack.

At least one Frontier Corps official was killed and other three injured by a bomb blast in Awaran district of Balochistan on Wednesday. The convoy was on routine patrol in the Mashkay area of the district and was targetted by a remote controlled bomb.
On 27 June, a local Amn Committee leader and two others were killed when their car was targeted through a remote-controlled bomb in Bannu (KP).
Some unidentified militants blew up a vacated Checkpost of Khasdar Forces in Khyber agency on Friday while no causalities were reported.

At least three policemen including a Station House Officer (SHO) were injured when a bomb exploded near their vehicle on Saturday. Their vehicle was targeted with a remote-controlled IED near a graveyard in front of Government Degree College Shewa.
At least one person was killed and four more were injured in a rocket attack on a house located in Chief Minister Sindh, Syed Qaim Ali Shah's hometown, Khairpur, on Saturday morning.
Suspected TTP militants targeted a police convoy near Badaber police station in Peshawar. The blast killed 17 people and injured 46+ others.

At least 28 people were killed and 65 injured in an explosion that took place in Hazara Town, a Shia concentrated area, Quetta on Sunday. Lashkar-e-Jhangi claimed responsibility for the attack, saying that the first attack was a suicide blast while the second was carried out by a remote-controlled device.

A suspected LeJ militant killed at least 31 people and injured 65 others in Hazara Town on Sunday. Most of the deceased belonged to the Hazara Shia community. The militant detonated his suicide bomb vest as he was stopped at a security checkpost.

Four Aman Lashkar volunteers were killed and 15 others injured when an explosive device hit their vehicle. The volunteers were responding to a rocket attack by suspected TTP militants when the explosion occurred. The incident took place in Wana as the Aman Laskhar volunteers were chasing a group of suspected TTP militants.
At least four security officials were killed while 16 others were injured in a remote-controlled blast that targeted a security forces convoy in Miranshah tehsil, North Waziristan Agency on Sunday.
On 30 June, four people were injured in a hand grenade attack in Orangi Town (Karachi, Sindh). One of them was in a critical state. The motive was not known.

A land mine blast killed a tribesman and injured three others in Upper Kurram. Suspected TTP militants had previously planted the device in the area. The explosion occurred when the victims car ran over the land mine.
A hand grenade explosion caused five civilian injuries in Lyari area of Karachi. The perpetrator remains unidentified.

A bomb explosion in Landi Kotal claimed the life of an Aman Tanzeem volunteer. The volunteer was stationed at a checkpost when the explosion took place. TTP militants are suspected to have planted the explosive device.
Unidentified militants planted a bomb outside the residence of a PPP lawmaker in Jacobabad. The explosion injured four children. There was no reported damage to the property.
A suspected TTP militant carried out a suicide bomb attack in Quetta which claimed 28 lives.
Suspected Afghani Taliban militants fired mortar shells across the Afghanistan border to target a security checkpost in Mamund tehsil of Bajaur Agency. The incident resulted in four injuries.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On July 3, US drones launched missiles against TTP and Haqqani network militants in the most deadly drone strike to date in 2013. At least 16 militants were killed, and took place in Dande Darpe Khel in Miranshah tehsil in N.Waziristan
Suspected TTP militants planted an explosive device in Chota Lahore. The device exploded causing panic in the area. No injuries were reported.
Three children were killed when a landmine exploded in Thul of Jacobabad. The children were allegedly playing with the device when it is exploded. It remains unknown whom planted the device.
Suspected TTP militants destroyed a property in Swabi when a bomb exploded on Wednesday. No injuries were reported.

A suspected TTP militant targeted a security checkpost in Dattakhel through a suicide bomb attack. Pakistan's military forces attempted to stop the militant in his vehicle before he detonated his device. The incident resulted in four security personnel being killed alongside the TTP militant.

Suspected TTP militants blew up a girls school in Wana tehsil of South Waziristan. Militants had planted explosive devices within the school building. The explosion caused serious damage to the building but caused no casualties.
An suicide bomb attack left eleven dead and injured 19 others in Chaman. A suspected TTP militant was targeting a vehicle of Afghan's border forces when he blew himself up.
A house of a local businessman was damaged when TTP militants planted explosives. There were no reported injuries.

Suspected TTP militants targeted a property belonging to a Levies Force personnel. A group of militants entered the property and blew it up with explosives. Significant damage was reported, but no less of life or injuries were reported. The Levies Force personnel appeared absent from the property.
Suspected Afghani Taliban militants fired mortar shells across the Afghanistan border into Angur Ada village. The incident resulted in five civilian injuries and seven fatalities.
Suspected TTP militants blew up a property in Aka Khel on Saturday. The incident destroyed the property but caused no loss of life or injuries. The motive behind the attack remains unknown.
A bomb planted by unidentified militants exploded killing three civilians and injuring 37 others. The explosive device was planted near Lahore's Anarkali area.
Suspected TTP militants planted explosives in a Government Girls Primary School in Bannu. The blast caused damage to the property, but no injuries were reported.
A suspected TTP militant suicide bomber drove his motorcycle into the vehicle of a tribal elder. The ensuing blast killed nine civilians and injured ten others.
Suspected TTP militants attack a police post in Swabi on Monday night. The militants attacked the post with hand grenades. No loss of life or injuries were reported.
A suspected TTP suicide bomber killed 7 civilians and injured 10 others in Hangu. The suicide bomber was targeting a vacant car owned by a peace committee chief.
Unidentified militants fired four rockets at an event for the restoration of peace. The incident resulted in several injuries. No group has yet claimed responsibility.

PAC's office was targeted in Lyari by an armed group led by Ghaffar Zikri. The group fired rifle grenades at the office injuring 21 civilians passing-by. The motive behind the attack is linked to the occupation of Ghaffar Zikri's property a few years earlier.
Unidentified militants fired two rockets in Panjgur. The militants were targeting a security checkpost but missed. No damage or loss of life was reported.

The Chief Security Office (CSO) of President Asif Ali Zardari was killed along with two others when a suicide bomb blast hit their vehicle. An unidentified bomber detonated his bomb when the CSO exited his vehicle. Eleven others were injured in the incident including 5 police personnel.
Suspected TTP militants planted an explosive device in a hand cart in Chaman. The explosion killed an FC personnel and two civilians alongside injuring six others.
Suspected TTP militants killed three and injured four others when a high intensity IED exploded outside a mosque in Kohat. The IED was planted in a motorcycle.
Two bomb blasts occurred at a railway track in Hussainabad. No group claimed responsibility for the incident. No injuries were reported.
A bomb explosion damaged an SSP office in Hyderabad on Friday. No group claimed responsibility. No injuries were reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On July 13, at least 2 ETIM militants were killed when a US drone missile hit a motorbike in Musaki village in Dos Ali tehsil of N.Waziristan.
Unidentified militants planted a bomb outside the residence of a retired police personnel. The explosion caused no loss of life.
Pakistan's military carried out airstrikes on TTP militant hideouts in Bara. The incident killed ten militants and injured five others.
A drone strike by Pakistan's military forces left 7 suspected TTP militants dead.
Suspected Baloch Separatists planted explosives on a gas pipeline in Mach area on Tuesday. The explosion caused moderate damage to the property, but no loss of life or injuries.

Pakistan's military forces carried out a military offensive in Baron area of South Waziristan. The military used gunship helicopters to destroy several suspected TTP militant hideouts and compounds in the area. The incident resulted in five militant fatalities and several injuries.
Suspected TTP militants planted an IED outside a property on Kohat Road in Peshawar. The explosion caused minor damage to the property, but no loss of life or injuries.

Suspected TTP militants targeted the vehicle of a tribal elder with an IED in Mamund tehsil. The explosion killed three passengers and seriously injured two others. The motive behind the attack remains unclear.
Suspected TTP militants planted a bomb at the main gate of a petrol pump in Omari Village. The explosion caused moderate damage and injured a security guard.
Suspected TTP militants planted explosives on a passenger bus travelling in Peshawar. The explosion caused moderate damage, but resulted in no loss of life or injuries.

Suspected Baloch Separatists attacked four electricity pylons in Mach of Bolan. The incident completely destroyed one of the towers as well as partially damaging the other three. No loss of life or injuries were reported.
Two Frontier Corps (FC) personnel were killed when they hit an IED planted at the roadside. TTP militants are the key suspects.
Suspected TTP militants planted explosive materials outside a government girls school in Bannu. The explosion caused moderate damage. No loss or life or injuries were reported.
A bomb blast in Karachi injured one and killed another. Municipal Commissioner Matanat Ali and his guard were travelling in their vehicle when it hit a roadside bomb.
Suspected Baloch Separatists planted an explosive device outside a warehouse in Chaman on Sunday. The remote-controlled device exploded causing damage but no loss of life or injuries.
Suspected TTP militants threw a hand grenade at a residential property in Paracha Town of Kohat district. The blast caused moderate damage to the property and injured three civilians.
Suspected TTP militants planted explosives outside a mosque in Afghan Colony on Monday. The blast caused moderate damage to the building but caused no casualties or injuries.
A suspected TTP suicide bomber killed 2 civilian and injured 10 others in Chaman on Monday. The suicide bomber blew himself up near Pakistan's custom office on the Pakistan-Afghanistan border.
Suspected TTP planted an explosive device outside a residential home in Peshawar. The blast caused moderate damage to the property, but no loss of life or injuries were reported.
Suspected Baloch Separatists blew up four electricity towers belonging to Quetta Electric Supply Company (QESCO) in Bibi Nani (Quetta).
A QESCO worker was killed by a land mine explosion when they were carrying out repair work on four electricity towers destroyed by suspected Baloch Separatists.
Suspected TTP militants planted multiple remote-controlled bombs in motorbikes and parked them in multiple areas of Parachinar. The explosions killed 57 civilians and injured around 100 others.
An IED explosion killed two and injured six others as their vehicle hit the device in Lower Kurram. Suspected TTP militants planted the explosive device at the side of Sherko Road.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
ACTOR2: AQIS: Al Qaeda in the Indian Subcontinent
NOTES: On July 28, at least 5 militants died when a US drone strike fired a missile at a house in Shawal valley in Shawal tehsil of N.Waziristan. The fatalities were said to be affiliated with AL Qaeda, and had recently travelled from Afghanistan to set up a training camp.
A roadside bomb killed one person and injured two others when their vehicle hit the device in Upper Kurram. Suspected TTP militants planted the device.
Four police personnel were injured when their police convoy hit an explosive device in Yakatut (Peshawar). TTP militants are suspected to have planted the device.
An IED explosion injured two security personnel as their vehicle hit the device in Wazir Bagh (Peshawar). Suspected TTP militants planted the explosive device at the side of the road.
Suspected Baloch Separatists planted an explosive device near a railway track in Musa Colony (Quetta). The explosion caused moderate damage.

TTP militants launched an attack against a jail in Dera Ismail Khan on Monday. Using rockets, grenades and heavy artillery fire, the militants attacked the premises enabling dozens of prisoners to escape. Five police personnel and a civilian were killed.
Suspected Baloch Separatists planted an explosive device outside a school in Kohlu. The blast caused moderate damage to the buildings, but no loss of life or injuries were reported.

A blast occurred in Azizabad area of the city, it took place in Block-8 area of Azizabad in a parked vehicle.No casualty was reported from the blast site.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
Suspected TTP militants planted an explosive device inside the NATO Supply Warehouse in Peshawar. The blast killed two and injured two others.

A bomb blast killed seven people and wounded 26 others, mostly including teenage boys, in Lyari neighborhood of the city after a football match, the bomb was planted on a motorbike that was parked outside the stadium.
Two soldiers were injured in a huge explosion a few yards away from the Manghopir Police Station. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
On August 2, unidentified armed men hurled a hand grenade at Hujra of President of ANP, in Landi Kotal (Khyber Agency, FATA). No casualty was reported.
Unidentified persons blew up a girls school in Rashakai area in Khar, headquarters of Bajaur Agency, it destroyed the building.No one was injured.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

A policeman was killed while two others were injured in a suicide blast in Katling Bazaar of the city, the attack occurred when police was on routine patrolling.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
A woman and child were injured in two bomb blasts in Daman Kahol area in Chaman town. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Unidentified persons planted an explosive device at the main gate of the residence of the principal and owner of a private school in Nasratzai in Shabqadar area.No loss of life was reported in the explosion.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Five persons were killed and more than two dozen others injured due to an explosion in a bogie.The explosion occurred near Chatiana Station of Toba Tek Singh district in Karachi bound Shalimar Express. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Militants blasted two power transmission towers in Mach district of Balochistan.It has damaged the pylons due to which there is shortage of 100 MW of electricity which was to be supplied to parts of the southwestern province. No group has claimed responsibility.

Militants blasted two power transmission towers in Sibi district of Balochistan.It has damaged the pylons due to which there is shortage of 100 MW of electricity which was to be supplied to parts of the southwestern province. No group has claimed responsibility.

Four militants sustained injuries in an explosion in Tor Chapper area in Darra Adamkhel. A group of militants headed by Omar Afridi s group planted an improvised explosive device in a hideout of Tariq Afridi's group,the explosion took place when Tariq Afridi s group entered the hideout.

An explosive device planted by unidentified persons beside the sweet shop in the main bazaar of Darra Pezu went off. However, it caused no loss of life but partially damaged the shop.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

On August 6, a hand grenade was lobbed into the house of a senator from Khyber Agency in Hayatabad. There was no casualties. Slight damage was reported in the house. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
In Bajaur Agency, a pro-government tribal elder and close relative of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa governor escaped unhurt when a remote-controlled bomb exploded near his car in Neeiage area.

An explosions occurred near closed wine shops,it triggered fear among residents but did not cause any substantive damage.The explosion occurred on Khyaban-i-Muslim, behind Cineplex and near the Village Restaurant.No casualties were resported.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

An explosion took place on Khyaban-i-Rahat, in Phase-IV, it happened near a wine shop. The shops stay closed during the holy month of Ramazan.No casualties were reported.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
A blast occurred at a closed wine shop at Sea-view in Defence near a food chain.No casualties was reported.No group has climed responsibility for the attack.

An explosion occurred close to a closed wine shop,it happened near Moti Mahal in Gulshan-i-Iqbal,it took place in a flower pot near the J.B. wine shop.No casualties were reported. No group has claimed responsibility.

At least eleven children were killed and Sindh MPA was injured in a powerful blast that jolted Lyari. The blast took place during a football match in Lyari's Sango Lane area, where a number of people were reportedly injured. The explosive material was rigged to a motorbike.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

The explosive material that was buried in a home in Kandhkot exploded and as a result two brothers died on the spot, while their sister sustained critical injuries.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

A prominent elder of Haleemzai tribe was injured in a roadside blast in Mohmand Agency.He was going home when he was targeted with a remote-controlled bomb.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack
A woman was killed and 20 others sustained injuries in a hand grenade explosion by unidentified armed men at Assadullah shopping center.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

An explosion occurred near the city branch of the Utility Stores Corporation. The explosives were packed in a pressure cooker that was kept near the utility store. No casualty was reported, the utility store was gutted after it caught fire. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Militants planted explosive material with in two feet of a railway track near Khuda Dad Railway Crossing in Tando Adam which went off with a big bang, destroying the railway track due to which the train service has been suspended.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Taliban suicide bomber killed 30 people at the funeral of a policeman, including five senior police officers and wounded 62, amongst the dead were 21 police officers. Whereas the rest were not yet identified but it did include children.

At least three people, including a minor girl, were killed in a landmine blast in Kashmore district of Sindh.The incident took place near Bakhshapur town of Kashmore district. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

A bomb planted in front of the hujra of former MPA of Awami National Party (ANP) exploded.Former MPA was not present there at the time of the blast while other people present in the hujra also remained unhurt.The blast destroyed the gate of the hujra and damaged a wall. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
In an anti-tank mine explosion on the second day of Eid, critically injured a 55-year-old shepherd who was grazing his cattle. No group has claimed responsibility for it.
Two persons were killed and one injured when a bomb exploded in a vehicle at Shakhdalatkhel in Upper Kurram.It is suspected that TTP is behind the attack.

A local tribal leader was killed while two of his guards sustained injuries when his vehicle hit a landmine explosive,planted in Patokh area in Dera Bugti.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

A remote controlled explosion took place at a police official's residence on Shahrah-e-Faisal. The explosion targeted SSP, whose residence is near Saddar police station. There was no loss of life. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
At least one person was killed and three injured when a vehicle hit by a landmine at Dera Murad Jamali. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Militants planted explosives to the main entrance of the house of tribal journalist in Dabkot village, four kilometers west from Wana, the headquarters of South Waziristan. The main gate of the house was blown away and caused serious damage to two rooms and structure of the building. No loss of life was reported. No group has claimed responsibility.
Two personnel of the Frontier Corps (FC) were injured when a roadside bomb exploded near their vehicle in the Brewery area.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
In a mine explosion in Dalasa village,a shepherd s foot was blown away.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
Two people were killed and another was injured when a bomb went off near a Wapda grid station on Sariab road. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

On August 12, unidentified armed men hurled a hand grenade at the residence of local notable on Kansi Road, which exploded causing minor damage to the walls of the house. No group has taken responsibility for the attack.

A woman and a child lost their lives while 26 others were injured in grenade attacks on Aga Khani Jamaat khana,militants threw a hand grenade from a wall of the Shahra-i-Pakistan, which landed inside the Jamaatkhana. It is suspected that Lashkar-i-Jhangvi was behind the attack.
Powerful explosions rocked Kharan in Balochistan on the eve of Independence Day celebrations. No human loss was reported in explosion.
Powerful explosions rocked Khuzdar on the eve of Independence Day celebrations. No human loss was reported in the explosion.
Powerful explosions rocked Turbat in Balochistan on the eve of Independence Day celebrations. No human loss was reported in the explosion.

Suspected militants blew up a local school in the Halimzai tehsil of Mohmand Agency, explosive device planted by suspected militants at the Government Primary School in Ghazi Baig village went off at night, destroying the building.No loss of life was reported,It is suspected that TTP is behind the attack.
A house was partially damaged in an explosion in the Basiakhel Police Station limits,the explosive device had been planted by unidentified persons near the house.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of India (2004-2014) Border Security Force
NOTES: Reports on Aug 23 of Indian shelling across the LoC into Nikial sector, Fatehpur tehsil, and Tatta Pani Sector, Kotli tehsil, Kotli District over the previous week. 13 civilians were injured (includes 8-9 injuries reported in separate events), 26 houses and 2 vehicles were damaged, and 10 cattle were killed over the week. No mention of Pakistani retaliation.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of India (2004-2014) Border Security Force
NOTES: Reports on Aug 23 of Indian shelling across the LoC into Nikial sector, Fatehpur tehsil, and Tatta Pani Sector, Kotli tehsil, Kotli District over the previous week. 13 civilians were injured (includes 8-9 injuries reported in separate events), 26 houses and 2 vehicles were damaged, and 10 cattle were killed over the week. No mention of Pakistani retaliation.

A powerful bomb planted at the Chaman railway station went off, when a large number of people were there to buy tickets. The bomb blast damaged the ticketing cabin, resulting in death of two people and injuries to 10 others.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of India (2004-2014) Border Security Force
NOTES: Indian forces fired across the LoC near the Balakot area in Nikial sector, Fatehpur tehsil, Kotli District on the night of Aug 21 and continuing into Aug 22. A woman and her child were injured in the shelling. No mention of Pakistani retaliation.

Three persons including two security men were injured in a blast that occurred in Mastung area of Quetta.The device went off with a blast near the vehicle of motorway police in Khad Kocha area of Mastung.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
A rocket attack on Alfalah Road in Lyari left two people injured.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Two people were killed while sixteen including 10 military personnel and six civilians sustained severe injuries in a bomb attack on an army truck near Rangers Headquarters in Korangi area of Karachi, area of the port city. TTP claimed responsibility for the attack.

A pro-government militant commander, his driver and three personal security guards were killed in an improvise explosives devise (IED) attack near Wana, the headquarters of South Waziristan Agency.It is suspected that TTP was behind the attack.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of India (2004-2014) Border Security Force
NOTES: Indian forces fired across the LoC near the Balakot area in Nikial sector, Fatehpur tehsil, Kotli District on the night of Aug 21 and continuing into Aug 22. A woman and her child were injured in the shelling. No mention of Pakistani retaliation.

Militants had planted an IED devise on Kanal Road in the Badhbher police precincts in Peshawar. It went off when the vehicle was passing; it caused partial damage to the vehicle and all on board remained safe.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

An explosion was reported near the security forces convoy in Bazidkhel area of the city. The explosive material was planted in a motorcycle. No casualty was reported. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

A Frontier Cops (FC) soldier got injured after hitting by Improvised Explosive Device (IED) planted by unidentified militants at Katta Kanai, a way off area of Tirah valley of tehsil Landi Kotal, Khyber agency. It is suspected that TTP is behind the attack.
Two workers of Awami National Party (ANP) survived a grenade attack in Shirin Jinnah Colony.

Unidentified armed men attached explosives with pipelines of two wells of natural gas and detonated it damaging the wells in in Pir Koh area of Dera Bugti district.No injury or loss of life was reported.
Unidentified armed men fired three rockets on the check post of security forces in the area of Kohlu Balochistan. No casualty has been reported.

A child was killed and another injured when a bomb exploded in Muslimabad street of Akhtarabad area near Western Bypass.The bomb was planted inside a toy which exploded with big bang when the children were playing with the toy after picking it from garbage, killing a kid and injuring another.

Three men were injured in a blast which occurred at a recently built three storey shopping mall near Hussain Chowk in Gulberg. India-Pakistan Dosti Bus was passing by the venue when the blast occurred.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On 31st August, a US drone fired two missiles at a vehicle near a seminary in Musaki village in Dos Ali tehsil of N.Waziristan. 3 militants were killed in the missile strike which destroyed the vehicle and severely damaged the walls of the seminary. The militants are said to be members of the IMU, which is affiliated with the Hafiz Gul Bahadur faction of TTP.

The house of the president of the Balochistan National Party-Mengal (BNP-M) was attacked with grenades. Armed men riding a motorcycle hurled two hand grenades at the house which exploded in the courtyard of the house.No injuries was reported. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

On August 31, the house of the president of the Balochistan National Party-Mengal (BNP-M) was attacked with grenades in Quetta city (Balochistan). Armed men riding a motorcycle hurled two hand grenades at the house which exploded in the courtyard. No injuries were reported. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
Several rockets were fired on a military check post near Mir Ali, but no casualty or damage to property was reported. It is suspected that TTP is behind the attack.

At least nine servicemen were killed and as many injured in a bomb attack on a military convoy in North Waziristan Agency. It took place in the Boya area on the main Datta Khel-Miranshah Road. The militant outfit Ansarul Mujahideen claimed responsibility for the attack.

At least nine servicemen were killed and as many injured in a bomb attack on a military convoy in North Waziristan Agency. It took place in the Boya area on the main Datta Khel-Miranshah Road. The militant outfit Ansarul Mujahideen claimed responsibility for the attack.

The main gate of the house of an official of Afghan Commissionerate was damaged after a low intensity bomb blew up on Jamaluddin Afghani Road in University Town, Peshawar. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

An improvised explosive device (IED) planted by unidentified militants went off near a security forces convoy on Datta Khel-Miranshah Road in North Waziristan Agency. No loss was reported in the blast. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Five students were injured in a grenade attack on a seminary adjacent to a mosque on Sariab Road.The attackers, riding a motorcycle, escaped after hurling the grenade into the courtyard of the seminary. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
Two people were injured in a blast in Sohbat Pur area of Jaffarabad district. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Three people including two children were injured in a grenade attack. Unidentified armed men hurled hand grenade at Bilal Madressah located at Mir Gahi Khan Chowk which exploded. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
Two people sustained injuries when unidentified militants threw a hand grenade on a container near Karkhano market. The incident occurred on Peshawar-Torkham Road

A person has been killed in a landmine blast in Jaffarabad district. Unidentified men planted a landmine roadside in RD-298 area of Jaffarabad district that exploded when foot of a passerby hit it and he died.

In an explosion that occurred near a Government girl's primary school in Bannu district 16 people including females and students sustained serious injuries. The explosive device was planted in a garbage dump near the school that went off with big bang. The building was also damaged. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack. [women targeted: girls]

In a blast two people were injured seriously when a middle intensity blast occurred inside a NATO container in Jamrud tehsil of Khyber agency. The blast occurred inside a NATO container near Karkhano market in Jamrood. The explosion left two people, the driver and cleaner injured. It is suspected that TTP was behind the attack.
At least 37 people have been killed and more than 80 people sustained injuries after a blast near Abbas Town. The blast took place at a residential area outside a Mosque on Abul Hassan Ispahani Road.
Two bombs exploded outside the SP (investigation wing) office in Dera Ismail Khan. However, no loss of life was reported. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Two security personnel were killed while four sustained injuries in a remote-controlled bomb attack in Dera Bugti.A vehicle carrying security personnel was on a routine patrol in Jaffarabad area of Dera Bugti when the device exploded. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Four people including three policemen and a civilian were injured in a bomb blast inside Hashtnagri Police Station. A blast occurred when explosive fitted in a motorbike parked inside the premises of the Hashtnagri Police Stadium went off with a big bang. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AQIS: Al Qaeda in the Indian Subcontinent
NOTES: On September 6, a US drone targeted a house in Darga Mandi area of Ghulam Khan tehsil in N.Waziristan when 2-3 missiles killed at least 5 alleged militants. Most of those that died belonged to the Haqqani network, but it later emerged that senior Al Qaeda militants also died in this strike. At least 4 more people were severely wounded.
