Four people including two children were injured in a landmine blast in R.D 298 of Pat Feeder area in Dera Murad Jamali district. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Militants fired rockets from an unknown place in Panjgur town; it landed and exploded near Government Degree Girls College, shattering windowpanes of the institution and nearby buildings. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
In Charsadda, a CD shop was blown up in Sardheri Bazaar, unidentified men planted explosives in the CD shop, and blew it up. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
In the Charsadda area, a CD shop was blown up in Sardheri Bazaar, unidentified men planted explosives in the CD shop, and blew it up. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Two people were killed and five others were injured in a bomb blast in Quetta, the blast took place near a grid station on the city's Sariab Road where a remotely controlled explosive device planted in a parked bicycle exploded. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

A security man was injured when militants fired several rockets at a check post of Levies Force that left a security man injured. The check post was partially damaged in the attack in Kamar Sar area of Mamond tehsil in Bajaur Agency. They were suspected TTP militants.

A security man was injured when militants fired several rockets at a check post of Levies Force that left a security man injured. The check post was partially damaged in the attack in Kamar Sar area of Mamond tehsil in Bajaur Agency. They were suspected TTP militants.
An injured man died in a landmine explosion in the area of Sohbatpur. No group has claimed responsibility.
A pedestrian was wounded when an improvised explosive device (IED) planted along the roadside went off in Mali Khel area of Kuram Agency. It is suspected that TTP was behind the attack.
A pedestrian was wounded when an improvised explosive device (IED) planted along the roadside went off in Mali Khel area of Kuram Agency. It is suspected that TTP was behind the attack.
Panic gripped the residents of Paharipura area when a bomb went off near the residence of a former nazim. No casualty was reported. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Unidentified armed men fired a rocket at the Lucky Cement Factory in Darra Pezu. A rocket shell fired by unidentified persons from Sheikh Badin Mountain hit the Hostel No-1 where a room was damaged. However, it caused no casualty. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

A low intensity bomb exploded in the Quaidabad area. However no causality was reported. The explosion took place in the Gulshan-e-Bunair, Quaidabad police remit. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
A member of a local peace committee was killed and five others were injured in a remote controlled blast in Salarzai tehsil of Bajaur Agency. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

A bomb killed two senior military officers and a solider in Upper Dir, they were returning with a convoy from Shahi Kot in Upper Dir district, when they reached Gat area an improvised explosive device planted on a road went off, destroying their vehicle. The Tehreek-i-Taliban Pakistan claimed responsibility for the attack.

A state-run school was partially damaged when a rocket fired by suspected militants hit the school in Janikhel in the Frontier Region (FR) Bannu. No casualty was reported. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

A state-run school was partially damaged when a rocket fired by suspected militants hit the school in Janikhel in the Frontier Region (FR) Bannu. No casualty was reported. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
A powerful blast took place outside a house located in the city area of Eidgah. No casualties were reported in the explosion. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

At least 16 pro-government tribals, including three women, were killed and nine more wounded in a bomb attack targeting a passenger van in Lower Dir. Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the attack.
A blast has been reported in the metropolis area of Landhi's Gulshan Buner. No loss of life was reported in the explosion.

A soldier of the Frontier Corps (FC) was killed and one injured as an IED blast hit a convoy of the security forces in Miran Shah tehsil of North Waziristan. The IED planted by the militants on exploded as the security forces convoy hit the landmine. It is suspected that TTP is behind the attack.
A house and a hujra were detonated by unidentified militants in Jamrud, Khyber Agency. Militants planted a bomb next to the boundary wall, the main gate and boundary wall were razed to the ground.

Unknown persons dynamited the house of a militant commander in Spin Khawri area on the Bypass Road. Unidentified persons had placed explosives at various points in the house vacated by militant commander Nabi Hanafi and then triggered explosions at night. The house was destroyed in the explosions but no casualty was caused as the family had already abandoned it recently. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
Four persons, including two women, sustained injuries when improvised explosive devices (IED) went off in the Habib Colony in the limits of the Cantonment Police Station.
The house of Frontier Constabulary (FC) personnel was partially damaged in a blast at Michankhel. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
The house of Assistant District Education Officer (ADEO) of Bannu was destroyed in a bomb explosion. No casulaity was caused in the explosion. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
One person sustained injuries in a blast near an abandoned check post of the Levies force in Sarki area. Militants had planted an explosive device on the under construction road in Sarki Chambagul.
Two security personnel were injured in a rocket attack by the militants at the checkpost in Dattakhel area of North Waziristan. It is suspected that TTP is behind the attack.
A school teacher sustained injuries when unidentified militants hurled two hand grenades into a school in Halimzai tehsil in Mohmand Agency. It is suspected that TTP is behind the attack.
Militants fired a rocket at Hayatabad that landed near a house in Phase-IV but did not cause any casualty or damage.
Three people were killed and at least 15 injured when a hand grenade exploded near a Shia Imambargah in Karachi's Landhi neighbourhood. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

An FC man and his son were injured in a blast outside their residence. Militants had planted an explosive material outside the house of an FC man located in the WANA camp which went off. It is suspected that TTP is behind the attack.
Three people were killed and at least 15 injured when a hand grenade exploded near a Shia Imambargah in Karachi's Landhi neighbourhood. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Three people were killed and 14 injured in a grenade attack on a mosque in the Achini Bala village in the rural Peshawar. The locals said the attackers opened fire on the people inside the mosque after the explosion.
At least seven security men were injured when a blast occurred near their convoy while passing through Sibi area of Quetta. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

At least five security personnel were wounded in a roadside bomb blast in Machh area of district Bolan. A Frontier Corps (FC) convoy was on its way from Quetta to Sibi when it was hit by a roadside bomb near Bibi Nani area of Machh. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

On September 20, unidentified militants hurled two hand grenades at the house of former minister on Dayal Road in Dera Ismail Khan city (Khyber Pakhtunkhwa). No casualty was reported. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
At least two people sustained injuries in an explosion in the Sariab Road area of the city. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
Two persons were injured and two vehicles were damaged in an explosion. It occurred near Islami Bank along Maal road. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

At least 22 people, including a journalist, were injured in a bomb blast in Sibi. An explosive device was planted in a motorcycle parked outside a restaurant and it was detonated by remote control. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
As many as 17 people were injured in a bomb explosion in front of Check shop at Nishter road near Tareen hotel. Bomb was planted in a motorcycle. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On September 22, a US drone strike targeted militants in Palgai, a village in Makin tehsil of S.Waziristan close to the Shawal valley and bordering N.Waziristan. At least 6 militants, unknown from which group but likely foreign militants, were killed when 2 houses were struck in the vicinity.
Four militants were killed in a blast at the base of an outlawed organisation in Bara tehsil of Khyber Agency The blast took place at the base of Lashkar-i-Islam in Nala-Malikdinkhel.
At least 25 people were killed and several others injured in a suicide attack targetting Christians near a Church in Peshawar.

A bomb targeting police officers killed at least five people and wounded five others near Saranan area. At least four of the dead were personnel of Pishin police. The bomb was planted underneath the police van, which exploded while the officials were performing routine checks. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Unidentified militants targeted a police mobile van with an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) at Wazirbagh area in Interior City, injuring two cops on the spot.The bomb was detonated with remote control device when the police mobile van was passing through the area. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
Afghan forces fired 6 mortar shells that landed deep inside Pakistan's South Waziristan Agency, killing two people and injuring four others.
In a remote controlled bomb one person was injured in Mohalla Baqir Shah area of Peshawar. Two houses were damaged due to the blast No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

An explosion occurred near a petrol pump on Old College Road in Jacobabad when a bomb planted under a stationary vehicle went off. No casualty or injury was reported. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
Three security officials were injured as militants fired rocket at a security forces camp. It took place in Jani Khel area of the district. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
A loud explosion was heard in Peshawar, one person was injured in the blast in Mohalla Baqir Shah area of Peshawar. Two houses suffered partial damaged due to the blast.

Four citizens were injured in a landmine explosion in Sui area of Dera Bugti. The victims were on their way home when the planted landmine exploded near Talkat area. No group has claimed responsibility.

A helicopter in which Chairman National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) was traveling came under rocket fire but fortunately no one was injured in the incident. The rockets were fired when the helicopter was landing in Mashkay area, a tehsil of the Awaran district. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
Seven people sustained injuries in a stampede at a circus after a remote-controlled blast in Sakhakot. No group has claimed responsibility.

Around 19 people were killed and 44 others sustained injuries in an explosion inside a van on Charsadda Road, Peshawar. The attack targeted a bus of Civil Secretariat employees that was carrying around 30-40 people. The bomb was placed in the back of the bus. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
A woman lost her life in a landmine explosion at Sunri area. No group has claimed responsibility.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On September 29, for the second time this month, a US drone strike targeted a house in Darga Mandi in Ghulam Khan tehsil of N.Waziristan. At least 3 militants died, although it could have been as many as 6 fatalities, and all those that died were affiliated to Haqqani network.
The death toll from a car bomb explosion in an ancient market Qissa Khwani Bazar in Peshawar rose to at least 42 and 107 people were wounded.
A car bomb killed at least 41 people, including 14 of the same family in the City's busy Qissa Khwani bazaar. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On September 30th in Boya area of Miran Shah tehsil of N.Waziristan, a US drone missile targeted and destroyed a house. Between 1-4 militants died in the attack at 4am local time.

A security man received injuries in a roadside blast in Regay area of Bajaur tribal region. The four personnel of Bajaur Levies were on their way in a pick-up truck to guard a team of polio vaccinators, when their vehicle was targeted with a remote-controlled explosive device. It is suspected that TTP is behind the attack.
A man was killed and two others injured when a few unidentified men threw a hand grenade on a house in the limit of Dauzai Police Station. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

At least three persons were killed and 10 injured including five security personnel in a powerful explosion on Pak-Afghan border area of Balochistan.The explosion occurred near the 'Bab-e-Dosti' (friendship gate) as security personnel were checking the people entering into Pakistan.

A security forces vehicle struck a landmine which went off on the side of the road in Balochistan's Mashkay area of Awaran district, while carrying out relief activities, two soldiers were killed and four others were injured.
Two army soldiers were killed and two others sustained injuries in a landmine explosion while they were carrying out relief work in Mashkai, Balochistan.

A suicide bomb attack claimed the lives of 17 people and left twenty two injured in the tribal Spin Tall region of Hangu. The compound of an ex-TTP (Tehreek-e-Taiban Pakistan) military commander, Mullah Nabi Hanafi, who splintered from the ttp to form his own militant group was targeted by current TTP militants. He was associated with TTP in the past but after developing differences formed his own militant faction to fight against the TTP. TTP claimed responsibility for the attack

Two policemen sustained injuries when a roadside bomb targeted a police van; the police van was on routine patrolling near Tajabad Graveyard. The van was partially destroyed in the explosion. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
In a landmine blast in Boshara area of Kurram Agency, three people received injuries, two of them are serious. The mine was planted in a field. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
One person was injured in a landmine blasts in Dander area of Kurram Agency. It is suspected that TTP is behind the attack.
A blast took place in Boshera Jauzak village, Kurram agency, where two explosives were planted next to the wall of a house. Two people sustained injuries in the explosion.
An improvised explosive device (IED) planted near a check post in Karkhano market went off, injuring one security personnel in Peshawar. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Three security personnel were killed and eight others injured in a remote controlled bomb attack on a security forces vehicle on Miranshah road. Ansarul Islam Mujahideen claimed responsibility for the attack.

A military vehicle on a routine patrol hit an improvised explosive device (IED) in the Bannu- Miranshah road in North Waziristan. Three soldiers were killed and at least seven others were wounded. A little known militant organisation, Ansarul Islam Mujahideen, claimed responsibility for the attack.

A prayer leader and a boy were wounded after an improvised explosive device went off in Ittehad Town. The IED exploded as soon as the prayer leader of Jamia Masjid Tauheed, came out from his home. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Nine people including four police personnel were injured when a police station came under grenade attack on the outskirts of Quetta. Militants on motorbikes hurled a hand grenade at New Sariyab Road police station. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

In a target remote controlled bomb explosion, a police van which was providing security to a polio team was targeted in Peshawar killing six police officers and injuring eight. The explosion took place near a hospital in the Budh Bher area of the city. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Goods related to an anti-polio campaign were being distributed at a small health unit in Bazid Khel area in the outskirts of Peshawar, when the remotely-detonated explosion occurred, killing 6 people and injuring 15. It is suspected that TTP carried out the attack.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of India (2004-2014) Border Security Force
NOTES: Reports of Indian shelling across the LoC on Oct 8. In AJK, 1 civilian was injured in Lanjot village, Nikial sector, Fatehpur tehsil, Kotli District. No mention of Pakistani retaliation.
On October 8, unidentified armed men hurled a hand grenade on a house near Iqbal Market in Orangi Town in Karachi (Sindh). No one was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility.
A bomb exploded in a bustling food market in Anarkali bazaar in the old city area of Lahore killing one person and wounding 13 others.No group has claimed responsibility.
A low-intensity blast at a restaurant killed one person and wounded 13 in a popular food street in Lahore. No group has claimed responsibility.

A high intensity blast occurred outside the Sindhi Biryani hotel in old Anarkali, Lahore also known as 'food street'. At least one person died, while 16 others were injured. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
A blast wounded a police officer on the ring road in Peshawar, which has regularly been hit by gun and bomb attacks in recent years.

A bicycle bomb tore through a crowded market area near a police station in Quetta, killing five and wounding 35. The dead included a policeman, women and children. TTP is suspected to have carried out the attack.
At least 12 soldiers were wounded when a security forces patrol vehicle was targeted by a remote controlled bomb in the semi-tribal area of Bannu.

Bomb attached with a motorcycle exploded near City police station in Liaqat Bazar, killing six people and more than fifty were injured. Several vehicles, shops and nearby buildings were also damaged due to the blast. The injured included children and policemen. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

At least two security personnel were killed and three injured when a roadside bomb hit an army vehicle in South Waziristan tribal region. The blast took place in Wana. It is suspected that TTP is behind the attack.

The shrine of Sheikh Modula Babaji in Sheikhan village was blown up The grave was destroyed by a two-kilogramme homemade explosive device planted near it by unidentified militants. Fortunately, there was no loss of life.No group has claimed responsibility.

One woman was killed and six others, including two children, were wounded in a hand grenade attack at Muzaffarabad Colony in Landhi near a medical center in Karachi.No group has claimed responsibility.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of India (2004-2014) Border Security Force
NOTES: Indian forces fired shells aross the LoC on Oct 14. In AJK, 6 civilians were injured and a house caught on fire when shelling hit Datot and Darkandi areas of Nikial sector, Fatehpur tehsil, Kotli District. Pakistani retaliation not mentioned.

In a hand grenade attack by unidentified armed men targeting the vehicle of a police constabulary injured 10 people in the Hazarganji area of Quetta, four children and two police officials were among the injured. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

A suicide bomb attack killed at least eight people, including a provincial law minister, and injured 28 others on the first day of Eid-ul-Zuha.The attack happened when law minister was exchanging Eid greetings with people at his residence in Kullachi town of Dera Ismail Khan.The minister was a member of the ruling party Tehreek-i-Insaf (PTI).No group has claimed responsibility.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of India (2004-2014) Border Security Force
ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Pakistan Rangers
NOTES: Pakistan accused India of killing a paramilitary soldier in unprovoked firing of heavy weapons including mortars by Indian Border Security Forces near the city of Sialkot.
Unidentified men fired two rockets at a Frontier Corps checkpost in Panjgur area. The rockets fired from an unknown location landed and exploded away from the post.No damage was reported.

A bomb hit a passenger train killing at least six people and wounding more than 17 people.The device planted on the railway track, exploded when the train approached a station in Naseerabad district, southeast of Quetta.Security personnel were also travelling in the train.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of India (2004-2014) Border Security Force
NOTES: Reports of Indian shelling across the LoC on Oct 22. In AJK, 1 civilian was injured in Datot village, Nikial sector, Fatehpur tehsil, Kotli District. No mention of Pakistani retaliation.
Three rockets were fired from Afghanistan side on a security forces check post Sarakai in Bajaur,two FC soldiers were injured.
A passer by and rickshaw driver sustained injuries in a roadside blast in the jurisdiction of Cantt police Station. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
A driver was killed when an improvised explosive device (IED) exploded at a roadside in Doaba area of Hangu. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

A boy was killed while three other boys were wounded in an improvised explosive device attack on a warehouse in the timber market near the Civil Hospital Karachi. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
A hand grenade explosion in the Timber Market located near Lyari in Karachi killed a child and injured two people.No group has claimed responsibility.
On 26 Oct, a government-run girls high school was partially destroyed when a bomb planted along its boundary wall exploded in Howaid (Bannu, KP). No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of India (2004-2014) Border Security Force
NOTES: Reports of Indian shelling across the LoC on Oct 26. In AJK, 1 civilian was injured in Red Kathar village, Nikial sector, Fatehpur tehsil, Kotli District. No mention of Pakistani retaliation.

A car bomb hit a Frontier Corps (FC) van escorting a bus of Shia pilgrims in Dringarh, Mastung killing two soldiers. The incident took place on the main Quetta-Taftan Highway.Frontier Corps and Balochistan Levies convoys were escorting five passenger buses of Shia pilgrims on the highway when the incident took place. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
Unidentified people fired a rocket in Quetta city, it fell near TB centre. However there was no injury or casualty. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
Five people were killed while two others injured in a grenade attack in Mamra area of Lower Orakzai. The grenade was hurled when a tribal jirga was in progress. No group has claimed responsibility.
A roadside bomb killed a soldier and wounded three others near the Afghan border. The explosion took place at Chashma Pull, near Miranshah. It is suspected that TTP is behind the attack.

Three security men suffered injuries in a roadside blast near Manzai area in Tank district. A mine clearing squad was leading a security forces convoy on Tank-Wana Road when it was targeted with an explosive device planted by unidentified persons along the roadside near Manzai area.
On October 29, four hand grenade attacks created panic and fear in Dadu (Sindh). Unidentified motorcyclists threw a hand grenade at the local press club. No group claimed responsibility.
In Larkana's Kousar Bridge area, unidentified motorcyclists targeted a police check post by throwing a cracker.No group has claimed responsibility.

At least four people were killed and 16 others injured in twin IED blasts on Zarghoon Road. The improvised explosive device (IED) explosions occurred near the provincial office of National Database and Registration Authority (NADRA). The first IED, was planted in a bicycle which went off, leaving several injured. The second blast occurred when the people rushed to the site to rescue the injured. As a result four persons died and many others sustained injuries. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Two troops were killed in an IED explosion in South Waziristan. The IED was planted at roadside in Zatrai village, South Waziristan, when it went off, killing two soldiers and wounding 4 others. It is suspected that TTP is behind the attack.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: Three suspected TTP militants were killed and three people were injured in a US drone strike in Miranshah bazaar in the North Waziristan tribal region.

A bomb explosion took place in a village in the South Waziristan Agency, near Afghan border, killing five soldiers. Two soldiers died at the scene while three of the four others seriously wounded later succumbed to their injuries.
Three persons were injured in blast by a remote controlled device in a motor Bargain centre owned by a senior pro government tribal elder Malik Taj Mohammad. No group has claimed responsibility

Security forces were attacked by militants in North Waziristan by rockets, however no causality took place. 3 rockets were fired on security forces in Miranshah by armed men. It is suspected that TTP carried out the attack.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On November 1, a TTP leader was killed in a US drone strike on his car or house in Dande Darpe Khel in Miran Shah tehsil of N.Waziristan. Alongside him, at least 4 other high-ranking TTP militants were killed - the TTP buried him in secret and announced a new leader a week after his death.

Five people were killed and two others were injured in a grenade attack in Mamra area of Lower Orakzai.The grenade was hurled when a tribal jirga was in progress.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack
A shop and a car was destroyed in a bomb blast in Lower Dir.However no losses of lives were reported.The bomb was placed in close proximity to the shop. No group has claimed responsibility.
Militants fired rockets from Afghanistan side of the border landed in Mamond tehsil of Bajaur Agency, leaving a woman injured.
'A security guard was injured when unknown individuals hurled a hand grenade inside an INGO guest house. Staff was relocated to Islamabad.'
Two people were injured in a blast at a vacant house located near the Eastern Bypass; roof of six room's collapsed.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

At least four people were killed and two more injured after unidentified armed men tossed a hand grenade at a jirga of a gathering of tribal elders, who had gathered to settle a matter, was in progress in Lower Orakzai's Mawara area when it came under grenade attack.No group has claimed responsibility.

A child was killed and six others were injured when a medium-intensity bomb went off near a government-run primary school in Peshawar. According to the police, the device was planted near an electric supply tower. It blew up, injuring seven people and spreading panic among locals.No group has claimed responsibility.
A bomb explosion in Peshawar caused a telephone exchange in the Meli Khel area to go up in flames. The building was empty thus there was no loss of life.No group has claimed responsibility.

Railway track was blown up in an explosion in Hyderabad, however, no casualty or major loss was reported in the incidents.A locally made bomb damaged the track between Karachi and Hyderabad minutes before the arrival of a Lahore-bound Business Express near Hussainabad's subway.No group has claimed responsibility.

A bomb exploded on the track a kilometre from the Gambat railway station in the Khairpur area. Railway track was destroyed when the locally-made bomb exploded sometime after the departure of the Shalimar Express to Karachi via Gambat railway station.No group has claimed responsibility.
A woman and her three children were wounded in a land mine explosion in restive resource-rich Dera Bugti district.No group has claimed responsibility.

Two simultaneous powerful blasts near Quetts Zarghon Road killed five people and left at least 17 injured.The bomb exploded in a crowded car repair market on double road near Zarghon Road.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Ten people, including a police constable, were injured when Baloch militants hurled a hand grenade at the assistant commissioner's office in Pasni, Gwadar.The banned Balochistan Liberation Front (BLF) has claimed responsibility for the attack.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Federal Investigation Agency
NOTES: On November 11th, an intelligence officer and a suspected militant were killed in Dhokan Rawli village, AJK, when the handcuffed militant led a group of intelligence to a weapons cache and exploded a grenade in a suicide attack.

A khasadar was critically injured when an improvised explosive device planted along a roadside exploded.The explosion caused fatal injuries to the khasadar, who was guarding the main Peshawar-Torkhum road in Sultan Khel area along with other khasadar personnel.

A security forces convoy was travelling on Peshawar's Ring Road when a roadside planted bomb detonated in Achini Bala area. However, there were no casualties in the blast.No group has claimed responsibility.

At least 15 people, including children, journalists and security officials, were injured in three separate bomb attacks targeting Shi'i Muslims in different areas of Karachi. No group has claimed responsibility.
A hand grenade attack outside an Imambargah (Shia worship place)located in North Karachi Sector 11 left at least two policemen injured. No group has claimed responsibility.

In Khyber Agency, two troops of Khasadar Force got injured in an IED blast planted by militants near their post in Gariza area of tehsil Jamrud, a sub-division of Khyber Agency.No group has claimed responsibility.
In Khyber Agency, two troops of Khasadar Force got injured in an IED blast planted by militants near their post in Gariza area of tehsil Jamrud.It is suspected TTP was behind the attack.

Two members of the Khasadar force were killed in an explosion by unidentified armed men, who had planted explosive device near a security check post in Takhta Beg area of Khyber tribal region's Jamrud Tehsil. No group has claimed responsibility.

Three people were injured in a suspected IED blast in the district of Awaran.The IED was planted on a road in Shah Ghazi area and went off when a donkey cart was passing by.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

An explosion occurred close to Imambargah Abul Fazal in North Nazim Abad injuring 8 persons including 2 police men, 2 reporters of a private TV channel and a camera man. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

The house of a tribesman was destroyed in Khanzeb Kallay, Jamrud tehsil when a bomb planted by unidentified armed men along the boundary wall of the building went off.No casualty was reported.No group has claimed responsibility.

One police personal was killed while three other sustained injuries when their vehicle hit a road side planted remote control bomb in Garah Jana village of Tehsil Kulachi District of DI khan.No group has claimed responsibility.

In Bannu, six people, including security personnel and a policeman, suffered injuries in a suicide attack on the convoy of Frontier Corps on Bannu-Kohat Road. The suicide bomber riding a Qingqi rickshaw blew himself up when the vehicle of FC soldiers bound for Bannu reached the Kurram bridge.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Two people, including a police official, were injured when a roadside bomb went off in limits of Badbher police station on the outskirts of Peshawar, the target of the explosion was a police van, which was shifting policemen to the police station after night duty.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

A woman was killed and four others,including a man, were injured in a grenade attack on a house in Kashkoal Banda of Swabi district. The hand grenade was lobbed at the houseby armed men, in the wee hours. No group has claimed responsibility.

In a bomb attack on security forces convoy two soldiers were injured in North Waziristan, it took place near Karam Kot area in Mirali sub-division of the tribal agency.It is suspected that TTP is involved.
A woman was killed and four others, including three women sustained injuries in a hand grenade attack at a house in Kashkol Banda in Bamkhel.No group has claimed responsibility.

At least five people, including two women and a child, were injured in a hand grenade attack on a shop in Jannat Bazaar, in restive Balochistan province's Gwadar district. No group has claimed responsibility.

Five people were injured in a hand grenade attack on a shop in Gwadar. Levies sources said that unknown armed men riding a motorcycle hurled a hand grenade at the shop, leaving five people, including a woman, injured. No group has claimed responsibility.

On November 20, unidentified armed men hurled a hand grenade at the local office of Awami National Party in Naurang town (Khyber Pakhtunkhwa). The explosion caused partial damage to the building, but there was no report of injured people. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

A suicide car bombing has killed two paramilitary soldiers in Pakistan's tribal region near the Afghan border.The bomber rammed his car into the main gate of a Frontier Corps base in the Shawa area of North Waziristan. Ansarul Mujahideen.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

A powerful explosion happened at Patel Road area of the city, killing one man and injuring four others.The bomb was detonated by a remote controlled device and explosive materials were fixed in a Rickshaw parked at the blast site.No group has claimed responsibility.
On 21 November, a suicide bomber blew himself up inside an office of the Customs department at Torkham border, injuring 26 people, seven of them are critical. No group has claimed responsibility.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On November 21, a rare US drone strike outside North and S.Waziristan hit Thal town in Thal tehsil in Hangu district. The strike hit a madrassa at 5am on the morning, allegedly killing at least 6 Haqqani network militants. The madrassa was said to have been used by refugees as well as militants affiliated to the Haqqani Network. A Haqqani source said the madrassa was also a base for the network where militants fighting across the border came to stay and rest, as the Haqqani seminaries in the tribal areas were targeted by drones. Many reports stated that 4 civilians also died in the attack.

Five people including two children were killed and 22 injured in a bomb explosion near Bareech Market area of Quetta. The militants had planted explosive materials in a cycle parked on the roadside. The banned Baloch United Army claimed responsibility for the attack.
Militants fired mortar shells from Kunar province of Afghanistan in Nawagai tehsil of Bajaur Agency,leaving two children injured.

Two powerful and simultaneous explosions in the Ancholi area of Karachi, killed at least five persons, including an associate producer of Geo News and a child, and injuring at least 20. The bombs were fixed to motorbikes and detonated by remote control device. Four shops, four motorbikes and four vehicles were destroyed in the blasts. No group has claimed responsibility for the blasts.

In a target attack in Quetta, a police constable was injured when men riding a motorcycle hurled a grenade at the Balochistan Constabulary's Tipu Line in Sariab area.No group has claimed responsibility.

Three khasadar officials were killed, while four others were injured in an improvised explosive device (IED) blast in Dawizai, Pandiali tehsil in lower Mohmand Agency.The men were on their way back to Dawizai when an IED exploded on the roadside.The Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan's Mohmand chapter claimed responsibility for the attack
Two people were killed and one other injured in a roadside bomb that was detonated near a car in the Shablan area of Upper Kurram Agency. It is suspected that TTP carried out the attack.
An explosion occurred in the Dal area of Upper Kurram Agency due to which one person was killed.It is suspected that TTP carried out the attack.

A remote-controlled bomb, planted along the road near Karamkot in Mirali Tehsil, was detonated when the security forces convoy was travelling from Miramshah to Mirali. Subsequently, two soldiers were killed on the spot whereas five others were injured.TTP claimed responsibility for the attack.
After a blast that killed two security men at the Mir Ali area in North Wazirstan, security forces shelled a residental area where a house was set ablaze near Mir Ali (North Waziristan Agency, FATA).

A girl was killed and six people were injured when a rocket fired by Iranian border forces hit three houses in Tump town of Kech district. An official of Kech administration said that one of the houses belonged to Mullah Omer, believed to be a commander of an Iran-based religious outfit, Jaish-ul-Adl.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: At least three suspected militants were killed and several others injured when two missiles were fired by a US drone on a compound in Angar Kalli area near Miranshah Tehsil in North Waziristan Agency.
A man was injured when an improvised explosive device went off in a building in Baghwanan Bazaar in a suburb of Peshawar.No group has claimed responsibility.

Militants hurled hand grenade and then opened fire at the office of a private media group, hurting two security guards. According to police the security guard had sustained bullet injuries in the firing at Qayyumabad area of the city. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Four personnel of Frontier Corps (FC) were wounded when a forces vehicle was targeted with roadside remote controlled bomb planted by unidentified armed men in Malik Shaga, Ghundi area of Jamrud tehsil of Khyber Agency.No group has claimed responsibility.

In a target attack one man was killed and 22 others were injured in bomb blasts that went off in Pakistan's southwest Chaman district. The bomb was detonated by a remote controlled device and explosive materials were fixed in a motorbike parked in the market.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

On December 5, unidentified armed man on a motorcycle hurled a hand grenade at a shop in Paposh Nagri area of Nazimabad. No loss of life and property was reported. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
In Mohmand Agency, a woman sustained injuries when an improvised explosive device (IED) planted in a field went off in Soran Darra area of Biazai tehsil.It is suspected that TTP is behind the attack.
4 people were killed in a suicide attack targeting a police chief in Quetta.

Anti-literacy militants blasted a government run girls primary school with explosives, in Saru area of tehsil Shabqadar of Charsadda. As a result of explosion two rooms of the school were destroyed but no loss of life was reported as the building was vacant at the time of blast.
An IED blast targeting Police van in the Jurisdiction of Sardheri Police Station left two policemen injured besides partially damaging the van.No group has claimed responsibility.

A member of village defence committee was injured in a remote controlled blast in Salarzai tehsil of Bajaur Agency.He was going home from the nearby market when a roadside explosive device, planted by unidentified armed men, went off with a bang.No group has claimed responsibility.

Four police men, including a station house officer (SHO) were injured in a bomb blast at Mazdoor Chowk. Police rushed to Mazdoor Chowk on information about the presence of a suspected item there. When they reached the site, the bomb exploded, injuring four policemen.No group has claimed responsibility.
A house was partially damaged in an explosive device that went off in the limits of Chamkani police station where it was planted near the main gate of the house of a police officer.No life was lost.

An explosive device device went off, damaging the car and house of a tribal elder in Larama village in the limits of Khazana police station.No life was lost,hence, no group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
A man, his son and their driver were wounded when a low-intensity bomb attached to their car exploded near NIPA in Gulshan-e-Iqbal, Karachi. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Seven Rangers personnel sustained injuries when a remote controlled bomb blast targeted their vehicle in Landhi.The explosives were fixed in a roadside motorcycle and went off when Rangers vehicle carrying ten personnel was passing through the Timber Market area. No group has claimed responsibility.

A roadside bomb struck a vehicle carrying Pakistani soldiers, killing four of them and wounding five other soldiers in the attack in the Spinwam village in the North Waziristan region.Ansar-ul-Mujahideenclaimed responsibility for the attack.

The Afghanistan based militants fired rockets on a village in Nawagai tehsil of Bajaur Agency. The rockets landed near an area where the funeral prayers were offered. However, no casualty was reported in the attack.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: At least five suspected militants were killed in US drone attack on Pak-Afghan border in Khyber Agency.

Roadside bomb has killed three members of a Pakistani bomb disposal team who were on their way to defuse another bomb elsewhere in the city of Peshawar.The attack took place in the Shaikh Mohammadi suburb.

Two people were killed and four others were injured in a blast in Parachinar, Kurram Agency on Hamzai Road, near a pick up van, killing two people and injuring three others. No group has claimed responsibility.
After the blast in Mir Ali, security forces started shelling over the area where the blast took place. A stray shell landed over a house of Issori Village and killed two of a family.

In a powerful bomb blast near Gosh Post on Razmak Miranshah Road 16 troops were injured. No group has claimed responsibility, though it is suspected that TTP was involved in carrying out the bomb blast.

A policeman was injured when a remote controlled Improvised Explosive Device (IED) was detonated near a police mobile van, when the mobile van was patrolling on Kohat road.No group has claimed responsibility.

A suicide bomber blew himself outside Imam Bargah in Gracy Lane near airport, killing at least three people including two police officials and injuring 14 others. The bomber was riding on a bike; he exploded himself when the police personnel signaled him. No group has claimed responsibility.

On 18 Dec, a woman was killed and her daughter-in-law and two others were injured when a grenade that looked like a toy exploded in her hand in a PECHS locality in Karachi city (Sindh). The victim saw a toy like object lying on the road and picked it up. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack

Militants in a suicide attack on security force's Khajuri check post in Mir Ali Tehsil of North Waziristan Agency (NWA) killed five soldiers and seriously wounded 35 others while they were offering prayers in the security post mosque. Ansarul Mujahedeen, a militant group linked to the Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) had claimed responsibility for the suicide attack.
A bomb exploded outside an ice cream parlor in Quetta, killing one person and wounding eight. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
Four people were injured when unidentified armed men on a motorcycle attacked a mosque in Badhabera area of Peshawar with a hand grenade.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

An SHO of Mauripur was killed and his guards were injured,when a bomb rigged to a parked motorcycle exploded in Karachi's Old Sabzi Mandi area. He was 'active' in operations against suspected militants.Two passers-by were also killed and 20 others injured. No group has claimed responsibility.

Three people were injured in a hand grenade attack outside a mosque near Peshawar. A couple of armed men riding a motorbike tossed a hand grenade near a mosque located in Peerano Kali area on Kohat Road. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
A bomb exploded outside an Imambargah in Orangi Town, killing four people and injuring 13, minutes after an explosion on the route of the main mourning procession.No group has claimed responsibility.

Police Line Road came under twin remote controlled bomb attacks which left one cop killed while five injured. The first explosion took place when a planted device at Chirkiaalee Bridge from some distance to District Jail went off while another was placed in garbage heap in front of a college. No group has claimed responsibility.

In Tirah valley a tribesman was killed when an explosive device planted by unknown militants on doorstep of a house went off here in Narai Baba area of tehsil Landi Kotal.No group has claimed responsibility.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: ON December 25, US drones targeted militants in the village of Qutab Khel in Miran Shah tehsil of N.Waziristan. The attack was thought to have targeted TTP militants, with at least 3 of them killed and a further 2 injured.

Militants exploded four improvised explosive devices (IEDs) en route the Chehlum procession of Hazrat Imam Hussain (RA) in Karachi that claimed three lives and wounded 25 others.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Two soldiers and five members of a tribal lashkar (peace committee) were injured in two separate explosions in Baizai tehsil of Mohmand Agency.The militants triggered an explosion through an improvised explosive device (IED) near the post of the Warsak Babazai peace committee.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
A minor girl was killed and and her little brother injured in a hand grenade blast at a bungalow in PECH Society.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

At least one person was killed in a missile strike in Hashim village area of Bajaur tribal. Rockets fired from Afghanistan's Nangarhar province landed in a residential area of Hashim village situated in Charmang tehsil of Bajaur tribal region.

Two soldiers sustained injuries in an improvised explosive device (IED) attack in North Waziristan. Security forces were on the way to Mir Ali from Miranshah, when the militants targeted their vehicle with an IED. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
Unidentified armed man fired two rockets at the Panjgur airport from an undefined location, no casualty was reported in the attack. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
Three people of the same family including a woman and two children were killed in a blast in Charsadda. No group has claimed responsibility.

At least two policemen received injuries after their vehicle was attacked in Bannu District of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, a roadside bomb exploded when the police van was approached. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

A blast exploded at Charsadda outside the mazar of Baba Saheb, fortunately no loss of life took place except some damages caused to the boundary wall of the shrine.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Three people were killed and six injured in a bomb blast inside a house in Toheedabad area on the outskirts of the city. Police said all the victims were Afghan nationals living in a rented house.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

An MPA of Muttahida Qaumi Movement (MQM) in Sindh Assembly, survived a bomb attack in SITE area. The incident took place when the MPA was on the way to his chemical factory in SITE area from his residence in PECHS Society. Unidentified armed men first opened indiscriminate firing, threw explosives and escaped from the scene. The MPA remained safe.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

A tribesman was killed when militants in Afghanistan fired mortar shells at the border area of Nawagai tehsil in Bajaur Agency.Militants fired several mortar shells from Afghanistan's Kunar province at Hassam Charmang area of Nawagai tehsil, located some 42 kilometres from Khar. They said that one mortar shell hit a house and as a result a tribesman was killed on the spot.
A bomb was heard near Qambrani road in Quetta's Sariab area.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

A bomb blast took place on RCD Highway here near Wadh town.The bomb planted on a roadside went off few seconds after Naib Tehsildar Wadh passed through in his private car.The blast, however, caused no damage to life and property.

On January 2, a handmade improvised explosive device (IED) exploded near the office of a food outlet along the GT Road in Islamabad city.The windowpanes of the adjacent building were broken; however, no casualty was reported. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

A state-run girls school in the limits of City Police Station was partially damaged in an explosion.Unidentified armed men had planted explosives to the boundary wall of the Government Girls High School in Dhub Banda.The gate and boundary wall of the school were damaged in the blast. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

A policeman was killed and three others were injured when a remote-controlled bomb blast occurred that targeted a police mobile, militants had planted the bomb at a bridge at Tank-Wana Road.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Unidentified armed men planted explosives inside the two-room building of Said Akbar Kali Girls School in Bakarabad locality of Ghundi area in Jamrud and blew it up.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

A police constable died and four other policemen were injured when their vehicle was hit by an IED remote-controlled bomb, while they were on routine patrolling in South Waziristan near Grah Phathar. The device was planted by the road.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

A man was killed and three others injured in a remote-controlled bombing in a seminary in the Mushti Mela area of Orakzai Agency.Unidentified armed men fixed a bomb in the room of Madrassa during Friday prayers. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

A bomb planted near the house of police constable exploded,the main gate of the house was destroyed and the boundary wall was partially damaged, no loss of life or injury was reported. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
Two people were killed in a remote-controlled explosion in Naseerabad.A powerful bomb exploded in the Notal area of Naseerabad district. There was no claim of responsibility for the attack.

In a target attack a PML (N) member escaped a life attempt but sustained injures in an attack in a bombing near his vehicle near West Bypass in the troubled city. He was on his way to Quetta international airport to travel to Karachi.The lawmaker and his guard sustained injuries.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

A man was killed and 10 others were injured in a bomb blast in Bakhtiarabad Domki area.A motorcycle rigged with an improvised explosive device, parked at the Bhag Chowk taxi stand by suspected militants went off with a big bang. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Gas pipeline was blown up in restive Dera Bugti area of Balochistan. Unidentified people had fitted an explosive device to the gas pipeline in Pir Koh area of Dera Bugti that went off with a huge blast and destroyed a huge portion of the pipeline.As a result, gas supply to the purification plant from the gas well was suspended.Nobody was hurt in the explosion.
Two people were killed and several others injured in a bomb blast in Bakhtiarabad in Sibi. The bomb was planted in a motorcycle.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

At least 10 people including a woman were killed and six others critically injured in a bomb explosion.The blast occurred in a guest house (hujra) near a mosque in Pirano Kale of Bara Akakhel area of TirahValley in Khyber Agency.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Unidentified armed men carried out two explosions at a girl's school in Bannu completely destroying the building. Militants blasted the girl's school in Hawaid area of Bannu which destroyed the school building. No loss of life was reported as the building was vacant at the time of the explosion.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
Some unidentified militants had fitted explosive device on gas pipeline which blew up with a huge explosion in Kachlak area near Quetta.

A suicide bomber blew him self at the gate of a Government school in Hangu district killing a student on the spot.The suicide bomber approached the gate of a government school in Ibrahim Zai area some 20 kilometers from the city on Kohat road in the school uniform and detonated his explosive laded vest.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
Unidentified armed men on a motor bike lobbed a hand grenade on a police station, in Quetta, injuring a cop.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

A police van was on a routine patrol in Regi Model Town, Peshawar, when an explosive material was detonated closed to the vehicle. The blast that damaged the Police mobile seriously wounded four people including police officials. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
An explosion rocked the Tehsil Shab Qadar of Charsadda, explosives were detonated in front of the residence located at Saro in Shab Qadar.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

An explosion injured at least seven people in Lower Kurram tribal region.The explosion occurred in a vegetable market in Sada bazaar area of Lower Kurram Agency. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Four policemen including Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP) were killed and ten injured in a powerful bomb blast at Lyari Expressway, near Essa Nagri.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
In a target attack a man sustained injuries in a hand grenade blast at Badaber area.The incident occurred at village Suleman Khel.

On January 11, unidentified armed men hurled a hand grenade at the house of an ANP leader, within the jurisdictions of Sharafi Goth police station, in Karachi city (Sindh). There were no reports of injured. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Twin bomb blasts claimed lives of six security officials and left two injured, deployed on the security of Prime Minister's Advisor Ameer Muqam a leader from PMLN, in village Martung of Shangla district.The security van escorting the convoy was damaged in the attack.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
A policeman was killed and another sustained injury in a bomb blast near a checkpoint in the limits of Regi Model Town police station.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of India (2004-2014) Border Security Force
NOTES: Reports of Indian shelling across the LoC on Jan 11. In AJK, 1 civilian was injured and houses were damaged in Goi village, Tatta Pani sector, Kotli tehsi/district. No mention of Pakistani retaliation.

A roadside remote-controlled bomb blast in Khyber killed two volunteers of the Amn Committee.Bomb was installed at a roadside in Khyber's Zakakhel area near a barricaded post of Amn Committee. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

On January 15, unidentified armed men attacked the house of adviser to chief minister on prisons affairs with hand grenades, damaging its main gate, in Karak (Khyber Pakhtunkhwa). However, there was no loss of life. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

A convoy of FC personnel was travelling from Central Kurram to Tull region when it struck a landmine in the Tora Wari area, leaving three Frontier Corps (FC) personnel severely injured. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

A member of the security forces was killed and another injured in a remote-controlled bomb blast in Sadukhel area of Landikotal tehsil in Khyber Agency.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
A bomb blast at a preaching centre of the Tableeghi Jamaat in Peshawar killed at least nine people and wounded more than 60 people.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
A bomb blast occurred near petrol pump in Kohlu district of Balochistan province, killing one person and injuring several others.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
On January 17th, a boy was killed while another wounded after an unexploded shell found near Kanait Datot village, Fatehpur district, exploded.

Four people were killed and 65 injured when a passenger train derailed following a bomb explosion on its tracks in southern Punjab in Rojhan sub-district of Rajanpur. The Baloch Republican Army (BRA) claimed responsibility for the attack.

Two Frontier Corps (FC) officials were severely injured while their vehicle was completely destroyed when an improvised explosive device (IED) went off at a roadside in Mamond tehsil of Bajaur Agency.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Unidentified militants blew up a government educational institution with explosives in Hangu, but no causalities were reported. The militants had planted an explosive material outside Government Boys High School Doaaba in Hangu, which exploded and damaged the building partially.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

A bombing, targeting a security forces convoy, killed 20 people and injured 30 others near Razmak gate in Cantt area of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa's Bannu district. Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed the attack.

Three volunteers of the Akakhel peace lashkar were injured when a bomb planted outside their office exploded in the Zawa area of the Bara tehsil in Khyber Agency. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

At least 13 people including six army personnel were killed and many feared injured in a bomb blast near the RA Bazaar in Rawalpindi. The Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the attack that targeted a joint check post of the police and the Pakistan Army.
A suicide attack near army headquarters in Rawalpindi killed 13 people including five army men.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

At least 36 of the 40 killed during the air strikes by the military forces in the North Waziristan tribal region were foreign fighters. Thirty-three Uzbeks and three Germans were among those killed during the air strikes, at least 15 were injured. They are suspected Islamic Movement of Uzbekistan (IMU) militants. At least 13 were killed near Mir Ali, while 12 more were killed in Miranshah.
In an armed forces operation, bombing by jet fighters, thirteen militants were killed in Mir Ali area of North Wazirstan.They are suspected TTP militants.
In an operation conducted by the armed forces twelve militants were killed in Miranshah bombing by jet fighters in North Wazirstan. They are suspected TTP militants.

At least 24 Shia pilgrims returning from Iran were killed and 40 others wounded when a bomb hit their bus. The attack took place in Khusak area of Kanak District of Mastung, some 45 kilometres from Quetta.Banned organisation Lashkar-e-Jhangvi claimed the responsibility for the attack.

Four militants were killed when jet fighters bombed hideouts in Tirah valley of the Khyber Agency; it was a coordinated operation of the armed forces including the air force.They are suspected TTP militants.

A police mobile van en-route to provide security to the polio campaign workers was targeted in a bomb attack that killed at least seven people, six police men and a bystander and injured nine others in Charsadda district of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa.

At least seven people including six police personnel and a minor were killed and five others were injured in a blast targeting police mobile in Sardheri Bazaar area of district Charsadda.The explosives were fixed in a bicycle that went off with a big bang through remote control device when the police mobile crossed the area and were on their way to provide security to anti-polio teams.
A member of a banned militant group was killed in an explosion in Shalobar area of Bara tehsil in KhyberAgency. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Nineteen bodies were recovered from a pile of rubble after a bombing by the military in the Tirah Valley. The air strikes came in response to the recent surge in militant attacks targeting security forces.They were suspected TTP militants.

A car bomb explosion in the outskirts of the city on Kohat road left at least eight people dead and around a dozen others seriously injured. A number of vehicles were also destroyed and many buildings sustained damages in the blast.No group have claimed responsibility for the attack.

At least three persons including two Frontier Corps (FC) personnel and a local journalist were injured when a roadside remote-controlled bomb exploded in Khyber Agency.Militants had planted an improvised explosive device (IED) along the road that exploded near a college in Landi Kotal area.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

In Khyber Agency, a Frontier Corps (FC) man sustained injuries when a small food supply convoy of forces was struck by a remote control bomb planted by unknown militants in Charwazgai area of tehsil Landi Kotal, sub-division of Khyber Agency.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
Unidentified armed men hurled a hand-grenade on a police van and injured a cop near Hasan Square in Essa Nagri.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

A patrolling party of Frontier Corps (FC) was hit by a remote controlled cycle bomb on Sariab Road of Quetta injuring four passers-by.The bomb was fitted to a bicycle and parked near a fuel station at Sariab Road near Gahi Khan Chowk. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

On January 26, unidentified militants hurled grenades at the residence of Senator in Murtaza area of Tank (Khyber Pakhtunkhwa). However, no loss was reported. The grenade partially damaged the house but all residents remained safe in the attack. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
A policeman was killed and four others injured when an explosion targeted a police vehicle in the Gomal area of Tank district.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

An expolsive device was planted at a hujra by unidentified persons, it partially damaged the hujra in the Ali Masjid area in Jamrud tehsil of Khyber Agency .No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Militants fired three rockets targeting Orakzai tribal region's agency headquarters in Kalaya area. One of the rockets landed in a residential area injuring several locals.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack

Unidentified armed men had installed two bombs at a roadside in the Sarsarang area of Upper Kurram near the Pak-Afghan border.Three women, who were walking on the road, struck the bombs, causing them to explode loudly, one woman was killed and her two daughters sustained injuries.

Rangers and police personnel were collecting evidence from a bomb site in North Nazimabad, when a bomb exploded. One Ranger was killed while four other Rangers, a policeman, rescue worker and bystander were injured in the blast.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
Two people were wounded when unidentified persons threw explosive material at a police mobile near Sohrab Goth in Karachi.
At least two people were injured in a hand grenade explosion near Rangers check post in Nazimabad.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

A suicide bombing, took place outside the main entrance of the headquarters of Pakistan Rangers Sacchal Wing, two rangers and the security guard of the nearby telephone exchange were killed and two passersby were wounded in the attack.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

One person was killed and 18 others were injured in a blast in Dera Allah Yar.The blast took place at Jamali bypass near Dera Allah Yar in a parked van.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Unidentified persons planted an IED in a car, which was parked near a roadside hotel on the Sindh-Balochistan highway in Dera Allahyar, two people; including a rickshaw driver, died and 18 others were wounded.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

A bus driver was killed and 9 passengers were injured as the bus they were travelling in ran over a landmine in Nasserabad, Balochistan.The passenger bus was on its way from Shahpur to Dera Murad Jamali when ran over landmine in Chattar area,no goup has claimed responsibility for the attack.
A police vehicle was attack with a remote controlled explosive device in the Shabqadar area of Charsadda. The vehicle was damaged but the police personnel remained unharmed.
An FC convoy vehicle was attacked with an IED in Charsadda. FC personnel remained unhurt.
A police vehicle was damaged by an IED explosion in Nowshera. Police personnel remained unhurt.
2 policemen were injured when unidentified armed men attacked their police station with hand grenades in Karachi.

Two explosions inside a cinema hall in the city of Peshawar killed at least five people and injured more than 30. This attack came a day after the TTP: Tehreek-e-Taliban nominated a five-member committee tto negotiated peace with the Government of the ISlamic Republic of Pakistan. TTP denied responsibility for thr attack.
5 people were killed and 20 injured in a grenade attack by an unidentified armed group at a movie theater in Peshawar.
9 people were killed and 50 wounded in a suicide bomb blast targeting a hotel in Peshawar.
A child was killed and 8 people were injured in an IED explosion targeting a passenger coach in Karachi. BRA claimed responsibility for the attack.
2 people were injured in a roadside bomb explosion in Kurram Agency.
A planted bomb exploded in the container boundary which was set up to secure a police station in Peshawar. No casualties were reported as a result of the explosion.
On February 8, an explosive set by unidentified armed men was detonated at the Technical Training Center in Sohbatpur town (Sohbatpur, Balochistan). No Injuries are reported in the source.
8 people were killed and 8 injured when an unidentified armed group attacked a Sufi gathering with hand grenades and gunfire in Karachi.
A roadside bomb struck a polio vaccination team in the village of Khugekhel, wounding three security troops who were escorting the team.
3 FC personnel were injured when a planted road side bomb targeting their vehicle was detonated in Landi Kotal.
4 security forces personnel were injured when a remote controlled bomb targeting their vehicle was detonated in Dattakhel.
4 people were killed and 5 injured when a suicide bomber targeting the funeral of an IDP detonated his explosives inside a house in Peshawar.
13 people were killed and 20 injured when an unidentified man threw hand grenades inside a movie theater in Peshawar. TTP denied responsibility for the attack.
19 FC personnel were injured when a remote controlled bomb targeting their convoy was detonated in Sibi. BLA claimed responsibility for the attack.
Pakistani jets carried out airstrikes against Taliban hideouts in North Waziristan, killing at least 15 people.
At least 8 policemen were killed and 20 people were injured when a sucide bomber drove his vehicle into a police bus in Karachi. TTP claimed responsibility for the attack.
A rangers vehicle was destroyed by a suicide bomber targeting rangers officials in Karachi.
8 people were wounded in a blast targeting a police vehicle in Peshawar.
4 people were injured in a hand grenade attack followed by a planted bomb explosion in Karachi.
Unidentified anti-education elements blew up a government primary school for boys in Thorawri area in Hangu, however no casualty was reported in the incident.
The BRA: Baloch Republican Army, claimed responsibility for planting a bomb that derailed a train in Kashmor. 8 people were killed and 20 were injured in the event.
7 people were killed and 30 injured in an IED explosion targeting a passenger train in Jacobabad.
1 policeman was killed in an explosion in Peshawar.
The offices of a television channel came under bomb attack in Karachi. The bomb destroyed the guard post of the building and the security guard suffered minor injuries.
15 people were injured in a planted bomb explosion outside a private school in an area of Karak.
1 person was injured in a planted bomb attack at a hotel in Peshawar.
23 militants were killed, many of them Uzbek fighters, in precision airstrikes by Pakistani forces in North Waziristan.
7 militants were killed in precision airstrikes by Pakistani forces in Khyber Agency.
15 militants were killed in an air strike by the Pakistan Airforce in North Waziristan.
1 person was killed in an IED explosion in Sibi.
9 militants were killed in an air strike by Pakistani forces in Thall.
2 people were killed including a Qaumi Watan Party leader when they were targeted by a remote controlled bomb in Buner.
1 person was killed and 6 others injured when their vehicle stuck a landmine in Dera Bugti.
At least 12 people were killed and 16 injured in a bomb blast at a public vehicles stand in Kohat. A militant group headed by 'Major' Mast Gul (TTP member) claimed responsibility for the attack.
30 militants were killed in air strikes by Pakistani forces in Tirah Valley.
Mortar shells fired by an unidentified armed group struck the houses of 2 tribesmen in Jamrud.
An FC major was injured in an IED explosion targeting his vehicle in Jamrud.
3 FC personnel and 1 civilian were killed and 8 others injured when a suicide bomber detonate his explosives outside the Iranian consulate in Peshawar.
A child was killed in a hand grenade explosion in Peshawar.
30 militants were killed in air strikes by Pakistani forces in North Waziristan.
1 person was injured in a bomb explosion near a school in Rawalpindi.
1 person was injured when militants threw a hand grenade at the house of a police official in Bannu.
1 person was injured when militants attacked a school with a hand grenade in North Waziristan.
No casualties were reported in an explosion targeting the house of a Khassadar official in Jamrud.
Unidentified militants detonated a roadside bomb as a military convoy was passing through Surab tehsil. The blast killed three military personnel.
Vehicle of Frontier Corps was targeted by an improvised explosive device in Kalat. Three soldiers were killed while six were injured. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
Gunship helicopters targeted militant hideouts in Jamrud, killing five militants and injuring nine people of which six were militants. The militant group targeted has not been identified.

A series of explosions and rocket attacks killed 2 and injured a dozen others during a Baloch Culture Day in Lyari Town on Sunday. Unidentified militants used explosives in the Baghdadi and Chakiwara areas of the Town. The motive behind the attack remains unknown.
Security forces carried out airstrikes in Bara tehsil on Sunday. The airstrikes targeted Shalobar, Akakhel and Malik Denkhel areas. Five TTP militants were killed during the incident.

Unidentified militants attacked the District Court in Islamabad on Monday. The militants hurled hand grenades and open fired on civilians and lawyers. Two suicide bombers took part in the attack. The incident killed 11 civilians and injured 20 others, in addition to the two suicide bombers.

Suspected TTP militants planted an explosive device along the roadside in Zakhakhel area of Landi Kotal tehsil. Passing through the area, a Frontier Corps convoy was hit by the explosion. The incident killed two and injured nine others.
Suspected TTP militants planted an IED in a field near Speenkai Saly area of Pringhar tehsil. The blast killed a tribesman.
Three security personnel were killed and 11 others injured when a security convoy was targeted with a remote-controlled bomb in Parachinar.
Unidentified militants planted explosive devices outside a school in Rawalpindi's Ratta Amral area. The explosion injured 1 civilian.
Baloch militants planted explosives at Goth Machi Railway Station in Ghotki. The explosion caused minor damage to the track and delays to service.

Six soldiers were killed whereas eight others sustained injuries when a secrity forces convoy was targeted through an improvised explosive device. Ansar-ul-Mujahideen claimed responsibility for the attack

On 5 March 2014, a military convoy was targeted by an IED device in Ormegi village in Tora Warai (FR Tank, FATA). Suspected TTP militants planted the device in the area. The blast killed 6 and injured 8 others.
A political agent (Kurram Riaz Mehsud) was attacked by suspected TTP militants through an IED blast which targeted their convoy.
Suspected TTP militants threw a hand-grenade into a bakery in Jiwani Town on Saturday. The blast injured ten.
Two persons, including a woman, were injured when a time explosive device exploded on Dalazak road in Peshawar. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

Two security personnel were injured in a remote-controlled bomb attack. These personnel were deployed for the security of the gase pipeline in Nasirabad district. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

Ahrar-ul-Hind militants attacked a military armoured vehicle in Sarband area of Peshawar. A suicide bomber targeted the vehicle as it was waiting at a petrol station. Seven people were killed and 30 others injured.

Suspected Afghani militants planted explosive devices on a bicycle at Science College Chowk in Quetta. The device exploded as military troops were passing through the area. Eleven people were killed and 35 others injured.

Suspected TTP militants planted a remote-controlled explosive device outside the cement factory (Cherat Cement) in Lakari area of Nowshera. The blast caused damage to a van and a police vehicle in the area. No injuries were reported.
Suspected TTP militants planted an explosive device in Shah Qabool area of Peshawar. The blast killed 1 and injured two others.
Suspected TTP militants planted a remote-controlled explosive device outside a residential property belonging to PML-N Saleem Khan. The explosion caused minor damage, but no injuries were reported.
On March 19, unidentified militants threw a hand grenade at the residential property of ANP leader Alam Zeb in Orangi Town's Quaide-Awam Colony in Karachi. The blast caused no injuries.
Five people were injured in a bombing at Sarki Gate, Peshawar. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

On March 20, suspected Baloch Separatists threw a hand grenade into the Pakistan Telecommunication Limited Exchange offices in Khuzdar (Balochistan). The blast caused moderate damage, but no loss of life or injuries were reported.
Suspected Afghani militants fired mortar shells into Pakistan's Bangidara village in Ghulam Khan tehsil. The blasts caused no loss of life or injuries.
Suspected TTP militants planted an IED along the roadside near Landi Kotal bazaar on Monday. The blast injured three Tawhidul Islam volunteers.
Suspected TTP militants planted an explosive device in a rickshaw along Sariab Road passing through central Quetta. Targeting an Frontier Corps vehicle, the blast injured 14 people.

One child was killed and 18 injured which included three Frontier Corps personnel, women and children in a bomb attack. The bomb, planted in a rickshaw, exploded when a security forces vehicle was passing through the area. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
A girl was killed and 18 other people were injured in a bomb explosion on Sariab Road in Quetta.

A suspected militant was blew himself up after an encounter with the police which took place in the limits of Ghauriwala Police Station. As the police signalled for the militant to stop, he didn't, and then fell from the bike, sustaining injuries, before blowing himself up.
On March 30, unidentified persons hurled a hand-grenade at a shrine in Kulachi tehsil (Khyber Pakhtunkhwa). However, no loss of life occurred in the blast.
Twelve people sustained injuries when unidentified men hurled a hand-grenade at a workshop in Peshawar.
Unidentified persons planted an explosive device near the house of Sajidullah in an area of Hangu, which caused partial damage to the building. There was no loss of life.
A blast in front of a house in Zargarabad area of Peshawar left three people injured, including two women and a child on Sunday.

Two people,railway police constable and a passenger were killed and six others, including two women were wounded after Quetta-Lahore bound Akbar Bugti passenger train was attacked by militants in Bolan District of Balochistan. Militants fired rocket propelled grenades and fired with automatic weapons on the train. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
Two people were injured when a blast took place near a seminary on University Road in Karachi.
Six students were wounded in a blast near a local seminary in Shahdadpur district of Sindh.

An explosion occurred near a contingent of security forces in Datta Khel district of North Waziristan.All the security personnel remained safe and no causalities were reported in the incident.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
In Karachi, a planted bomb exploded outside the Mosque, leaving two children wounded. No caualities were recorded.
A 10-year-old boy was killed and four others were wounded when an explosive they found in the garbage detonated in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa's Nowshera town.

In a bomb blast near Faizabad interchange in Islamabad targeting former president General Pervez Musharraf, the convoy transporting him from the Armed Forces Institute of Cardiology (AFIC) to his farmhouse in Chak Shahzad passed by moments before the explosion, there were no casualties.It is suspected that TTP was involved.
A Frontier Corps man was killed and two others were injured in a landmine explosion in Dera Bugti. The security forces suspected the Baloch militants to be responsible for the attack.
Seven people were injured in a hand grenade explosion in Jaffarabad district on Saturday. Unidentified motorcyclists hurled a hand grenade at a shop, damaging several shops.
At least 12 mortar shells fired from Afghanistan fell into North Waziristan on Saturday.

On April 6, unknown men hurled a hand grenade at the house of a journalist in Jhang city (Punjab). However, the journalist, Jamshid Baghwan, remained unhurt. The blast also damaged nearby houses in the area.
Two boys were injured in a blast that occurred in a playground near Sariab railway station in Quetta.
A 16-inch diameter gas transmission pipeline running from Pirkoh gas field was blown up on Sunday, which completely cut off supply of gas from the wells to the plant in Dera Bugti.
