A boy was killed and three others injured when a hand grenade exploded in Bahawalnagar. They were playing with the grenade lying in an exercise area of army when it exploded.
Four people were killed on Miranshah Razmak Road on Monday evening when a car came under a rocket fire. The incident took place near Tal village.
A planted low-intensity improvised explosive device went off near Perfume Chowk in Gulistan-e-Jauhar in Karachi. The explosion damaged a car.
A shop was targeted with a hand grenade in the limits of Clifton police station in Karachi, where a woman, Ghazala Syed, assumed her office as Station House Officer (SHO) Tuesday.

On April 8, an explosive exploded in the up-market neighbourhood of Zamzam of Karachi city (Sindh). The attack caused panic to spread in the area and forced shops to close. Police believed it to be a detonated grenade.
A bomb explosion was reported at a store in Karachi where a child was also reported to have been injured.
A police check post in Karachi was attacked when unidentified armed men hurled a hand grenade that left Deputy Superintendent of Police (DSP) Rana Ghulam Muhammad injured.

A portion of the railway track in Kotri area was damaged as a result of a blast on Tuesday evening. After the first blast, another low-intensity blast occurred at a railway track in Sehrish Nagar area, but no casualties were reported in the blast.

A portion of the railway track in Kotri area was damaged as a result of a blast on Tuesday evening. According to sources, the blast damaged a portion of the railway track near Khursheed Colony in Kotri area but no casualties were reported in the blast.

At least 12 passengers were killed and more than 30 wounded on Tuesday when militants bombed a train in Sibi of Balochistan province. There was no claim of responsibility but the security forces suspected Baloch Separatist to be behind the attack.
A number of bombs went off at numerous locations in Sindh, including five in Hyderabad in just fifteen minutes.

At least 17 people were killed and 46 others injured in a bomb attack on Rawalpindi bound Jaffar Express at Sibi Railway Station. Five children were among the dead. The Baloch Liberation Army claimed responsibility for the attack.

At least 23 people were killed and nearly 120 injured when a powerful bomb went off at a crowded market place in Islamabad.It took place at a wholesale fruit and vegetable market in I-10 sector.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

On April 4, two men on a motorcycle hurled a hand grenade at Awami National Party (ANP) leader's house in Mehran Town in Karachi city (Sindh), no casualties resulted in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
A woman and her minor daughter were seriously injured when they stepped on a landmine in Baizai tehsil in Mohmand Agency on Wednesday.
A railway track on Wednesday was blown up, minutes after an Awami Express train passed through the Sarhari railway station of Nawabshah.There have been no casualties or injuries.
A bomb exploded in a fruit and vegetable market in Islamabad, killing at least 18 people and leaving dozens more wounded.
At least five people were killed and multiple injured on Wednesday when an explosion occurred in a hotel near the Mandi Mor area of Rawalpindi.
A motorcyclist was killed when an explosive device fitted to his bike went off in the Spin Thall area in Hangu district, on Thursday.
Four people, including two children, were wounded when an improvised explosive device (IED) went off near a police post at Dir Town on Dalazak Road in Peshawar on Thursday evening.

Barely minutes after an Awam Express train passed through the Sarhari railway station in Nawabshah, a blast occurred on one of its tracks, there have been no reports of casualties or serious injuries.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

A roadside bomb blast hit a vehicle in Datta Khel area of North Waziristan, killing three people and injuring two others.The bomb was planted on the roadside and was triggered with a remote controlled device. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
Unidentified armed men fired a rocket at a vehicle in the Shawal area that killed six people on spot and left four injured who died in the hospital.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
A remote control bomb planted by the roadside in Dattakhel targeted a vehicle that killed three persons and two sustained injuries.
A rocket fired on a vehicle at Shawal killed 10 persons.
A man was injured in an explosion in Quetta on Saturday. According to police, unknown men had placed explosive devices in a box of bananas which went off.
A bomb exploded near the offices of the Intelligence Bureau and Balochistan National Party-Mengal in Quetta. No one was hurt in the incident.
A woman sustained injuries in a hand grenade attack on the house of district president of the PML-N Khuzdar, Agha Shakeel Durrani, on Monday.
Unidentified armed men planted explosives near the house of Janan, a female singer in Peshawar which partially damaged the building.

On April 14, unidentified armed men hurled hand grenade on a house of Muhammad Saleem Khan in Peshawar city (Khyber Pakhtunkhwa). As result of hand grenade attack, boundary wall and panes of house were damaged; however, no causality occurred.
A 16-inch diameter gas pipeline was blown up in Dera Bugti on Tuesday, suspending gas supply to the Sui plant from five pipelines.
Unidentified persons fired rockets at the house of a tribesman in Dhari Banda on Tuesday. The sources said unidentified persons fired rockets at the house from the nearby fields.
A house was damaged in a blast in an area of Hangu on Tuesday. They said that unidentified persons had placed explosives outside the house of Muhammad Raziq in Gharibo Killay.
Helicopter gunships attacked militant hideouts near Miranshah after a security man was injured in a roadside explosion.
An improvised explosive device went off on Ghulam Khan Road near Saidgee check post, north of Miranshah, when security personnel were carrying water from a nearby spring. One of them was injured.
One person was injured and several houses were damaged when an improvised explosive device went off outside the residence of a PPP leader in Karachi on Wednesday morning.

Awami National Party's leader came under attack as remote control blast hit his Vehicle in Charsadda.The blast occurred at Sar-Dhari area of Charsadda.The ANP leader was amongst three people who sustained injuries.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
A suicide attack took place in a election meeting of Awami National Party in the Peshawar area of Yakatoot, killed seventeen people.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Two people were wounded in a landmine blast in Marjanzai area of Loralai district on Wednesday. They said the landmine was planted along a roadside and went off when a motorcycle carrying two people hit it.
Two houses were partially damaged when an explosive device planted near a house went off in Kohat Development Authority township, on Thursday.

Explosions took place in the weapons depot of the Frontier Corps Khyber Rifles in the Khyber tribal region.The depot is located in a fort in Khyber's Landi Kotal area.The depot was completely burnt.No casualties have so far been reported.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
A four-inch diameter gas pipeline was blown up in Sibi, about 145 southeast of Quetta, on Saturday morning, suspending gas supply to Khajak Town which is the second largest village in the district.
On April 19, unidentified persons hurled a hand-grenade at the tent of a peace committee member in Nowshera (Khyber Pakhtunkhwa). Sources said the hand-grenade was lobbed at the tent of Anwar Khan.
A gas pipeline was blown up by unidentified militants in Kandhkot. Gas supply to most of the cities of the province remained suspended.

At least six people were killed and more than 45 others were injured in a powerful explosion in Nichari road area of Quetta.The banned Lashkar-e-Jabbar (alias Lashkar-i-Jhangvi (LJ) claimed responsibility for the attack.

At least eight people, including two paramilitary troops, were wounded in a blast at Qandhari Market area of Mall Road Chaman, the Pak-Afghan Border city.Paramilitary Frontier Corps convoy was coming towards the mess when the FC's vehicles reached near by the Market, a bomb planted inside the motorbike exploded.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Six people, including five policemen and an ambulance driver were killed in an attack on a police patrol on the outskirts of the regional capital of Peshawar, three people were also injured in the attack.A bomb was planted on a motorcycle.It is suspected that TTP carried out the attack.
Unidentified armed men lobbed a hand grenade outside Kechi Baig Police Station in Saryab area of Quetta which resulted injuries to two cops. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Thirteen people including two children were injured in a bomb blast in Quetta's Satellite Town area. The blast occurred near a private hospital and the bomb was planted on a bicycle which was detonated using a remote control. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Four people including a former police officer was killed in targeted suicide bomb attack in Karachi.Former police officer came under attack when he was sitting with friends at a shop at old 'Sabzi Mandi' area.Around 15 people were also injured in the attack.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Four people were killed while 30 others sustained injuries in an explosion in the Delhi Colony area of Karachi. A timed IED device was planted in a rickshaw, loaded with ball bearings and nut blots.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

A powerful bomb exploded in the residential area killing four people and wounding 25.The attack took place in the neighborhood of Clifton in Karachi. The bomb badly damaged several vehicles and a nearby multi-story building.No one has claimed responsibility for the attack.

In a suicide attack a police officer and three others were killed in Karachi.The explosion took place in a tailor's shop near police officer's residence in city's Old Sabzi Mandi area.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

A bomb blast took place targeting a bus carrying members of the minority Shiite sect, it missed its intended target. The attack took place on the main road outside a Sunni mosque in the upscale Defence neighbourhood, just after Friday congregational prayers had ended and worshipers had started leaving.The bomb was planted in a rickshaw on the road that the bus was taking and detonated by remote control, The bus was hit and some passengers were injured.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

At least six people were killed and two dozen wounded in an explosion that occurred outside a mosque at Gizri locality. The explosive device had been planted on a rickshaw parked outside a mosque at Chaudhry Khaliq-uz-Zaman Road, Clifton.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

A roadside bomb planted by militants along the road exploded in Pakistan's tribal region near the Afghan border, killing at least three soldiers and three others were injured. The attack occurred in an area on the border of South and North Waziristan tribal regions. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Four persons, including a child, were killed while several others were injured when unidentified armed motorcyclists threw a hand grenade at a seminary on the Frontier roundabout on 28 April 2014, in the SITE area of Karachi.

A hand grenade attack on a religious school in the Pakistani commercial center of Karachi killed at least three people and injured nearly a dozen more people.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

A young man was killed when an explosive device planted outside the house of a transporter in the SITE area went off. The bomb planted outside the house in Metroville, Block-3, was detonated through a time device. The door to the house was damaged and a passerby was injured.
A roadside improvised explosive device went off near a security check post in Khyber Agency when NATO trucks were passing through the area. No damage to human life was reported.
A basic health unit was blown up by suspected TTP militants in Aqrab Dag, Shabqadar on 30 April 2014. No casualties reported.
A Government Girls Primary School was blown up in Mashu Khwar, Shabqadar on 30 April 2014 by suspected TTP militants. No casualties reported.
Five children were killed in a toy bomb explosion inside a religious seminary.It took place in Karachi's Frontier Colony.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Six militants, including a key commander of the Sajna TTP group, were killed and three others sustained injuries when an RC bomb planted on a roadside exploded at Shaktoi locality of South Waziristan Agency on 30 April 2014. Sources said it was a result of ongoing infighting between Sajna and Shehryar Mehsud factions of the Taliban.

A road side blast in South Waziristan left five people dead on the spot and three others injured. Explosive material was planted on the side of a road in Ladha tehsil and was exploded via a remote control.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
Suspected Baloch separatists blew up an eight-inch diameter gas pipeline with remote explosives in Pir Koh area of Dera Bugti on 1 May 2014.
At least one man was killed and another injured in a hand grenade attack by unidentified armed men on a transporter's house in Metroville, SITE, Karachi on 1 May 2014.
Suspected TTP militants blew up a girls primary school and a boys primary school with planted explosives in Darwazgai, Mohmand Agency on 1 May 2014. No casualties occurred.
Suspected TTP militants blew up a girls primary school with planted explosives in Saro Kalley, Charsadda on 1 May 2014. No casualties occurred.

An explosive device planted by suspected TTP militants near the main gate of the Hameed Akbar Private Medical Centre in Hangu went off at night, damaging its boundary wall and main entrance on 1 May 2014. No injuries were reported, but this was the second attack on this medical centre; in the first one, six patients were injured.
Seven people (including a policeman) were injured in a bomb blast by unidentified armed men at Chandni Chowk, Khuzdar on 2 May 2014. They were hospitalized, some with critical injuries.

Suspected TTP militants fired three rockets in three places from an undisclosed location in Bannu, 2 May 2014. One hit a mosque near a filling station, causing partial damage to its building. The second rocket hit the house of Abbas Khattak in Kot Adil Colony damaging a room while the third rocket landed in an empty place. No casualty was reported.
Four soldiers sustained injuries caused by an IED planted by suspected TTP militants on the Malam Jabba road in Swat district on 2 May 2014.
A security forces convoy was attacked by an explosive roadside device planted by suspected Baloch separatists in Naag, Washuk on 2 May 2014. No injuries were reported, but the vehicle was damaged.
Two people were injured when an IED planted by unidentified persons exploded in Sadda Bazaar, Kurram on 3 May 2014.

A Balochistan Frontier Corps personnel was killed and another injured in a roadside blast on the Quetta-Sibi highway, some 25 kilometers south of Mach town of Bolan district on 3 May 2014. The FC party had been engaged in road clearance between its Bibi Nani and Drinjin posts.
Unidentified men blew up a portion of a railway track in Noshki with an explosive device on 5 May 2014. No loss of life reported.

A state-run school was partially damaged when an improvised explosive device (IED) planted by suspected TTP went off in Bannu on 5 May 2014. The main gate and windows of Government Girls Primary School, Mambati Bargazai were destroyed when the explosive device planted near the premises went off.

Two policemen were wounded and a police van was damaged in a low-intensity bomb blast in North Karachi on 6 May 2014. The police van from the Khwaja Ajmer Nagri police station was on duty near the police post in Baba Morr, North Karachi.

Two oil tankers were partially damaged when two improvised explosive devices (IEDs) went off at the Keamari oil terminal within the jurisdiction of the Jackson police station on 6 May 2014. The blasts occurred at different times and locations; both tankers were empty at the time.
A moving oil tanker was targeted with a timed IED in Shershah on 6 May 2014. The tanker was damaged but did not ignite. No loss of life reported.
2 TTP members were killed and 2 injured in a motorcycle bomb attack in Miranshah on 6 May 2014 as a result of ongoing infighting between Sajna and Shehryar Mehsud factions of the Taliban.
At least two people were killed and one person injured on 6 May 2014 in an IED blast which occurred in the Miranshah bazaar of North Waziristan. TTP is suspected.

On 6 May 2014, at least two persons (later reported to be members of a peace committee (Aman Lashkar) were killed and three others injured in a roadside remote controlled bomb blast in Zakhakhel of Landi Kotal tehsil (Khyber Agency).
A volunteer of peace committee was killed when an improvised explosive device (IED) went off at Shalobar area of Khyber Agency on 7 May 2014.

On 8 May 2014, 9 Frontier Corps personnel were killed and several others were injured as a security forces convoy was targeted with an IED in Ghulam Khan Tehsil of North Waziristan tribal region. TTP is suspected.
Suspected TTP blew up a boys' primary school in Kamangara, Tehsil Nawagai on 8 May 2014.

2 persons were killed and 10 injured in a blast that occurred on a busy Double Road area of Quetta, capital of Balochistan, on 8 May 2014. The blast occurred near NADRA office at Double road during rush hour. Baloch separatist groups may be involved.
At least four persons sustained injuries in a blast outside a shop near Meena Bazaar on 8 May 2014.
2 civilians were killed and fifteen injured in a remote-control explosion in Quetta on 8 May 2014. The bomb, attached to a bicycle, was targeting a passing police patrol vehicle.
Two houses were partially damaged in an IED blast in Tora Warai area in the limits of Doaba Police Station on 9 May 2014. No casualties reported.

Two brothers were wounded by an IED detonating in Marhati Banda fields, Nowshera on 9 May 2014. It may have been planted by one of their rivals, with whom a disagreement over tobacco crop harvesting had occurred.

On 9 May 2014, two explosions occurred in Khuzdar Town. Both were targeting police; the first occurred near a police checkpost adjacent to Arbab Complex, in which a passerby was hit by shrapnel. The second took place at Chakar Khan Road area, targeting a police vehicle.
Nine people were injured in a blast near Kohati Gate in Peshawar on 10 May 2014. It was due to a hand grenade being hurled.
3 mortar shells were fired from across the border in Afghanistan and landed in Spinwam, NWA around 10 May 2014. No reported injuries.

A roadside bomb planted by suspected TTP militants killed one paramilitary trooper and injured four others on 11 May 2014 in Pakistan's troubled northwest near the Afghan border. The bomb went off in the Kitkoot area 16 miles (26 km) northwest of Khar.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: TTP: Tehreek-i-Taliban Pakistan
NOTES: Three militants were killed in a blast that took place in the center of banned outfit, Laskar-e-Islam (LI), in Ghaibi Baba area, Tehsil Bara, sub-division of Khyber Agency on 11 May 2014. A heavy bomb exploded inside the premises of LI center that left three fighters, including two from Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan.

Three security personnel were injured when an IED planted by suspected TTP hit their convoy in North Waziristan tribal region on 11 May 2014. The convoy was going to Bannu from Mirali when the improvised explosive device planted along the road at Khajuri went off near one of the vehicles.

2 women were killed and one injured when security forces started shelling an area where an IED blast had taken place near Mir Ali on 11 May 2014. Mortar shells hit residential compouds in Khushali Toorikhel, Haiderkhel (add. Research).

Five people were killed and eight others injured in a blast inside Shah Nawaz football ground in Faqeerabad, Peshawar on 11 May 2014. A suicide bomber entered the area and fired off rounds before detonating; his target was a registration camp for IDPs.
At least 17 people were injured in a grenade attack on Chakar Khan Road, Khuzdar on 11 May 2014.
A bomb blast occurred as a result of an IED planted on a motorbike by unidentified armed men on Barkhan Road in Rakhni area of Loralai district on 12 May 2014. No loss of life reported.
A security guard of a local school was killed in a hand grenade attack on 12 May 2014, when unidentified motorcyclists hurled it at him on his way to the school. They also opened fire on him.
A man was killed when unidentified armed men hurled a hand grenade and then resorted to firing near Gomal Medical College, Dera Ismail Khan on 12 May 2014.
A security man was killed and three others were injured when an improvised explosive device planted by suspected TTP on a roadside went off near Gursal checkpost in Baizai tehsil on 12 May 2014.

A volunteer of Safi peace committee was killed and his driver was seriously injured when his vehicle was hit by a roadside bomb on the katcha track at Ziarat Marble in Safi tehsil of Mohmand Agency on 13 May 2014. TTP claimed responsibility.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: Ten LeI militants were reportedly killed on 14 May 2014 during a US drone strike in Khyber tribal region at the Pak-Afghan border. US drones targeted a LeI militant's compound and some vehicles of the militant group in Khyber tribal region's Nazyan area.
7 people were injured in a blast at Railway Road in Bannu. The explosion targeted a police van and injured primarily police personnel.
A bomb blast by an unidentified group damaged a railway crossing at Mayani in Rojhan town.

2 security forces personnel were killed and at least 11 people injured in 3 remote explosions claimed by the TTP in the Khar area of Bajaur Agency and the Chamarkand area of Safi tehsil in Mohmand Agency.

2 security forces personnel were killed and at least 11 people injured in 3 remote explosions claimed by the TTP in the Khar area of Bajaur Agency and the Chamarkand area of Safi tehsil in Mohmand Agency.
One person was killed and another injured in a landmine blast in the Sui area of Dera Bugti.
A blast by suspected Baloch separatists hit railway tracks in the Dengra area of Bolan (Kachhi) district.

PAF aircraft bombarded positions of local and foreign militants in the Miranshah and Mir Ali tehsils of NWA killing 60. 30 other militants were wounded. Artillery was also used in the assaults. Some commanders were reportedly among the casualties.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Unidentified Armed Group (International)
NOTES: PAF aircraft bombarded positions of local and foreign militants in the Miranshah and Mir Ali tehsils of NWA killing 60. 30 other militants were wounded. Artillery was also used in the assaults. Some commanders were reportedly among the casualties.
5 civilians were injured in a blast targeting the Rangers HQ in North Nazimabad in Karachi Central.
7 civilians were injured after a motorcycle-planted bomb planted by suspected TTP militants exploded near the Pakistan Rangers HQ in North Nazimabad in Karachi Central.

Helicopters and fighter jets assaulted militant hideouts in the Miranshah, Machis Camop and Mir Ali bazaar areas of NWA. 4 militants were reported killed in the Machis Camp area during the airstrikes.

Helicopters and fighter jets assaulted militant hideouts in the Miranshah, Machis Camop and Mir Ali bazaar areas of NWA. 4 militants were reported killed in the Machis Camp area during the airstrikes.
Helicopters and fighter jets assaulted militant hideouts in the Miranshah, Machis Camp and Mir Ali bazaar areas of NWA. 4 militants were reported killed in the Machis Camp area during the airstrikes.
6 security personnel were killed and 3 injured in a remote explosive blast by suspected TTP militants in Pandyali tehsil of Mohmand Agency.
3 soldiers were killed and 3 injured when they hit an IED planted by suspected TTP militants near Nowsher Fort in an area bordering NWA (south of Mir Ali).
3 soldiers were killed and 2 injured when they hit a landmine in the Bannu area.

Explosives planted in a donkey-cart in Baldia Town, Karachi exploded on 31 May 2014, injuring four people. The blast took place near the Muhammad Khan Police checkpost, which suggest policemen were the target; however, none were injured.
A powerful bomb targeting police forces went off near Jehangirabad dry canal in Badaber on 31 May but did not cause any casualty or damage.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Balochistan Levies
NOTES: Three personnel of Levies Force were injured in a grenade attack on Khand Road in Khuzdar on 31 May 2014.
Unidentified persons fired two rockets at Bannu city on 31 May 2014; one hit a mosque and another landed near a house. No casualties reported.
A man was injured in a remote-controlled bomb blast in Pasni area of Balochistan on 1 June 2014.
A tribesman was injured when an improvised explosive device planted by unidentified armed men exploded in Pandilai, Mohmand Agency on a dirt road around 1 June 2014.
A man was killed and two injured when unidentified armed men hurled a grenade at a shop on Tariq Road in Karachi on 1 June 2014.
A son of an MNA from BNP-Mengal was injured when a remote-controlled bomb hit his vehicle in Pasni town of Gwadar district on 2 June 2014.
Two security personnel were injured when an improvised explosive device exploded in Pandiali tehsil of Mohmand tribal region on 2 June 2014.
A man was injured when a hand-grenade was lobbed into a house on the outskirts of Khuzdar town early on 2 June 2014.
Two people were injured when a RC bomb went off on 2 June 2014 on the rail track linking Quetta with Iran in the Peshuk area, some 29km east of Dalbandin town in Chagai district.
An IED blast occurred on National Highway near Soniji Goshak area of Khuzdar district on 2 June 2014, no casualty was reported.
At least 7 were killed and as many injured when an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) exploded near a station wagon car in Khomta area of Kurram Agency on 3 June 2014.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand-grenade at the residence of Qaumi Watan Party (QWP) leader in Paharipura, Peshawar on 3 June 2014. No injuries reported.
2 military personnel and three civilians were killed by suspected. TTP in a suicide attack in Tarnol, Rawalpindi when their car was targeted on 4 June 2014. 6 total casualties.
A suicide bomber hit a bus carrying security agency personnel around 4 June 2014, leaving four injured in Fatah Jang railway crossing, Attock. TTP later claimed responsibility.
Two tribesmen were injured when an improvised explosive device exploded in Pandiali tehsil of Mohmand tribal region on 5 June 2014.

Two men were killed and four others wounded in a bomb explosion outside Al-Mustafa mosque in the militancy-infested Orangi Town area on 5 June 2014. It did not appear to be suicide bombing, but the police believed that one of the deceased was allegedly preparing the explosive or transporting it when it detonated due to some mishandling.
At least 5 people sustained injuries in a blast outside a mosque in Karachi on 5 June 2014. It was carried out with a planted device.
A volunteer of peace committee was killed and another got injuries in a roadside explosion in Mamond tehsil of Bajaur Agency on 5 June 2014.
A grenade attack on the residence of a Levies Force official here left a girl injured on 6 June 2014 in Khuzdar.
On 7 June 2014, a soldier lost his life in a second IED blast in Kamrang area of Bara. TTP claimed responsibility.
One FC soldier was killed and another was injured in a roadside blast on 7 June 2014 in the Nawagai tehsil of northwestern Pakistan's Bajaur tribal region.
On 7 June 2014, an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) went off near a Pakistani checkpost at the Pak-Afghan border, killing one soldier in Bajaur Agency. TTP claimed responsibility.
Peace committee member was killed when a roadside bomb exploded on 8 June 2014 in Ambar district.
2 people were injured in an explosion in Sabzal Raod, Quetta on 8 June 2014. It was a roadside bomb explosion.

On 9 June 2014, three soldiers were killed and 12 injured, including two civilian women passersby, when an explosive laden vehicle struck security forces checkpoint in North Waziristan Agency's Boya area. A child was also killed

Iranian border guards fired two dozen rockets into Panjgur, Balochistan province on 9 June 2014, near an FC checkpost. No casualties were reported. Iran then closed its border with Pakistan following an attack on Taftan.
On 9 June 2014, at least two FC men died and three were injured in an explosion in Awaran.
15 suspected. TTP militants were killed in Tirah Valley, Khyber Agency on 10 June 2014 during military airstrikes.
Three rooms of a police station and nearby mosque were damaged in an explosion in Dera Bugti on 10 June 2014. No casualties reported. More explosives were later found.
TTP militants fired rockets and hurled hand grenades at the internally displaced person (IDPs) camp in Togh Serai Muhammad Khwaja on 10 June 2014 in Hangu. No loss of life occurred.
A camel died in a landmine explosion by unidentified armed men in Dera Bugti town area of Balochistan on 11 June 2014.
A peace committee member was injured in a roadside blast in Kamangara area in Nawagai tehsil on 11 June 2014.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On June 11, a US drone launched a first strike in Pakistan for nearly 6 months due to the failed peace talks between TTP and the Pakistani government. This strike hit a house and a vehicle in the Darga Mandi area of Ghulam Khan tehsil in N.Waziristan. 6 militants died - 4 from the Islamic Movement of Uzbekistan and 2 more from TTP.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On June 12, a US drone fired multiple missiles at a house storing explosives in Darga Mandi in Ghulam Khan tehsil in N.Waziristan (the same village as the strike on 11th of June). At least 6 militants died in the attack, with a further 4 injured, with the majority belonging to the Haqqani network, but including a couple of TTP commanders as well.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: Key militant commanders from Haqqani network and Afghan Taliban were killed on early Thursday in a US drone strike in Dand-e-Darpakhel area of North Waziristan on 12 June 2014.
Militants damaged the building of a government primary school for girls in Mian Dheri area here by blasting an explosive device early on 12 June 2014 in Swabi. No loss of life reported.

A 10-year-old was killed when a mortar shell fired from Afghanistan landed in Sheen Pokh, a border village in Loey Shalman area of Landikotal tehsil in Khyber Agency on 13 June 2014. Four mortar shells were fired in total.
At least one policeman was killed and two FC men were injured on 13 June 2014 when a roadside explosion occurred in Salarzai area of Bajaur tribal region.
A police constable was killed when unknown armed men attacked a security check-post with hand grenades in Gulaband area of Dir Lower on 13 June 2014.
In Peshawar, at least three persons were injured in rockets attack by unidentified armed men in Railway Quarters and Nothia on 13 June 2014.

At least one person was killed and two security personnel injured in twin blasts near Khanpur in Mansehra. Twin blasts occurred when an improvised explosive device (IED) fixed along the Shahrah-e-Karakoram went off while the security forces' convoy was passing through Khanpur area on 14 June 2014. A second blast took place at the same place while the rescue operation was in progress and the injured were being shifted to the hospital for treatment. A private vehicle was damaged in this attack and a passenger was killed.
At least two security men were injured in a remote controlled bomb blast near a vehicle of the security forces at Mansehra on 14 June 2014.

On 14 June 2014, two personnel of Bomb Disposal Squad (BDS) sustained wounds as the bomb they were trying to defuse went off here in Jacobabad. The BDS personnel successfully defused four out of five bombs found near the railway tracks here.
A security man was killed while two other personnel injured in a landmine blast in Safi on 14 June 2014.
On 14 June 2014, three people including a security official, were injured in a landmine blast at Lower Chamar Kand in tehsil Safi (Mohmand Agency).
A man was killed and five others injured when militants detonated two locally madebombs one after the other to target an army convoy at Karakoram Highway in Shinkiari area on 14 June 2014.
Unidentified militants targeted a vehicle with an improvised explosive device (IED) in the Chamarkand area, killing one and injuring five others in Mohmand Agency on 14 June 2014.
A volunteer of the Aman Lashkar was killed as roadside bomb went off in Tehsil Bara of Khyber Agency on 14 June 2014.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: Over a 100 people, including suspected. TTP militants and civilians as well as children, were killed by a US drone strike in Dattakhel on 15 June 2014. The Karachi airport attack mastermind was also reportedly among those killed.
Six army soldiers were killed on 15 June 2014 in a mine blast in Ghulam Khan area of North Waziristan.
A railway track was damaged in an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) blast near Haji Shehr area of Kachhi district on 15 June 2014, however, no causality was reported.

On 16 June 2014 a number of militants hideouts in Degan, Datta Khel in North Waziristan Agency (NWA), were targeted by jet aircrafts. According to ISPR, there were confirmed reports of presence of foreign and local militants in these hideouts who were linked in planning of Karachi airport attack. Reportedly over 50 militants mostly Uzbek foreigners were killed in the strikes. An ammunition dump has also been destroyed.
Five security personnel sustained injuries in a remote controlled bomb blast near a security forces convoy in Tehsil Mirali of North Waziristan Agency (NWA) on 16 June 2014.

At least 27 militants were killed after fighter jets pounded militants' hideouts in Shawal area on the second day of 'Zarb-e-Azb' operation launched by army in North Waziristan Agency to wipe off foreign and local militants on 16 June 2014.
On the night between 16 and 17 June 2014, unidentified persons attacked the house of a local leader of Qaumi Watan Party in Jamrud tehsil (Khyber Agency) with hand grenades. No injuries reported.

In North Waziristan agency on 17 June 2014, the PAF jets destroyed a number of militant's hide outs training camps and an explosive manufacturing factory leaving as many as twenty five militants dead and taking the death toll in the three days to well over two hundred. Mir Ali was one specific area which witnessed strikes.
The Pakistan Air Force aircraft pounded militant hideouts early 17 June 2014 in parts of North Waziristan, killing more than 50 militants in Mir Ali.
Four people were killed in a drone attack in Darga Mandi, NWA on 18 June 2014. They may have been civilians.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: At least eight suspected militants were killed in a US drone strike 18 June 2014 in the Miranshah tehsil of North Waziristan tribal region.
A personnel of the Levies force was killed and another sustained injuries when in a rocket attack by militants on a security checkpost in Shalozan Tangi area in Kurram Agency on 19 June 2014.

The Pakistan Air force jets resumed strikes on the militants positions on fifth day (19 June 2014) of the operation Zarb-e-Azb, initiated against the militants in North Waziristan agency Sunday last, mowing down around 15 militants.

A suicide attack by a suspected TTP militant on the residence of a peace lashkar chief in the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa capital killed at least two people and wounded five others on 19 June 2014 in Matni, Peshawar.

Pakistan s military gunship helicopters pounded militant targets in North Waziristan tribal region on 20 June 2014, killing up to 20 suspected rebels, as the number of civilians fleeing an expected ground offensive passed 150,000.

Two policemen were killed, and two others injured on 20 June 2014 as a result of an improvised explosive device (IED) blast on a police van in Torghar. The attack took place in Akazai area of Torghar district.
At least 51 people were injured after a remote control bomb ripped through a saint's shrine packed with devotees in the suburbs of Islamabad on 20 June 2014. One person later died.
20 suspected militants were killed in an airstrike by Pakistani forces near Hassu Khel, NWA on 21 June 2014.
A bomb exploded in front of Ahsanabad police check post near Super Highway in Karachi on 21 June 2014, damaging a number of bikes and cars. No casualties were reported.
Local gunship helicopter strikes on 21 June 2014 inin Bara Malakdin Khel area of Khyber Agency killed three militants and injured six others.
3 militants were killed in Bara area of Khyber Agency on 21 June 2014, and six were injured in air attacks by Pakistani jets.
10 suspected militants were killed in an airstrike by Pakistani forces near Pak-Afghan border in Khyber Agency on 21 June 2014.
Armed forces bombed three militant retreats to the ground in Qutab Khel, outside Miranshah, killing 12 militants incl. foreign fighters and arresting 24 on 21 June 2014 as part of Zarb-e-Azb.
In Peshawar, an elder of Badhber received minor injuries when a roadside bomb exploded near his vehicle at Faqirabad Chowk on 22 June 2014.
At least three persons were injured when a roadside explosive device exploded in Masho Khail area in the outskirts of Peshawar on 22 June 2014.
A policeman was killed during a routine patrol in a roadside blast in Warsak Kandaro, Lower Dir on 22 June 2014.

At least 25 suspected militants were killed in air strikes and by ground troops of armed forces in North Waziristan as the number of Internally Displaced Persons, fleeing the cordoned area, crossed 430,000 on 23 June 2014.
A soldier sustained injuries in a landmine blast in Anargi Shandara in Baizai subdivision on 23 June 2014.
A power pylon was blown up in Sumanat village in Shabqadar tehsil on 23 June 2014 by unidentified armed men. No casualties reported. Another bomb nearby was defused.
Five suspected militants were killed as military jets continued strikes to destroy hideouts in Tirah valley of Khyber Agency on 24 June 2014.
On 24 June 2014, unidentified persons blew up the Jirga Hall in Darsamand area in Doaba town in Hangu district. No loss of life reported.
A khasadar man was killed in an explosion in Safi area of Mohmand Agency on 24 June 2014.
Six members of the same civilian family were killed in air strike by the jet fighter in Khyber Agency on 24 June 2014, in Pak Darra of Tehsil Jamrud.
At least 13 militants were killed as Pakistan jet fighters bombed and destroyed 6 hideouts in Raj Gull, Jamrud, Khyber Agency on 24 June 2014.
A remote control blast occurred in the office of a private courier company through a package at Block 15, Gulshan-e-Iqbal, Karachi on 24 June 2014. No casualties reported.

27 militants were killed in air strikes in Mir Ali and surrounding areas on 24 June 2014 when jet aircraft destroyed their 11 hideouts during the ongoing Zarb-e-Azb operation in North Waziristan. A huge cache of ammunition was also destroyed.

Three people (not including bomber) were killed on 24 June 2014 in a suicide bombing in NWA tribal area. Two were soldiers and one was a civilian. This was the first such attack of its kind since the launch of Zarb-e-Azb.
20 militants were killed and 12 hideouts were destroyed during the air blitz in Khyber tribal region on 24 June 2014 (18 fatalities coded in other events).

At least seven civilians, including a woman and children, died when a mortar shell hit a house in the Meraban Loki Khel area which is located in part of Tirrah Valley in the Jamrud Tehsil of Khyber Agency on 24 June 2014. Locals claimed that they died in the air strikes by the army.
Three rockets were fired in different areas of Karachi on 25 June 2014. The first rocket hit the wall of a Naval complex in Agra Taj, Lyari.
Three rockets were fired in different areas of Karachi on 25 June 2014. The second rocket fell on the roof of a house in Machar Colony. Three people were injured in these three incidents.
Three rockets were fired in different areas of Karachi on 25 June 2014. The third rocket hit the container terminal of Karachi Port, destroying one container.
Thirteen Taliban militants were killed in air strikes in Mir Ali, North Waziristan on 25 June 2014 as operation Zarb-e-Azb continued in the lawless tribal region. 12 surrendered.
Four people were injured in a grenade attack at a police picket in the Sadiqabad area on 25 June 2014 in Rawalpindi.

2 people were injured in an IED explosion in Bar Qambar Khel, Bara on 26 June 2014; the device was planted at the main gate of the house of a member of the proscribed militant group, Amr Bil Maroof wa Nahi Anil Mumkir.
2 FC men were killed and one injured in an IED attack in Mashkay, Awaran on 27 June 2014.
Suspected TTP militants blew up a solar-powered tubewell in Darwazgai, Ekkaghund, Mohmand Agency on 28 June 2014.
Suspected TTP militants blew up a government primary school for girls in Shano Ghunda, Mohmand Agency on 28 June 2014.
Suspected TTP militants blew up a boys government primary school in Mateen Kor area of Mohmand Agency on 28 June 2014.
17 militants were killed in the latest Zarb-e-Azb airstrike by Pakistani forces in NWA on 28 June 2014.

A powerful blast took place outside the office of a private courier company at Raza Square located in Malir City area of the metropolis early 28 June 2014. However, no loss of life was reported in the attack.
A government-run primary school for girls was blown up by suspected TTP militants in Shabqadar tehsil of district Charsadda on 28 June 2014.

Two soldiers were injured when four rockets landed inside the Cantonment area in Peshawar in the early hours of 29 June 2014. According to police, the target was apparently Bacha Khan Int'l Airport, and the rockets were fired from Ghundi Afghan Refugee Camp.
A security forces personnel was killed in an IED explosion in North Waziristan.
5 suspected Uzbek militants were killed in Miranshah when Pakistani jets bombed their hideouts.
A security forces personnel was killed and 2 others injured in an explosion at their checkpost in Spinwam.
2 suicide bombers were killed and 3 people were injured when the bombers collided with each other while riding motorbikes in Quetta.
2 girls were killed and a man was injured when a bomb they had mistaken for a toy detonated in Zhob.
Police killed 3 militants in Karachi following a hand grenade attack on their checkpost.
13 militants were killed in an air strike by the military forces of Pakistan in Degan.
2 policemen were injured in an IED attack on their vehicle in Peshawar.
A policeman was injured in an IED attack on his vehicle in Quetta.
11 militants were killed in an air strike by the Pakistan Army in Miranshah.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On July 10, at least 6 militants from Al-Qaeda were killed when US drones destroyed a house in Doga Madakhel village in Data Khel tehsil of N.Waziristan. At least 2 more people were injured - all the fighters were foreign, mostly Arab.
4 Khasadar forces personnel were injured in an explosion in Quetta. The explosives were planted on a parked motorcycle.
3 people were injured in a remote controlled bomb blast targeting a police vehicle in Bannu.
A road side explosive device was detonated near an FC vehicle in Kech. No casualties or loss of life occurred.
Foreign militants attacked a security checkpost with rockets in Mirali. Security forces responded with an airstrike killing 13 militants.
2 foreign suicide bombers detonated themselves to evade capture by security forces in Boya.
18 foreign militants were killed in Pakistan security forces air strikes on militant hideouts in North Waziristan.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On July 16, at least 15 people died when drones hit a house. Of the fatalities, the majority were of Uzbeki origin, suggesting that the Islamic Movement of Uzbekistan militants were killed, although another report suggested Hafiz Gul Bahudur group may have been targeted.
35 militants were killed in Pakistani air strikes in Shawal.
A security forces personnel was injured in an IED explosion targeting his vehicle in Momand Agency.
8 people were killed and 3 injured in 2 explosions targeting a passenger van in Hangu.
2 FC personnel were injured in an IED attack by suspected Baloch separatists targeting their vehicle in Quetta.
1 policeman was killed in an IED explosion targeting his vehicle in Peshawar.
3 people were killed and 20 injured in a remote controlled explosion by unidentified militants targeting security forces in Khuzdar.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: At least 11 militants died when US drones targeted a series of houses in Doga Madakhel village in Data Khel tehsil of N.Waziristan. The militants were thought to be from TTP and IMU.
Pakistani planes bombarded militant hideouts in Shawal killing 28 militants.
2 people were injured in an IED attack on their tractor in Momand Agency.
A man was killed and 4 people including 2 FC personnel were injured in an IED attack in Momand Agency.
2 Pakistani soldiers were killed in an IED attack in Ghulam Khan.
2 people were killed in a landmine explosion in Kulachi.
1 person was killed another injured as a result of a bomb blast targeting a busy market in Quetta.
A group of armed men planted explosive devices at the premises of an under-construction checkpost belonging to the Levies Forces. Soon after the devices exploded. No reported injuries or fatalities.
A militant commander of LeI escaped unhurt when an explosive device went off. The device was planted by suspected TTP militants. No injuries were reported.
Militants (TTP) planted explosives in a government girls primary school in the Dando Bridge area of Mamond. No loss of life was reported.
Militants fired rockets which landed in Goth Madad Khan Umrani (Tamboo Tehsil) last night. Two civilians were injured in the incident. The motive behind the attack remains unclear.
A Levies official was killed and 3 accompanying individuals were injured when their vehicle hit a landmine near Dera Bugti.

SOURCE: Express Tribune (Pakistan); Pakistan Today; Balochistan Express
NOTES: PTI representative Faqeer Jamshed Ahmed and two guards were killed in an IED blast on Monday morning. The explosion took place near Faqeer's car on Mahdi Road. No other injuries were reported.
A military vehicle in Dir was targeted with a remote-controlled bomb as it was on its way to Dir Town from Barawal. There were no reported casualties.
The Pakistani army carried out fresh airstrikes against militant hideouts in Kam Sham on Tuesday. This incident is part of the army's operations to clear the militants from North Waziristan.
The Pakistani army carried out fresh airstrikes against militant hideouts in Marshikhel on Tuesday. This incident is part of the army's operations to clear the militants from North Waziristan.
The Pakistani army carried out fresh airstrikes against militant hideouts in Datta Khel on Tuesday. This incident is part of the army's operations to clear the militants from North Waziristan.
An IED was used in a low-intensity blast outside the office of a cable operating located in Quaidabad area on Wednesday. The incident caused damage but no injuries.

A drone strike targeted a compound in Alwara Mandi on Wednesday, early in the morning. Four missiles were fired at the compound and a vehicle parked inside it. 6 militants were killed in the incident. There were no other reported fatalities or injuries.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A U.S. missile strike killed 5 militants in the Datta Khel area as it targeted a house in the village. A further 2 militants were injured in the incident.
Two police constables were injured when unidentified persons hurled a hand grenade at the office of DPS, Hayatabad, on Thursday evening. There were no reported fatalities.

Eight people were injured in a remote control bomb explosion in the Maal road area along the Pak-Afghan highway. The remote control bomb was planted onto a motorcycle and parked in the area. No fatalities were reported.
FC personnel escaped a roadside bomb attack in the Sangsilla area of Dera Bugti district.
An IED hit a passenger van travelling from Hangu to Peshawar. The IED blast occurred near the Doaba area of the Hangu District. No fatalities were reported.
Four people were injured when a remote controlled device exploded in Chaman. The device was planted on a motorcycle and parked in the area. No fatalities have been reported.
A bomb blast injured four persons along Maal road. The bomb was planted in a motorcycle which was parked on the road. No fatalities were reported.
Sixteen people were injured when militants threw a hand grenade into a shop selling national flags.
On 12 August, twelve people were injured as an IED exploded at a shop selling Pakistani flags in downtown Quetta. No fatalities have been reported.
A bomb blast injured at least 22 civilians in Quetta on Tuesday. Suspected TTP militants planted the bomb near a small roadside stall. No fatalities were reported.
Rockets were fired on a Frontier Corps camp in Tump area. The rockets were fired from nearby mountains and landed near the FC camp. No injuries were reported.
Twelve people were injured as militants threw a hand grenade towards a vendor selling national flags. No fatalities have been reported.
Nine family members of a peace volunteer were injured when a mortar shell fell on the house of Sadiq Shah. No fatalities were reported.

A pro-government tribal elder and leader of Salarzai Peace Committee remained unhurt when his vehicle was targeted with a remote-controlled bomb. His companions (driver and bodyguards) also remained unscathed. The motive of the incident remains unknown.
JSMM activists blew up a rail track between Rahuki and Usman Shah Hurri in Hyderabad. No injuries were reported.
A remote controlled bomb killed one FC security personnel as they were passing through the Hazar Ganji area. Another FC personnel was injured in the incident.
A roadside blast took place in Nawagai Tehsil. No injuries were reported.
A roadside blast in Mamond Tehsil killed one civilian. No other injuries were reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone struck a compound in Madakhel area in Datta Khel killing 11 Punjabi Taliban militants.
At least 9 militants were killed and several hideouts destroyed in fresh airstrikes carried out in North Waziristan.

SOURCE: Aid Worker Security Database; Pakistan Today
NOTES: On 19 August, a roadside bomb exploded when a school van struck the bomb while it was travelling through Tangi village (Bajaur Agency, FATA) killing three female teachers and one driver working for a local NGO and two children.
At least 9 militants were killed and several hideouts destroyed in fresh airstrikes carried out in the Kokikhel area of Tirah Valley.

A security force personnel was injured when a remote control bomb exploded near their convoy on Wednesday. The bomb exploded when the convoy was moving between Sor Aap and the Tasp area of Panjgur. No fatalities were reported.
An FC convoy was hit with a remote controlled bomb in the Sor Aap area of Panjgur district on Thursday. The bomb injured one FC soldier and damaged the vehicle. No other injuries were reported.
Two persons were injured in an explosion in Khar. Suspected TTP militants planted the explosive device near the main entrance to Chaquri area in Khar. No fatalities were reported.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Border Security Force
NOTES: Reports of Indian shelling aross the LoC on Aug 22. In AJK, the Charwa, Anula, Khadral, Bajra Garhi, Beeni, and Sucheetgarh villages of Sialkot tehsil/district in Punjab were affected. 3 Pakistanis (at least one civilian)(coded across 5 events) were killed and 11 others were injured.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Border Security Force
NOTES: Reports of Indian shelling aross the LoC on Aug 22. In AJK, the Charwa, Anula, Khadral, Bajra Garhi, Beeni, and Sucheetgarh villages of Sialkot tehsil/district in Punjab were affected. 3 Pakistanis (at least one civilian)(coded across 5 events) were killed and 11 others were injured.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Border Security Force
NOTES: Reports of Indian shelling aross the LoC on Aug 22. In AJK, the Charwa, Anula, Khadral, Bajra Garhi, Beeni, and Sucheetgarh villages of Sialkot tehsil/district in Punjab were affected. 3 Pakistanis (at least one civilian)(coded across 5 events) were killed and 11 others were injured.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Border Security Force
NOTES: Reports of Indian shelling aross the LoC on Aug 22. In AJK, the Charwa, Anula, Khadral, Bajra Garhi, Beeni, and Sucheetgarh villages of Sialkot tehsil/district in Punjab were affected. 3 Pakistanis (at least one civilian)(coded across 5 events) were killed and 11 others were injured.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Border Security Force
NOTES: Reports of Indian shelling aross the LoC on Aug 22. In AJK, the Charwa, Anula, Khadral, Bajra Garhi, Beeni, and Sucheetgarh villages of Sialkot tehsil/district in Punjab were affected. 3 Pakistanis (at least one civilian)(coded across 5 events) were killed and 11 others were injured.
On 23 August, a blast at a bus station in Wana injured two members of the Christian community. Suspected TTP militants were sitting in a nearby shop when the bomb exploded.
Militants threw a hand grenade into the Naimat Kada hotel on Monday morning. The incident resulted in one death and 16 injuries. Police were quick to arrive to the scene.
Suspected Baloch Separatists fitted explosives onto an electricity pylon which went off causing disruption of electricity to several towns and villages in the area. No injuries were reported.

Suspected TTP militants planted a bomb on the Jaffar Express train which exploded as the train was on its way to Rawalpindi. The train was near Sibi Railyway Station at the time of the blast. Three passengers sustained injuries.
Suspected TTP militants threw a grenade into a restaurant in Quetta on Monday. One person was killed and 18 others injured as a result of the blast.
A local TTP commander was killed and two others injured when a remote control bomb exploded. A UAG planted the bomb on the roadside.
Suspected Baloch Separatists planted a bomb which destroyed the Sufi shrine in Mastung. One person was injured as they were passing through the area.
Militants targeted a police vehicle with a remote-controlled explosive. Militants had planted the explosives along the roadside in Sui. No police personnel were injured in the blast.
Suspected TTP militants targeted a security force vehicle as it was travelling in Mohmand Agency. Two security officials were injured when their vehicle was hit by a remote-controlled IED.

Suspected Baloch Separatists fired rockets at a Frontier Corps checkpost in the Tump area of Kech district. The rockets landed away from the post. FC personnel responded by firing rockets. No injuries were reported.
Suspected TTP militants threw grenades into a restaurant in Quetta. One person was killed and at least 14 others were injured.
Suspected Baloch Separatists fired two rockets at a Frontier Corps checkpost in Rakhsan River area. The rockets landed away from the post. No FC personnel were reported to be at the checkpost.
Suspected TTP militants threw a hand grenade into the residence of Sanab Gul in Mattani on Wednesday evening. Two people were injured in the incident.

Five security personnel were injured when they were hit by an IED blast. Suspected TTP militants had planted the IED explosives at the roadside. A search operation was launched following the incident.
Two Balochistan Constabulary personnel were injured when militants threw a hand grenade near their vehicle.
A major encounter left 32 militants dead and three militant hideouts destroyed. Pakistan army helicopter gunships launched the air attack in the remote area of Bangidar in North Waziristan.

Suspected TTP militants fired upon a cargo airplane as it was en route to Bacha Khan International Airport for refuelling. The incident took place in the southern villages of Peshawar. No damage was reported.

An explosive device planted by suspected TTP militants exploded when police forces were on patrol in Bannu. No loss of life or injuries were reported. The police launched a search operation following the incident.

Four policemen were injured when two Jundullah militants attacked the Madadgar 15 Centre in Karachi. The militants threw an IED into the centre before escaping on motorcycles. Civilians went unharmed. The motive behind the attack is seen as an attempt to demoralise local police forces.
An IED planted by suspected TTP militants injured three security personnel in Hangu. Following the incident, security personnel launched a search operation.

Suspected TTP militants planted an IED outside the residence of Haji Wilayat Hussain (former councillor of ANP). The IED exploded injuring two passers-by. The incident follows a previous attempt of extortion against the councillor (and businessman).
Suspected TTP militants attacked two police convoys in the Turbat area of the Kech district. The TTP militants attacked the convoys with bombs. No casualties or fatalities were reported.
A member of the Charaming Communal Militia sustained serious injuries after a remote controlled bomb exploded on the roadside. Suspected TTP militants planted the bomb in Nawagai tehsil.

Suspected TTP militants planted an IED outside the residence Sherzamin Khan (Chamakrand Communal Militia). The IED went off injuring Mr Khan. Following the blast, police forces launched a search operation.

Suspected Afghani Taliban militants fired two rockets into the Khar area on Sunday. A student sustained injuries as a result of the attack. The attack comes as Afghani Taliban continue to step up their sabotage activities in the area.
TTP militants planted explosive devices in a newly rebuilt school in Nawagai tehsil. The explosive devices went off destroying the new building. No casualties or injuries were reported.

A gas pipeline supplying a purification plant in Sui was blown up in Lunda Mullah (Dera Bugti) on Monday. Unidentified militants planted an explosive device with a timer. No casualties or injuries were reported.
Military gunship helicopters killed 10 suspected TTP militants as they struck the area of Boya Degan in North Waziristan. The incident represents a recent action of the Zarb-e-Azb operation.
A landmine explosion left one man injured in Dera Allah Yar area of Jaffarabad. Militants had planted the landmine by the side of the road as part of a sabotage act.

Suspected TTP militants planted an IED bomb outside a property belonging to Mr Shah. The IED exploded causing serious damage to the property. However, no loss of life was reported as Mr Shah and his family were not in the residence. The motive behind the attack remains unknown.

A hand grenade attack left at least eight people wounded in Lyari Town of Karachi. Unknown militants hurled a hand grenade towards civilians at Mirza Adam Road. No group has claimed responsibility for the incident.
An IED blast injured three civilians when there truck hit the explosive device. Planted by suspected TTP militants, the truck hit the IED in Safi tehsil.

Military forces killed 30 suspected IMU militants when they launched fresh airstrikes in Shawal area of Sewa Tehsil (North Waziristan). Military forces used gunship helicopters and fighter jets in the operation.
Military fighter jets killed 35 suspected TTP militants as they bombed militant hideouts in Datta Khel tehsil. The incident represents a recent action of the Zarb-e-Azb operation.

At least 10 suspected TTP militants were killed in fresh airstrikes carried out in North Waziristan. Army helicopter gunships carried out a precision strike on a suspected TTP compound as part of the army's Zarb-e-Azb operation.

Unidentified armed militants attacked a police convoy in North Nazimabad Town of Karachi. Riding motorcycles, the militants hurled a cracker (bomb) at the police vehicle before fleeing the scene. No casualties or injuries were reported.

Two remote-controlled bomb blasts killed at least seven and injured three others near Zargari Town in Hangu District. Suspected TTP militants planted the bombs along the roadside. The first bomb went off as a passenger van went by. As people rushed to assist the victims of the first blast, the second bomb exploded.

Three suspected TTP militants were injured in a roadside blast in Bara tehsil on Friday. A bomb planted by unidentified militants hit the suspected TTP militants car as it was making its way to a village in the tehsil.
Suspected TTP militants planted an IED near the main entrance to a grid station in Kalaya. The blast destroyed the main entrance and walls to the grid. There were no reported loss of life.

Two activists of HNG were injured when a remote controlled bomb detonated. Suspected TTP militants planted the explosive device along a roadside in Bar Qambar Khel. The motive behind the attack remains unknown.
A bomb blast killed three people and injured 19 others in Quetta. Unidentified militants planted the bomb in a car in Quetta. The motive behind the attack remains unknown.

Suspected TTP militants planted a bomb in a van on Saryab Road. It is believed the car bomb was intended to target a Frontier Corps patrolling team. However, the bomb exploded hitting the busy shopping area. Three people were killed and 24 others injured. One FC soldier was amongst the dead.

Suspected TTP militants planted explosives in a vehicle and parked it in Satellite Town. The explosion killed three people and injured a further 24. A search operation was launched following the incident.

Suspected TTP militants planted an explosive device in a girls' school in Nurur village (Bannu). The bomb exploded during the night causing damage to the boundary wall. No loss of life or injuries were reported.

Suspected TTP militants planted an IED outside the residence of a businessman in Murshidabad (Peshawar). The IED exploded causing damage to the property. No loss of life or injuries were reported. The motive behind the attack remains unknown.
A landmine planted by suspected TTP militants killed one and injured for others in Uraz Mohammad village on Sunday evening. The bomb exploded as civilians were passing through the area.
Three security personnel were killed and two others injured when TTP militants fired rockets at Spinwam Fort. No retaliation was reported.
In the latest development of the Zarb-e-Azb operation, 15 suspected TTP militants were killed when helicopter gunships targeted militants hideouts in Tabayi area.

Suspected TTP militants blew up a bridge in Sheen Kamar (Bara tehsil) on Monday. The militants had planted an explosive device under the bridge which went off early in the morning. No loss of life or injuries were reported.

SOURCE: Pakistan Today; Frontier Star; Right Vision News
NOTES: Military forces killed at least 23 suspected TTP militants when they carried out fresh airstrikes in Tirah Valley. Fighter jets pounded several military hideouts in the area.

Military forces conducted fresh airstrikes against militant hideouts in Datta Khel on Wednesday. The airstrikes targeted the villages of Nawe Kili and Zaram Asar. At least 40 militants belonging to the TTP or foreign militant groups were killed. The airstrikes are part of the military's wider Zarb-e-Azb operations.

Suspected TTP militants attacked the house of a Babikhel tribesman. The TTP militants used rockets and hand grenades in the attack. Two residents were injured in the incident. The motive behind the attack remains unknown.

Fresh airstrikes killed 23 suspected TTP militants in North Waziristan on Thursday. The airstrikes targeted hideouts in Datta Khel and surrounding areas (Zaram and Ismail Khel). The airstrikes are part of Pakistan's Zarb-e-Azb military operation.

Suspected TTP militants threw a hand-grenade at a house in the Phandu locality. Five children were wounded in the attack. The incident comes after residents of the property have been receiving extortion demands.

A bomb blast damaged the house of a former lawmaker belonging to ANP. Suspected TTP militants planted the bomb outside the property which exploded at 8pm on Thursday. No loss of life or injuries were reported.
A bomb planted in Turbat town went off killing a security personnel passing through the area. The bomb was located on a road leading to a security check post in the area.
A remote-controlled blast killed at least four LeI militants as their vehicle was hit by the blast. The perpetrators behind the bomb placement remain unknown.
Suspected TTP militants hurled a hand grenade at the residence of a local PPP leader. No loss of life or injuries were reported. The motive behind the attack remains unknown.
Twelve suspected TTP militants were killed in airstrikes conducted in the Boya area of North Waziristan. Three hideouts were also destroyed in the process.
A military personnel was killed and another injured following a bomb blast in Dasht. Unidentified militants detonated a roadside bomb as a paramilitary convoy was passing through the area.
Eleven people were injured when an explosive device went off in Jinah Town of Quetta. Suspected TTP militants had planted a timed device in a motorcycle and left it in the area.

Suspected Baloch Separatists targeted the vehicle of Frontier Works Organisation (FWO) through a remote-controlled bomb. The FWO vehicle were engaged in road construction in Dasht tehsil when they were targeted. One worker was killed and two others injured.

A remote-controlled blast killed two military personnel and injured another. Suspected TTP militants targeted the military vehicle through a remote-controlled explosion device planted on the roadside. A search operation was launched following the attack.
At least 23 suspected TTP militants were killed when Pakistan's military launched fresh aerial strikes on militant hideouts in Ghulam Khan.
Aerial strikes killed 19 suspected TTP militants in North Waziristan on Tuesday. Pakistan Military jets targeted various hideouts throughout the area as part of the Zarb-e-Azb operation.
A suicide attack left five dead and injured 24 others. A suspected TTP militant used a vehicle to target a senior military official with a vehicle-borne suicide attack.
Suspected TTP militants planted explosive devices outside two houses in Hangu on Wednesday. Both devices exploded causing minor damage to the properties. No loss of life or injuries were reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On September 24, at least 8 militants died when a US drone hit a vehicle near the Afghani border in Lawar Mandi village in Data Khel tehsil of N. Waziristan. The militants were thought to be linked to IMU and the TTP.
Thirteen suspected TTP militants were killed by Pakistan military jets during airstrikes on Wednesday. The military jets targeted hideouts in Kokikhel (Tirah Valley).

Jundallah militants carried out a bomb attack on a senior police officer in Defence Housing Authority (Karachi) on Thursday. The militants had planted a bomb inside a pickup van which was remotely detonated. Two died and six others were injured as a result.
Suspected TTP militants planted a bomb outside a house in Larama village (Peshawar). The explosion damaged the boundary wall but caused no casualties.

Three pro-government Daweezi Communal Militia members were killed when an IED targeted their vehicle in Pandiali. Suspected TTP militants had planted the device in the Daweezi area. The motive behind the incident remains unclear.
Suspected TTP militants killed 2 oeople and injured 23 others in an explosion in Sibi tehsil. The militants had planted explosives in a motorcycle.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A U.S drone strike killed two suspected TTP militants and two of their Arab militant allies. The U.S drone targeted the town of Wana in South Waziristan.
Fresh airstrikes killed 15 suspected TTP militants in Shawal area of North Waziristan. The air attacks were targeting five hideouts in the area.
Suspected TTP militants planted a bomb onto a motorcycle and placed it outside a shop in a camp for internally displaced persons in Hangu. The blast killed seven people and injured 13 others.
Two people were injured when a bomb hit a coach in Kohat tehsil. The TTP are suspected to have been behind the incident.
Suspected TTP militants killed five people and injured four others as a result of a bomb explosion in Tirah Valley. The explosion occurred near a militant post in the area.
An IED bomb blast injured two security personnel in Spinwam. The security personnel were clearing landmines from the area when the blast occurred. TTP militants are suspected.
BRA militants planted explosives under a gas pipeline in the Loti gas field. The blast caused serious damage. No loss of life or injuries were reported.

An unidentified suicide bomber killed 5 civilians and injured several others in Hazara Town. The bomber blew himself up in a crowded shopping area of the town. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
Suspected TTP militants planted an explosive device outside a residential property in Jamrud tehsil. The blast partially damaged the property, but caused no loss of life or injuries.

Suspected TTP militants targeted a military convoy as they were passing through Jamrud tehsil. The militants planted a remote-controlled explosive device at the roadside. There was no reported loss of life or injuries.
Suspected TTP militants threw a hand grenade at a police convoy in Karachi. The blast injured two police personnel. The militants managed to flee the scene of the incident.
On October 1, unidentified armed men killed a school teacher and two children in a grenade attack at Askari Public School in Peshawar city (Peshawar, KP).
A hand grenade attack killed one teacher and left two children injured on Wednesday. Suspected JI militants threw a hand grenade at the Askari Public School and College in Shabqadar area of Peshawar.
Two people were killed and nine others injured when UBF militants threw a bomb and open fired on two barber shops in Quetta. The motive behind the attack remains unclear.
Suspected TTP militants damaged a PESCO transmission line in Peshawar when they planted explosives on a power tower.
A TTP militant killed 7 and injured 11 others when he left an explosive device on a passenger coach in Peshawar. The device exploded when the TTP militant exited the coach.
Military forces carried out a series of airstrikes in Jamrud area on Friday. The operation was targeting suspected TTP militant hideouts in the area. The operations killed 15 suspected TTP militants.
Suspected TTP militants planted explosive devices outside two residential properties in Tank. The blast caused damage to the properties, but no loss of life or injuries were reported.
A timed explosive device killed 6 and left 13 others injured. Suspected TTP militants planted the device inside a passenger van in Kohat.
Three police personnel were injured in a blast in Orangi Town on Sunday. The blast took place near their police vehicle. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
Unidentified militants planted an explosive device on a motorcycle in SITE Town. The blast injured 6 police personnel and 8 civilians. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On October 5, a US drone targeted Uzbek militants in Kundghar, which is located in the Shawal area in Birmal tehsil of S.Waziristan (close to N.Waziristan border). The area is reportedly a base for fighters travelling to Afghanistan. Two or three missiles reportedly hit a house, killing between 4 and 7 militants belonging to IMU.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone strike killed 8 suspected TTP militants and injured 6 others in North Waziristan. The drone strike targeted the residence of Taliban leader Habib.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On October 6, a US drone targeted a house in Mangrotai in Shawl tehsil in N.Waziristan. This area straddles north and south Waziristan, but in this attack, 4 Uzbeks belonging to IMU were killed (a further 4 were injured). The target was a house of a TTP commander, but it was unclear whether he died in this attack

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On October 7, a second strike of the day was fired by US drones - this time in the Data Khel tehsil on a mountain very close to the Afghanistan border. at least 3 died, with 5 more injured - al the fatalities were from IMU and were Uzbeks.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Aid Workers (Pakistan); UN: United Nations; Health Workers (Pakistan)
NOTES: 'One UN polio worker was killed in an IED explosion. Two others (not counted) were also killed in the attack.'

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: For the third attack in Shawal valley in 3 days, US drones struck a training centre in Kundghar, which is located in the Shawal area in Birmal tehsil of S.Waziristan (close to N.Waziristan border). Two or three missiles hit a house reportedly belonging to a TTP commander, and at least 4 died with a further 5 injured.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone strike killed 15 suspected TTP militants in Jamrud and Barra. The drone strikes were targeting multiple militant hideouts in the area.
Suspected TTP militants planted an IED device outside a local residence in Safi tehsil. The blast killed two and injured 1 other civilian. The motive behind the attack remains unknown.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone strike killed 15 suspected TTP militants in Jamrud and Barra. The drone strikes were targeting multiple militant hideouts in the area.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On October 8, 4 militants were killed when a US drone fired a missile at a moving vehicle in Laman area of Data Khel tehsil in N.Waziristan, close to the Afghan border.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone strike killed four suspected TTP militants in Datta Khel on Thursday. The drone strike was targeting a vehicle passing through the Laman area.
Suspected TTP militants planted a remote-controlled bomb alongside the roadside in Salarzai tehsil. The blast injured 6 people.
A police convoy was partially damaged when a planted bomb exploded in Quetta. Suspected Baloch militants had planted the device along Mastung Road. No loss of life or injuries were reported.
Unidentified militants fired four rockets into Lyari Town on Friday. The blasts injured 9 civilians. The motive behind the attack remains unknown.

Pakistan's military forces blew up three suspected militant hideouts in Bannu on Friday. Security forces were conducting a search operation in the area when they cordoned off the area and planted explosives in the properties. No loss of life or injuries were reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
ACTOR2: AQIS: Al Qaeda in the Indian Subcontinent
NOTES: On October 11, two missiles were fired from a US drone, flattening a house in Chancharano Kandaw area of Khyber Agency's Bara tehsil. The missiles were targeting senior Al Qaeda figures who were fleeing the conflict in N.Waziristan. Alongside Al Qaeda figures, the missiles also killed TTP militants. At least 4 militants died, with 2 more injured.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On October 11, the US launched their 400th drone strike in Pakistan (349th under Obama) when they targeted a vehicle in the Shawal tehsil of N.Waziristan. The car was very close to the Afghan border, and at least 2 militants from the Hafiz Gul Bahadur Group died
Suspected TTP militants planted an explosive device on the roadside in Sipah area of Orakzai. The blast killed one civilian and injured another.
Unidentified militants hurled a hand grenade at a FC vehicle as it was driving on Joint Road (Quetta). The militants managed to flee the scene unharmed. No loss of life or injuries were reported.
A peace committee member was killed by a roadside bomb blast in Kohat on Saturday. Suspected TTP militants had planted the bomb in Kohat.
Military airstrikes killed 21 suspected TTP militants in North Waziristan on Sunday. Pakistan's military were targeting two militant hideouts in the area.
Suspected TTP militants planted a remote-controlled bomb alongside the roadside in Khar tehsil. The blast injured one civilian.
Suspected TTP militants targeted Levies Force personnel with a remote-controlled explosive device in Razmak. The blast injured one LF personnel.
A suspected TTP militant blew himself up in Tirah (Valley) on Wednesday. The blast killed five civilians and injured seven others.
An LeI suicide bomber attacked a group of pro-government militants. The attack left eight dead and 15 others injured.
A suspected TTP militant blew himself up in Bara on Wednesday. The blast killed seven civilians and injured thirteen others.
Suspected TTP militants planted an explosive device along the roadside in Wana. A FC vehicle hit the device as they were passing through the area. Two FC personnel were injured in the blast.
An airstrike operation killed 10 TTP militants in Khyber Agency. Pakistan's military were targeting three hideouts in the area.
Military forces carried out a series of airstrikes in Tirah (valley) on Thursday. The operation targeted five military hideouts in the area, killing 21 militants in the process.
A bomb blast damaged the house of an ANP district leader. Suspected TTP militants planted the bomb outside the property which exploded on Friday. No loss of life or injuries were reported.
Suspected TTP militants planted an explosive device along the roadside in Salarzai tehsil. Two security personnel were killed and a further two injured in the blast.

Iranian military forces fired three mortar shells into Pakistani territory on Saturday. Pakistan's security forces responded by tightening security at the border. No loss of life or injuries were reported.
Suspected TTP militants blew up a mobile tower in Kalaya area. The blast completely destroyed the tower. No loss of life or injuries were reported.
Three Frontier Corps personnel were injured when TTP militants attacked their checkpost in Mamund tehsil. The militants fired several rockets at the checkpost before fleeing the area.
Suspected Afghan militants fired two mortar shells into Nawagai tehsil on Tuesday. The blast killed one.
Afghani militants fired mortar shells into Charmang tehsil. The blast killed 1 and injured two others.
