Suspected TTP militants planted explosive devices in a vehicle parked in Hangu. The explosion destroyed four shops, but no loss of life or injuries were reported.

Suspected TTP militants fired mortar shells at a Mosque in Sepah area (Bara tehsil). The incident killed two civilians and injured two others, while another residential property in the area was hit injuring 6. Suspected TTP militants also fired shells at a residential property in Shalobar in Bara which killed 2 others.
Military airstrikes killed 30 suspected TTP militants in Datta Khel. Pakistan's military were targeting four militant hideouts in the area.
Suspected TTP militants planted explosives outside the property of a FATA politician. The blast caused severe damage, but no loss of life or injuries were reported.
Suspected TTP militants targeted a polio team in Mamund tehsil. The team were travelling with Levies personnel when there vehicle was hit. The blast injured three.
Pakistan's military shelled militants hideouts in Bara tehsil. There were no reported fatalities or injuries.
A suspected TTP militant targeted a JUI-F rally in Quetta. The suicide bomber killed three people and injured 20 others.
Two security personnel were injured when they were hit by a bomb blast. Suspected TTP militants planted the explosive device along the roadside in Landi Kotal.
Pakistan's military targeted military hideouts in Bara tehsil through airstrikes. The incident killed 20 suspected TTP militants.
Nine security personnel were injured when an IED exploded in Charmang tehsil. Suspected TTP militants planted the device along the roadside.
Pakistan's military carried out airstrikes in Datta Khel. The airstrikes killed 35 suspected TTP militants.
Suspected TTP militants planted explosive devices outside a Government Primary School in Bara tehsil. The blast caused moderate damage, but no loss of life or injuries were reported.
Suspected Baloch Separatists planted explosives outside the residency of a tribal elder in Dera Allah Yar. The blast caused moderate damage, but no loss of life or injuries were reported.
Unidentified militants hurled a hand grenade at a Islamic Research Centre in Karachi. The grenade blast killed one and injured seven others.

NOTES: Reports of Indian shelling aross the LoC on Oct 28. 1 elderly civilian was killed in shelling in Chinikot sector, Haveli tehsil/district, AJK. No mention of Pakistani retaliation.
Military airstrikes killed 20 suspected TTP militants in Tirah Valley. Pakistan's military were targeting several hideouts in the area.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
ACTOR2: AQIS: Al Qaeda in the Indian Subcontinent
NOTES: On November 11, a US drone strike in the forested valley called Dawa Toi near the Afghan border was targeted in Data Khel tehsil in N.Waziristan. While two senior members of AQIS were killed, 2 children also died (children of one of the militants). The children and the people inside attempted to flee after the first missile hit their house, but another missile struck the vehicle as they were leaving. Between 4 and 7 died.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On December 26, two missiles in quick succession hit Kundghar village in the Shawal tehsil of N.Waziristan. The target of the first strike was the TTP, while the second strike hit a different house killing militants from the Islamic Movement of Uzbekistan. The first strike reportedly killed the leader of the Punjabi Taliban, although this was not verified. In total at least 7 militants died, with 5 more injured.

NOTES: On January 4th, a US drone targeted militants in Lawar Mandi in Data Khel tehsil of N.Waziristan. The strike hit one or two houses, as well as a possible vehicle, killing at least 6 militants. Strike was initially thought to have targeted Hafiz Gul Bahadur and some TTP militants, but it later emerged that this strike killed an important member of Al Qaeda. Some reports suggested Bahadur, the leader of Hafiz Gul Bahadur group, was killed in this strike, but this was not confirmed by any security officials.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Civilians (Italy); Aid Workers (Italy); Civilians (United States); Aid Workers (United States)
SOURCE: Aid Worker Security Database; Bureau of Investigative Journalism
NOTES: On January 15, a US drone strike hit a building in Shawal tehsil (N.Waziristan, FATA) killing between 5 and 7 people. The strike succeeded in its target of Ahmed Farooq, a US citizen and senior al Qaeda leader. Amongst the 5 killed were two civilian hostages held by Al-Qaeda - an Italian and an American. Washington Post later claimed there was a surveillance lapse in that the CIA had reportedly detected a western hostage held by Al-Qaeda a year before, but did not monitor the hostages movements using drone surveillance.

NOTES: Indian Border Security Forces shelled working boundary of Sialkot, leaving a woman injured, and causing damage to property.
At least 60 people dead in an explosion inside an imambargah in Shikarpur. Jundallah claims full responsibility

A rocket attack targeting a senior police officer and his family killed two police escorts in Gawadar. The incident happened in the evening when district police chief Asghar Ali Yusufzai was travelling with his family from Khuzdar district to the town of Gwadar in Balochistan province. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack but Baloch separatists are suspected

The TI gunmen were on routine patrol when a roadside bomb went off in Naray Baba area of Tirah Valley .Three TI activists were killed on the spot and another was critically injured. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

In Central Kurram, four security personnel were killed when their vehicle hit a roadside bomb planted by unknown militants.

Three activists of Tauheedul Islam (Aman Lashkar) were killed when their vehicle hit a landmine in Naray Baba area in Khyber Agency. Salahuddin Ayoubi, spokesman for the LashkareIslam, claimed responsibility for the attack.
One security personnel was martyred and other one was injured in a blast in Dera Bugti. No further information on cause of blast or those responsible.

One security personnel of Frontier Corps Balochistan was killed and two others wounded when their vehicle hit a landmine planted in Chattar area of District Nasirabad, Balochistan. No group has claimed responsibility.

Unknown persons blew up main gate of the ICMS School and College with a timed explosive device in Hayatabad area of Peshawar.
