In Chithar area of Nasirabad Balochistan, BRA men blew up two towers of high transmission line at night between Friday and Saturday, causing suspension of electricity supply to respective areas of Sibi as well as Quetta. No group has claimed responsibility but baloch separatist groups are often responsible for such attacks.

An IED was attached to the railway tracks which exploded near Bakhtiarabad, Sibi, Balochistan. A two feet deep railway track damage was caused after the blast. No responsibility was claimed for the attack but Baloch separatist groups are suspected to be behind the attack

Militants blew up a state-run school for girls in Orakzai Agency,. The sources said that unidentified persons planted explosives at various places in the Government Girls Middle School in Bezot area in lower Orakzai Agency and triggered the explosion early in the day. Two rooms and verandah of the school were destroyed and the boundary wall was damaged in the explosion which took place at 6am

At least three people were killed and five critically injured in bomb attack on a a pro-government militia in Tirah Valley of Khyber Agency. An IED was detonated in a compound belonging to TI ppeace Lashkar in the Narai Baba area of Tirah, according to sources Three militia members were killed on the spot and five received shrapnel wounds militants from the Mangal Bagh-led Lashkar-e-Islam extremist group had planted the IED near their compoundin Tirah, Bara Tehsil, Khyber Agency

Thirteen suspected militants were killed and their seven hideouts destroyed when the Pakistan Air Force (PAF) fighter jets pounded various areas of Tirah Valley in Khyber Agency on Monday, official and local sources said.According to the Inter-Services Public Relations (ISPR), the fighter jets targeted Tor Khas area in Khyber Agency

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Khasadar Force
NOTES: A khasadar official and three volunteers suffered injuries when the vehicle of a local peace committee head was targeted with an improvised explosive device in Mohmand Agency tehsil Ghalanai . Political tehsildar, Baizai, Miraj Khan confirmed the incident and said that Baizai peace committee head Malik Sanobar was going in his vehicle when it was hit by an improvised Explosive device in Shandara area.As a result, a khasadar official, two peace volunteers, Ismail Khan and Hazrat, were injured. No group claimed responsibility for the IED blast
A security forces personnel was killed when a landmine exploded in the Bezo Sar area, Hangu, Lower Kurram Agency.
A tribesman was killed and his wife sustained injuries when a mortar shell hit a house in Lashora village, Jamrud tehsil of the Khyber Agency.

A government-run community health centre was blown up by unidentified persons in Shal Kor area of Ekkaghund tehsil of Mohmand Agency. Local people hold that the individuals had planted explosives in the building of the health centre. They said that two blasts occurred in the building which destroyed its structure and boundary wall

ACTOR1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Border Security Force
NOTES: A man was injured seriously by mortar shells fired by Indian Border Security Forces (BSF) on Sialkot border village Kulliyaan Chanoor-Pindi Panjoraan in Bajwat Sector of Sialkot Working Boundary.

At least two children died while two others critically injured in a disguised bomb explosion at Kharal Maldialan near Bagh Azad Kashmir, on Thursday [12 February]. Other sources reported the same similar incident at Chanyalan village with the same fatalities.

Khyber 1 operation is underway to kick out the presence of terrorists from the country. Security forces targeted various places of militants in Tirah Valley's village Koki Khel and Sheikh Kot, killing as many as seven terrorists whereas 15 others sustained injuries. Moreover, sources claimed to have bulldozed various hideouts of the militants.

Jet fighters targeted the sanctuaries of proscribed Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) and Lashkar-e-Islam (LI) in, Tor Darra, Kukikhel area of Tirah Valley, Khyber Agency. Seven suspected militants were killed and 15 others were injured in the air strikes. 7 militant hideouts were also destroyed

At least 25 people were wounded when a blast on railway track hit a passenger train near Jacobabad city of Sindh, leading to derailment of four bogies. According to police and rescue officials, the explosion was caused by a train hitting an IED on the tracks in Jacobabad. No group has claimed responsibility for the act, such acts are usually carried out by Baloch separatist groups(Jacobabad is on the border of Balochistan and Sindh)

According to sources, security forces conducted an operation to rescue the polio-team, whose four members had been abducted by armed men about a week ago. When personnel of security forces encircled the area for the rescue operation, the suicide bombers blew themselves up. The hostages, however, could not be rescued. The polio-team vehicle has been found in the mountains of Zhob
Chief Justice of the Balochistan High Court Justice Noor Muhammad Maskanzai escaped a bomb explosion in Noshki.

As many as 17 districts of Balochistan, including parts of Quetta, plunged into darkness after suspected militants blew up two pylons of a power transmission line in Chatter area of Nasirabad district. Sarbaz Baloch, a spokesman for the banned Baloch Republican Army, calling from an unknown location informed media that his organisation had carried out the attack

ACTOR1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Border Security Force
NOTES: The Indian Border Security Force (BSF) shelled border villages in the Charwah Sector of the Sialkot Working Boundary, killing a 60 yearold man.

A woman was killed and 14 others, including children, were injured in a blast in a house near Sadar Market in Lower Kurram Agency. Official sources say that the blast occurred when a toy-like bomb exploded in Gul Jan s house situated in Gula Jan area of Kurram s Pir Qayyum village. The condition of three wounded was reported as critical as the injured were rushed to Tehsil Sadda Hospital by rescue teams
A security man was killed and three others injured in a landmine blast in Ugh, Dera Bugti.

At least eight people were killed and several others were injured in a suspected suicide bombing near the Police Lines in Lahore, said police senior officials. According to initial reports, a suicide bomber came to a hotel outside the Police Lines and blew himself up near the main gate of Police Lines in Lahore's Qila Gujjar Singh area. A breakaway faction of the Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan, Jamaatul Ahrar, has claimed responsibility for the attack

ACTOR2: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone strike killed at least six militants in Shawal
Three people were killed while five others sustained injuries in a when a militant shot them and later blew himself up near the entrance gate of Imambargah QasareSakina BinteHussain.
Two people died and eight others were injured in a blast in a mosque at Shakriyal Road.

Unknown militants blew up a water pipeline in the Dera Bugti area of Balochistan, suspending water supply to many areas. According to reports, an explosive device was planted on a water pipeline in Toba Nokahai, an area of Zahein Loti, which blasted the pipeline. As a result, the water supply was suspended in the area
A landmine explosion killed two people and injured two others in Balochistan's Naseerabad district Chahtar area.

Just hours after officials had repaired two 220 kilo Volt Ampere (kVA) transmission lines in Chatter area of Naseerabad district of Balochistan on Friday, militants blew it up again for a second time in as many weeks.There have been no claims of responsibility for the latest attack.

A time device bomb exploded near Pakistan Muslim League Nawaz (PML-N) office in Khlu area of Balochistan Saturday, no causality was reported. According to Levies force, unknown men planted a time device bomb near the PML-N office which exploded. The wall of office was damaged and no loss of life was reported

Two bogies of a Quettabound train derailed when bomb exploded at the main railway track in Dera Allahyar area of Jaffarabad district on Saturday. Police officials said that unidentified people had planted an improvised explosive device at the track linking Balochistan with the rest of the country and detonated it as a train was passing. 'A portion of the track blew up and bogies No 4 and 5 derailed due to the explosion,' a police official said. However, it caused no casualty and the passengers travelling remained safe

A Balochistan High Court Chief Justice escaped a remote-controlled explosion targeting his vehicle in the Reko Anjeri area of Naushki district,. However, the chief justice and officials present in the convoy remained unhurt in the explosion So far, no group has claimed responsibility for the bombing.

Two Khasadar force personnel sustained splinters injuries when a remote control Improvised Explosive Device (IED),planted by unknown militants went off near their check post here at bypass road of tehsil Jamrud of Khyber Agency,

Three volunteers of Tauheed-ul-Islam (Aman Lashkar) were killed and five others were wounded when an explosive device went off in their stronghold in Naray Baba of Tirah Valley in Khyber Agency, official sources said on Sunday. Sources said that the blast occurred in the sanctuary of Tawhidul Islam after it forcefully took the center from proscribed faction of Bara based LashkareIslam. The spokesperson of outlawed LI took the responsibility of the explosion

The Armored Personal Carrier of KPK Police came under IED attack in Totalia area of district Buner when explosive material planted by an unknown armed group on a road side went off. District Police Officer (DPO) Buner Khalid Hamdani told media, the APC of KP Police was on routine patrolling when it reached near Tothalia area in Buner. He said soon after the blast the police and security forces rushed on the spot, cordoned off the area and started search against assailants

As many as three children including two girls were injured after a mortar shell fired from undisclosed location landed over in a house of local tribesman in Tirah Valley of BarKhyber Agency, local administration official said on Monday. Bara administration official said the incident occurred in Mastak, a mountainous area of Tirah Valley Khyber Agency wherein the house of Mardan Khan was completely destroyed.
Unidentified men blew up an 18inch diameter gas pipeline in Loti gas field area of Dera Bugti.

At least eight people were injured in an explosion on the Mall Road area of Balochistan's Chaman. Explosives planted on a bicycle detonated with a huge bang wounding eight passersby. The intensity of the blast destroyed four vehicles situated in the vicinity and also damaged more than a dozen shops No group immediately claimed responsibility for the bombing.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Constabulary
NOTES: One Frontier Constabulary (FC) personnel was killed in a roadside blast in Quetta in Mawar area.
Seven police personnel of Bannu district, were injured when their vehicle was hit by a roadside explosion in Kinger Pul, Bannu.
Militants blew up an under-construction college for men in Orakzai Agency.

At least 12 soldiers were injured as an IED planted on the road side in Sheen Warsak, South Waziristan went of. The soldiers were heading to DIK from Wana. 3 soldiers were said to be in critical condition. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack
Unidentified militants blew up two gas pipelines in Dera Bugti and Pir Kho on Sunday. 2 pipelines of 8inch diameter were exploded, disrupting the gas supply in Dera Bugti and Pir Koh.
Unidentified miscreants blown up two gas pipelines in Dera Bugti and Pir Kho on Sunday. 2 pipelines of 8inch diameter were exploded, disrupting the gas supply in Dera Bugti and Pir Koh.
The wall of a government-run girls' school and two vehicles were damaged in a bomb blast in Karachi.
Unidentified persons blew up a shop in Samana area by Bilyamina Police Station.
A Frontier Corps soldier was killed while on duty near a gas pipeline in Dera Bugti by a landmine. He was taken to the closest hospital where he succumbed to his injuries days later.
A woman was killed in an explosion in Hoshab, about 90 Km east of Turbat.
An official of FWO was injured and vehicle was also damaged in Tajaban bombing, 80 Km East of Turbat.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: PTI: Pakistan Tehreek-i-Insaf; Government of Pakistan (2013-2018)
NOTES: On 19 March, unidentified militants hurled a hand grenade at the house of a KPK provincial minister Ali Amin in Dera Ismail Khan. No casualties were reported as residents were not home at the time however a huge crater inside the property was created. The minister is a member of the PTI.
Unknown men hurled a hand grenade at the house of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa provincial minister Ali Amin in Dera Ismail Khan. No one was hurt.
A woman was killed in a landmine blast in Hoshab area of Kech district.

The Pakistani Airforce in the Tirah Valley of Khyber Agency killed at least 48 militants belonging to the TTP and LI in fresh airstrikes. Such precision airstrikes are part of the Zarb-e-Azb campaign to rid the tribal areas of militancy.
A man was killed and nine others injured in a bomb blast near Brohi Chowk in Sector 12L of Orangi Town, Karachi.

On 15 March, 16 people were killed and 78 others injured when Jamaat-ul Ahrar suicide bombers struck two churches during Sunday mass in Lahore's Youhanabad locality. Attackers first broke in and shots were fired after which 2 of the attackers detonated their bombs.

ACTOR2: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: Khawrey Mehsud, a top commander of TTP and closed aid of slain Taliban chief Hakimullah Mehsud was reportedly killed in a US drone strike in Kurram agency.

A private school in North Nazimabad was attacked with a grenade. Nobody was hurt in the attack as students were attending classes. The school was evacuated and children were sent home with their parents

Unknown militants planted improvised explosive device at the building of the boys primary school in Shal Kor, Mohmand which went off with a bang. As a result the building was razed. The political administration and security personnel rushed to the spot soon after the incident, cordoned off the area and started search operation.
Pakistani airstrikes killed 34 terrorists in remote Tirah Valley of the Khyber tribal region.
Two boys and a man were injured when a bomb exploded in Sameejabad area of Multan.
11 security personnel were injured when an improvised explosive device (IED) went off in Mangrosa area of Khyber.

Twenty suspected militants were killed and five others sustained injuries when the Pakistan Army helicopters targeted their hideouts in the Tirah Valley of Khyber Agency . Gunship helicopters targeted the hideouts of the proscribed militant organisations, Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) and Lashkar-e-Islam (LI) in Sandapal, Takhtakai and Nari Baba areas of Tirah Valley
Three soldiers sustained injuries when their convoy was targeted by an IED planted by unknown militants in Tirah Valley , Khyber Agency.
Militants hurled a hand grenade on a private school; no one was injured in the attack.
At least two rangers personnel were killed and four others(including civilians) were injured in a suicide blast in North Nazimabad, Karachi. No group has so far claimed responsibity for the attack

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Jundallah; LeJ: Lashkar-e-Jhangvi
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Bohra Communal Group (Pakistan); Shiite Muslim Group (Pakistan)
NOTES: On 20 March, TTP , LeJ and Jundallah carried out a sectarian attack on the Bohra community (shier minority) mosque in Aramabag, Karachi where 2 worshippers were killed and 11 others injured due to a bomb attached to a motorcycle at the mosque.

At least seven suspected militants were killed and 10 others sustained injuries when helicopters gunship blitzed the sanctuaries of militants in Tirah Valley Khyber Agency. Pakistani helicopters pounded the hideouts including Nari Baba, Sanda Paal, Nangrosa and others which are under the control of outlawed Bara based Lashkar-e-Islam and Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan
A 14-inch diameter pipeline in Dera Allah Yar was blown up.

Twenty-four militants were killed and five others sustained injuries when Pakistan Air Force fighter aircraft pounded their hideouts in Tirah Valley, Khyber Agency. Security forces targeted hideouts of the Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) and Lashkar-e-Islam (LI) in Dars Jumaat, Sandana, Takhtakai and Khyber Sangar in Tirah Valley.
On 23 March, a house was damaged in a grenade attack in the industrial town of Hub, no one was injured.
Two people were killed and three others wounded in a landmine blast in Ladha Tehsil, Shaknoi area.
Seven people were injured from a bomb in industrial town of Hub.
A man and his son were killed and three others injured in a roadside blast in Ladha tehsil of South Waziristan Agency.

Fifteen militants were killed and several others sustained injuries in air strikes by the Pakistan Air Force (PAF) fighter aircraft in various areas of Tirah Valley of Khyber Agency .Fighter aircraft and helicopters bombed the sanctuaries of the Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) and Lashkar-e-Islam (LI) in Wacha Wona, Surkas, Seekhkot and other mountainous areas in the Kukikhel tribal territory.
16 militants were killed by artillery shelling after military forces launched a search operation in Shabak area in Kurram after one soldier was killed in a roadside IED. Unknown militant factions.
1 soldier was killed when a security forces vehicle was targeted by an IED in Shabak, Kurram Agency, no militant faction claimed responsibility.

Thirty militants were killed and several others sustained injuries when Pakistan Air Force (PAF) fighter aircraft and helicopters pounded their hideouts in Tirah Valley in Khyber Agency. The Inter-Services Public Relations (ISPR) said that the fighter aircraft and helicopters targeted the bunkers of the proscribed Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) and Lashkar-e-Islam (LI) in Kukikhel, Sepah, Kamarkhel and Shalobar areas in Tirah Valley, amongst those killed was key LeI spokesman Salahuddin Ayubi .
Three power pylons were blown up in Charsadda by unknown militants who used a remote control device to attack the transmission line.

Pakistan Air Force continued its strikes against militants in final decisive round with killing of eight more terrorists in Tirah Valley of Khyber tribal region. According to security forces officials, Pakistan military jets conducted airstrikes in Tirah Valley, said to the last stronghold of Pakistani militants, and killed eight and injured five others.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Special Security Unit
NOTES: Militants breeched security loop as they attacked a Special Services Unit (SSU) van with an improvised explosive device, killing 2 and injuring many others.

2 policemen were killed and 15 others (including 2 civilians) were injured when a bomb secured to a motorcycle went of near a Special Security Unit in the Shah Latif area of Karachi, The TTP has claimed responsibility for the attack.

In Lower Dir, at a cramped bazar, 32 shops were damaged after a bomb went of in a mobile phone company shop. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack and while 5 kg of explosives were used there were no reported casualties.
Baloch militants attacked on an oil tanker carrying oil for a Chinese company in Saindak, Balochistan. Suspected connected to BLA.
Unknown people detonated a bomb in a school in Sohbatpur, Balochistan, razing it to the ground. There was no loss of life reported.
Chief of the local peace committee was killed and two volunteers injured in a militants' rocket attack in Tank.
3 siblings were injured by a bomb explosion in Kharmato area in the limits of Bilitang.
9 people including four children were injured in an explosion in Began Bazar of Kurram Agency.
At least two soldiers were killed when an IED went off near a military vehicle in Nanno area of South Waziristan. The TTP has claimed responsibility for the attack
In Sipah, Khyber agency, the military pounded LeI militant hideouts in Nangrosa, Spin Drand and Thor Khel with jet fighters, killing 5 suspected militants.
At least six suspected militants belonging to the TTP were killed and several others injured when Pak Airforce jet fighters pounded their hideouts in Tirah Valley, Khyber Agency.

10 militants were killed and three others sustained injuries when a fighter aircraft pounded their hideouts in Tirah Valley of the Khyber Agency. The fighter aircraft and gunship helicopters targeted the sanctuaries of the banned Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) and Lashkar-e-Islam (LI) in Tirah Valley.
2 people sustained injuries when some unidentified armed men hurled a hand grenade and opened fire at a barber shop.

A levies official was killed in a targeted improvised explosive devise blast in Badan, Mamond in Bajaur. Levies subedar Sultan Bakht was on his way to guard a high school where secondary school examinations were in progress when the blast occurred, killing him on the spot

At least 6 suspected militants belonging to TTP and LeI were killed and three more injured as military planes pounded their hideouts in Tirah Valley. Officials hold that sir strikes were conducted in Sandapal, Nangorsa, Speen Drand and Nakai in Sipah
Three hand grenade attacked were witnessed across Charsadda within the span of 8 hours. No casualties were reported but the city remained panicked.
Unidentified persons blew up the house of a tribesman in Shagai in Khyber Agency.
Militants lobbed a hand grenade at a CNG station in Takhtbai, no casualties reported.
An official of the political administration and 3 Levies personnel were injured in a roadside blast in Dabara area in Tank.
Two security personnel were killed in an explosion in Naray Baba, Khyber Agency.
20 militants were killed in Tirah as military fighter aircraft pounded hidehouts in different villages across Tirah Valley. 4 hideouts were also destroyed in the attacks

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On April 12, 4 militants were killed when a US drone fired two missiles at a building in Shawal tehsil of N.Waziristan. The militants belonged to the Sajna faction of the TTP - 2 people were also injured in the attack.
Two women and a child were killed and three women and five children sustained injures when a mortar shell fell on their house in Orakzai Agency
Military forces started an aerial offensive in Central Orakzai agency, killing 11 militants and destroying several hideouts in the agency
Two soldiers were killed when their vehicle hit and EID in Mir Ali, North Waziristan. Troops were on their routine patrol when the IED exploded, no group has claimed responsibility
3 bomb disposal squad officials were gravely injured while defusing a bomb in Sararogha, South Waziristan. The officials were defusing a bomb left on the roadside by militants however it exploded

5 TTP militants were killed when aerial precision strikes were carried out by the military in central Orakzai. A further two hideouts were destroyed in the remote attack as well. The hideouts were in Safial Darra, And Kasha area of central Orakzai Agency.

A bomb went of in front of the house of senior advocate in the Peshawar courts , Latif Afridi. While no one was hurt this is a repeated attempt on the lawyers life who in known in the region to stand firm against militants and pursue legal pathways to eliminate their presence in the region.
Military helicopter gunships targeted TTP militant hideouts in Ahat Mela, Kasha and Tang Kilay in Central Orakzai Agency, killing 8 militants and destroying three hideouts
A blast took place in Peshawar's Pishta Khara area on Ring Road in an attempt to target security forces, yet no one was injured.
A grenade attack in Karachi left three people injured.
A labourer was killed and 5 wounded when a bomb exploded while the labourers were digging at Kurram River an area of Laki Marwat.

A small portion of a railway track in Husainabad, Hyderabad Sindh was blown up by an IED, no casualties were reported. While no group has claimed responsibility for the attack, police forces suspect banned Sindi nationalist groups to be behind the attack
A girl was killed and another injured when a mortar shell fell on a house in Tirah valley of Khyber Agency.
Four members of a family were injured when an explosive device planted near a well went off in Bilyamina area of Hangu.
A soldier was injured when an IED exploded during his patrol by the roadside in Safi Tehsil, Mohmand Agency
A Khasadar force personnel was injured when a remote controlled bomb exploded in Jamrud, Khyber Agency. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack

22 militants were killed as jet fighters pounded Dattakhel, North Waziristan agency, one of those killed was a key TTP commander. 3 hideouts were also destroyed. Predominantly TTP fighters are the target of such raids and in this scenario both local and foreign fighters were killed
A five-year-old girl was killed in a grenade attack near Lea Market, Lyari.
In Peshawar, an IED exploded killing 1 and injuring 7 policemen near a police station. TTP claimed responsibility.

20 militants belonging to the TTP and LEI , including 3 potential suicide bombers were killed when PAF fighter aircrafts targeted their hideouts in the Tirah Valley of Khyber Agency. Ammunition depots and hideouts were also destroyed in the remote attack
A tractor loaded with wheat bags ran over a landmine killing one and injuring two others in Bakhshapur Sindh, bordering Balochistan. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
A landmine blast killed one and injured two others in the jurisdiction of Bakhshapur Police Station near Kandhkot.
A policemen was killed and eight suffered injuries in a bomb blast near a Peshawar police station.
Nine police personnel and a student were injured in a remote control blast.
As Pakistani military jet fighters pounded Tirah Valley, Khyber Agency, 9 militants were killed, 20 injured and 4 TTP/LEI hideouts were destroyed
At least 4 people were killed and 18 others injured when a bomb attached to a motorbike exploded on a busy roadside in Sibi. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
Unidentified persons blew up the house of a tribesman in Bulandkhel area in Orakzai Agency. No one was hurt.
An airstrike targeted hideouts in Bagh, Wochay Wona, Paati and Naaka areas of Tirah.
One person was killed in an improvised explosive device (IED) blast in Hayatabad area of Peshawar, claimed by the TTP.
An explosive device was planted along a road near Bagh Naraan to hit a security convoy; however, it missed and a passerby was killed.
A woman was wounded and a suspected militant was killed when his suicide vest went off.

One policeman was killed and several injured on an attack on Aftab Sherpao, leader of the QWP. The attacker started by shooting, however just as he was shot back at by security he blew himself up with a suicide vest he had on underneath. This is the third attack on Sherpao in 8 years. The TTP claim full responsibility.
A security official was killed and two others were injured as an IED exploded in DIK. The TTP claimed full responsibility for the attack
4 people were injured in a grenade attack on an arms shop at Landi Kotal bazaar.

27 suspected TTP and LeI militants were killed and key strongholds captured over the past 24 hours in the Sandapal, Tordara, Kundwala and Mehrban Killay areas of Khyber Agency. 5 soldiers were also killed during the operations which also involved airstrikes.

27 suspected TTP and LeI militants were killed and key strongholds captured over the past 24 hours in the Sandapal, Tordara, Kundwala and Mehrban Killay areas of Khyber Agency. 5 soldiers were also killed during the operations which also involved airstrikes.

27 suspected TTP and LeI militants were killed and key strongholds captured over the past 24 hours in the Sandapal, Tordara, Kundwala and Mehrban Killay areas of Khyber Agency. 5 soldiers were also killed during the operations which also involved airstrikes.

At least 2 people, including a police officer, were killed in a suicide attack on Aftab Sherpao's convoy as it passed through Umarzai in Charsadda. This was the fourth attack on Sherpao in recent years. Fatalities includes attacker.

27 suspected TTP and LeI militants were killed and key strongholds captured over the past 24 hours in the Sandapal, Tordara, Kundwala and Mehrban Killay areas of Khyber Agency. 5 soldiers were also killed during the operations which also involved airstrikes.
A peace committee member was killed in Nawagai , Bajaur Agency by a targeted roadside blast. Jamaatul Ahrar has claimed responsibility for the attack.
2 people were killed in a landmine explosion in Mardan.
The brother of a provincial minister was killed and at least 3 others injured, including his police guards, during a cracker attack on the ministers office in the Lyari neighbourhood.
A peace committee member was killed by an IED planted by Jamaat-ul-Ahrar in the Nawagai tehsil of Bajaur Agency.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: LeI: Lashkar-e-Islam
NOTES: At least 28 suspected TTP and LeI militants were killed and 10 others injured in airstrikes on the Rajgal, Mehraban Killay, Gharbai Kandao and others areas of Tirah Valley. 2 militant hideouts were also reported destroyed. At least 4 of the militants were also killed in Kuki Khel and Kandu.

Former MNA from Bajaur Agency and PPP Central Executive Committee member Syed Akhunzada Chattan survived a roadside bomb blast in Khar, Bajaur. the bomb was planted by the road exploded near his vehicle. The officials said Chattan and his companions remained unhurt in the attack, and no group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
16 suspected TTP militants were killed in Pakistani airstrikes in the Datta Khel area.
1 person was killed and 3 people were severely injured by a multiple landmine blasts on the same day around Tangwani town.
A former PPP MNA survived an IED blast as his vehicle was traveling from Khar to Mandal in Bajaur Agency.
At least one person was killed in a landmine blast in the Jafarabad area.

At least 28 suspected TTP and LeI militants were killed and 10 others injured in airstrikes on the Rajgal, Mehraban Killay, Gharbai Kandao and others areas of Tirah Valley. 2 militant hideouts were also reported destroyed. At least 4 of the militants were also killed in Kuki Khel and Kandu.

At least 28 suspected TTP and LeI militants were killed and 10 others injured in airstrikes on the Rajgal, Mehraban Killay, Gharbai Kandao and others areas of Tirah Valley. 2 militant hideouts were also reported destroyed. At least 4 of the militants were also killed in Kuki Khel and Kandu.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: LeI: Lashkar-e-Islam
NOTES: At least 28 suspected TTP and LeI militants were killed and 10 others injured in airstrikes on the Rajgal, Mehraban Killay, Gharbai Kandao and others areas of Tirah Valley. 2 militant hideouts were also reported destroyed. At least 4 of the militants were also killed in Kuki Khel and Kandu.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: LeI: Lashkar-e-Islam
NOTES: At least 28 suspected TTP and LeI militants were killed and 10 others injured in airstrikes on the Rajgal, Mehraban Killay, Gharbai Kandao and others areas of Tirah Valley. 2 militant hideouts were also reported destroyed. At least 4 of the militants were also killed in Kuki Khel and Kandu.
16 TTP militants were killed in North Waziristan Agency as Pakistani airforce pounded the area with air strikes

28 suspected TTP/LEI militants were killed in airstrikes carried out by security forces in the Tirah Valley in Khyber agency. The airstrikes also managed to destroy hideouts in Rajgal and Mehraban Killay.
4 soldiers were critically injured in Miranshah, North Waziristan when a security vehicle struck a landmine.
2 army personnel were injured in a rocket attack by suspected TTP militants on the Bush Ghar Naray checkpost in the Angoor Adda area.
4 security personnel were injured by an IED near Baran Dam in the Drayaba FR in the Bannu area.
A young girl was killed and 3 members of her family injured when in a grenade attack on their house in Mohammadzai on Hangu road.
A PPP central executive committee member's car came under an IED attack in the Salarzai area of Bajaur Agency. No injuries reported.
A peace committee member was killed by an IED that went of in Alinagar, Safi Tehsil Mohmand Agency. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
A gas pipeline was blown up by suspected Baloch militants in the Tali Mat area of Dera Bugti.

Baloch Seperatists group blew up a gas pipeline in Pirkoh, Dera Bugti. Levies said that a remote control device was planted by a pipeline transporting gas to the purification plant, it damaged 24 inches worth of the pipeline and caused a heavy fire

As a group of tribal elders were travelling from Bajaur Agency headquarters back to their village, a roadside IED targeted them and 6 elders were killed in Mamond Tehsil. The TTP has claimed responsibility for the attack.
A pro-government tribal elder was killed along with five companions in a roadside bomb blast in Mamond tehsil of Bajaur tribal region.
A civilian was killed as a result of cross border shelling from Afghanistan into Pakistan s Bajaur Agency. Militants have been firing mortar shells from Afghanistan into Pakistani territory.
A youth was killed and another injured in a grenade attack in Safi tehsil of Mohmand Agency.
Unidentified assailants blew up two transmission towers near Khuhra village close to Badah town in Larkana.
At least 4 civilians were killed in shelling in NWA.
On 13 May 2015, the houses of a PTI candidate were damaged in rocket and grenade attacks in Tora Warai (FR Tank, FATA). No casualties were reported.
A male high school student was injured when a bomb planted in a water flask went off in Lakki Marwat.
JUI(F) politician and Baloch Assembly opposition leader Abdul Wasey was targeted in a roadside bomb attack that he narrowly escaped.
Under operation Zarb-e-Azb, 13 TTP militants were killed and their hideouts destroyed in North Waziristan as the military conducted aerial raids in the area

In air strikes conducted in North Waziristan s Shawal area by security forces 17 suspected militants from different groups including the TTP and foreigners were killed while three hideouts were destroyed
Pakistan's Air Force carried out airstrikes in the Wareka Mandi area of Shawal, NWA, killing 17 Uzbek and Afghan members of the TTP.
2 rooms in a Shrine in Uthmankhel, Bajaur were destroyed when a bomb planted by unidentified militants exploded in the shrine. The rooms exploded at 6 AM when no one was inside

The shrine of Ghazi Baba was blown up in Arang area in Utmankhel Tehsil in Bajaur Agency. Unidentified persons planted explosives at the shrine, destroying two rooms of the complex. No casualties were reported.
One civilian was injured as a bomb went off near the Al-Zarghuni Mosque and the office of the deputy-superintendet of police in Hayatabad town on May 16.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On May 16th, 5 TTP militants were killed when a US drone fired missiles at a domestic compound in the Wara Mandi area of Shawal tehsil of N.Waziristan.
An improvised explosive device (IED) planted by the wall of a park in Kohlu exploded Sunday. No loss of life was reported.
Former Tribal Senator Abdur Razaq and his family were safe after an IED that was planted outside the main gate to his house exploded and damaged the boundary wall in Hayatabad, Peshawar.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: At least 5 TTP militants were killed by a US drone strike in Shawal, North Waziristan
A police officer sustained injuries in a blast at a security checkpost in Spin Thall in Hangu district on May 19.
In airstrikes conducted by the Pakistani Airforce, 13 TTP militants were killed in Dattakhel and five hideouts were destroyed.
A TI volunteer (Aman Lashkar) was killed in a landmine explosion in Landikotal, Khyber Agency. No group has claimed responsibility.
A security personnel was killed and another injured when an IED exploded over a patrol vehicle in Spinwam, North Wazi ristan. No group claimed responsibility for the attack
At least three people were injured when an unidentified assailant hurled a hand grenade at a shop in Quetta.
5 people were injured in a grenade attack by unidentified assailants on Quetta's Quarry Road.
A suspected TTP suicide bomber attacked a mosque in the Shabqadar area of Charsadda on May 22, injuring four people and killing himself.
A man was killed and four others injured when explosives planted in a parked rickhaw exploded in Quetta.
In a second attack later in the week, Former Tribal Senator Abdur Razaq and his family narrowly escaped when a rocket hit by unknown assailants targeted his house in Hayatabad, Peshawar.
A rocket hit the residence of a former senator in Hayatabad township. No one was injured in the blast which hit just outside the main gate.
3 Security personnel were killed as their vehicle on regular patrol drove over an IED planted by the TTP in Dattakhel Waziristan

On 24 May, three civilians, including a 12-year-old boy were killed and 15 others injured when BLA militants attacked a convoy of cars carrying the President's son with an explosive laden parked motorcycle in Hub, Balochistan
A former senator, Abdul Wahid was injured as his vehicle went over an IED in Gulnahi area of Mohmand Agency. No group was claimed responsibility for the attack as yet.
A landmine blast killed and injured cattle in the Sui area of Dera Bugti district on May 25.
A landmine explosion took place in Pirkoh gas field area causing damage to a nearby house.
Former senator Malik Abdul Wahid was injured in bomb blast in Mohmand Agency's Ghalanai area on May 25. Another IED was also reported in the same area, causing no casualties.
3 peace committee members were injured when an IED exploded, targeting the vehicle of a former leader of theirs.
On May 26, unidentified persons lobbed a hand-grenade into the house of a local journalist but it caused no casualty in Jamrud Tehsil of Khyber Agency (FATA).
At least five security personnel were seriously injured in a blast that occurred while they attempted to defuse an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) in Bajaur Agency.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Pakistan Rangers
NOTES: At least 2 suspected TTP militants, including a suicide bomber, were killed on May 26 in the Faqeerabad area of Peshwar, after the bomber exploded his suicide jacket during a Rangers search operation.
A truck was targeted by an IED in Ghallanai, Mohmand Agency, injuring 8 soldiers. No group claimed responsibility for the attack
A bomb blast hit railway tracks in ther Nawabshah area on May 27, causing no casaulties.
A bomb blast on the railway track in Hyderabad city area disrupted railway traffic on May 27 as a Mirpurkhas-bound train just crossed the area five minutes before the incident.

An area councillor and his family survived a grenade attack on their house. The grenade was launched from the outer boundary wall and exploded in the courtyard and while a portion of the house caught on fire no loss of life was reported.

A homemade, magnet bomb was attached to the vehicle of a PTI election hopeful while he was canvassing Hangu, KPK for votes in the local body election. The candidate sustained injuries. No one has claimed responsibility for the attack.

A blast near the premises of Qaddafi stadium killed one sub inspector who was on duty at the time. The blast took place during a cricket match between Pakistan and Zimbabwe, in the first international series Pakistan has held in many years.
A cop sustained injuries as unidentified men hurled a hand-grenade at a polling station in Bogha Union Council.

Around 31 May 2015, a grenade attack left at least 7 people dead when supporters of an independent candidate, Wali Khan, were celebrating his victory in the local bodies elections. Other sources reported 10 dead.
10 TTP militants as well as foreigners were killed in air strikes in Dattakhel, North Waziristan. A large cache of arms and ammunition were also destroyed.
A roadside bomb blast in Wana, SWA by unknown assailants killed a political administration official and two others .

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On June 1, US drones hit TTP militants in a compound in Shawal tehsil of N.Waziristan. 2 of them were thought to be TTP militants, with the other three being part of the TTP-allied Islamic Movement of Uzbekistan.
Unidentified persons lobbed a hand grenade into a house in the Thall area. 1 person was injured.
At least 9 TTP militants were killed and 13 others injured in airstrikes by the Pakistan army on Dattakhel, North Waziristan.
A family shopping centre in Tank that was established two months back was targeted by an improvised explosive device. No injuries were reported.
Eight persons were injured in a land mine blast in Jani Berri area of Dera Bugti.
DSP Zahoor Khan was unharmed in a targeted remote control bomb blast in Dera Ismail Khan, yet 2 others were injured.
A policeman was injured when a remote control bomb exploded near a police vehicle in Kulachi, KPK.
A levies personnel was injured and needed his leg amputated after he stepped on a landmine in Pewar, Kurram Agency. No group has claimed responsibility
Unidentified men attacked a house with hand grenade. There was no injury or casualty.
Two children were injured in land mine blast in Sui area of Dera Bugti.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On June 6, US drones fired several missiles at buildings and a vehicle in Saidgai area of Data Khel tehsil in N.Waziristan, killing 9. The majority were from the TTP, but 3 of the dead were civilians. Some reports claimed the civilians that were killed were members of the militants family, but it was confirmed that they were three women.
8 train passengers were seriously injured when four bogies of a train derailed due to a remote control explosive device on the track in Jaccobabad.
Precision military airstrikes killed 12 TTP/LeI militants in Tirah Valley, Khyber Agency. Several militant hideouts were also destroyed
The house of a local leader of the Pakhtunkhwa Milli Awami Party (PkMAP) was attacked with a grenade.
On 11 June, two vehicles were damaged in a hand grenade blast. No causality was reported.

As many as two Frontier Reserve Police personnel were killed while FRP Deputy Commandant Malak Tariq and three other policemen were injured in a suicide attack on their vehicle at Hayatabad the Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed the attack in a statement on the group's website.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Khasadar Force
NOTES: On 12 June 2015, a moderate intensity bomb explosion at Torkham near Pak-Afghan border in Khyber Agency killed one civilian and injured five others including two Khasadars (levy personnel). The TTP are suspected to be behind the attack.
20 militants were killed and several hideouts destroyed during air strikes by security forces in North Waziristan Agency (NWA).
A child was injured in a hand grenade explosion by unknown assailants in Sariab area of Quetta.
A vehicle carrying ASF (airport security forces) personnel escaped a bomb attack.
A bomb blast damaged railway tracks near Khair Muhammad Banglani village in Thull.
Baloch Separatists blew up a section of a gas pipeline in Pir Koh, Dera Bugti, Balochistan. Gas supply was hence suspended in Balochistan, however no loss of life or injuries were reported.
2 persons sustained injuries when unidentified persons threw a hand-grenade into a house in Halimzai tehsil, Mohmand.
An improvised Explosive Device (IED), planted by unknown militants near Takhta Baig check post of tehsil Jamrud exploded, no injuries were reported.

An IED blast occurred outside of a school in Khar, Bajaur. No loss of life was reported although the school is considerably damaged. This is the first such attack in three months. No group has claimed responsibility yet however it is suspected that the TTP are responsible.
A political tehsildar was injured when he was targeted by an IED on his way to inspect a school that had just been blown up by an IED. The TTP is suspected to be behind the attack.
The house of former union council member was damaged in an explosion in Bannu district. No injuries were reported in the incident.
20 militants including some of their important commanders, were killed in air strikes in remote areas of Khyber Agency.
One soldier was killed and six others were injured when their vehicle ran over an IED in Mir Ali of North Waziristan Agency.
At least two security persons were killed and two others sustained injuries in a landmine blast in Kurram Agency. The TTP is suspected to be behind the attack.
A tribal elder was injured and a nephew of his killed in a bomb explosion near a mosque in Gut Agra locality of Mamond tehsil.

SOURCE: Pakistan Today; South Asia Terrorism Portal
NOTES: On 28 June 2015, at least 20 TTP militants were killed in Air strikes by military forces of Pakistan in Shawal area, Data Khel (North Waziristan Agency, FATA).

Security forces in airstrikes killed TTP militants including foreigners. 12 militants were killed; though other reports originally noted 23 fatalities. The strikes also destroyed several arms depots and hideouts around the region.

At least three employees of a construction company sustained injuries in a roadside bomb blast in Turbat. Unidentified men planted an explosive device on Kech Bridge in Turbat and detonated it with remote control when vehicles of a construction company were passing through the area.
Six security personnel were injured from mortar shells from Afghan security forces in South Waziristan.
2 children were injured in Swat from an explosion of a hand grenade.
An explosive device went off near a banquet hall. There were no casualties.
A remote-controlled bomb attack on army vehicles in North Waziristan, killed between two and three and injured six.
A convoy of security forces escaped a bomb attack between Dang and Kogudan areas near Turbat.
A school was blown up by militants in Kamangara Nawagai sub division of Bajaur Agency.

One person was killed and 15 others injured as a bomb planted by suspected Baloch separatists exploded in a prominent hazara neighbourhood in Quetta, although no group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
At least 3 security personnel were killed in a remote control bomb blast in North Waziristan near border with Bannu.
A local farmer was injured as a landmine exploded while he was tending his crops in Nasirabad, Balochistan.
Three people were injured in a bomb blast on ring road in Achini area.
Unidentified men suspected to be Baloch separatists blew up a six-inch diameter gas pipeline in Sohbatpur area, causing suspension of gas supply to the entire area.
A government-run boys school was blown up using explosives by suspected Taliban militants in the Malakdin Khel area of Khyber Agency, no casualties were reported.

Suspected Baloch separatists planted the remote-controlled device under the Sariab Bridge, close to a private hospital. the bomb went off wounding at least two bystanders and damaging two cars which were parked close by
Two officials of security forces were killed and five members of the bomb disposal unit were injured in an IED blast planted by suspected TTP militants in the Sandana area of Tirah Valley
At least 14 TTP militants including key commanders were killed after Pak military fighter jets pounded their hideouts in Alwara, North Waziristan Agency
Two persons were injured when unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at a house in Buland Khel, Orakzai tribal agency.
A house was partially damaged in a blast in Doaba. No injuries were reported.
An Indian surveillance drone had entered Pakistan's air space on 15 July. The UAV was brought down in Bhimber area by Pakistani troops.

At least two Hazara Shia people were killed in a suicide explosion in Quetta. The bomber, with unknown affiliations attempted to enter Quetts Hazara Town area but was intercepted by security personnel. The interception forced the attacker, who was wearing women's clothes, to prematurely detonate his explosives
2 children were injured when a bomb exploded in Tochi area of Bannu.

At least two persons were injured in an explosion caused by suspected Baloch separatists in Lehri, Sibi Balochistan. According to Levies sources, unidentified men had attached a remote control bomb to a motorcycle and parked it near a bus stop.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Border Security Force
NOTES: Reports of Indian shelling on July 25 and 26 across the LoC into the Chinikot sector of Haveli tehsil/district. 1 civilian was injured in the Polas village of this sector on July 25. No mention of Pakistani retaliation.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Border Security Force
NOTES: Reports of Indian shelling on July 25 and 26 across the LoC into the Chinikot sector of Haveli tehsil/district. 1 civilian was injured in the Polas village of this sector on July 25. No mention of Pakistani retaliation.
A man was injured in a landmine blast in Baizai tehsil of Mohmand Agency.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Border Security Force
NOTES: Two persons were killed and 23 others injured in heavy shelling by Indian Border Security Forces (BSF) on Sialkot border villages in Bajwat Sector of Sialkot Working Boundary.
As many as two persons were injured in a landmine explosion in Tehsil Chithar area of Nasirbad, no group has claimed responsibility.
National Party's central leader and MPA Haji Muhammad Islam Baloch along with his family was escaped in attack of rockets in Kharan by unknown assailants.

On August 5th, a leader of the National Party and MPA, Haji Islam Baloch, along with his family, survived several rocket attacks on his vehicle by suspected militants in the Pattak area of Besima tehsil. One of his guards was injured by one of the explosions. No group has claimed responsibility.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On August 6, US drones fired missiles in Lawar Mandi in Data Khel tehsil in N.Waziristan, killing at least 4 fighters belonging to the Haqqani network.
Baloch Republican Army claimed responsibility for an explosion on a railway track in Sadiqabad which derailed a whole bogey but no injury or loss of life was reported.

On August 9th, a passenger train was derailed by a bomb blast on the track in the Chandrami area of Rahim Yar Khan. Parts of the train were damaged, but no injuries were reported. No group has claimed responsibility.

A member of local peace committee has been killed in remote bomb blast caused by militants in Tehsil Maidan of Lower Dir. According the police, bomb, planted at the residence of Dilawar Khan exploded in the Ziarat Kalle Sorri Pao area of tehsil Maidan, killing him on the spot.
One police official died and several civilians including children were injured when a bomb hidden in a sleeping bag by suspected Baloch separatists exploded in Quetta.
An army captain and two soldiers were killed in bomb attack in a Khyber Agency, when security forces were sweeping the Sandan area of Tirah Valley for improvised explosive devices IEDs.
At least one soldier was killed and five others injured in an explosion caused by suspected Baloch separatists in Turbat district of Balochistan on Friday.

A suicide attack, by a Punjabi teenager led to the death of Shuja Khanzada, Punjab Home Minister, and 19 other individuals. While investigations are still under way it is likely the LeJ was attacking retaliatory to the arrest of their leader
An IED planted by LEI/TTP on a roadside injured two civilians in Tirah Valley, Khyber agency
On August 16th, the Pakistan Army claims to have killed 40 militants through precise aerial strikes in the Shawal area of North Waziristan.
Military planes pounded hideouts in Shawal, North Waziristan killing 50 militants from the TTP and Haqqani Network
Military airstrikes targeted TTP and LEI hideouts in Tirah Valley, Khyber Agency, killing 15 militants
Military airstrikes killed 18 suspected TTP and affiliated militants in Shawal, North Waziristan.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Border Security Force
ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Pakistan Rangers
NOTES: A Pakistani civilian was killed in heavy shelling by Indian Border Security Forces in Sialkot, the Pakistani military retaliated with heavy fire as well.
On August 19th, at least 25 militants were killed in air strikes by the Pakistan Air Force in the Shawal area of North Waziristan, FATA.
On August 19th, a Pakistani soldier was injured when his vehicle hit a roadside bomb in the Derakai area of Bajaur Agency, about 16km from Khar.
On August 20th, Pakistan claimed to have killed 28 militants through Air Force air strikes in the Shawal area of North Waziristan, FATA.
On August 20th, Pakistan claimed to have killed 15 militants through Air Force air strikes in the Gharlamai area of North Waziristan, FATA.
An IED bomb, planted by suspected TTP members went off on the road side in Upper Dir killing 1 and injuring 3

On August 22nd, 3 people, including 2 tribal leaders, were killed, and 2 others injured, when militants targeted a vehicle with an IED blast in the Arang area of Bajaur agency. No group has claimed responsibility.

On August 23rd, PPP Mamond tehsil president Malik Mohammad Khan was killed when unidentified militants exploded an IED near his residence in the Gilele area of Mamond, Bajaur Agency. No group claimed responsibility.

On August 23rd, four security personnel were injured when unidentified militants targeted their vehicle with a remote controlled IED in the Saptary area of Bajaur Agency. No group claimed responsibility.
On August 23rd, a section of a 12-inch gas pipeline was blown up by a planted IED in the Dera Allah Yar area of Jaffarabad district. No group has claimed responsibility.
At least 4 security personnel were killed due to a cross border rocket attack on a check post in Khyber Agency.

On August 23rd, 4 Pakistani Army soldiers were killed, and four others injured, when Afghani militants fired rockets at the Akhund Walah Pass checkpost in Tirah valley of Khyber Agency from the border areas of Afghanistan's Nangarhar province.
On August 24th, two people riding a motorcycle in the Khalid Brohi village area near Tangwani were killed when an IED exploded underneath them. No group claimed responsibility.
On August 24th, 2 civilians were killed, and 2 others injured, when suspected militants threw a grenade into a shop in the Mullah Fazal Chowk area of Gwadar. No group claimed responsibility.

On August 25th or 26th, two Pakistani soldiers were killed when their military convoy was exploded by a roadside IED in the Nano area of South Waziristan. TTP: Tehreek-i-Taliban Pakistan claimed responsibility.
On August 25th, for the second day in a row two people riding a motorcycle in the Khalid Brohi village area of Kashmore district were injured when a land mine exploed underneath their vehicle.
A Pro-government tribal elder was killed in a blast in Bajaur caused by an IED on the roadside, the TTP claim full responsibility
On August 27th, a pro-government tribal elder was killed when an IED was detonated by remote control in the Chamarkand area of Mohmand Agency. Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan claimed responsibility.
On August 28th, for a second time in 24hrs, a tribal elder was killed by a remote-detonated IED in the Chamarkand tehsil area of Bajaur Agency. TTP is suspected, but not verified.
On August 29th, at least 14 militants were killed in air strikes by the Pakistan Air Force in the Shawal area of North Waziristan, FATA.

On August 29th, a Pakistani soldier was killed, and four others injured, security forces convoy was hit by a roadside IED explosion in the Pash Ziarat area of Makin tehsil, South Waziristan. TTP claimed responsibility.

On August 31st, a driver was killed and 3 passengers injured, including a local tribal leader, when their vehicle was exploded by a roadside IED in Khar tehsil, Bajaur Agency. No group claimed responsibility, although TTP has been behind at least one recent attack on a tribal leader in the area.
A suicide blast outside the political offices of the political administrator in Jamrud resulted in the death of 3 people and injured 54. The TTP claimed responsibility for the attack.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: On September 1st, 5 foreign militants were killed, and at least 3 injured, in a US drone strike on a compound in Karwanda village, of Datta Khel, FATA. 3 of the militants were Uzbek nationals.
At least 17 TTP militants were killed in North Waziristan as the Pak Air force pounded the area with heavy fire from jet fighters
At least 15 TTP/LI militants were killed as Pakistan Air force jet fighters struck Tirah Valley in Khyber Agency
A roadside blast in Hangu resulted in the death of a district councillor aligned with the ANP.
The first ever attack by a Pakistani drone attacked a TTP militant compound in the Shahwal Valley of North Waziristan, killing 3
On September 11th, 2 members of a peace committee were killed in a roadside IED blast in the Dwezai area of Mohmand Agency.

A dozen unknown armed men fired rockets at the residence of the acting speaker of the Balochistan Assembly, setting fire to the speaker's house and 20 of his relative's houses as well. No loss of life was reported.

On September 12th, a woman was killed, and 2 other people injured, when unidentified armed men threw a grenade at the house of a local tribesman in the Inzari Mian Gan locality of Dawezai, Mohmand Agency.
At least 15 suspected TTP and other militants were killed in military airstrikes in Shahwal, North Waziristan
A planted bomb went off in a busy bus station in Multan, Punjab, killing 10 and injuring scores of people. The BLA is suspected to be behind the attack

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: On September 15th, 5-8 Frontier Corps personnel were injured when their vehicle was targeted by a remote control IED in the Wana bypass area, South Waziristan.
On September 17th, a local tribesman was seriously injured when unidentified armed men threw a grenade at him while he was driving a tractor in the Talaband area of Sarband.
On September 17th, a boy sustained minor injuries when the house of a teacher was partially damaged by a bomb blast in Ustarzai Payan village, Kohat district. No group claimed responsibility.
Iranian forces fired mortar shells at Pakistan's bordering town of Mashkai in spreading fear and panic in the area, however there was no loss of life or property reported in the shelling

On September 18th, a Pakistani airstrike killed 8 Pakistani civilians. Although this strike was originally reported as a US drone strike, it later emerged to be an airstrike by the Pakistani military. A house of a suspected militant was struck when in which 3 women, 4 girls and two boys were staying. No militants were reported to have been killed in the attack that took place in Shonkrai Narai village in Ladha village of S.Waziristan.
At least 15 TTP/LI militants were killed and several others injured as military jet fighters pounded their hideouts in Tirah, Khyber Agency

Unidentified militants bombed a state run girls primary school in Sipah, Khyber agency. The boundary wall was severely damaged, no loss of life was reported as the area has been evacuated due to the military operation in the area.
At least eight people among them an elder of Marri tribe have been killed in landmine blast and rocket attack took place in Marwar coalmine area of Balochistan

A village councilor belonging to the Pakistan Tehreek-i-Insaf (PTI) survived an attempt on his life in Manglawar area of Swat. Police sources said unknown attackers threw a hand grenade at councilor Dildar Ali's house in Manglawar area of Swat. The councilor survived while while his wife was wounded in the attack.
At least 25 militants were killed in Pakistani military airstrikes near Datta Khel area of North Waziristan Agency.
A house was damaged when an explosive device went off near a boundary wall in the Shahidabad in Hangu. No casualties reported.
One security official was killed and 2 others sustained injuries in an IED blast in the Toran Dara area of Safi tehsil.
A pro-government elder and former peace committee head was killed and his son injured by a roadside bomb in the Bannu area.
A member of a Lashkar force was injured in Nawagai tehsil of Bajaur Agency by an IED.
Twenty-two TTP militants have been killed by pakistani military air strikes in areas along the Pak-Afghan border in Datta Khel
A woman was killed when unidentified assailants threw a grenade into her house in Ustarzai Payan in the Kohat area.
2 women were injured in a roadside blast at Khaisor village in the Bakakhel area of Bannu.

At least eight people were killed and 13 injured in suspected suicide attack targeting a camp office of a federal lawmaker of the ruling Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) in Taunsa. LeJ is suspected to be behind the attack
A tribal chief and ANP leader survived a bomb blast in the Mamond area of Bajaur Agency. His vehicle was destroyed in the blast.
A blast in a local bus killed at least 10 people, two of them children, on Sariab road Quetta . Twenty-two people were injured, six of them seriously.
2 security personnel were killed in a landmine explosion and gunfight in the Khost area of Harnai district.
A personnel of Frontier Corps (FC) was killed in landmine blast in Khost area of Harnai, Balochistan.
The PAF fighter jets bombed TTP and LeI militant hideouts in Rajgaal area of Tirah Valley and killed at least 21 militants and injured several others.
Eleven people, including six children, were killed and 12 injured when a suicide bomber blew himself up at an Imambargah in Bhag, some 200km east of Quetta
An IED went off outside a house in the Miryan area of Bannu. No injuries reported.
Several militants were killed and hideouts were destroyed in a Pakistani Buraq drone strike in NWA.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A US drone strike killed 6 Daesh militants in the Nazyan district of Khyber Agency.
A suicide bomber with unknown affiliations blew himself up early in the morning during Muharram Ashura processions in Jacobabad, killing at least 27 Shia muslims

ACTOR1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Border Security Force
NOTES: 6 people were injured, 50 houses damaged and livestock killed during a mortar attack by BSF on a village in the Shakargarh sector.
8 people, including 3 tribal elders and 5 guards, were killed in an IED and rocket attack in the Marwar area of Quetta district. The BLA claimed responsibility.
One security official was killed and three others injured when an IED went off along the roadside in Tirah, Khyber Agency. No group claimed responsibility for the attack
One soldier was killed and three others sustained injuries in an improvised explosive device blast in the Tirah Valley in Khyber Agency
3 civilians were killed and 9 others injured when a bomb planted on rail tracks in Dasht, Mastung went off. No group has claimed responsibility for the blast
A pro-government tribal elder was killed and three of his companions injured when an IED exploded in Salarzai, Bajaur, no group claimed responsibility for the attack.
A man was killed by a landmine planted by a suspected militant group.
Non-violent activity: On November 4, no casualties were reported after a hand grenade attack on a flourmill in the limits of Chamkani police station near Peshawar (Khyber Pakhtunkhwa).
At least 15 TTP and LeI militants were killed after Pak Airforce jets targeted militant hideouts in the Tirah Valley
Four members of a family sustained injuries in a blast that targeted a house owned by an Afghan national in Shahkas's area of Jamrud.

Over half a dozen people were wounded in a grenade attack against PPP leaders in Lyari which missed them and hurt some nearby members of the Kutchi community. The attack was allegedly carried out by a Lyari-based gang.
A Khasadar Force member and a civilian were killed in an IED blast in Safi tehsil of Mohmand Agency.
At least 22 TTP and other militants were killed after Pak Airforce jets targeted militant hideouts in Shawal, North Waziristan.

On 18 Nov, two members of the Zakhakhel communal militia Lashkar were critically injured when an explosive device planted by unidentified assailants exploded in a bunker in Nari Baba in Tirah Valley (Khyber Agency, FATA).
A member of the security forces was killed by a roadside bomb in Mashkay tehsil of Awaran district.
Two employees of a private TV channel Dunya News were wounded when two unidentified men on a motorcycle hurled a cracker at their office located in Karachi.
2 employees of Dunya News were injured when unidentified motorcycle riders threw a hand grenade into their office in Faisalabad.
Iranian border guards fired four mortar shells into Pakistani territory in Chagai area of Balochistan however, no loss of life was reported in the attack
At least 2 soldiers were killed and another injured when their convoy was hit by a roadside bomb near Toorwam village in the Sarwaiki area of SWA.
One person was killed and 4 injured in a remote bomb blast near Lea Market in Karachi's Saddar area.

A man was killed and six others injured in a cracker attack on a gas cylinder shop in the Kharadar area of Saddar Town. Two unidentified assailants riding motorcycle threw cracker at a gas cylinder shop resulting in one casualty and injuring six others.
3 policemen were injured when patrolling in Quetta as a IED exploded as they drove past. No group claimed responsibility for the blast.
At least three policemen were injured in an IED blast on Qambrani road, near Quetta's Wazir Bagh.

JUI-F party member and Federal Minister for Housing and Works Akram Khan Durrani was injured when his car was hit by a roadside bomb in Bannu. This is the second attempt on Durrani's life, the first came in 2007 . In recent years JUI-F has become a frequent target of attacks by the TTP.

2 passersby were killed by an IED which hit the convoy of the Minister of Housing as he was traveling in Bannu district. The Minister was unharmed. 5 people, including 2 police, were injured in the attack.

21 suspected TTP and LeI militants were killed and four of their hideouts destroyed when Pak Airforce jets carried out air strikes in the area, according to army press releases. LeI claims they lost no members during this attack
Unidentified persons fired rockets at a truck at Turssa village near Parachinar, headquarters of Kurram Agency, on Saturday, killing its driver and injuring the cleaner.
A tribal leader was injured and a passerby killed by an IED blast that hit the tribal leader's vehicle in Mohmand Agency. Another source said two tribal elders were killed in the blast.

On 28 November 2015, a former peace committee leader was killed and another seriously injured in a roadside blast in Ambar tehsil [coded at Ajdarra] of Mohmand Agency. The injured man died on the way to a hospital in Peshawar.
2 low intensity blasts were reported in the Chashma Achozai area of Quetta. No injuries reported.
2 blasts occurred in different areas of Quetta on Airport Road. No casualties were reported.
A bomb blast hit the convoy of the Federal Minister for Housing and Works in the Nermikhel area of KPK. 2 people were killed and 3 injured. The Minister was unharmed.

Three people were injured after an explosion occurred outside the office of Din News in Lahore. Initial investigations suggest that a cracker caused the powerful blast, no group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Two people were injured when bomb went off near a fire brigade station at the Bacha Khan Chowk in Quetta . It was an improvised explosive device planted close to the fire brigade station and detonated with the help of a time device, no group has so far claimed responsibility.
Unidentified militants threw grenades at a security forces camp in the Khuga Khel area of Landi Kotal tehsil. The grenades landed in the camp but caused no casualties.

On December 3, unidentified assailants threw a grenade at the house of a local trader in the jurisdiction of Pandu Police Station near Peshawar (Khyber Pakhtunkhwa). The blast destroyed boundary walls and two shops close by but no casualties were reported.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Pakistan Rangers
NOTES: A Rangers vehicle was damaged by an explosive device attached to a bicycle as it drove by. No injuries were reported.
On December 5, unidentified assailants threw a grenade into a house in Kabal tehsil (Swat, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa). No casualties were reported.
4 people were injured in a bomb blast outside the residence of a contractor in the Sarki Gate area of Peshawar.

Unidentified attackers hurled a grenade at the Sargodha Bureau of Express News TV channel Monday evening, the channel's website reported. No loss of life was reported, however, the channel claimed that a security guard was injured and the building's exterior was damaged in the cracker attack.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: A member of the Frontier Corps (FC) personnel was killed and 4 other people were injured when a TTP-planted bomb went off at a checkpost in Quetta.

A remotely controlled Improvised Explosive Device (IED) killed an official of Frontier Corps (FC), paramilitary troops, and wounded three others in Quetta. A passerby child was also wounded in the explosion, no group claimed responsibility for the attack.

A planted bomb exploded in a busy market in Parachinar, killing at least 24 civilians. Lashkar-e-Jhangvi claimed responsibility for the attack, saying it was an attack against those sending their children to fight in the Syrian war . LeJ is a very anti-shiite militant group and Kurram agency has a big Shia population.
A blast damaged a house near Wazir Bagh Sunday night. Locals said the bomb planted outside a house went off with a loud sound at around 8:55 pm, damaging the boundary wall.

The security forces claimed to have killed eight militants and injured eight others in airstrikes conducted by the fighter jets on Tuesday in Rajgal and Saperay areas of Tirah Valley in Khyber Agency.

The security forces claimed to have killed eight militants and injured eight others in airstrikes conducted by the fighter jets on Tuesday in Rajgal and Saperay areas of Tirah Valley in Khyber Agency.
At least six suspected TTP and LeI militants were killed in military air strikes in the Rajgal and Sparee areas of Khyber Agency's Tirah Valley
4 people were injured in a grenade attack in the Lyari area of Karachi.

One person was wounded when a powerful explosion occurred outside the Minhaj-ul-Hussain Institute in Johar Town, Lahore yesterday evening. Police investigators said that a cracker exploded outside the educational institute of Shia community.
17 TTP militants were killed and several others injured when Pak Army military planes bombarded 3 TTP hideouts in Shawal, North Waziristan.
Precise air strikes by the Pak Army resulted in 6 TTP and LeI militants being killed in the Tirah Valley and 3 hideouts were destroyed as well.

At least three suspected TTP militants were killed on Saturday, and one security personnel injured after a convoy of security officials was targeted by an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) in North Waziristan's Tehsil Tarayza.
At least two people were killed in a mine blast in Baizai, Mohmand Agency on Monday.
A civilian was killed and 3 security personnel injured in a landmine blast in the Baizai area.
Two FC officials were injured in a blast in Margat, near Quetta area of Balochistan. The blast occurred through a remote controlled device that detonated the bomb planted at the roadside.

On 23 December 2015, at least 3 persons, including two children, were killed and a child sustained injuries in a roadside blast in the Ambar Tehsil [coded at Ajdarra] of Mohmand Agency, tribal sources said on Wednesday.
Crossing into Pakistan, Iranian border guards on Sunday fired three mortar shells in the Washuk district of the restive Balochistan province. No loss of life or property was reported

At least two people were killed in land mine blast in Chamalang area of Loralai district on Tuesday.According to the security sources two people were on motorcycle when they hit land mine in Chamalang area.

Two people were killed in a landmine blast in the Chamalang area of Loralai district. Sources in the security forces said two people were travelling on a motorcycle when they hit a landmine. Both of them died on the spot

Twenty-six people were killed and more than 50 others wounded after a suicide bomber struck a regional office of the National Database and Registration Authority in Mardan. In an email to media outlets, Ehsanullah Ehsan, Jamaatul Ahrar spokesperson claimed responsibility for the attack holding that government offices will be persistently targeted for their role in the war against terror.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: A soldier from the Frontier Corps (FC) was killed and another injured in a remote control bomb blast in Dasht area of Kech district here on Tuesday.
At least eight suspected TTP and LeI militants were killed and 11 others injured when Pak Army fighter planes bombed their hideouts in Tirah valley, Khyber Agency.
An FC soldier was killed while one more was injured in a remote-controlled bomb blast in Dasht, Kech. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

In Mastung, a Frontier Corps (FC) soldier was killed and two more suffered injuries in a roadside explosion in the Ispilinji area. An FC vehicle was on its way to supply water to check posts when it was hit by an improvised explosive device (IED) explosion. No group has come forward to claim responsibility for the attack.

At least four militants were killed and six others injured when PAF jet fighters pounded their hideouts in the Jamrud tehsil of Tirah Valley on Tuesday. Other sources claimed as many as 8 had been killed and 11 injured.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: A Frontier Corps (FC) soldier was killed while two others were injured when an improvised explosive device (IED) exploded near the FC convoy in Ispilinji area of Mastung district.

At least three rockets were fired in Mand and Dasht areas of Kech District by unidentified militants, which landed in open ground whereas one rocket landed near an election Polling station. No one was hurt however panic spread in an area gearing up for local body elections.
A student of class four died when a rocket fired by unidentified assailants exploded in a date orchard in Tump, a town close to the border with Iran in Kech district, on Sunday.
1-2 soldiers were injured in a remote bomb blast that hit his vehicle as it was traveling from Tarbela to Peshawar in the Duranpur area of KPK.

A remote controlled, improvised explosive device went off near a security forces vehicle in the vicinity of Peshawar Motorway Toll Plaza causing minor injuries to a soldier. 11 soldiers were on board the attacked vehicle while one of them sustained minor injuries
2 police were injured when a militant threw a grenade at a police mobile on the Mardan-Sawabi road.
A peace committee volunteer (Lashkar) was injured in the Sarwaki tehsil of SWA after his vehicle hit a roadside bomb.

Two soldiers sustained injuries in a roadside blast at Shaheedano Dand in Kurram Agency on Thursday, official sources said. The sources said that a convoy of the security forces was heading to Khwana Khandao from Shaheedano Dand.

A pro-government tribal chief Wali Jan Mehsud escaped a roadside bomb blast in South Waziristan on Friday. Security forces said that Mehsud was on way to Shahur High School, when a remote-controlled bomb went off at a roadside near Moley Khan Serae. The blast slightly damaged the car of Mehsud.

At least 38 suspected foreign and local militants were killed in military air strikes in the North Waziristan tribal area The strikes were carried out in the Datta Khel tehsil of North Waziristan, destroying several militant hideouts. The strikes targeted several militant groups including the IMU and TTP.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: 5 people died when a US drone fired missiles at a compound in Mangrotia in Data Khel tehsil of N.Waziristan on January 9th. This strike killed a senior TTP commander and his associates, 2 were also injured.

Coast Guard personnel were on routine patrolling when their vehicle hit a landmine in Kaldan area of Jewni Tehsil in Gwadar. They said two personnel were killed on the spot whereas three sustained serious wounds. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
A man was injured in a grenade attack in Satellite Town area of the city on Sunday. Armed men hurled a hand-grenade into a wine shop on Munir Mengal Road and escaped.

Two persons riding a motorcycle hurled hand-grenade at the office of ARY News in Sector F-7/4, causing serious injuries to the driver of DSNG van. The perpetrators left a pamphlet at the scene claiming the government must stop operation Zarb-e-Azb. Rumors were quick to circulate that the attack was carried out by ISIS however, with no official claim, and with the attack being so different from the group's usual tactics the claim is not substantiated.

An explosion rocked Nazimabad area of Karachi on Thursday evening, injuring at least two people, the bomb was planted in a rickshaw, no group has claimed responsibility.
A parked vehicle was damaged on Friday by a bomb planted by an unidentified group in Pirkoh area of Dera Bugti, no causality was reported.
Five police constables were injured in a handgrenade attack on police van during a routine patrolling in Shagai area of District Swabi.

Six personnel of the Frontier Corps were killed and another received injuries in a blast near the Margat FC check post area , the bomb was detonated remotely as members of the Frontier Corps patrolled the area.

At least twelve people were killed and 25 others injured in a bomb blast near a security Kharkhano check-post of Khasadar Force in Khyber Agency on Tuesday. The attack was a suicide bombing and the bomb was detonated as the attack came near a Khasadar Force line officer.
Security forces killed nine TTP/LI militants in air raids conducted in Khyber Agency in area close to Pak-Afghan border.
