Two members of local peace committee were injured in a blast near Pakistan-Afghan border in Nawagai tehsil of Bajaur Agency on Thursday.
Three men were killed and another sustained injuries on Thursday when a missile fired from Afghan territory struck a local bakery in Birmal, close to Angoor Ada, in South Waziristan Agency.

Balochistan Home Minister Mir Sarfaraz Ahmed Bugti escaped a powerful landmine blast targeting his convoy in Phelawagh area of Dera Bugti on Friday. Sarfaraz Bugti and his security guards remained unhurt but the vehicles of the home minister and his security guards were damaged. The BRA claimed responsibility.

A remote-controlled blast took off on Pandu Inqilab road which hit vehicle of a local seminary administrator's injuring the cleric, Qari Salahuddin in the jurisdiction of Chamkani police station, Peshawar.

At least two people, including an administrator of a religious seminary, were injured when a roadside bomb planted by unknown persons hit a vehicle at Peshawar's Sabzi Mandi area in Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa.

Two mortar shells fired from Afghanistan landed in Bazar Zakhakhel in Landikotal tehsil of the Khyber Agency. Alleged militants fired two mortars shells from Afghanistan which landed near the residential area of Zakhakhel.

Unidentified assailants threw a grenade at the house of the Balochistan irrigation minister in the Defence Housing Authority of Lahore. The grenade did not explode.

Two bogies of Akbar Khan Bugti Express were partially damaged in an explosion at Mithari area of Bolan district when unknown men, suspected to be Baloch separtists had attached explosive devices with railway track which went off when the train was heading to Rawalpindi from Quetta Station.

Three security personnel and two civilians were injured in a suicide car bomb attack near the cantonment area in Zhob town on Friday. The condition of two of the injured is said to be serious. Fatalities include bomber. A splinter faction of the TTP claimed responsibility.

In Tump area of Kech district, four security personnel, including an officer, were injured in a rocket attack. Sources said that a convoy of Frontier Corps (FC) was passing through the area when it came under an attack launched by militants from nearby mountains, using rocket launchers.
Fresh air strikes by the Pak Airforce in Tirah Valley area of Khyber Agency killed as many as six suspected TTP/LI militants and left several injured.
A security man sustained injuries in a landmine blast in Baizai subdivision of Mohmand Agency on Wednesday.
A TTP suicide attack targeting a convoy of a paramilitary force killed at least 10 people, including four troops, and wounded nearly two dozen others in the high security area of Quetta.
Wife and daughter of an ex-serviceman were injured in a hand-grenade attack at Mairaj Colony in Takhtbai early Thursday.
Three men sustained injuries when an explosive device planted at the backside of the house of KhyberPakhtunkhwa Minister for Revenue Ali Amin Gandapur went off, no group has claimed responsibility.

bomb blast took place at a Rangers' post in Liaquatabad on Sunday evening did not cause any damage to life, but triggered fear and panic among the area people
A landmine explosion near a shop claimed two lives in Lakki Marwat, a town about 110 miles south of Peshawar on Monday morning.

At least two persons were injured in a hand grenade blast in Hub area of Lasbella district, unidentified men hurled a hand grenade on the house of Nasrullah at Jam Colony which went off, leaving two persons injured on the spot.

At least nine suspected TTP and LeI militants were killed and five injured in air strikes in the Rajgal and Kukikhel areas of Tirah valley of Khyber Agency on Monday.

At least nine suspected TTP and LI militants were killed and five injured in air strikes in Tirah valley of Khyber Agency.

A seven-year-old shepherd boy died in landmine blast in Kordan area of Dera Bugti district on Wednesday.

Two men were killed and two others were injured when a planted improvised explosive device (IED) went off in the Mama Ziarat area of Datakhel tehsil in North Waziristan.

A peace committee member was killed in an IED blast at Ziarat Kali (or Khwar) area of tehsil Safi.
An IED explosion left one man injured in the Janikhel frontier region connecting Bannu with North Waziristan.
On February 19, Taliban detonated bombs and exploded the girl's wing of a newly built government school in Peshawar city (Peshawar, KP). TTP claimed responsibility for the attack.
On 20 Feb, the building of the district education office was slightly damaged in a grenade attack in Gwadar (Balochistan). No one was injured in the attack.

NOTES: At least five Frontier Corps personnel were wounded in a suspected TTP-planted improvised explosive device (IED) blast near a security checkpost in Wana, South Waziristan Agency, on Wednesday.

A landmine hit a vehicle of security personnel in Karam area of Dattakhel, killing a soldier and injuring two others.

A man sustained injuries when an improvised explosive device (IED) went off in the Janikhel area of Bannu on Tuesday.

NOTES: Suspected militants hurled hand grenades at two different Rangers check posts in Karachi's Gulshan-e-Iqbal. At least 10 people were killed and 23 injured in a blast by a remote explosive in the DHA area of Lahore.
2 top JuA militants were killed in targeted artillery strikes across the Af-Pak border by the Pakistani military.
A youth was killed and another persons eriously wounded by a landmine blast in the Qadirabad neighbourhood of Nushki.
3 FC personnel and a civilian were injured by an IED that hit the security forces vehicle on Sariab Rd in the Ziarat Bibi area of Quetta.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
NOTES: On March 2 2017, a US drone killed two militants linked both to the Afghan Taliban and the Haqqani network. This was the first reported US drone strike since Trump became President two months before. A drone fired a missile at a motorbike in Lower Kurram tehsil in Kurram district of KP province.
A young football player was seriously injured when an IED went off on the road leading to Hangu stadium.
An LEA member was killed when their vehicle hit an IED in the Awaran area.
9 mortar shells were fired into the Nukundi area of Chagai in Pakistan by Iranian border forces. No casualties reported.
On November 3rd, at least 2 people were injured when an IED exploded in the Zakhakhel Adda Rangra market of Landi Kotal. Two vehicles were also damaged. No group claimed responsibility.
A resident of Borki in Kurram Agency was injured in a landmine explosion.
5 people, including 2 FC personnel, were injured in a grenade attack on some civilians by unidentified motorcycle riding assailants in the Turbat area. The BLA claimed responsibility.
A bridge on the coastal highway in Gwadar was damaged in a bomb blast. The BLF claimed responsibility.
A bomb went off in a school in the Jani Khel area of Khyber Agency.
A vehicle of the security forces was hit by a bomb blast, smashing the windows but causing no injuries in the Khuzdar area.
The Pakistan Air Force carried out airstrikes in Khyber Agency's Rajgal Valley, killing a number of suspected LeJ militants and destroying many terrorist sanctuaries (unknown fatalities).
On March 16, unidentified assailants threw a grenade at the Municipal Committee building in Mastungcity (Balochistan), causing significant damage to the building.
An FC member and 2 suicide bombers were killed in an attack on a training centre in Shabqadar. Jamaat-ul-Ahrar claimed responsibility.
An ANP activist was wounded in a roadside bomb blast in the Hiyati area of Utmankhel tehsil of Bajaur Agency.
2 soldiers were killed and 2 others injured by a landmine in the Angoor Adda area of SWA.
On 22 March 2017, railways tracks were damaged in the Mehrabpur area (Naushahro Feroze, Sindh) by an explosive.
Some railway tracks were damaged in the Misri Shah area, near Rohri, by an explosive.
On March 23, a government girl's school was damaged in an IED attack in Qilla Abdullah (Killa Abdullah, Balochistan). No one was injured in the attack. It is suspected that TTP is behind the attack.
A grenade attack by unidentified assailants in the Lyari area of Karachi left at least 12 people injured.

'An NGO vehicle drove over an IED in Saifal Darra in Orakzai Agency which exploded and wounded three aid workers. Although the wounds were not life threatening, two female staff members required medical attention. The aid workers were not the target of the attack, the IED had been intended for security forces in the area.'
At least 22 people were killed and 50 injured in a bomb explosion outside an imambargah in Parachinar.
A security force personnel was killed while another was injured when their vehicle hit a landmine in the Shawal area of South Waziristan.
Two mortar shells fired from Afghanistan across into Pakistan struck the Shingkak area of Kurram, destroying one shop completely.
Mortar shells fired from Afghanistan across into Pakistan struck the Kachkina area of Kurram, almost destroying a mosque and graveyard.

Seven people (including the bomber), four of them army men, were killed and 18-20 others injured in a suspected suicide blast on Bedian Road in Lahore. The targets were allegedly the members of a census team, 2 of which were killed.
On November 4th, a woman was killed, and another injured, when they stepped on a landmine in the Baker area of Landi Kotal
On November 4th, a child was killed, and 2 other civilians injured, when a landmine exploded in Salopangha village of the Sarwekai sub-division, South Waziristan.
At least three people were injured in a blast in Gwadar city. An improvised explosive device (IED) was planted in a motorcycle parked on the side of a road by unknown militants.
An IED went off in Mamond tehsil, partially damaging a house. It was suspected that the bomb was planted near the main gate of the house of Pacha Gul in the Tangai locality of Bajaur.
A child was killed and two others were injured in a hand grenade attack by unidentified militants in the outlying Jinnah Town of Quetta.
A child was killed and two persons were injured in a roadside bomb blast in Khar tehsil of Bajaur Agency.
At least three children were injured in a roadside blast that occurred near a garbage bag placed on Zargoon Road in Quetta.
A security personnel was killed and another was seriously injured when a roadside improvised explosive device (IED) hit their motorbike in the Alingar area of Safi tehsil.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: Four security personnel belonging to Frontier Corps, and a civilian, were killed when a roadside bomb exploded under the FC convoy on its way to Mand, Kech district. The Baloch Liberation Front later claimed responsibility.

At least 14 people, 4 of them security personnel, were killed, and several others were wounded, when a passenger van hit a landmine in the Godar area of tribal Kurram Agency. It was allegedly detonated remotely when the van was driving by. Four of the deceased were Khasadar personnel who were deployed for census duty.
Several militants were killed in targeted air strikes by the Pakistan military in Sattar Kalay and Narai Nau areas of the Rajgal Valley in Khyber Agency.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
NOTES: On April 26th, CIA drones killed at least 7 TTP militants in Lawar Mandi area of Data Khel tehsil in N.Waziristan. One of the militants that died was an important TTP commander.
An IED blast planted on roadside by militants in the Dera Bugti area of Balochista partially damaged a passing vehicle when it went off. No casualties were reported.
Suspected militants blew up the roof of a one-room farmhouse belonging to a relative of the Balochistan home minister in Dolli, Rujhan tehsil, in Rajanpur district.
A police vehicle patrolling near Doli/Rojhan, Rajanpur was damaged by a landmine blast which left six personnel injured.

One person was killed when an explosive device went off in Tindo area near Sadda in Kurram Agency on Sunday. The device was found by the man on the side of the road, and went off when he picked it up.
5 people were injured in Awaran when alleged militants fired a rocket into the Mashi area. They were shifted to hospital.

A bomb went off and destroyed the gate of the Government Girls' Primary School, Baghbanan in Peshawar. No one was injured. Following the explosion, the bomb disposal unit (BDU) found another device planted inside the school, which they defused.

Between 3 and 4 people, including Counter-Terrorism Department personnel and a civilian, were injured after a blast hit their vehicle near the Khattako Pul area in the Chamkani police limits when they were returning from the site of an earlier explosion that occurred outside a girls' school. Officials believe both bombs were meant to target the CTD personnel.
One man was killed and another four injured in a hand-grenade attack on a house in Turbat on Tuesday. The unidentified assailants managed to flee.
Four people were injured when their vehicle hit a landmine in the Kahan area of Kohlu district. Sources say it was planted by militants.

At least 25 people were killed, while 35 others, including Deputy Chairman Senate Maulana Abdul Ghafoor Haideri, were injured in an IS suicide bomb attack on the Senator's convoy in Mastung. The convey was targeted on the Quetta-Karachi National Highway when Maulana Haideri had just left a seminary after attending a graduation ceremony and offering Friday prayers. The bomber was riding a motorcycle when he engaged the convoy and detonated himself.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: Two security personnel were injured in an explosion in the Margat area of Quetta. An improvised explosive device planted on a roadside detonated when the security forces passed by.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: Two personnel of the paramilitary Frontier Corps were injured in a roadside IED blast, Bolan district.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: Four FC personnel were injured on Monday as a roadside IED exploded near their vehicle in the Spalanji area of Mastung.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: Five FC personnel were injured when an Improvised Explosive Devise (IED) exploded near their vehicle while on patrol of the Kharlachi area near the Pak-Afghan border.

An IED blast damaged a gas pipeline passing through the Hub River area in Manghopir late on Wednesday night. The CTD officials suspected involvement of Baloch nationalists in the IED blast that they said might be linked with a renewed wave of violence in Balochistan.
On 19 May, a mortar shell fired from Afghanistan killed a woman and injured a boy in Shamsai border village in the Loe Shalman area (Landi Kotal, Khyber Agency, FATA).
Three improvised explosive devices went off in Ghani Rehman Qila, near Peshawar, damaging property. However, there were no casualties reported.
Around 10 people were injured in five low-intensity bomb blasts in different areas of Shabqadar, Charsadda tehsil.
Five mortar shells were fired from Iran and landed in Balochistan's Chaghai area on Sunday. No casualties were reported.

Four members of the Akkakhel peace committee and a Levies police man were killed in a roadside IED blast in lower Tirah, Khyber Agency. The bomb was detonated near the home of one of the Akkakhel peace committee men.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
NOTES: On May 24, a US drone fired 2 missiles that struck a compound in Shawal tehsil in N.Waziristan, killing 3 TTP militants.
At least four people were injured in a blast after their vehicle ran over an improvised explosive device in the Chakothi sector of Azad Jammu and Kashmir, along the LOC.

Seven people were wounded in a roadside explosion in the Dunbar area of Mamond tehsil, Bajaur Agency. A group of local residents were on way to their home from a nearby shop when a remote-controlled device placed along the link road went off.
On June 12, suspected militants hurled a hand-grenade into the residence of a DSP Izhar Shah in Swabi city (Khyber Pakhtunkhwa). It exploded inside the house, however no one was injured.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
NOTES: A senior commander of the Haqqani network in addition to two others from the organization were reported to have been killed in a US drone strike in Spin Thal, an area bordering Hangu district in Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa and Orakzai and North Waziristan agencies.
One man was killed and six others, including four children, were injured after an explosive device targeting a pickup truck went off in the Mashkai tehsil, Washuk district of Balochistan.

On June 18, a rocket was fired from an unknown location at the gate of the residence of Sardar Akhtar Mengal, president of the Balochistan National Party, in his native town of Wadh (Balochistan). The gate was badly damaged, but no casualties were reported.

On June 18, Iranian border security forces fired several mortar shells into Pakistani territory, at least one of which exploded in the Prom area of Panjgur district (Balochistan). No casualties were reported.

7 people were injured in an explosion on a passenger bus in the Qaidabad area Karachi. The explosion was initially thought to be the result of a cylinder blast, however residue of explosive substances led authorities to deem it the result of militants. The explosion left three shops completely destroyed and the roof of bus was blown away.

85 people were killed, and over 200 injured, after two subsequent explosions hit a densely populated area of Kurram Agency's Parachinar city. The twin blasts in Parachinar were reported to have occurred in Turi Market near Tal Adda, where a bus terminal is also located. The second explosion reportedly targetted rescuers and bystanders who rushed to aid those who had been hurt in the first blast. No group has claimed responsibility.

Fourteen people, including six policemen and the suicide bomber, were killed, and 21 people were injured, in a suicide car bombing near the office of the inspector general of police Balochistan on Gulistan Road in Quetta. Two groups claimed responsibility: Tehreek-i-Taliban Pakistan and, Islamic State.
At least one student was injured in a landmine explosion in Ladha area of South Waziristan. He was taken to hospital nearby.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: Four people, including a security man, were killed while another soldier received injuries when a remote-controlled IED went off in the Akkakhel area of Tirah valley.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
NOTES: Two missiles reportedly fired from a U.S. drone hit a vehicle and killed local ISIS commander Pir Agha and three of his associates in Marghalan village of South Waziristan.
A mobile phone tower was partially damaged in a bomb blast at Walijaid near the Sariab area of Quetta. No group has claimed responsibility.
On 7 July, Balochistan's Health Minister and National Party leader survived an assassination attempt in Panjgur area (Balochistan) when possible militants fired a rocket at his convoy.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: At least four FC security personnel were injured when their patrol hit a land mine in the Ali Khel area of upper Orakzai.
Iran's border guards fired three rockets into Pakistani territory which landed in Paroom tehsil of Paroom district, with no casualties reported.

An IED went off in the area of Bin-Qasim on Monday just a few seconds after the convoy of Chinese engineers passed through main National Highway in Karachi.No casualties were reported, however the green belt of the road was damaged. It is suspected that militants planted the IED and targetted the engineers.

The District Police Officer (DPO) of Qilla Abdullah, his security guard and driver were killed and over 10 other people, including five police personnel, injured, in a suicide blast in the border town of Chaman. Tehreek-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the attack. The suicide bomber rode his motorcycle into the vehicle carrying the DPO.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
SOURCE: Nation (Pakistan); Express Tribune (Pakistan); Associated Press of Pakistan
NOTES: 2-3 Frontier Corps (FC) personnel killed and five injured in an IED blast near Lakka Tegga Check Post in Kurram Agency. No group has claimed responsibility.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: Two Frontier Corps personnel were critically injured in a blast in Bara subdivision of Khyber Agency. An IED planted near a water tanker was detonated with a remote control when the FC men were busy filling their tanker in the Malakdin Khel area. No group has claimed responsibility.
A bomb blast was reported on Sunday in Salarzai that left several people injured.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: Two Frontier Corps men were killed, and several injured, on Monday in a suicide attack targeting their convoy in Peshawar's Hayatabad. Ten others, including passerby, were injured in the blast near Bagh-e-Naran chowk. Tehreek-i-Taliban Pakistan claimed responsibility.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: LeI: Lashkar-e-Islam
NOTES: Security forces claimed to have killed at least eight suspected Tehreek-i-Taliban Pakistan and Lashkar-e-Islam militants and injured three others in air strikes on their hideouts on the first day of Operation Khyber-IV in the mountainous region of Rajgal in Tirah valley near the Afghan border.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: One Frontier Corps (FC) soldier was killed in an IED blast near a check post at the Chaman border crossing with Afghanistan.
A bomb disposal squad (BDS) official was killed and another was injured when a mine went off during a clearing operation in the Rajgal area as part of Operation Khyber 4.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: An IED explosion killed one FC soldier while another was injured in the Aka Khel area of Khyber Agency. No group has claimed responsibility.

SOURCE: South Asia Terrorism Portal; Daily Regional Times (Pakistan); Nation (Pakistan)
NOTES: On 24 July 2017, at least 27 persons (incl. bomber), including 9 Policemen, were killed and 56 others injured in a suicide blast near the Arfa Karim IT Tower on the Ferozepur Road (Lahore, Punjab). The bomb was targeting a police picket in the area. Tehreek-i-Taliban Pakistan claimed responsibility following the attack.
On July 29th, at least four civilians were killed and five injured in a blast in the Chedgi area, close to the Pakistan-Iran border. No group claimed responsibility.
A man died and dozens were wounded when a massive truck bomb exploded on Lahore's Bund Road, near Suggian. Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan is suspected, but not confirmed.

Two civilians were killed and as many others injured in a bomb blast in a bazaar of Awaran town. Security officials said that an improvised explosive device was planted close to a shop in the bazaar and detonated by remote control. No group has claimed responsibility.
At least three people were killed and 26 injured when an IED targetting labourers exploded in Nawagai, Bajaur Agency. No group has claimed responsibility, although the TTP is suspected.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: On 12 August 2017, at least 15 people, including 8 soldiers, were killed and 40 others injured when a suicide bomber targeted a military truck near the Pishin bus stop in Quetta city (Quetta, Balochistan).
Two levies personnel were among four hurt in a blast when unknown men hurled a hand grenade at a house of MPA Sakhi Amanullah Notezai in the Faisal Colony area of Dalbandin.
A mortar shell, presumed to have been fired from Afghanistan, hit a wood stall near Landi Kotal bazaar on Monday, but no one was injured in the attack.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: 6 FC personnel were killed, and 3 others injured, when their patrol vehicle was targetted by an improvised explosive device (IED) in the Khost area of Harnai district.
At least five mortar shells, allegedly fired from the Afghan side, landed in a hilly terrain of Sheen Pokh area of Loe Shalman. No injuries were reported.
Two schoolchildren were injured when one of the two mortar shells fired from across the Afghan border exploded near the hostel of the Army Public School inside an army camp, Landi Kotal.

On August 16th, three persons sustained injuries when a vehicle carrying members of peace committee was hit by a roadside IED outside Mera village, in the Maidan area of Lower Dir district. No group has claimed responsibility.
On August 17th, an improvised explosive device (IED) damaged about 10 feet of railway track in the Zangi area of Nushki District. The device was set to go off via timer.

On August 19th Iranian border forces fired two mortar shells into Pakistani territory near the Buleda valley area of Kech district. No casualty was reported as the mortar shells landed and exploded in an abandoned area.
On August 25th, one civilian was killed by a landmine blast in the Chattar area of Dera Murad Jamali, Nasirabad district, after he stepped on it.

On August 26th, a bomb explosion took place at an under-construction police checkpoint in the Umeedabad area of Peshawar, partially damaging the checkpoint, and destroying its walls and gate. No group has claimed responsibility.
On August 27th, 2 soldiers were killed and 3 injured in a landmine blast in the Barmal area of South Waziristan.

Two civilians were killed and as many others injured when their vehicle hit a landmine in the Gichak area of Panjgur district on August 28th. The landmine was planted by suspected militants on the roadside.
On August 28th, at least two security personnel were killed in a landmine blast in the Angoor Ada area of South Waziristan.

On 1 September 2017, three men, including an anti-Taliban tribal elder, were killed while two others were injured when a roadside IED went off in the Ambar tehsil [coded at Ajdarra] of Mohmand Agency. Jamaat-ul-Ahrar, a splinter group of Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan, claimed responsibility for the attack.
On September 6th, three members of a family were killed and another was seriously injured in a landmine blast in the Kahan area of Kohlu district.
On September 10th, two khasadar police were injured when a mortar dropped near their checkpost at the Stara Mill area of Landi Kotal tehsil. The mortar was believed to be launched by militants.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: On September 11th, 5 FC soldiers were injured in an IED blast which targetted the security forces vehicle in the Khwaizai area of Mohmand agency. No group has claimed responsibility.
On September 12th, at least one person was killed and four others were injured when an 'old' improvised explosive device (IED) went off in North Waziristan.
On September 12th, a civilian was killed and another injured in a bomb blast near a house in the Nasao area of Kahan in Kohlu district. No group has claimed responsibility.

ACTOR2: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
NOTES: On September 15th, three Taliban militants were killed and another one wounded when a US drone fired missiles at a compound in the Ghuzgarhi area near the Afghan border in Kurram Agency. Among the deceased was commander Maulvi Mohib, affiliated with the Haqqani network.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: On September 15th, at least six FC personnel, and three civilians, were injured in a twin hand-grenade attack at the main entrance gate of Torkham, along the Pak-Afghan border. The unidentified militants who threw the grenades managed to flee, causing security forces to launch a cordon and search.

On September 17th, a local official and five security personnel were killed in a roadside bomb blast in Mamond tehsil of Bajaur Agency. TTP: Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan claimed responsibility for the attack.

On September 18th, two civilians were killed and 22 others were injured in a suicide blast near the Friendship Gate at Chaman, along the Pak-Afghan border. The attack took place in the parking lot of the border area where people and Nato trucks wait for clearance for their onward journey. No group claimed responsibility.
On September 19th, three security personnel were injured when a landmine exploded under their vehicle in the Khoidad Khel area of Kurram Agency.

On September 21st, at least two Pakistan Customs officials received injuries when a roadside remote IED went off in the Matha Khel area of Landi Kotal, Khyber Agency. The customs crew was on its way to Torkham from Peshawar when it was targeted at around 9am with a bomb planted by militants on the main Pak-Afghan highway. No group has claimed responsibility.
On September 23rd, a 12-year-old boy was killed in a landmine blast in the Sangsilla area of Dera Bugti district. It was planted there by suspected militants.

On September 25th, three traders were injured when a shopping centre was attacked by suspected militants with a hand grenade in Karak city. Later, a suspect was arrested and handed over to counter-terrorism department.

On September 26th, the driver of a school bus of the Pakistan Mineral Development Corporation (PMDC) was injured in a roadside bomb blast in the Hanna Sour area outside of Quetta. The 35 or so students in the bus remained unhurt. The bomb was allegedly triggered remotely.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: On September 27th, four security personnel were injured when two improvised explosive devices (IEDs) went off near an FC vehicle in the Shorki area of Kurram Agency, close to Pak-Afghan border. They were taken to hospital.

On September 29th, three civilians were injured in a grenade attack near a private hospital in the Shinwari Town area of Peshawar. Unidentified attackers lobbed a grenade at the owner of the hospital as he returned from Friday prayers. Extortion demands were made previously to the hospital. The Counter-Terrorism Department registered an FIR of the incident.

On October 2nd, a man was killed and two others were critically injured when a remote controlled IED targetted their vehicle in the Ghat area of Charbagh tehsil, Swat. One of the men in the vehicle was Amn Council member, Ahmed Zeb, believed to be the main target. His father was the deceased.
On October 4th, Iranian troops fired at least 11 mortar shells into the Pakistani border town of Chedgi, Panjgur district. No casualties were reported.

On October 5th, 23 people were killed, including the bomber, and around 30 injured, in a suicide bomb attack at the entrance to the shrine of Pir Rakhyal Shah in the Fatehpur area of Jhal Magsi district. The unidentified bomber detonated himself while he was being searched by police. No group has claimed responsibility.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: On October 7th, three Frontier Corps (FC) personnel were injured when a landmine exploded near their vehicle in the Kalera area of Dera Bugti.
On October 8th, a man was seriously injured when his motorcycle hit a landmine in the Neelagh area of Dera Bugti.
On October 10th, a Pakistan army man was killed when an IED went off at a border post in the Bin Shahi area of Upper Dir district.

On October 13th, a remote controlled bomb blast damaged the Pakistan Telecommunication Company tower in the Ispilengi area of Mastung district, suspending telephone and internet service to the district. No group has claimed responsibility.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: On October 15th, at least 4 Frontier Corps personnel were killed, and 2 others injured, while they were on a search mission in the Kharlachi area of Kurram Agency. Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan [TTP] claimed responsibility for the attack.

On October 18th, 9 people were killed (7 policemen, 1 civilian, and the suicide bomber), and 22 others were injured, when a Tehreek-i-Taliban Pakistan suicide bomber exploded their vehicle in the Sariab area of Quetta. The attack was targetting a group of Rapid Response Group officers as they began their patrol.
On October 18th, two security personnel were killed in a remote controlled IED explosion near the Jalal check post in FR Bannu. No group claimed responsibility.
On October 19th, at least 12 civilians were injured when unidentified armed men hurled a grenade in Sultan Shaheed Chowk, Mastung. No group claimed responsibility.
On October 19th, 26 civilians were injured when unidentified armed men hurled a grenade at a hostel near Bilal Mosque in Gwadar, Balochistan.
On October 22nd, at least 1 person was injured, and 4 shops damaged, when a bomb exploded in Sapna Market of Chakdara town, Lower Dir. No group claimed responsibility.
On October 22nd, a civilian was injured when he and another man hit a landmine while riding a motorcycle through the Mawand area of Kohlu district.
On October 23rd, several people were injured when a security forces vehicle was targetted by an IED in the Hazar Ganji market area of Quetta.
On October 27th, a young sheppard was killed when a landmine exploded under him in the Goth Hadi area of Chattar, Nasirabad district.
On October 27th, 6 passengers on the Akbar Bugti Express train were seriously injured when a bomb planted on the railway track by suspected militants exploded near Machh, in Bolan district.
On October 27th, two rockets were fired from across the Afghan border into the Loy Shelman area of Khyber Agency. No group claimed responsibility, and no casualties were reported.

On October 27th, Awami National Party (ANP) leader Abdul Razzak and his brother were killed when explosives planted under their car exploded while they were on their way to Pishin. No group claimed responsibility.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: On October 29th, a Frontier Corps (FC) personnel was killed, and another injured when their convoy was hit by an IED blast in the Sarwakai area of South Waziristan.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: On October 31st, 3 Bajaur levies personnel (Frontier Corps) were injured when an IED went off near their patrol in the Janat Shah area of Bajaur Agency, near Khar.
On November 3rd, at least 2 people were injured when an IED exploded in the Zakhakhel Adda Rangra market of Landi Kotal. Two vehicles were also damaged. No group claimed responsibility.
On November 4th, a child was killed, and 2 other civilians injured, when a landmine exploded in Salopangha village of the Sarwekai sub-division, South Waziristan.
On November 4th, a woman was killed, and another injured, when they stepped on a landmine in the Baker area of Landi Kotal
On November 6th, Iranian border troops fired 3 mortar shells into the Parag Koh mountain area, near the village of Tahdem Bazar Deh, of Panjgur district Balochistan. No casualties were reported.
On November 6th, 2 police personnel were injured when a landmine planted by unidentified armed persons exploded underneath them in Dera Bugti district.
On November 7th, an IED targeted an anti-polio health team in the Arif Kele area of Lower Dir, however no casualties were reported. No group claimed responsibility.
On November 7th, and IED targetted an anti-polio health team in the Arif Kele area of Lower Dir, however no casualties were reported. No group claimed responsibility.
On November 7th, a local man was injured when a landmine planted by unidentified armed persons exploded in the Patokh area of Dera Bugti district.

On November 9th, 4 people were killed, including 3 police officers and a suicide bomber, and 9 other people injured, when a Tehreek-i-Taliban Pakistan suicide bomber targetted them on Airport Road in Quetta. A few nearby vehicles were also damaged.
On November 12th, 3 police personnel and 1 civilian were injured when a roadside bomb targeted a passing police vehicle near Tochi bridge in the Norar area of Bannu town.

On November 24th, an Additional Inspector General of the police was killed, and several other police personnel injured, in a targeted suicide blast in the Hayatabad area of Peshawar. No group claimed responsibility. It is unclear whether the Inspector's bodyguard was also killed.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: On November 25th, 4 people were killed (5 including the bomber), and 19 injured, when a TTP suicide bomber targetted a Frontier Corps vehicle on Sariab road in Quetta. Most of the casualties were civilians.
On November 29th, 2 army soldiers were killed, and 3 injured, when an IED exploded in Sibi, Balochistan.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
NOTES: On November 30th, 4 militants were killed when a US drone strike dropped two missiles on the compound of a Haqqani Network commander in the Ghuz Gari/ Ghoz Garhi area in Upper Kurram tehsil of Kurram district close to the Afghan border. Haqqani militants were killed, although there was some speculation that some of the fighters may have been from the Afghan Taliban.

On November 30th, 5 Aman Lashkar members were killed, and 4 others injured, when unidentified militants targetted the tribal elders in their vehicle with a remote IED in the Arokai area of South Waziristan.
On November 30th, 1 child was killed and 2 other civilians injured when a bomb exploded outside a gate in Christian Colony, Chaman city, Balochistan. No group claimed responsibility.
On December 1st, 1 army soldier was killed, and another injured, in an IED blast in the Chamarkund area of Mohmand Agency.
On 2 December 2017, the vehicle of a pro-government tribal elder Malik Amir Rehman was targetted and damaged by an IED in Ambar tehsil [coded at Ajdarra], Mohmand Agency. The tribal elder was unhurt.
On December 5th, 6 people were killed, and 8 others injured, when a remote controlled IED targetted a civilian vehicle in the Mir Ali area of North Waziristan.
On December 5th, 3 civilians were injured when suspected militants hurled a grenade into the Sada Bahar hotel in Khuzdar. No group claimed responsibility.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Border Security Force
NOTES: On December 7th, 2 Pakistani civilians were killed, and another injured, when shells launched by Indian border troops hit Polas Kakuta village of Abbaspur, AJK.
On December 10th, 3 children were injured by a landmine explosion near Amin checkpost in the Darpa Khel area of North Waziristan.
On December 11th, 2 people were injured when their motorcycle hit a landmine in the Marwand area of Balochistan.
On December 14, suspected militants hurled a grenade at a National Party office in Turbat, damaging the building but causing no injuries.
On December 15, suspected militants hurled a grenade at the Turbat home of several labourers, damaging the building but causing no injuries. This was the second grenade attack in Turbat in two days.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
NOTES: On December 17th, a US drone strike hit a compound in Matta Sangar village, Kurram Agency, which allegedly belonged to a TTP commander. No casualties were reported.

On December 17th, 9 members of the Christian community were killed, and at least 50 injured, when 2 Islamic State suicide bombers attacked the Bethel Memorial Methodist Church in Quetta. One of the attackers blew himself up at the entrance, while the other was killed in shootout with nearby police.
On December 19th, 3 security personnel and 1 passerby were injured when their vehicle was targetted by a remote-controlled IED on the road near Gara Mastan, Dera Ismail Khan district.

On December 21st, a surrendered Baloch militant was killed when a landmine targetted his vehicle as he attempted to aid his relatives who were being shot dead by Baloch Liberation Tigers militants in the Nohkani area of Dera Bugti.
On December 22nd, unidentified militants threw a grenade at a police post in Dera Ismail Khan before retreating. The blast damaged a wall, but no injuries were reported.
On December 24th, suspected militants blew up a section of pipeline in the Pir Koh gas field area of Dera Bugti district.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: On December 24th, 3 Frontier Corps personnel were killed when an IED exploded near them during a search operation in Ghulam Khan village of North Waziristan.
On December 25th, a motorcyclist was killed when he hit a landmine in the Zain Koh area of Dera Bugti.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
NOTES: On December 26th, at least 2 suspected militants were killed by a US drone strike in the Mata Sangar area of Kurram Agency.
On December 29th, a civilian was injured by an exploding landmine in the Malam area of Dera Bugti district.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Balochistan Levies; Civilians (Pakistan)
NOTES: On January 1st, 7 Frontier Corps and Levies personnel, and 1 civilian, were injured when two IED blasts targetted an under-contruction police station on Mall Road in Chaman, Qilla Abdullah district.
On January 4, an IED went off near the residence of a local of Masood Adamzai in Safi tehsil (tehsil hq coded) (Safi, Mohmand, KP) resulting in damages to the main gate of the house.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: On January 5th, a Frontier Corps personnel was injured when his vehicle was targetted by a remote controlled IED in the Aingar area of Mohmand Agency.
On January 7, 2018, unidentified men used an IED to blow up a gas pipeline in Pirkoh gas field area in Dera Bugti district.
On January 7, 2018, a scrap hand grenade exploded in Utmankhel area (Lower Orakzai, Orakzai) injuring seven kids.

On January 9, a TTP suicide bomber targeted a police vehicle near GPO chowk in Quetta city (Quetta, Balochistan) killing five policemen and two civilians and, injuring 16 others including 8 policemen.
On January 11th, an army soldier was killed, and 2 others injured, by an IED blast in the Sarobi area of North Waziristan.
On January 14th, 2 children were injured when an IED exploded in the Sarwakai area of South Waziristan.
On January 16th, 2 people were injured by a landmine explosion in the Dera Bugti area.
On January 17th, 2 police officers and a civilian were injured when a remote controlled IED exploded near them on Mall road, Chaman.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
NOTES: On January 17th, an Afghan militant was injured in a USA drone attack on compounds in Badshahkot village, Lower Kurram.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
NOTES: On January 24, a missile targeted a house and killed two Afghan militants affiliated with the Haqqani network. The strike was fired from a US drone, and took place Dapa Mumuzai village in Central Kurram tehsil of Kurram district. However, there was some confusion about the exact location of the strike, with some sources claiming it took place in neighboring Orakzoi, or even Hangu district to the south.
On January 28th, 2 security personnel were killed, and 4 others injured, when a roadside IED exploded in the Dasht Siyachi area of Jiwani town.
On January 30th, at least 6 civilians were killed, and 1 injured, when their vehicle hit a landmine near Boshehra in Upper Kurram.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: On January 30th, at least 5 Frontier Corps personnel were injured when their convoy hit a roadside IED near Pasni, Gwadar district.

On February 3rd, 11 Pakistan Army soldiers were killed, and 13 others injured, when a Tehreek-i-Taliban Pakistan suicide bomber detonated themselves near the soldiers outside an Army base in Kabal, Swat district.

On February 5, Baloch Liberation Front militants targeted a pro-government militia leader's vehicle with an IED in Chitkan Bazaar of Panjgur town (Panjgur, Balochistan) killing his brother and injuring 8 other civilians.
On February 7th, a tribel elder was killed by a remote controlled IED in the Hialal Khel area of Nawagai tehsil, Bajaur Agency. No group claimed responsibility.
On February 7th, 2 security personnel were killed when unidentified militants launched a rocket at their vehicle in the Mir Ali Eidak area of North Waziristan Agency.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
NOTES: On February 8th, Tehrik-e-Taliban Pakistan's deputy chief Khalid Mehsud, alias Commander Sajna, was killed by a US drone strike in the Gorwak area of North Waziristan. Prior to confirmation by the TTP, there was confusion as to whether he was killed in Pakistan or Afghanistan's Barmal district as some reports suggested. According to TTP, Mufti Noor Wali took over as deputy chief following the death.
On February 8th, a child was killed, and another injured, when a landmine exploded in Madakhel village on the outskirts of Mir Ali town, North Waziristan.

On February 15th, a peace committee member and local tribal leader, Malik Shahjahan, was killed in a landmine blast in the Mushti Bazaar area of Orakzai Agency. 2 others sustained injuries in the blast.
On February 16th, a member of a local Peace Committee was killed by an IED explosion in the Gat Agra area of Bajaur Agency.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Balochistan Levies
NOTES: On February 17th, a Levies' official and a civilian were injured when a remote controlled bomb targetted them in the Gat area of Bajaur Agency on their way to a mosque.
On February 21st, 1 civilian was killed, and 2 others injured, when they stepped on a landmine while collecting firewood in Lawana Khaitar village of Barnala tehsil, AJK.
On February 23rd, the PDMA deputy director and 2 other civilians were injured when a remote controlled motorcycle bomb exploded on Ring Road in Peshawar. No group claimed responsibility.
On February 28th, a tractor was completely destroyed by an IED explosion near the house of tribal leader Haji Sahib. No group claimed responsibility.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: On February 28, 4 Frontier Corps personnel were killed and seven others were seriously injured when an unidentified suicide bomber detonated themselves at a check post in the mountainous region about 30km from Quetta city (Quetta, Balochistan).
On March 2nd, an army captain and soldier were injured by a roadside IED blast in the Paindee Cheena area near Zakhakhel bazaar, Khyber Agency. No group claimed responsibility.
On March 4th, a woman was seriously injured when an IED exploded in Zakir Khel of Mir Ali tehsil, North Waziristan.
On March 4th, 2 civilians were injured when unknown persons lobbed a grenade in Turbat's central market. No group claimed responsibility.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: On March 5th, 1 FC personnel was killed, and 6 others were injured, in an IED explosion near their vehicle in the Pushak area of Johan tehsil, Balochistan.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: On March 9, 2 FC personnel were injured when their vehicle was targeted by a roadside IED on Pirkus Road in Hub town (Las Bela, Balochistan).

On March 14th, at least 10 people, including 6 police personnel, were killed, and 20 people injured, when a TTP suicide bomber detonated themselves in Raiwind village of Lahore's Iqbal Town. The target was a large annual congregation at the Tableeghi Markaz, but the bomber was stopped by police prematurely at a check post.

On March 15th, at least 6 civilians were killed, and 5 injured, when 1200kg of explosives detonated in the home of a cleric in Qila Saifullah town, Balochistan. The perpetrators and motive remain unknown.
On March 17th, Iranian forces fired a half dozen shells into the Parako area of Panjgur district. No casualties were reported.
On March 18th, members of an unidentified armed group fired a rocket at the home of a local PPP leader in Khar, Bajaur Agency, while he was inside. The home was damaged, but no casualties reported.
On March 21st, 3 civilians were killed when their vehicle hit a landmine in Rajay village, Chagai district.

On March 23rd, an IED blast partially damaged the walls of a house in the Goth Gull Zaman Bugti area of Nasirabad district. The bomb was planted there by unknown people, and the nature of the target is unknown as well. No casualties were reported.
On March 24th, 10 people were injured when unidentified armed men hurled a grenade onto the stage during a cultural festival in Sikandar Janubi village of Dera Ismail Khan.
On March 25th, at least 4 civilians were injured when suspected militants hurled a grenade at a residential building in Railway Colony of Dalbandin town, Chagai district.
On March 28th, a boy was killed, and 2 others injured, when an undetonated shell exploded in the Bahi Kor area of Mohmand Agency's Yake Ghund tehsil.
On March 28th, suspected militants blew up an under-construction government school in the Aka Khel area of Bara district, Khyber Agency.

On March 30th, at least 3 police personnel were killed, and 2 injured, when their vehicle was targetted by a remote controlled IED on the road in Kulachi tehsil of Dera Ismail Khan district. No group claimed responsibility.
On March 31, a local died when his motorbike hit a landmine planted on the road in Bekhar area of Dera Bugti district (Dera Bugti, Balochistan).
On April 1st, a civilian was injured by a landmine blast in the Pash Ziarat area of Makin tehsil, South Waziristan.
On April 6th, 5 security personnel were injured when their vehicle hit a roadside bomb in the Mir Ali area of North Waziristan.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: On April 9th, at least 5 Frontier Corps personnel were injured when an unidentified suicide bomber detonated themselves near an FC checkpost in the Baleli area of Quetta city.
On April 12, a landmine detonated in Kahan tehsil (tehsil hq coded) (Kahan, Kohlu, Balochistan) killing a man and injuring one another.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: On April 15th, at least 3 Frontier Corps personnel were injured when their vehicle was targetted by a remote controlled IED near the Mir Ali checkpost in Bannu district.
On April 17th, a Pakistan Army soldier was killed when a landmine he was defusing detonated in the Datta Khel area of North Waziristan.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Former Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: On April 18th, 2 people were injured, including a retired Mohmand Rifle (Frontier Corps) soldier, when an IED placed outside of their home in the Sarzai area of Khyber Agency was detonated. No group claimed responsibility.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Border Security Force
NOTES: Indian forces fired both heavy and small weapons across the LoC into the Khuiratta sector of Kotli District, AJK, on Apr 18, 19, and 20. 8 civilians were injured on the 18th. No mention of Pakistani retaliation.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Border Security Force
NOTES: Indian forces fired both heavy and small weapons across the LoC into the Khuiratta sector of Kotli District, AJK, on Apr 18, 19, and 20. 4 civilians were injured on 19th. No mention of Pakistani retaliation.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Border Security Force
NOTES: Indian forces fired both heavy and small weapons across the LoC into the Khuiratta sector of Kotli District, AJK, on Apr 18, 19, and 20. 1 civilian was injured on the 20th. No mention of Pakistani retaliation.
On April 22nd, a member of the Pakistan Army's Bomb Disposal Unit was killed, and 3 others injured, when an IED exploded in the Drewasta area of North Waziristan.

On April 22, an explosion occurred targeting security personnel (assumed based on source text that mentions the blast occurred during routine curfew) in Miranshah town (North Waziristan, KP). No injuries or fatalities reported.
On April 23rd, Iranian border forces fired shells into the Nok Kundi area of Chagai district. There were no casualties, as the mortars landed away from residential areas.
On April 24th, a Pakistan Army soldier was killed, and 3 injured, by a roadside blast in the Zarzanai area of Daraban tehsil, DI Khan district.
On April 25th, 3 police personnel were injured when unidentified persons threw a grenade at their checkpost in the Liaquat Bagh area of Dera Ismail Khan town.

On April 26th, at least 4 civilians were killed, and 32 injured, when suspected militants threw a grenade into a home where a wedding was being held in Saidgai village of North Waziristan. No group claimed responsibility.
On April 27th, a police officer and 2 civilians were injured when suspected militants threw a grenade at a police post near Commerce College in Dera Ismail Khan.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: On May 2nd, an IED exploded near a convoy of Mohmand Rifles (Frontier Corps) in the Aman Ghundai hill area of Safi Tehsil, Mohmand Agency. There were no casualties.

On May 4, unidentified men hurled a hand-grenade at a group of people offering funeral prayer (religious affiliation is unclear) in Mand area (Kech, Balochistan) killing one person and injuring three others.

On May 7th, a girls' school was damaged by an IED in Mir Ali tehsil, North Waziristan. A pamphlet nearby said the attack was claimed by Ittehadul Mujahideen North Waziristan and warned to not send adult women to the school.

On May 9th, the boundary wall of a girls' school was destroyed by an IED in the Hasokhel area of Mir Ali tehsil, North Waziristan. A pamphlet nearby said the attack was claimed by Ittehadul Mujahideen North Waziristan and warned to not send adult women to the school. This was the second such attack in the tehsil.

On May 10, an IED exploded near a railroad track in Dasht town (Kharan district, Balochistan). A second explosive device kept inside a pressure cooker at the same site was recovered and defused by BDS. No group claimed responsibility.
On May 10th, suspected militants blew up a 2ft section of the railroad in the Saryab Road area of Quetta.

On May 11th, a police officer was killed, and 6 other people, including civilians, injured, when a remote controlled motorcycle bomb targetted a police vehicle near the main bus stand in Bannu town. No group claimed responsibility.
On May 13th, an IED detonated under the vehicle of a tribal elder, Malik Haji Ahmad Khwezai, in the Sultan Khel area of Halimzai tehsil, Mohmand, injuring his driver.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: On May 14th, 2 Frontier Corps personnel were injured when they were targetted by an IED blast near a petrol pump in Miranshah, North Waziristan.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: On May 17, 1 civilian was killed, and 14 police and civilians injured, when a suicide bomber targeted a Frontier Constabulary vehicle in the Kachehry Chowk area of Nowshera. The attack was later attributed to a TTP-Hizbul Ahrar network.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Border Security Force
NOTES: Indian forces fired shells across the LoC on the evening of May 19. The shells hit the Samani tehsil of Bhimber District; 2 women were injured in Chahi village. No reports of Pakistani retaliation.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Border Security Force
NOTES: Indian forces fired shells across the LoC on the evening of May 19. The shells hit the Samani tehsil of Bhimber District. No reports of Pakistani retaliation.
On May 22nd, 1 person was killed, and 3 injured, when unidentified militants hurled a grenade inside a home in Sararogha, South Waziristan.

On May 26, two low intensity explosions occurred on the railway tracks near Sehrish Nagar locality of Hyderabad city (Hyderabad, Sindh). Trains were suspended as a result, although no major damage was done to the tracks.
On May 26th, suspected militants detonated explosives on a private tower in the B-Area of Sar Kharan tehsil, Kharan district, Balochistan.

On May 28, an IED targeting a police vehicle detonated in the D-Chowk area of Dera Murad Jamali town (Nasirabad, Balochistan) injuring 16 people, including 3 policemen. One of the injured succumbed to his injuries on June 9.

On May 29th, Malik Amanullah, a member of a peace committee in Bajaur Agency, was targeted and severely injured in a remote controlled IED attack in the Charmang area of Nagoi tehsil. No group claimed responsibility.
On May 30, a Pakistan Army vehicle hit a roadside mine in the Data Khel area, North Waziristan killing 2 Pakistani soldiers and injuring three others.
On June 3rd, 2 police personnel were injured when unidentified armed men hurled a grenade on their check post in Dera Ismail Khan city. No group claimed responsibility.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: On June 4, 3 Frontier Corps personnel were killed and two other injured when an Islamic State suicide bomber detonated themselves at the Aziz FC check post in Mastung city (Mastung, Balochistan).
On June 7th, 2 police officers and a civilian were killed when a police vehicle was targetted by an IED in the Zaimdara village area of Lal Qila tehsil in Lower Dir district, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Border Security Force
NOTES: Indian forces fired a single mortar shell across the LoC on June 8. 2 people were injured in Janjot Bahadur village, Khuiratta tehsil, Kotli District of AJK as a result. No mention of Pakistani retaliation.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: BNP-A: Balochistan National Party-Awami; Former Government of Pakistan (2013-2018)
NOTES: On June 10, unidentified militants planted explosives around the house of former provincial minister and BNP-A leader Mir Asghar Rind in the Gomazi area of Mand town (Kech, Balochistan), and blew up the house. No one was in the house when the blast occurred.

On June 15, an unclaimed remote-controlled explosive device detonated in the Kohlu area (district capital coded) (Kohlu, Balochistan) damaging a tribal elder's house, government dispensary, and a school. No reported casualties, and not clear if anyone was present at the time of the explosion.

An unclaimed IED exploded on the vehicle of PTI leader Saeed Khan in the Shana Khawra point of Shehdad Kot area near Hamzoni, North Waziristan District in KP on June 20. The leader was in the car at the time but no one was hurt.
An unclaimed bomb exploded on a police vehicle near a mosque in Nasirabad's Dera Murad Jamali in Balochistan on June 23. 3-4 policemen and 3 civilians were injured.
A man was walking outside of his home when an unclaimed landmine exploded and injured him on June 29 in the Pash Ziarat area of Shawal tehsil, South Waziristan in KP.
A young girl was injured in a 'toy bomb' explosion on June 29 in the Mantoi area of Tiarza tehsil, South Waziristan District, KP Province.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Bomb Disposal Squad
NOTES: Suspected Baluch separatists fired rockets at a Bomb Disposal Squad convoy on July 2 in the Ture area of Mashkai tehsil, Awaran District, Baluchistan Province. 6 troops were killed and 2 wounded.
An unclaimed attacker threw a grenade at a PTI office in Razmak City, N Waziristan, KP Province on July 3. 10 of the office workers were injured.

2-3 employees of an oil and gas company were killed and 5 others injured when their vehicle hit an unclaimed landmine in the Nokhani area of Dera Bugti while on a surveying expedition, as reported on July 3.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
NOTES: On July 4, 2 militants affiliated to Hafiz Gul Bahadur were killed in the Tor Tangai area of Data Khel tehsil in N.Waziristan by a US drone strike.

An unclaimed IED exploded in front of a businessman and electoral candidate's house in the Hayatabad area of Peshawar on July 5. No casualties reported. It was not clear if anyone was present at the time.

SOURCE: Pakistan Today; Tribal News Network; News International (Pakistan); Pakistan Observer
NOTES: An unclaimed remote-controlled bomb detonated on a MMA candidate's convoy in the Takhtikhel area of Bannu, KP Province on July 7. The candidate along with 6-7 other people were injured. The candidate filed a FIR against PTI rivals for the incident.

SOURCE: Pakistan Observer; Daily Today's Muslim Peshawar; AFP; AP
NOTES: A TTP-claimed suicide bomber detonated himself at an ANP rally in the Yakatut area of Peshawar on July 10. 22 people, including ANP candidate Haroon Bilour, plus the bomber were killed and 63 people were wounded.
An unclaimed blast occurred near the election office of the Balochistan Awami Party (BAP) in Khuzdar, Balochistan Province on the night of July 12. 2 people were injured.

SOURCE: Statesman (Pakistan); AP; Express Tribune (Pakistan); Dawn (Pakistan); Xinhua
NOTES: On July 13, a suicide bombing claimed by the Islamic State at a BAP political rally in Daring-Gar town 25 km away from Mastung town (Mastung, Balochistan) killed 149 people (plus the bomber) and wounded 150-300 others. The BAP candidate Siraj Raisani was among those killed.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: JUI-F: Jamiat Ulema-e-Islam-Fazl; MMA: Muttahida Majlis-e-Amal
SOURCE: Xinhua; AFP; Daily Regional Times (Pakistan); Pakistan Today
NOTES: An unclaimed bomb detonated on a convoy for JUI-F/MMA candidate Durrani near Bannu town. 4-5 people were killed (not including the candidate) and up to 24-39 others injured.
On July 17, two Army personnel were killed in a road side explosion by TTP in North Waziristan agency.

On July 20, four people were injured in the border town of Chaman in Balochistan province after an improvised explosive device (IED) planted in a motorcycle exploded as a law-enforcement vehicle passed by. Injured presumed to be Pakistani police.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Balochistan Levies
NOTES: On July 20, six people were injured in a bomb blast planted by unidentified men in Quetta city targeting a security vehicle (assumed police).

On July 20, four people were injured when an alleged IED exploded outside a house in the Dal Mal area of Tajzai neighbourhood in Lakki Marwat city. Other sources say the explosion may have been caused by a gas leak. The house is located near a madrasa.
On July 22, at least 20 people were injured after a hand grenade exploded outside Balochistan Awami Party's electoral office in Dalbadin. It was not clear who threw the grenade.
On July 22, a man was injured when he hit a landmine planted near the road in the Batkhu area of Dera Bugti district.
On July 22, two mechanics were injured when unidentified men threw a grenade into their garage in the Mach area of Bolan district.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: PTI: Pakistan Tehreek-i-Insaf; Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018)
SOURCE: Frontier Star; Dawn (Pakistan); Pakistan Press International; GeoTV
NOTES: On July 22, a suicide attack claimed by TTP injured five people including, PTI leader and candidate for PK-99, Ikramullah Khan Gandapur, and 2 police near Noori Darbar of Kulachi town (Dera Ismail Khan, KP). Ikramullah Khan Gandapur and his driver later died in hospital. 3 total fatalities including the bomber.

Two attackers riding on a motorcycle threw an explosive at a car of a candidate of Allah-o-Akbar Tehreek (AAT) party in Latifabad No. 8, Hyderabad on the evening of July 24. 1-2 people were injured (definitely the driver of the car, potentially the candidate as well - sources vary).
On July 24, at least two people were wounded in a hand grenade attack in the evening at the Muslim Milli League's (MML) office in Latifabad No. 8.
On July 25, unidentified assailants fired rockets at a polling station in the Turbat area of Balochistan, causing no injuries or damage.

On July 25, an explosion targeted a PPP camp outside a polling station in Larkana's NA-200 constituency, injuring up to 5 people. On June 21, police claimed that they arrested an alleged militant belonging to SRA who was involved in the Larkana blast.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: On July 25, at least three security forces personnel (police + Frontier Corps) and a teacher were killed in an unclaimed suicide bombing while escorting polling staff of NA-271 Buleda, Balochistan. The military protection party was ambushed at Dashtuk, near the Pak-Iran border. 14 others were injured in the attack.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
SOURCE: AFP; Dunya News; Daily Times (Pakistan); GeoTV; Independent (Pakistan)
NOTES: On July 25, an alleged suicide bomb attack claimed by IS hit a polling station near a school by the Eastern Bypass in Quetta, killing at least 32 (including the bomber) and wounding up to 70 others. The explosion allegedly occurred near a police vehicle when police and FC personnel attempted to stop the bomber from entering the station. 6 police officers were among those killed.
Unclaimed rockets hit a BNP-Awami party camp in the Bonistan Bazar area of Panjgur District on election day, July 25.
A small explosion took place in front of a high school polling booth in Madeji town, Shikarpur District on election day, July 25. No injuries reported.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Border Security Force
NOTES: On 2 Aug, a Pakistani woman was killed during cross-border shelling by Indian forces along the LoC in Mandal sector (Muzaffarabad, AJK). No retaliations by Pakistani forces were recorded.
Around Aug 4, a tribesman was injured in the Kaniguram area of Tiarza, South Waziristan, KP Province, when an unclaimed toy bomb exploded.
On 5 August 2018, an unclaimed IED exploded on Pakistani military forces in the Muhajir Bazaar area of Razmak subdivision, North Waziristan. 3 soldiers were injured.
3 children were injured when a toy bomb exploded near a mosque in the Sultan Khel area, Landi Kotal on Aug 6.

Around 6 August 2018 (as reported), an unclaimed landmine exploded on military forces when they were installing a fence on the Af-Pak border in the Dandi Katch area of Spin Wam tehsil, N Waziristan. 2 men were injured.
An elderly man was killed in a bomb blast in the Malgin area of Kohat on Aug 10 after a bomb allegedly planted by some rivals exploded on him.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Civilians (Pakistan); Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps; Labour Group (China)
NOTES: On 11 August 2018, a suicide bombing attack, claimed by the BLA, targeted a civilian bus transporting Chinese engineers to a mining project in the Dalbandin area of Balochistan Province. The bomber was killed; 6 people, including 3 Chinese, the bus driver, and 2 paramilitary soldiers (Frontier Constabulary), were wounded. This is reportedly the first time a Baloch separatist group has claimed a suicide attack.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
SOURCE: Daily Regional Times (Pakistan); Xinhua; Frontier Star
NOTES: On 12 August 2018, an unclaimed bomb blast attached to a parked motorcycle and remotely detonated hit a vehicle(s) of Frontier Corps on Mall Road in Chaman, killing 1 person and wounded 10-15 others, including a child and 4 FC personnel.
2 unidentified men threw a hand grenade into a shop on Masjid Road in Nushki, Balochistan on Aug 14, injuring 11-14 people in what may have been an attempt to disrupt Independence Day celebrations.
On Aug 18, an unclaimed IED exploded at the Boya Madakhel area near Miranshah (N Waziristan district, KP). 1 civilian was killed; 3 security personnel (assumed police) and 2 civilians were injured.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Frontier Corps
NOTES: On Aug 23, an IED exploded on the vehicle of bomb disposal experts of the Frontier Corps near Dand Kaly area (Data Khel tehsil, North Waziristan agency, KP). 1 soldier was killed and 3 were injured. Officials blamed the Pakistani Taliban for the incident, but no group has claimed responsibility.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Counter Terrorism Department
NOTES: On Aug 25, an unclaimed bomb attached to a car used by Counter Terrorism Department police went off in Mastung town (Balochistan). 3 people were injured.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Frontier Corps
NOTES: On Aug 26, unidentified men on a motorcycle threw a grenade at a vehicle of Frontier Corps in the Turbat area (Kech, Balochistan). 3 security forces and 2 civilians were injured.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Sasoli Tribal Group (Pakistan); BNP-M: Balochistan National Party-Mengal
NOTES: On Aug 31, an unclaimed IED detonated by remote control exploded on the motorcycle of a Sasoli tribal elder and the brother of the BNP-M leader in the Nimarg area (Kalat District, Balochistan). The elder was killed and several others may have been injured.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Border Security Force
NOTES: On 3 Sep, a Pakistani villager was seriously injured at Nadheri village in Goi sector (Kotli, AJK) when Indian forces fired a rocket across the LoC.

On Sep 3, an IED exploded in the Kandava area (Mastung, Balochistan), killing a school teacher and injuring his son. The victim was the brother of a man who was killed about a week earlier (coded separately). Subsequent investigations linked both killings to the Islamic State.
On Sep 4, an unclaimed explosive planted on a railroad track was detonated just before trains passed over them in Naushahro Feroze district (Sindh). No damage or injuries were caused.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Balochistan Levies
NOTES: On Sep 14, an unclaimed motorcycle bomb targeted the assistant commissioner's vehicle in Pishin district (Balochistan). 3 Levies were killed and 2 were injured.
